story:
The Contractors is an immersive, grand-scale role-playing game set in a war-torn future of super-soldiers, giant mechs, and vanishing humanity.

Because of its size, we’re developing the game in stages. For this fund goal, we are focusing on:

Finalized concept art for environments, characters, vehicles, and weapons

Establishing a forum-equipped website for our supporters and hosting it for a year

"Breaker" Suit | Standard Issue Body Armor

Our Vision

Think about the games you love and what you love most about them.

Is it driving around a huge cityscape in a sweet ride of your choosing, whether it’s got four wheels or spinning blades, chasing glory while sunset eases in the night?

Is it the adrenaline rush of raining gunfire as you tactically take out waves of enemy soldiers with a kick-ass arsenal of weapons you’ve level grinding to obtain?

Is it mastering the skills and upgrades of your multi-class character as you send them through an epic, seamless, and reactive story?

Well, we love all those things, too. That’s why we want to fuse together all the best parts of all our favorite games and make something awesome – and we want to bring you in on it. We understand that’s an ambitious goal. We’re an ambitious people. But we’re also being realistic about it.

Building something like this is going to take time, a clear and flexible plan, and lots of hard work. So, we’re planning to get the engine running one phase at a time.

We’re hoping you’ll join us while we realise our dream game. It’s still early days, but if you stick with us, your ideas can become a reality too.

The Story

In The Contractors, the world has advanced through unimaginable technological marvels in the game of war. So much so, that our drives of greed and ambition ran unencumbered by limitation and consumed the world like a wildfire. Now we are spared one thing: desperation.

We’ve come full circle. It’s a dog-eat-dog world but instead of claws and fangs, we have guns loaded with more ammo than there are human lives left.

The cities are hollow. Our armies draw strength from living steel. In some measures, machines are the dominant species of the world’s ravaged ecosystem, and the masters they answer to are ones who will never stop fighting.

Because, after all, isn’t there always something to fight for?

Gameplay

A lot of what we have planned for The Contractors is still being refined and tested, while other aspects are still being designed. What we can share for sure now is our design goals:

Open-world exploration

 Seamless storyline with interwoven missions

Gorgeously rendered environments

 Third- and first-person interchangeable POV

Elegant, world-appropriate interfaces

Want some more details? Here are some features we have planned:

Powered mech-suits

Drivable vehicles to explore with

RPG-style experience leveling

Real-time encounters of waves of enemies in the open world (no transitions here!)

Gun fights with elements of cover-based combat

 Item loot drops and a robust inventory system

Customisable weapon upgrades

Technology

CRYENGINE offers us a great system for rendering, lighting, animation, and particle effects,.

With the amazing, purpose built real-time environment, we can create a beautiful open world realizing triple AAA graphics.

What We Will Achieve In This Phase

To tackle such a big project, we’re adopting an old strategy: “How do you take down a hydra? One head at a time.” We’re applying this approach to our funding, where we’ll be breaking up the games funding and development into discrete, deliverable milestones.

For this stage of funding, we’ll be focusing on creating finalized concept art and game-ready 3D models for all assets needed in The Contractors. This includes, as mentioned above: environments, characters, vehicles, and weapons.

In addition, we’ll be creating a simple “whitebox” test environment, in which you’ll be able to play as some of our characters, with some of our weapons. Backers even at the lowest tier will receive this test environment as a playable executable file (.exe). Where We Are Now

Below are some of the key concepts we’ve developed so far which, with your help, will be taken to a final and polished state. Note that these are initial concepts and do not reflect the final quality we’ll be taking them to by the end of this fund goal’s development stage.

Current Concepts: Characters

Current Concepts: Vehicles

Current Concepts: Weapons

 

These are blueprints, called "orthographics" that our 3D modelers use to turn concept art into real game assets.

Why Crowdfunding

Getting to this point in pre-production hasn’t been easy. As an indie developer, I personally have tapped into my own funds to create the initial concept art and models, as well as devote my time to work on building this game. To date, it’s been 3 years – and there’s been no inkling to slow down. To continue with building this game, we need some support. The funds which you, our beloved backers, generate will be used to fund the creation of high-end assets made by some very talented artists – and they don’t come cheap. That’s why we need you.

Rewards and Perks

One of the unique aspects of our crowdfunding efforts is including any potential backer into the development process. Have you ever wanted to design a weapon or vehicle, and then see it fully realised in a game? Well this is your chance!

For a limited number of backers at certain reward tiers, we’re offering a chance to work together with our art team to design a custom exclusive skin for a weapon, vehicle, or character (whichever you choose) which will then be posted in our game store.

We’ve made this opportunity exclusive to some of the higher-end reward tiers. Please see our reward perks for more details.

Other Ways You Can Help

Whether you can contribute as a backer or not, you can always help by sharing the game with people you know. So please don’t hesitate to spread the word if you want to see the game get made! Any of our promotional art or videos – anything at all – are free to be shared on social media, forums, or what-have-you.

Thank you for your support!

story:
Those who follow us for some time will notice a difference in the third stretch goal. We have decided to insert the bestiary because we will release free expansions that will increase the decisional paths available!! So we replaced that stretch goal as it has already been substantially achieved!

The Ballad Singer is an RPG/Visual Novel, set in a fantasy world which is completely governed by the player's choices. After being the most funded Italian video game on Kickstarter ever, TBS is now on Indiegogo!

We've taken elements from game-books and visual novels to develop a videogame with an unprecedented format. TBS offers a fantasy story yet to be written, where the world changes and reacts to the player's actions. This will allow you to live up to 1700 stories and 40 different endings, your decisions will affect the way the tale unfolds. Every single development and subplot in your story will be completely narrated and illustrated, even the smallest ones. Death is final, you won't be able to go back to try and correct your mistakes. In TBS, every choice is crucial.

Pre-Alpha footage gameplay video

 

 

The Domino System is what allows you to live thousands of different narratives within The Ballad Singer. The paths will change according to your actions, the characters you have selected, and their progress or failures. The system is inspired by Neural Networks and Chaos Theory. Each choice you'll make will influence the options at your disposal, not just for the character you'll be using in that moment, but also for the others.

Upon the death of one hero, you’ll begin playing with another adventurer, in a world that has been completely reshaped by the previous choices. In the single player campaign, you'll play as one of the four main characters, following their adventures in the world of Hesperia.

The main elements considered by the Domino System are the selected character and the decisions you'll be taking. The heroes are four different adventurers, each with their own features. You will shape their fate, through your actions. Each decision unfolds a new page in your story, told by the narrating voice and depicted by the illustrations. Surviving will be hard, anticipating the repercussions of your choices on the other side of the world will be almost impossible. By killing the dragon, will Leon have saved the town from its fury? Or has he shifted the whole balance of the region? If Leon were to die in the fight, would he condemn the whole country? Could the dragon favor one of the factions?

 

Over your ballad, you'll be able to play with up to four adventurers, each with his or her own goals and limits. Some much stronger than others. They don't know it, but their own individual destiny is in the hands of each other. Through your decisions you'll be able to favor or compromise the aspirations of the other adventures and of the entire world of Hesperia!

Our goal is ambitious: to rearrange the fundamentals of the Fantasy genre, creating something completely new. The world of Hesperia is a fantastic yet realistic universe, where the laws of science merge with those of magic.

The magic system itself, the enemies, and the monsters are all treated individually, each match has been studied to be different: you will never find the same situation twice or a "default" method to approach fights.

Each match will be potentially lethal if not approached with caution. Magic is based on the control of natural elements, but it is rare and hard to master. Magical objects are legends, and wizards themselves need to wear armor, as melee fights come by often and can rarely be avoided.

Hesperia is a cruel world, merciless on unprepared adventurers. Don't trust anyone, use your instinct and your knowledge, this is the only way to survive and to continue your quest.  

The RPG component in TBS is highly important. Only through a deep understanding of the characters and their abilities, just as with the story of the game world, will you be able to face the challenges of The Ballad Singer at your best, getting to the end of your tale. 

You'll often be called upon to make choices based on wit, strategy, and even ethics. Use your common sense, but don't forget the past of the characters and their ambitions. Each choice could change the aspect, the equipment, the morality and the psyche of our heroes. The characters are as dynamic as the world, and are reshaped with each choice.

Playing without empathizing with the heroes, taking random decisions, will often result in their death. However, in The Ballad Singer, dying is part of the story, so it's not a "Game Over". When the character you're playing as dies, you will be able to play as a new hero, within the same story, in a different narrative path.

Your ballad will be over only once you are out of available characters, either because they're dead, killed by your decisions, or simply because you haven't met them yet. This aspect shouldn’t be seen as a negative, as we've decided that each narrative path must have the same relevance.

Playing through the game more than once is a paramount part of the experience, if faced without the fundamental premises of any Role-Playing Game, it will indeed result in a hard and perilous journey.

The “My Ballad” mode lets you write your story in the world of Hesperia, starting by selecting one of the available characters. Throughout your adventure, depending on your choices, you will also have the chance to play as other heroes, moving towards final or intermediate endings, goals and failures, new tales or death. 

Once your campaign is over, a map will be displayed, showing the narrative paths you have taken, the characters you have played with, and the goals you have achieved, allowing you to share your experience with other The Ballad Singer players. 

Facing the "Hot-seat" campaign mode, you'll have the chance to share the experience with a friend, who will select a second character. You will begin the story with your hero and, upon death or the completion of a chapter, the second player will take his turn, making his way through the world of Hesperia with another adventurer. However, the world won't be the same, as it will have been influenced by his decisions and by those of the previous player! This mode opens a series of cooperative and competitive dynamics. Playing in competitive mode, a complex system of trophies and scores will decide the winner, while, opting for cooperation, once the game ends, the final results will display all your contributions! The "Hot-seat" mode is offline, and has been designed to give you the opportunity to share the story with a friend, taking turns.

Music in TBS plays a fundamental role, all characters have their own soundtrack, just as every region and situation. These aspects have been thought out to make players experience every different combination of situations as a unique event. Two composers are working on the soundtrack: Michael Firmont and Gianluca Ferro. Beside working on a German TV series, Michael collaborates with several composers, directors and producers in Los Angeles and London and has written music for different international movies and projects. 

Gianluca is a talented composer and guitar player, and has published several records. His last one, "A Hole in the Ocean", came out in 2016. 

Listen to the first tracks of the soundtrack:The Ballad Singer Original Score

 

 A feature you'll find particularly useful when on the move, unwilling to leave the adventure behind, is the cross-platform integration for TBS! After the Windows/Mac versions, and any other reached through our stretch goals, we intend to release a mobile version of the game. You'll be able to use the Cross-platform saving system though all the versions!

We've put together an extremely valuable set of reward packages for our backers. We know you're taking a leap of faith with us, and we want to make sure you’ll feel our appreciation when we launch.  

Rewards description

Complete game: Kickstarter version of The Ballad Singer, contains an additional 10% of the story which won’t be in the retail version.  

Digital map of Hesperia (printable): right after closing the Kickstarter campaign, we'll send the high resolution printable map of Hesperia. 

Survival Kit: digital pamphlet with survival tips and tricks for this fearsome world. 

Beta access: Beta (October 2018)

Alpha access: Alpha (September 2018)

Digital Artbook: a collection of the best artworks. 

Digital signed prints: a collection of our favorite artworks signed by our artist. 

Digital Mistery box (3 different boxes): Mistery Boxes might contain deleted scenes, alternative scenes, mysterious artworks or work in progress material.

Community exclusive chat: live chat on the development of TBS with the other fans! 

History of Hesperia (digital book): A short book narrating the events before those told in TBS, summarizing the stories told in the fantasy novels of the Kalesin Saga. 

We have decided to continue our Indiegogo InDemand campaign to reach more stretch goals and to guarantee more content to the followers who have already supported us!

Up to now we've worked with our own personal funds to pay all the partners. However, to be able to finish The Ballad Singer within a reasonable time, supporting all costs, we decided to ask you, our backers, for help. We've just reached the target goal (25,000 €) so we'll be able to release the game within the estimated time. The Ballad Singer, as it has been created, has a high potential, and could easily see the addition of several contents. We have the chance to create an even richer game. Now we can refine the development process and add even more elements thank to your support here on Indiegogo.

Below, we've detailed how the 25,000€ of the initial goal will be spent. Please note that the initial goal covers, with fees and taxes, less than 1/3 of the project costs. The rest of the funds will be added by our team members. 


Join the community

Facebook

Instagram

Tumblr

Twitter

Website

Risks and challenges

Developing video games is an expensive and complex business, particularly if you mean to create a completely illustrated and narrated dynamic world. There have been many roadblocks during the development; bringing together the team, and maintaining the vision of the game for all this time has been a huge challenge. We have studied a gameplay system which is simple, yet with lots of elements, and the difficulty lies in correctly matching all of them; of course, we'll do whatever it takes to see this game completed in its entirety. 
We are ready for this challenge and we want this to be the first great step to create something different, something you'll love as much as we do!

story:
Board of the referendum debate? Puzzled with questions about it all? Don’t snap, just pass GO and collect your Wee Play cards!

This upcoming referendum is one of the biggest choices that the people of Scotland will make. Finding a space to discuss it openly is not always easy. We think Wee Play is a referendum game changer because it turns the ‘Yes’ vs ‘No’ style of the debate on its head. Undecided? It might help you make up your mind or spark your interest on a topic to research further.

The aim of the game is to put the power of democracy into people’s hands, but we can’t do it without you. Come and help us make this game changer a reality by funding the start up costs of the project. For just £20 you can be one of the first to get your hands on a copy of the game and help get Scotland playing!

What is it?

A game of Wee Play opens up discussions about independence, creating a safe space for anyone, anywhere, to talk about the referendum. Rather than playing to win, we play to make sense of the bigger picture.

The pack of cards you get contains 3 suits:

A: Things to Think About

B: Pro-independence Points of View

C: Pro-union Points of View

Then all you need to play is some players (any more than 3 people can play but we find 6-8 players works best), a table to gather round and a couple of hours to play. 

Cards are dealt from each pack in rounds 1, 2 and 3 and players select two cards from each hand that they want to play. In the final round, the aim is to make sense of the cards that have been played, clustering them as you see themes emerging. The links you find between Things to Think About and the Points of View may be surprising, and thought-provoking discussions will open up at every stage.

Wee Play is produced by So Say Scotland in Partnership with Open Up UK as part of their Scotland Loves Democracy campaign. 

By donating to this crowdfunder you will:

  • Help us place our first order of 200 Wee Play games
  • Pay a part-time member of staff for 12.5 hours a week to promote the game to schools and community groups and across Scotland.
  • Print flyers and posters to advertise the benefits of Wee Play in public spaces and promote Scotland Loves Democracy.
  • Give our hard working volunteers some travel expenses.
  • Allow us to offer a free downloadable pdf version of the game.

We make our funds go a long way. Last year So Say organised the Thinking Together citizens’ assembly where people came together to discuss ‘The Future of Scotland’. For this event we only had £7000 in cash but managed to get over £80,000 of in-kind donations to make it happen!

If our fundraising efforts are a success, we aim to have the order placed with the printer by 30th April and to have the games delivered to you by the 30th of May.

Let’s get Scotland playing!

Democracy is for life, not just for the referendum! Our story so far:

So Say Scotland loves democracy because we think that everyone’s voices have a right to be heard. But in order to make democracy a reality we need new ways to engage.

This campaign is vital because Scotland is facing a crisis of democracy.

  • Voter turnout is low with a 50.6% turnout at the 2011 Scottish Parliament Election[1].
  • Representation is low compared to other European countries with the ratio of elected councillors in Scotland 1:4270 compared with 1:600 in Spain and 1:125 in France[2]

So Say are a politically neutral, non-profit and voluntary initiative. We promote different ways of taking part in decision making through raising awareness and creating practical tools such as Wee Play.

We created Scotland Loves Democracy as a campaign where individuals and organisations that support democracy can connect and share. Our aim is to get people talking and to develop more tools like Wee Play to get Scotland engaged with democracy.


We are so excited that the referendum has mobilised a new wave of democracy lovers on both sides of the debate. We aim to harness that energy and activity beyond the referendum and turn Scotland into a hub of democratic innovation, whatever the outcome.

Getting the word out:

Spread the word and the democracy love!

Badger your boss to buy Wee Play cards for company team building. Cajole your community group to play it with young and old. Pester your local pub to get a set and include Wee Play in their entertainments.

Democracy is for everyone, right? Why not volunteer with us and become one of our Making it Happen Folk, we’ve got lots of ways to get involved. Drop us a line at makingithappenfolk@gmail.com

Visit our Scotland Loves Democracy campaign, like it on Facebook and follow the campaign on Twitter

And while you’re at it why not give So Say a bit of Facebook, Twitter and Kiltr attention too! Sign up for more updates here!

As media partners Kiltr are So Say Scotland's newest Advocates. They've shown real enthusiasm about the game. 

Watch this space for more updates!



[1]http://www.electoralcommission.org.uk/__data/assets/pdf_file/0007/141379/SP-2011-electoral-data-report-WEB.pdf

[2] Eberhard Bort, Robin McAlpine and Gordon Morgan, The Silent Crisis: Failure and Revival in Local Democracy in Scotland, The Jimmy Reid Foundation, April 2012.

If you are an organisation that would like to place a bulk order or that can't donate to a crowdfunder but would still like to order a copy of the game, get in touch at weeplayscotland@gmail.com We'd be happy to hear from you!

The film for this crowdfunder was funded by the Electoral Reform Society Scotland, one of So Say Scotland’s founding Advocates. Invaluable support to get our crowd fund off the ground.

that the people of Scotland will make. Finding a space to discuss it openly
is not always easy. We think Wee Play is a referendum game changer because it turns the ‘Yes’ vs ‘No’ style of the debate
on its head. Undecided? It might
help you make up your mind or spark your interest on a topic to research
further.

democracy into people’s hands, but we can’t do it without you. Come and help us

Play opens up discussions about independence,
creating a safe space for anyone,
anywhere, to talk about the referendum. Rather than playing to win, we play to
make sense of the bigger picture.

story:
Drone racing in a fun, intense and affordable way

The Drone Racing Game as we called it is a racing game like no other.  It gives you the best of digital games combined with the best of physical games. 


What's included

The ULTIMATE KIT includes everything you need to start a battle: drones, controllers, flags, cones, headsets, and FREE mobile app. Just take them out of the box and you’re off to racing.


Beat your friends. Conquer the leaderboard

The competition is about to get intense. Now with every win, you’ll earn points to help you climb to the top of your leaderboard.

 

Intuitive, beautiful, and fun mobile experience

Challenge your friends. Book a date and get ready to race. Watch the best drone racing footage from drone racers all over the world. All in one simple, fun, and beautiful mobile app.

First person view

Be in the pilot seat and experience the thrill of first person view flying.

 

More than flying, racing experiences

Whether you want to race against your friends in the park, compete against your family in your backyard, or organize your own drone racing league, Drone Racing Kit offers you endless possibilities to setup your own tracks.


Technical specifications of the drones

  • Motors: Brushed motors
  • Frequency: 2.4Ghz
  • Channel: 4CH 6 Axis Gyro
  • Camera Pixel: 2 MegaPixels HD Camera
  • Video Time /Photos: About 30min video or 800 pictures
  • Battery for Controller: 4"AA" batteries
  • Battery for Quadcopter: 3.7V 500mAh Li-poly
  • Charging Time: About 120 mins (USB charging)
  • Flying time: About 6-7 minutes
  • Controlling Distance: up to 100 meters
  • Dimension: 31*31*8 cm

Key features of the drones

  • Built-In 2 megapixels HD Camera and Electronic Compass, Equipped with WIFI for real-time transmission to take amazing videos and photos between built-in camera and mobile devices attached on remote controller.
  • The transmitter has built-in two modes, Mode 1 and Mode 2  for remote controller.
  • 6-Axis gyro quad-rotor craft flight, stability, can easily implement various flight movements, stronger wind resistance, easier to control with headless mode.
  • 2.4GHz technology adopted for anti-interference, allowing to fly up to 20 quadcopters at the same time without interfering with each other.
  • Can perform both indoor and outdoor flying.
  • Built in rechargeable high performance Li Poly battery.

Perks


Referral Program

We are excited to announce our referral program which allows you to earn free Drone Racing Game when you refer your friends make purchases.  Please see below for details:
  • You have to log into your Indiegogo account in order to participate in this campaign.
  • You have to be a contributor of this campaign.


Deliveries begin in August, 2016

We've already started production 2 months ago.  The first production batch will be available by the start of August, 2016.  So if you order early and you're one of the first few hundred backers, we will be able to ship the products to you just right after the campaign ends in mid August. Don't worry if your orders do not fall into the first batch as we will manage to ship your orders in September or October.

The team

Autonomous designs and manufactures everyday smart products.  We're a team of more than 30 people around the world with offices in San Francisco, New York, Los Angeles, Shenzhen, and Ho Chi Minh City.  Our team includes engineers with deep experience in robotics, artificial intelligence, computer vision, speech recognition, natural language processing, software, and hardware. We have served thousands of customers around the globe. Check out some of our happy customers and other products: https://www.autonomous.ai/customers


Frequently asked questions

1. Do you ship worldwide?

Yes, we ship our products worldwide. Actually we have lots of oversea customers purchased our products from desks to robots.

2. What's the maximum flight time?

The maximum flight time is 7 mins just enough for at least 3 races but you can always purchase the spare batteries to have more flight time.

3. What’s the controlling distance?

The controlling distance is about 50 meters (164 feet).

4. Does this game require certain skills to play?

It's very easy to fly and almost requires no skills but we do recommend you to start the game with the free style mode to have some practices before getting ready for the races.

5. How do I challenge my friends?

It's another easy thing to do. Just need to download the app, choose the person (within your community or worldwide) you want to challenge and send the request.

6. Can I challenge more than one person?

You can challenge as many people as you want but you can only compete with one at a time.

7. How do I connect my phone to the drone?

Just find the correct Wifi access point of your drone and than connect your phone to it. Once this connection is established our app will be able to automatically configure and display the video stream coming from the drone to your smartphone/tablet.

8. How do I upload my videos to the app?

The videos will be automatically uploaded to your app when your phone accesses the internet.

9. Can I sign up with social media accounts?

Yes, you can! Currently you can sign up to our app with your Facebook, Twitter or Gmail account.

Customer services

1. Why I have to purchase through Indiegogo?

We use the Indiegogo platform to keep the transparency with our campaign: all the stats, numbers, deadlines and dollars raise through this campaign will be displayed real. Indiegogo is also a safe and trusted place to shop.

2. I was trying to order a perk but there was an error. What happened?

Please refer to this article on common errors and ways to resolve: Common Contribution Errors.

3. Can I order more than one perk at the same time?

Sorry! The Indiegogo system does not allow you to place orders for multiple perks at the same time so you will need to place multiple orders.

4. Who should I contact for further supports?

We always welcome questions so please feel free to contact us at human@autonomous.ai if you ever have one.

Risks and challenges

We are a team of seasoned engineers, entrepreneurs, product developers and supply chain experts with years of entrepreneurial and manufacturing experience so the risk is minimal. However the production and distribution is subjected to our best efforts, so there may be some brief delay but we will do the best to make sure this won't happen.

The products shown above are only the prototypes so the production version may be slightly different but we can assure you that the final version will be the best one.

We have tested mostly all popular Android phones (including Nexus 5, Nexus 6, Nexus 5X, Nexus 6P, Samsung Galaxy S5, Samsung Galaxy S6, and Samsung S7...).  But we did not test it on all available Android phones.  The Android ecosystem is too fragmented, and it is impossible for us to test every single Android phone on the market.  We will continue to monitor customer feedback and make sure that our products work with the most popular Android devices.

Help us spread the words

We understand that not all the people can contribute. So we would really appreciate if you can help us spread the words by sharing this campaign to your friends using the Indiegogo sharing options above.

story:
Playable Demo

Play now the latest version! here

Hello!

I'm Santiago Zapata, a game developer who loves developing turn based computer roleplaying games. You can see my work at http://slashwareint.com

Some months ago I started developing a game with an idea in my mind: I wanted to make people being able to experience the fun of a roguelike / dungeon crawler game, without the high entry barrier currently created by outdated and overly complex interfaces, and I wanted them to be able to do it from their smartphones and other portable devices. I had been looking for a game like that and could never find it, it was time to create it!.

I set into that journey of development, and today I can say the foundations are laid out, but I think it's time to take it to another level... I'm launching this campaign because with your help, I'll be able to make the game even more accessible, fun and artistically pleasing, so that it can be enjoyed by a lot of people in the world.

There's an existing playable version available at http://slashwareint.com/ananias; this campaign seeks to complete the game by implementing new cool features, polishing the game experience immensely, and making it available to all major platforms HTML5 based development allows.


What does this game play like?

Gameplay is designed to be simple and fun; just after tapping on the title screen you will find yourself into the game. Your goal is to survive about 25 levels, and fetch an ancient artifact located at the end.

The levels in the dungeon are randomly generated every time you play, so you have to explore the level gathering useful equipment and looking the stairs to the next level, while avoiding death and managing your limited resources.

  • ...will you drop your spare weapon and carry this potion with you, knowing it could be useful on the next level?
  • ...will you risk attacking a group of enemies to fetch that powerful armor that could save your life? or will you better run away to save your hitponts
  • ...will you withstand the enemy attacks to reach the backrow and kill the fairy who is constantly healing all others?
  • ...will you carry with you that powerful weapon to use it against strong enemies two levels below, even if that means using up inventory space and attacking with a weaker weapon?

The odds are against you, but if you die there's always a chance to start again and wish for better fortune

There are a lot of mobile roguelikes out there... what makes this one different?

Ananias is designed from the ground up with the idea of a straightforward user experience for a touch screen device; interactions are optimized so you don't have to waste time with cumbersome movement, while still allowing you to explore the dungeon and fight the dwellers of the dungeon.

A simple gameplay is also a strong design focus; the game is designed for you to be able to do quick playthroughs, trying to delve deeper into the dungeon every time.

There are 28 enemy types, each with an unique feature that makes him stand apart from the rest. We are favoring uniqueness versus quantity in the monster design. Let me show you some of them!

Satyr: This mystical race inhabits the temple ruins, they move quickly so keep an eye on them!
Necromancer: These sorcerors meddle with the realms of the dead, they can summon undead servant to do their command
Fencer: Masters of the swords, they are able to easily disarm their enemies leaving them at their mercy
Demonspawn:This dark demonical race is able to warp next to their enemy giving them no chance to escape their doom

The game is being developed using the phaser.io library, one of quickest growing frameworks for HTML5 mobile development; it has great integration with CocoonJS, which in turn is capable of generating native packages for a lot of platforms.

What we need and what we'll do

The original campaign we had launched was not successful, we have adjusted the project hoping to be able to still make this come to life!

We are looking forward for 1499 USD, with this money we will able to include the following:

New environments

The game currently has a single environment (The Temple Ruins); it needs a bit more variety to make it interesting for the players, there will also be optional branches the players can go through for further adventure and loot!

Following is the layout for the main dungeon:

  • Temple Ruins: Centuries ago it was as a place of worship, now it's overrun by monsters.
  • Cavern of Chaos: Located beneath the temple ruins, these caverns mark the entrance to the underworld.
  • Underground Lagoon: A giant subterranean water reservoir.
  • Crystal Caves: These dark depths are adorned by multicolored crystals, old as earth itself.
  • Darkness Abyss: Deep below the surface of the earth where all dead spirits rule.
  • Hell: The domains of the Draconians, a dark place devoid of all life.

Locations will also be made more interesting by adding special rooms and features spiced by awesome pixel art, as well as hidden artifacts to complement the plot. For this I'll continue working with the master pixel artist Denzi, whose work includes large contributions to the Dungeon Crawl Stone Soup graphics and many other projects.

I'll also add illustrations for the new locations, the player will see them once he gets there

Companion Monsters

Monsters you can train to aid you in your quest! There will be 3 different base monsters with different abilities you can choose from the beginning, they will evolve into different monsters if you find special spells into the dungeon, gaining new skills.

Other Game Features

  • Short cutscenes, similar to the old Ultima Games, for the Intro, Game Over and Victory, to help immerse players into the game.
  • Minibosses, unique strong monsters, they'll pop up at the end of each section of the dungeon and will give out special rewards.
  • Allow saving games.
  • Add journey memorial screen resuming your accomplishments and allow sharing it.

Polished User Experience

One of the most important points will be to ensure the game is very easy to get into. I'll test thoroughly in as many devices and with as much people as possible.

This will probably require revamping the UI through several design iterations, and I'll also need assets to make that happen.

Soundworks

Musical scores for each environment and sound effects made by Ashton Morris specially for the game! there's a sample of his work here:

  

Distribution

  • Cover art and other concept media: For displaying the game on the application stores and other distribution channels.
  • Optimized mobile native deployments (Android / iOS)
  • Publishing on app stores

Let's talk about the perks

When development of the game is finished, there will be a free version and a premium version with added features. Contributing to this campaign entitles you to the premium version, along with additional perks.

All perks are cumulative, pick a high level perk and you'll get all the benefits from lower level ones

Lynx - 1 USD

Access to the premium version of the game.

Jackal - 5 USD

All "Lynx" perks plus...

A virtual postcard with art from the game, signed by the developer

Warrior - 10 USD

All "Jackal" perks plus...

  • Access to the special funders version, in which you start with special branded equipment
  • You'll be credited as a funder in a section of the game website

Knight - 20 USD

All "Warrior" perks plus...

We will include you as a named knight of darkness, a monster that might pop up randomly into the game, including your name on it's description.

Hero - 50 USD

All "Knight" perks plus...

CD with the Original Soundtrack

Summoner - 100 USD

All "Hero" perks plus...

We will include a new monster race to the game, based on a description you'll give us, this includes doing a special sprite and programming its abilities!

Help us spread the word so this game can become a reality!

All Pixel Art on this campaign page was created by Denzi, take a look at his website!

	There's an existing playable version available at http://slashwareint.com/ananias;
	this campaign seeks to complete the game by implementing new cool features, polishing the game experience immensely, and making
	it available to all major platforms HTML5 based development allows.


What does this game play like?
Gameplay is designed to be simple and fun; just after tapping on the title screen you
will find yourself into the game. Your goal is to survive about 25 levels, and fetch
an ancient artifact located at the end.


The levels in the dungeon are randomly generated every time you play, so you have
to explore the level gathering useful equipment and looking the stairs to the next level, 
while avoiding death and managing your limited resources.

...will you drop your spare weapon and carry this potion with you, knowing it could be useful on the next level?
...will you risk attacking a group of enemies to fetch that powerful armor that could save your life? or will you better run away to save your hitponts
...will you withstand the enemy attacks to reach the backrow and kill the fairy who is constantly healing all others?
...will you carry with you that powerful weapon to use it against strong enemies two levels below, even if that means using up inventory space and attacking with a weaker weapon?
The odds are against you, but if you die there's always a chance to start again and wish for better fortune
There are a lot of mobile roguelikes out there... what makes
	this one different?
Ananias is designed from the ground up with the idea of a
	straightforward user experience for a touch screen device; interactions
	are optimized so you don't have to waste time with cumbersome movement,
	while still allowing you to explore the dungeon and fight the dwellers
	of the dungeon.
A simple gameplay is also a strong design focus; the game is designed
for you to be able to do quick playthroughs, trying to delve deeper into
the dungeon every time. 
There are 28 enemy types, each with an unique feature that makes him
	stand apart from the rest. We are favoring uniqueness versus quantity in the monster design. Let me show you some of them!





Satyr: This mystical race inhabits the temple ruins, they move quickly so keep an eye on them!




Necromancer: These sorcerors meddle with the realms of the dead, they can summon undead servant to do their command




Fencer: Masters of the swords, they are able to easily disarm their enemies leaving them at their mercy




Demonspawn:This dark demonical race is able to warp next to their enemy giving them no chance to escape their doom


The game is being developed using the phaser.io library, one of
	quickest growing frameworks for HTML5 mobile development; it has great
	integration with CocoonJS, which in turn is capable of generating
	native packages for a lot of platforms.
What we need and what we'll do
The original campaign we had launched was not successful, we have adjusted the project hoping to be able to still make this come to life!
We are looking forward for 1499 USD, with this money we will able
	to include the following:
New environments

	The game currently has a single environment (The Temple Ruins); it needs a bit more variety to make it interesting
	for the players, there will also be optional branches the players can go through for further adventure and loot!



Following is the layout for the main dungeon:

Temple Ruins: Centuries ago it was as a place of worship, now it's overrun by monsters.
Cavern of Chaos: Located beneath the temple ruins, these caverns mark the entrance to the underworld.
Underground Lagoon: A giant subterranean water reservoir.
Crystal Caves: These dark depths are adorned by multicolored crystals, old as earth itself.
Darkness Abyss: Deep below the surface of the earth where all dead spirits rule.
Hell: The domains of the Draconians, a dark place devoid of all life.


Locations will also be made more interesting by adding special
	rooms and features spiced by awesome pixel art, as well as hidden
	artifacts to complement the plot. For this I'll continue working with the master pixel artist Denzi, whose work
	includes large contributions to the Dungeon Crawl Stone Soup graphics and many other projects.
I'll also add illustrations for the new locations, the player will see them once he gets there
Companion Monsters
Monsters you can train to aid you in your quest! There will be 3 different base 
	monsters with different abilities you can choose from the beginning, they will evolve into different monsters if you
	find special spells into the dungeon, gaining new skills.


Other Game Features

Short cutscenes, similar to the old Ultima Games, for the Intro, Game Over and Victory, to help immerse players into the game.
Minibosses, unique strong monsters, they'll pop up at the end of each section of the dungeon and will give out special rewards.
Allow saving games.
Add journey memorial screen resuming your accomplishments and allow sharing it.
Polished User Experience
One of the most important points will be to ensure the game is very easy to get into. I'll test thoroughly in as many devices 
and with as much people as possible.
This will probably require revamping the UI through several design iterations, and I'll also need assets to make that happen.
Soundworks
Musical scores for each environment and sound effects made by Ashton Morris specially for the game! there's a sample of his work here:
  
Distribution

Cover art and other concept media: For displaying the game on the application stores and other distribution channels.
Optimized mobile native deployments (Android / iOS)
Publishing on app stores
Let's talk about the perks

	When development of the game is finished, there will be a free version
	and a premium version with added features. Contributing to this
	campaign entitles you to the premium version, along with additional
	perks.
All perks are cumulative, pick a high level perk and you'll get all the benefits from lower level ones
Lynx - 1 USD
Access to the premium version of the game.

Jackal - 5 USD
All "Lynx" perks plus...
A virtual postcard with art from the game, signed by the developer

Warrior - 10 USD
All "Jackal" perks plus...

Access to the special funders version, in which you start with special branded equipment
You'll be credited as a funder in a section of the game website

Knight - 20 USD
All "Warrior" perks plus...
We will include you as a named knight of darkness, a monster that might pop up randomly into the game, including your name on it's description.

Hero - 50 USD
All "Knight" perks plus...
CD with the Original Soundtrack

Summoner - 100 USD
All "Hero" perks plus...
We will include a new monster race to the game, based on a description you'll give us, this includes doing a special sprite and programming its abilities!
Help us spread the word so this game can become a reality!
All Pixel Art on this campaign page was created by Denzi, take a look at his website!

story:
Forever Neon Card is a totally awesome new retro futuristic playing card deck by the guys at Third Moon Publishing. It has wicked cool bright fluoro colours, radical chrome text and totally awesome grids!

I know your not a dweeb so dust off the tape deck player, put in some electro synth and take your next poker night to the max!

We are Third Moon Publishing, a small collective of graphic designers, artworkers and illustrators based in London, UK. Yeah, we might not have been creating card decks very long but we do have years of experience in over 14 countries world wide in graphical and digital design. Our goal is trying new ideas, taking risks and starting audacious projects, and we'd love you to be a part of it!

story:
Index: Welcome * The Funding * The Future * Referral Contest


(Demo/Full version, Windows, German/English, 34.6 MB)

Or find us:
                                   

Cars Incorporated is a tycoon game about designing and selling your own cars. It is an ongoing project that has consistently been growing, along with it's still small but dedicated fanbase, during the 19 versions released so far.

Since the first early access version in late 2011 it has been available as a fully playable game that has been praised for it's already solid gameplay and it's stability by new and returning players over and over again.



It's semi-freeform-body-editor, it's improvable and customizable engines, along with it's fun to watch simulated races make Cars Incorporated a unique business simulation in the spirit of classic car builder games like Detroit (1993) and Motor City (1994).



The Achilles heel of the game so far has been the lack of funding which has slowed the development to a crawl but has never stopped it entirely - and never will, as we have been consistently pushing forward since 2011 (or 2010 if you count the time before the first release).



Since the introduction to Steam Greenlight we have experienced a rise in preorders, putting the financial requirements to get the development on the (fulltime) fast track almost within reach.
The accompanying rise in feedback and suggestions is also making it necessary to spend more time on the project than we can currently afford due to the regular job of the main developer.

So we're asking you, our fans and supporters, as well as all you tycoon players that stumble accross this campaign to help us put the development onto the fast lane.



Ever since the development of Cars Incorporated has started the graphics had a low priority as the focus was on the game mechanics. As a result most of the graphics in the game now, are still considered placeholders.
The original plan was for version 0.60 - at a time when most of the mechanics will be in place and changes to the UI become less likely - to redo all the graphics and replace the backgrounds with graphics rendered in Blender 3D.
But all the feedback we received in these past months has made it very clear to us that even now, with the game somewhere in the middle of development, and even in a genre that has classically been less focused on graphics, the looks make the sales.



So the plan was changed and while we're finishing up the last incarnations of version 0.3x, the revised plans for version 0.40 call for a replacement of the GUI ahead of it's time to bring in all those great suggestions we have received and make the game more appealing to people who stumble upon it.

The new UI, that is currently in the planing stage will get rid of the 2D backdrops. Instead 3D scenes will take their places, making the game much more beautiful and the UI more flexible, especially with regards to the screen resolution, which will become configurable in v0.40.
The menus, statistics and settings will be 2D overlays that contain all the game elements that do not require or do not work in 3D. These windows will be drag-able and most will be switchable between 3 sizes: mini-view, regular and an expanded view that will only work on larger resolutions.



The bottom line is that the new plan for version 0.40 will require a lot of 3D modelling work and quite some development time (especially if the previously planed features like achievements are to remain in the game at this point).
With the current funds available these tasks can only be worked on in our spare time, as we need to make money to live. This results in the ongoing crawling speed, the development has been in since the project started.
With your help we can change this and put the development on the fast track. Hitting the inital goal will enable the game's developer to work full time on the game for at least 2-3 months, which will make it possible to get all that work done and release version 0.40 1-2 months after the end of the campaign.



If the funding for version 0.40 can be secured, all the versions that follow will also profit from that, especially if the development speed can be kept up by rising sales or additional campaigns for v0.50+.

So here are some of the corner points for the next major versions of Cars Incorporated:

v0.3x (remaining)
- revamped business simulation
- a range of smaller improvements are still open

v0.4x
- revamped User Interface with 3D backgrounds and 2D menues
- selectable screen resolution
- Achievements

v0.5x
- Driving simulation (highly depends on the financing, will be dropped again if no fulltime work is possible by then)
- body editor revamp
- body generation 4
- game time until 1970



Even without contributing to this campaign directly you can support Cars Incorporated by simply making people aware of it - I'm no marketing expert, in fact I pretty much have no idea of what I am doing in that regard - but here's your chance to help Cars Incorporated with this. And for helping out you can even win the game in digital and boxed versions, T-Shirts, access to development steps between releases and you can even become a part of the game yourself.

All you have to do is use the tools provided by Indiegogo further up on this page to promote this campaign. If you are logged in when doing so Indiegogo can track how many people you send here. Just be sure to send them here, not to the game's homepage as that can not be counted by Indiegogo.

For each referral (unique visitor) you will receive 1 point. Every Euro contributed by one of your referrals (limited to those Indiegogo could track) will give you 5 points. The 5 highest ranking people at the end of the campaign will receive the following prices:

1. Price

Will receive the Perk "Be In The Game" for free. This includes immediate alpha-access, an autographed boxed copy with your key once the game is completed, access to the development versions, a cool T-Shirt with one of your ingame build cars on it AND one of the default AI opponents will bear your name and your picture (if desired of course, I will not force you ;-)

2. & 3. Price

Will receive the Perk "The Inner Circle" for free. This includes immediate alpha-access, a boxed copy with your key once the game is completed, as well as access to the development versions.

4. & 5. Price

Will receive the Perk "Alpha Package" for free. This means a digital copy of the game with immediate alpha access.

I will be sending out regular updates about the campaign which will also include the latest standings of this contest, so be sure to follow the campaign.

People directly involved with the project (David Klande, Martin Herrmann and people paid to promote the campaign cannot take part in this contest).

story:
Who I am:

Mi name is Javier Benavente. This is my second time as developer, and my first game. My other project is an application called Handy Dice, which lets you roll all kind of dices with many options, even including on-line features.

Now I think I am ready to make a game, I do not want to be too ambitious, but the goal is to get a fun game.


Introducing the project:

No Heroes Left is in advanced development state. The game is already functional, without serious bugs, and I have the necessary tools to create as many levels I want. So, why a crowd funding campaign? Because this way the game can get much better than doing everything myself.

The main target is to get a nice professional OST. If the campaign success, the extra money will be spent on better 3D models, deployment on other platforms, better sound effects, a bigger campaign, or even a multi player mode.

To check the game's current development state, you can download the demo HERE. It is in alpha state, so music, sounds, textures and sprites are provisional: many are just placeholders.



There are two game modes currently planed:

  1. Campaign:  with lots of levels and enemies. It will feature a story that will unfold as the player progresses through the game.
  2. Random game: endless mode where the difficulty is increased each level, and every game session is different.

You can fully customize your craft every game. The final version will include many more weapons and accessories to choose from.

The game will be definitely released, even if it does not get funded, but obviously will not be able to get many of the planned improvements, and will take much longer to get a quality product.

I am planning to release the game on Desura and will look for other options, as Steam, and other known on-line stores.


Technical info:

The game uses the Unity3D engine, which makes it is easy to port it to different platforms. Currently Windows, Linux, Mac-OS, Android, iOS and PS Vita are planned, but others may be supported in the future (depending on success and funding).


Other ways to help No Heroes Left:

If you like this project, you can tell your friends or vote it on Steam Greenlight.

story:
Congratulations - WE DID IT EVERYONE!

Wow! Moments ago the second (and final) stretch goal was secured, GREAT JOB FOLKS! I spoke with VICTARUS this morning and he is absolutely thrilled and READY to take on the project full time.

KMS on the other hand, is out "dress shopping," and while he is happy about the stretch goal being accomplished, there is a little remorse about what the OT (off-topic) forums are about to do with this...

ALL NEW CONTRIBUTIONS WILL GO DIRECTLY TO HARDWARE PURCHASES.

EXTRA FUNDS FOR HARDWARE SO FAR: $350.00

Thank you so much for your support. We will be using all of these funds to improve and grow WWII Online as much as we can. Your support means a great deal and is fueling us with the opportunity to do so much more.

Once again proving that WWII Online and its community will stand the test of time. We are so grateful for having the best online gaming community EVER. And while that may seem biased, I'm starting to think our critics and fellow industry teams are starting to believe that.

SALUTE FROM RAT HQ!

==================

STRETCH GOAL #2 - $6000/6000 (100% FUNDED)

Full time Programmer & More!

Stretch Goal Funding Amount: $24,000 total (or +$6,000 from Stretch Goal 1).

Successful funding of stretch goal #2 will result into the following: 

  • Second full time programmer for  5 months (100% dedicated to code).
  • "Funder" Personal Decal for everyone who contributed to this funding drive.
  • We will deploy our forums to a new state of the art platform (Invision Power).
  • New art for British Hurricane Mk IIc aircraft.
  • New art for French P39 aircraft.
  • New art for German BF-110C aircraft.
  • Rat "KMS" has vowed to be pictured wearing a pink dress (poor soul).
Note: Forums will retain all historical data, users, post counts, etc.

STRETCH GOAL 100% FUNDED - $5000/$5000

New Game Update 1.34.11 (Stretch Goal)

Stretch Goal Funding Amount: $18,000 total (or +$5,000 from primary).

Successful funding of the stretch goal will result into the following: 

  • German Army Sniper class receives pistol (+2 mags).
  • US Army Sniper class receives pistol (+2 mags).
  • British Army Sniper Class receives pistol (+2 mags).
  • French Army Sniper class receives pistol (+2 mags).
  • New art for the following tanks: S35, Crusader and Panzer 38T.
  • Upon release we will offer a 1 week welcome back soldier event.
  • We will rebuild the Personal Decal tool for squads to purchase.
  • Game client will be available for both PC & MAC.


PRIMARY GOAL 100% FUNDED - WOOT!

New Hardware for WWII Online (Primary Goal)

This funding campaign is dedicated to further improving that hardware which will create increased stability for the game server, increased speed of all important administration functions we do on a daily basis and to reduce current bandwidth choke points.

Successful funding of this goal will result into the following:

  • New network routers.
  • New remote power switches.
  • New high speed cables for faster data transfer.
  • Increased memory for several machines.
  • Increased storage for several machines.
  • Contractor installation and maintenance.

All of these upgrades to our infrastructure is extremely important to keep gaming operations smooth and have sufficient fall backs in case of hardware failure. It will also allow us to quickly get important systems back online during any outages by adding remote restart capability. 


How will my contribution help?

We are 100% funded by YOU, our community. You directly give us the "fuel" to do more to improve your gaming experience. All monetary contributions result into the increased probability of success.

Once funded, what happens next?

We begin the purchasing of the hardware and conduct the installation process. Once the stretch goal is achieved, we will begin the software development of 1.34.11 and prepare for its deployment on both the PC & MAC.

Other Ways You Can Help

There are two ways you can continue to support WWII Online in greater ways, not only during funding campaigns like these but by routinely supplying us with the means to do bigger things for the game. 

  • Increase awareness of this funding campaign - you are our biggest voice.
  • Upgrade your account to a HERO, and receive a FREE towing account.

Up the ante, join the Hero Builder team.

All of these upgrades to our infrastructure is extremely important to keep gaming operations smooth and have sufficient fall backs in case of hardware failure. It will also allow us to quickly get important systems back online during any outages by adding remote restart capability. 










   How will my contribution help? We are 100% funded by YOU, our community. You directly give us the "fuel" to do more to improve your gaming experience. All monetary contributions result into the increased probability of success.   Once funded, what happens next?  We begin the purchasing of the hardware and conduct the installation process. Once the stretch goal is achieved, we will begin the software development of 1.34.11 and prepare for its deployment on both the PC & MAC.   Other Ways You Can Help There are two ways you can continue to support WWII Online in greater ways, not only during funding campaigns like these but by routinely supplying us with the means to do bigger things for the game.   Increase awareness of this funding campaign - you are our biggest voice. Upgrade your account to a HERO, and receive a FREE towing account. 

Up the ante, join the Hero Builder team.

story:
Hi folks!

We are Andreas (27) and Sebastian (26), two enthusiastic gamers from Germany, who always dreamt about making games of our own. This dream can become reality with your help! 

Both of us have the skillsets to bring a game to life, programming and 3D-modeling as well as drawing, a musical background and voice acting. We each acted on our own before but now we will combine our skills to bring you awesome games. 

Sebastian's working as a Software Engineer for a local company and has always enjoyed 3D modelling and was interrested in game development as a whole.

Andreas is currently studying Media IT at the local Universtiy of applied sciences. He draws and scribbles on every piece of paper he can find and has learned to play the violin and guitar.

Both of us enjoy singing (at home and at karaoke events) acting and voiceacting.

Funding our project will enable us to put our skills to use with the appropriate software and bring you many hours of joy and excitement.  

 

What We Need

We need a commercial and a team license for the game engine, that´s where most of the raised money will be spent on (Unity).

Further on we need a license for audio software to compose (FruityLoops) for recording and editing we will use Audacity, because it´s free for commercial use, and about 699$ for image editing software (Photoshop), for 3D modeling and sculpting we use Sculptris and Blender, that´s because there both free to use even for commercial purposes and possess the needed functionality that we need.

If we are not able to release a game within two to three years the remaining funds will go to charity.

In case we will not reach our funding goal we will use the funds for most crucial software that we need to begin development.

 

What You Get

You will experience classic games with new and fresh ideas. We strive to enhance the potential of classic Amiga /  Atari / Commodore / PC Engine games. 

Also the casual market is a wide open space for fresh and creative ideas, which we are eager to deliver and bring you games that are fun, challenging and will glue you to the screen. 

Since we have a gaming experience for about 22 years, we've seen many brilliant and also many bad games. But even some bad games just had their potential thrown out the window. That potential and ideas we want to use and enhance them with our experience and creativity.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Always think about how even tiny amounts can help us achieve our goal and are very much appreciated. But if you don't have that tiny amount you can always spread the word about us. 

Facebook / Twitter

story:
Making a Classic Survival Horror Game

How much do I like this genre? When I saw Alone in the Dark game at a friend's house in 1994, I wanted to make a game like that. Then I saw Resident Evil 1 and 2 a few years later, then I really wanted to make videogames. I've tried working on Obscure when I knew it was in early development. I've spent a lot of money so I could keep on playing Resident Evil Outbreak.

In 2000 I begun working professionaly for: Mircroids, Electronic Arts & Ubisoft.

Flashforward 2013, I still haven't worked on anything close to Resident Evil other than maybe Still Life (highly reccomended). I'm not going to sit idly by waiting for my game to happen anymore. I want to make my own game and keep the rights to it so that if there are sequels they will remain true to the original.

 

Features:

  • Multiple characters to choose from with unique features and abilities.
  • All scenarios will be playable with online partners as an option
  • Walk and Shoot
  • Switch to over the shoulder cam any time you want to
  • Auto aim in 3D, switch targets from nearest to farthest
  • Dodging / Evasion moves to avoid being hit
  • Unlockable weak characters for extra challenge
  • Customizable difficulty level for action and puzzles: easy, normal or difficult
  • Each character will talk
  • More to add soon

 

 

Can I do all of this myself? YES I CAN.

I've spent the last 2 weeks learning programation, how to set up multiplayer, teaching myself animation, all things I had never done before. I've spent time building quick assets to get a rough idea of the game's look. The video sample right now isn't very scary and it's missing textures, the animations are very rough too. I've solved most of the features I am enunciating here, they aren't in the video because I didn't have time to animate the characters performing those actions yet. I mostly need to work on the art from now on.

I'm 100% confident I'll do this.

But I need your contribution so I can work on this full time. 

WHAT I NEED

  • Money to cover my expenses for the entire year I will be working on this.
  • I would like to put a good sum into the audio recording and quality voice acting. Professional sounding audio with believable acting is crucial to me when playing a game.
  • People talking about the game to anyone who is interested in Survival horror games.

If funding allows it:

  • If it's overfunded to the point I can afford assistants to handle building the game's environments and animation, I will do it. My plan for now is that I go on this project full tilt by myself.

-If I don't reach my funding goal, I will still be working on this game, but it won't go as fast or be complete as it would be if I have to keep seeking contracts or working on other people's productions while doing this. Even if I do reach my goal, I will most likely start another campaign because I want this game to happen, I want to work on this full time, producing a scary videogame.

 

I'm asking for 100k right now and I will release a full game next year. I will try for more funding. Ideally, I would need 100-300k, which isn't much considering the average game production cost is 5 million dollars.

IF YOU WANT TO PURCHASE THE 250$ + OPTIONS, SINCE THOSE ARE ALL CUSTOM WORK, DON'T HESITATE TO CONTACT ME FIRST WITH ANY QUESTIONS SO WE'RE SURE TO BE ON THE SAME PAGE. THANK YOU

story:
Who am I?


My name is Clark Thompson.  I currently serve as ministry relations director for a Christian contemporary radio station in Chattanooga, TN.  I've served in various capacities for over 17 years, from leading music,  a volunteer youth minister, and pastor of a church.  I am also a musician and traveled as a lead vocalist with a Southern Gospel Quartet for nearly 10 years.   My passion is serving others, and sharing the gospel with those who do not know it.  I've always wanted to serve on a mission trip, but due to a severe back injury from serving in the military,  I haven't felt like I could do it.  I was healed with surgery in January 2013.  One of my goals for this year was to go on my first mission trip.   I am a preacher of the gospel, and also sing.  I have many gifts and talents that I want to share while I am on this trip. 

Your contributions will assist me and a team of missionaries to minister to many indigenous people in the villages that surround Panama.  Many of these places go untouched by those who live in the city.  I will be involved in personal evangelism, assisting in bringing food to the those in the outlying areas who have little food.   I don't want to be part of the majority in America who are comfortable in their standard of living, and do little or nothing to help others who need it.  God teaches us that we should be careful of that and serve each other with love.  (Galatians 5:13)


What do I need?

  • My travel, lodging, ground transportation, & expenses is $1205.  We will also be buying food for the area villages while we are there.  Extra expenses are estimated at $300.  So a total of $1500 is needed.
  • I am a chef.  While serving in the military, I was sent to college to learn my culinary skills.  I hope to be able to share my talents with the villagers, and include the message of hope and love of the Gospel of Jesus Christ while I am doing it. 
  • I am stepping out on faith by committing to going on this trip.  I trust God for His provision, and feel in my heart that I am being obedient in going on this trip.  I am going no matter how much is raised here.  I will sing on the street corner if I have to, to get the rest!  
  • The contributions go directly to SCORE international.  http://www.scoreintl.org/#all


What is more important....

Your participation will impact the generation of people that we meet, but more importantly your contribution will impact generations of people who will come to know the love and hope of the salvation message of God, through His Son, Jesus Christ.   J103 and SCORE have been teaming up for many years on annual trips to Panama, Costa Rica and other countries.  Many seed were sown on these trips where there is a great harvest of new believers. 

I will be writing a journal, and taking video and pictures while I am there.  I am hoping to bring back a message to share with others in my community about my experiences in Panama, in hopes that others will share in the same passion and make a decision to take step of faith. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Any contribution is welcomed.  Every little bit will go towards the goal.  If you cannot contribute, please share this with your friends via social networking vehicles like Facebook, Twitter, Google plus...and any others you participate in. 

Your prayers are welcomed.  Please pray for God's mercy in our travels and while we are there.  That God will use us for His glory and purposes. 

Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

MOST OF ALL, THANK YOU FOR READING THIS.

story:
Update #1:

Here's a video showing some of the power-ups of the game in action!


Codename Blast is an infinite 2D space shooter which aims to deliver dynamic and visually engaging space backdrops to complement a fun and challenging gameplay experience.

The player controls the “Explorer” spaceship.
Faced with waves of asteroids, the player must destroy or evade them using his shooting skills and dexterity.
Destroying asteroids grants you points, which can be affected by a multiplier that is awarded depending on the amount of asteroids you destroy without being hit.
These asteroids break down into three categories:

 Normal/Gold asteroids will reward the player with points for destroying them.
 Normal asteroids give a base 10 points, while Gold asteroids reward the  player  with a base 50 points.

 Asteroid fields are composed by clusters of larger, indestructible asteroids which the spaceship has to evade. The reward is variable depending on whether the player successfully evades all asteroids with no damage. Hitting an asteroid nullifies the multiplier.


 

Meteors are sudden high-speed asteroid fragments which the player has to dodge after an indicator appears on the edge of the screen.


The spaceship can also collect power-ups which grant different bonuses to the player.
Some of the power-ups are:

  Speed burst, which boosts the spaceship to maximum speed while giving it a temporary indestructible state.


 Health/Shield replenishers, which restore some of the spaceship’s hull/shield.

· 

 Fire burst, which grants you infinite ammo for a limited time which is shot at a much higher and automatic rate.


 Ship upgrades, which grant you new weapons (such as additional turrets), hull upgrades, etc.


The game will feature social integration such as Leaderboards (for Points and Distance), Achievements, as well as the ability to share scores in known social networks.

We’re a team of two brothers who share a common passion for video games.

Miguel Melo is an experienced graphics designer and overall asskicker in art. He works on all of the visual flair and beauty that make our games so nice to look at (pun intended).

Nuno Melo is a Computer Science student and our code ninja. He works on all of the magic that make our games so fun to play (again, pun intended).

We have big plans for the future, and hopefully this game will help us kick start a series of projects already in development.


There’s only so much we can do with sheer will alone, and although we are already in an advanced development stage, there are costs associated with the publishing of the game which we can’t afford, namely the Android license, the Apple Store license, as well as a Mac OS X computer which is required to develop games for the iOS platform.
In sum, your funds would go into the following:

  • Android Licensing, as well as Android-powered devices for testing.
  • Apple Store Licensing, as well as an iOS-powered device for testing.
  • A Mac OS X powered computer for development.
  • Software Licenses.

ny additional funds will be used to fuel our human machines, since, as you know, time is money and as a college student and an unemployed artist, we are very short of both.


Goal #1:

3000 USD - Build the game for Android and iOS-powered devices (this includes all hardware, and software/publishing licensing required).

Goal #2:

4000 USD - We want to deliver the most polished game we can, and for that we need several testing devices. These additional funds would be put into purchasing a wide range of testing devices.



What if you can’t help?

If you can’t help financially, spread the word through social networks using indiegogo’s share buttons below. It helps a lot!

story:
Gaming Reprogrammed!
We are gamers and we want everyone to play with more comfort, fashion and passion.


Do you get blisters and sore thumbs from pressing hard on your controller sticks and buttons when gaming?
Thumb Trainers are designed to improve comfort and enhance your performance during game-play.
Each design is ergonomically shaped to be thin and hug the wearers thumb.
You put them on when you will be playing hard.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
FEATURES

We have conducted market research aimed towards gamers, which shows
a great level of interest in owning and using a pair of Thumb Trainers.

When surveyed, 83% of gamers say they get pain and discomfort from pressing down on the analogue sticks and buttons.

The worldwide gaming community needs thumb protectors.


Designed by gamers for gamers.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

THE TECHNICAL STUFF
We have prototyped and produced samples and we now need to do the tooling for the final mold and be ready to manufacture for much a larger demand.

We have a website ready for direct selling - www.thumbtrainers.com.




Here is a picture of one of the machines which will be producing Thumb Trainers.


We have calculated the needs for the tooling, production and packaging.

Click to learn more >>> Manufacture Demonstration

Thumb Trainers will be manufactured in various colors and sizes. We will produce multicolored ones and glow-in-the-dark ones. Using micro-switches and molding insert technology, we will be able to manufacture light-up ones, which will light up when you press the trainers down on a button.

Yes we will produce Thumb Sneakers for USA gamers and
Thumb Trainers for UK gamers.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
OUR PROGRESS SO FAR


----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------



********CALLING ALL GAMERS********
Grab your payment card then :) Any amount helps.
Please make your contribution today.

Thank you
The ThumbTrainers Team

If you are not donating, please use the Indiegogo share tools to promote our campaign to other crowd sources and gamers across your social networks.
