story:
Welcome on the crowdfunding campaign of «Mercury»
Mercury is a casual game. In this little puzzle game, you will help a scientist to gather mercury as much as possible. This mercury will finally turn into gold thanks to a mysterious process elaborated by this scientist. Help him to enrich!

Do not hesitate to watch the presentation video which will show you the gameplay.

 

 

  

My name is Eric Lamure. I create cartoon, my passion... For some time now I've started to produce mobile games to try to live of my work.
I am really interested in video game conception, it is a real pleasure to imagine original and new approaches.

Do not hesitate to visit my personals pages to learn more about me and my ambitions
Site web : http://www.ericlamure.com
Facebook : https://www.facebook.com/lamureeric
Youtube : http://www.youtube.com/user/EricLamure

 

 

 

I produced my first game, a game for childs, few weeks ago : «Pierrot Boom ! » and I obviously realized that I needed a communication campaign to ensure the distribution of a game.
Today I forge ahead to start my communication and collect the sufficient funds for the developing part and the marketing of my game.

The game will mainly diffuse in the differents stores of smartphones:
-AppStore for iPhones
-Google Play for Androids
-Windows Phone Store for Windows phones
A free version will be proposed, it will only contain 5 to 10 levels.
And one paid version at 1,50€ wich will contain all the levels, 45.
I also plan, after the output a developement of updates which will be featuring a challenge mode ! 10 more levels.

 

 

 

20% will be attributed to the conception work (a part of the graphic elements have been completed but I still have two months of work to decline the 45 levels and put in place all the interactions relating to the game)

5% adaptions of the game on different support

30% basic campaign by independent studios

40% valorization campaign on the AppStore and Google Play

 

 

 

Goal of the game :

The goal for the player, is to travel through the level to reach the target.

To do that, player begins with a barrel who propel a mercury ball. This ball could be divided as we touch it. We can then separate our balls up to twice to spill and move the mercury to the goal.

Technique:

When the player put his finger on the screen, barrel point in his direction. After a few seconds, barrel project the initial ball.
This one is the bigger one, as we click on it, she divides into two smaller balls. We can then click again to divide each ball again. It's the only way we have to move mercury into the level. Both divisions performed, you can't reiterate this action. Your only choice is to restart the level to adjust first shoot.

Differents objects could be clickable, whether thrusters you will activate/deactivate by click on it, or rotating obstacles which can turn on them to modify the ball trajectory etc…
Scenery features different interactive elements, hatches to open by touches switches, carton to burn by warming mercury under heat lamp or freezing the ball to slide and hit the target. In every case, the player would be submitted to a different logic.

Level:
The game includes 9 pack of 5 levels each, which represent 45 levels total. Each pack will have a privileged theme.
Division, Ice, Heat, Double barrels, Hatches and Switches.

 

 

 

All the help you can give to me is welcome. You can like my facebook page or subscribe to my Youtube channel so you can be inform about my future projects.
Thank you for reading and for your help.
story_txt:
Welcome on the crowdfunding campaign of «Mercury» Mercury is a casual game. In this little puzzle game, you will help a scientist to gather mercury as much as possible. This mercury will finally turn into gold thanks to a mysterious process elaborated by this scientist. Help him to enrich!

Do not hesitate to watch the presentation video which will show you the gameplay.
 
 
   
My name is Eric Lamure. I create cartoon, my passion... For some time now I've started to produce mobile games to try to live of my work. I am really interested in video game conception, it is a real pleasure to imagine original and new approaches.
Do not hesitate to visit my personals pages to learn more about me and my ambitions Site web : http://www.ericlamure.com Facebook : https://www.facebook.com/lamureeric Youtube : http://www.youtube.com/user/EricLamure
 
 
 
I produced my first game, a game for childs, few weeks ago : «Pierrot Boom ! » and I obviously realized that I needed a communication campaign to ensure the distribution of a game. Today I forge ahead to start my communication and collect the sufficient funds for the developing part and the marketing of my game.
The game will mainly diffuse in the differents stores of smartphones:  -AppStore for iPhones -Google Play for Androids -Windows Phone Store for Windows phones A free version will be proposed, it will only contain 5 to 10 levels.  And one paid version at 1,50€ wich will contain all the levels, 45.  I also plan, after the output a developement of updates which will be featuring a challenge mode ! 10 more levels.
 
 
 
20% will be attributed to the conception work (a part of the graphic elements have been completed but I still have two months of work to decline the 45 levels and put in place all the interactions relating to the game)
5% adaptions of the game on different support
30% basic campaign by independent studios
40% valorization campaign on the AppStore and Google Play
 
 
 
Goal of the game :

In every case, the player would be submitted to a different logic.

story:
PUBLIC SA

LES and LINKS 

(7th of November 2013)


If you've missed the crowdfunding campaign, you can now purchase the game over at the BigCartel webstore.


You might also want to check the depository of links and resources (including character sheets) here, and the G+ Sagas Community here.


STRETCH GOALS (20th of October)

Now that the game has funded I'm happy to present some stretch goals.

1: At $2,500 I will be able to order art of places and things to give you a better sense of the time and space of the game. - DONE!

2: At $2,800 I will write another character role for the game: the Thrall. Many playtesters were interested in playing a viking slave, so I'll make it possible for you to play one. - DONE!

3: At $3,000 all the backers at Raven and higher will recieve a pdf of the Fiasco playset called Blood Saga by Pedro Ziviani (of BRP: Mythic Iceland). - DONE!

4: At $4,000 

Higher quality paper + a supplemental chapter for playing court cases in the saga period. This chapter will be written by Jason Morningstar (Grey Ranks, Fiasco, Durance...) and based on the historical Grágás legal text. - DONE!

 

5: At $4,500 

An appendix with "viking" recipes for the gaming table (by me) + an essay about gender roles and relations during the viking era (by Elin Dalstål, writter on Gaming As Women). - DONE!

 

6: At $5,000

A digital handdrawn map of Iceland + a bonus playbook for playing Grendel-like characters (by Sage LaTorra, co-author of Dungeon World). - DONE!

 

7: At $5,500

Physical map for Futhark or add-on for Yggdrasil + two more essays in the appendix (details forthcoming). - DONE!

 

STILL TO GO:

 

At $7,000:
-all the Yggdrasil backers will get the map in physical format
-I will get someone to help me edit the book (I can’t catch all the mistakes alone)
-I will pass the graphic design and layout of the book over to a professional (I was planning to do it myself and I’m far from a professional)

 

At $8,000

The illustrations in the book will be printed in colour.

 

Racing to the end! 

 

PRESENTATION

What is this project about?

Hi, my name is Gregor and I'm writing a game about the lives of norse settlers in Iceland, 10th century A.D. The game deals with the trials and issues that the norse people had to deal with on the icelandic frontier. It takes a more accurate historical approach to vikings and their culture than is common in most games, but avoids excessive minutiae of attack rolls or damage, focusing instead on the turbulent relationships and strict cultural norms that make up their original sagas.

What I'm asking for?

I need the money so I can print the gamebook the way I envisioned it as well as to cover the expenses I already had in making the game. If I gather more money than I need to accomplish this, the money will go into making the book better and prettier as well as releasing bonus material and ephemera. If the book gets as good as I can make it thanks to your contributions and I still get more money, I will donate some of it to other projects or charity (I haven't yet decided on the specifics).

What do you get?

At the most basic level and every level thereafter, you will get a note of thanks in the book.
For 5$ I will send you a black and white pdf of the game.
For 20$ you get the pdf plus a physical copy of the book (please add 10$ for shipping outside the EU).
For 35$ you will get a limited edition pack of the game which will include the pdf as well as the softocoverbook, a rune-stone that I will randomly draw from a bag and laminated playsheets for the game, all inside a jute bag (please add 10$ for shipping outside the EU).
For 50$ you will get a gift/retail bundle of four books (please add 10$ for shipping outside the EU).

 

Want to know more?

If you have any other questions, drop me a line in the comments and I will try to answer as many as I can.

Don't forget to check the Updates page for more info.

--

FAQ (updated daily; last update: 20th of October)

Q: I forgot to add 10$ for international shipping. What can I do?

A: I have added a new pledge level, called "Shipping outside the EU". You can make a second pledge at this level if you already backed at the Yggdrasil or Futhark and want your book sent outside the EU but forgot to add $10 to your pledge.

 

Q: Do I need Apocalypse World to play this game?

A: No. Sagas of the Icelanders is a standalone game.

 

Q: Is Sagas of the Icelanders a reskin of Apocaplypse World?

A: Sagas is a "deep" hack, meaning that it takes the core systemic framework of Apocalypse World (AW), but creates what is more or less an entirely new game around it, very much like Dungeon World, Monsterhearts or tremulus. If you're already familiar with AW-derived games then you will know how to handle the system but you will perhaps also need to unlearn a few things. If you're new to the AW system, the game provides a lot of ingrained guidance so even first-time roleplayers can jump in without trouble.

 

Q: Will the game be available outside the crowdfunding campaign?

A: I will figure out a way to sell the pdf with a little hassle as possible. I will also print a small number of copies beyond what I need to fulfill all the orders from the backers. I will make those extra copies available in some way, but I can't say anything about the specifics right now.

 

Question: Will there be more Futhark levels available?

Answer: Futhark is limited to the number of runestones I have, which is the number of letters in the futhark alphabet. Sorry. I’ll try to make it so even the Yggdrasil level gets some extra goodies with the book, but that depends on how far the campaign will go.

Question: Can I make a contribution using PayPal?
Answer: Not at the moment but I’ll look into adding PayPal support. I'm not based in the US, so handling PayPal is a problem.

story:
**IMPORTANT**

AFTER DONATING, PLEASE LEAVE YOUR INGAME NAME AND PREFERRED GUN IF APPLICABLE IN THE COMMENTS TAB!!! WE CAN NOT PUT GUNS OR ANY OTHER ITEMS IN BACKPACKS!

DO NOT REQUEST ANY PERK CHANGES HERE. ANY PERK CHANGE REQUESTS WILL BE IGNORED. PERKS CAN NOT BE CHANGED. YOU CAN DECIDE WHAT WEAPON YOU SPAWN WITH ONCE WHEN YOU DONATE. SO MAKE IT A GOOD ONE ;).

you can NOT spawn with any of the following:

1. items in BAGS

2. repair equipment (tyres, fuel etc)

3. rpgs, satchel charges, grenades or smoke grenades

4. radio

5. bags any larger than Alice size

IF YOU DONATE, the procedure for spawning with weapons is as such:

step 1; create a new character

step 2; once logged in, log out within 25 minutes of creating the character, and wait at the lobby for 1 minute

step 3; log back in, once logged in, you will have your weapons and will spawn at your vehicle location (if you have that perk)

step 4; if this does not work, repeat. if it still does not work, contact krauterz or mancow ingame or by email at krauterz@live.com.

step 5; DONATORS CAN NOT CHANGE THEIR PERKS ONCE THE ORIGINAL REQUEST HAS BEEN PROCESSED!

**DONATION PERK RULES**

*1 DO NOT TELL ANYONE THE LOCATION OF VEHICLES!

*2 no deliberate trolling, or exploiting. this includes using vehicles that you have not got the perk access to use

*3 NO SPAWN CAMPING. it is ok to sit in capitals and murder innocents, but give them a change to get out of the city first..

*4 NO WASTING VEHICLES. dont crash one helicopter into 8 others..


*5 TRY NOT TO ADD TOO MANY VEHICLES TO THE GAME! take a chopper to a capital, but HIDE IT WELL. OR imobilize it.

*6 AND FINALLY, DONT DEATHMATCH OR SHOOT OTHERS AT PERK LOCATIONS!!! it takes up to 10 minutes to respawn there each time. please dont do it! DOING IT WILL RESULT IN A ONE DAY BAN, second warning is removal of perks for 2 days, third warning is permenant removal of perks.

*7 WE OFFER FULL REFUNDS FOR DONATIONS FOR ONLY 24 HOURS. AND ONLY IF PLAYER GIVES A RELIABLE REASON FOR THEIR REFUND REQUEST! THIS IS A DONATION SYSTEM! NOT A PAY TO RECEIVE SYSTEM!

**DONATING ACCEPTS THESE RULES. BREAKING RULES MAY RESULT IN SUSPENSION OF PERKS, REMOVAL OF PERKS AND DEPENDING ON THE MAGNITUDE OF THE INCIDENT, BANS MAY BE APPLIED**



Short Summary

ZUST is the most popular Day-Z sanctuary (private hive) server currently running. However, the owner has run into an unexpected problem which means he cannot pay for the next month of server hosting service. it is up to us to keep it going until the owner can once again run the show!

we just upgraded our server! its now an 8 core with HT (meaning 16 virtual cores!) 8gb of ram and almost 1gbps connection!


What We Need & What You Get
Realisticly, all we need is one months worth of funding, which is $360. ($169 for the server and $200 to hire 3 full time RDC admins) however, the more we collect, the better this server will become. more money means more slots, better uptime and less lag


QUIRKS INCLUDE WEAPONS AND VEHICLES! depending on how much you donate, the owner of the server can give you weapons, and other items. if you donate a lot, we can even give you a helicopter permenantly!
If we do not reach our goal of $260, the funds will be allocated to the next possible server restart stage. if its a few months away, this will aid in helping the server come back to life as much as possible.


The Impact
If ZUST gets shut down, players all across the world will lose their progress, vehicles and weapons. WE CANT LET THIS HAPPEN!
Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
Krauterz, the owner of the server, assures us that with proper funding, and with a goal that is met, not only could the server stay up indefinitly, but he could double the slot count. increase performance and add more perks to the game.


Other Ways You Can Help
If you cant donate, dont worry, just like us on facebook! and of course feel free to connect to our server to talk directly to an admin!

WE CANT LET THIS HAPPEN!Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).Krauterz, the owner of the server, assures us that with proper funding, and with a goal that is met, not only could the server stay up indefinitly, but he could double the slot count. increase performance and add more perks to the game.Other Ways You Can HelpIf you cant donate, dont worry, just like us on facebook! and of course feel free to connect to our server to talk directly to an admin!

story:
Build a Game

Build a Game enables people from all walks of life to create, play and publish games with no programming.

We are three guys that love making games, playing games and making complex systems simple enough for everyone to use.
 
This campaign is about bringing the game medium to as many people as possible. With the right tools, game creation can be as simple as taking a picture.

Your contributions make Build a Game possible by providing the much needed funds that allow us to focus on Build a Game and complete it by fall of 2013.

What We Need & What You Get

Our funding goal is set at 36,000. This amount allows each of us to cover our monthly living and business expenses for the next 6 months. Basicslly 2,000 a month each. With this amount we can stay hyper focused on development and make a great application!

Our perks are all about Build a Game. From custom art, tiles and tools. The perks are focused on what you'll want when you get Build a Game in your hands!

In the event that the goal is not met, we plan to use the funds to continue development. Our goal is bringing Build a Game to market and every penny counts.

The Impact

Build A Game, designed and engineered to Build, Play, Share and Sell, reinvents the game industry within one app and creates an ecosystem which supports the future of interactive media.

Building with the layered design is simple enough for kids and powerful enough for professionals to create unique expressions and ideas with the greatest of ease.

Play becomes a shared experience like never before, connecting all games and platforms together for the most dynamic playing environment to date. 

Sharing and selling provide opportunity for growth and ownership creating a strong community of dedicated users.

Lastly, the care and quality of the software engineering, positions Build A Game with the leading role for continued innovation and expansion.  

Build A Game is the application to build, play, share and sell your game and content creations. A complete solution, organized, streamlined and ready for players, developers and dreamers to let themselves go.

So the question, can we make game development easier, can we make playing more fun, can we make publishing better, the answer, is yes and the app is Build A Game.

Other Ways You Can Help

As the campaign gets under way we can use your help getting the word out about Build a Game. Be sure to post on your favorite blogs, review sites and forums, as well as Facebook and Twitter. 

And remember the Indiegogo share tools help make that even easier!

Your voice and pledges can make this a success!

Thank you for all that you do!

 

We look forward to the next 30 days!

Eric Walker

Nathan Warden

Chad Walker

story:
Gaming for Grub!

Gamers everywhere have a passion for their games of choice. Roleplayers, Card gamers, Miniature Wargamers, and Table Top enthusiast love to sit down and have a good game. Foodmachine Houston  is a group of dedicated gamers from multiple gaming platforms that want to do more for our community through gaming.

My name is Mike Ramirez and here is my story.

Born in 1985, I have been able to have a broad variety of gaming under my belt. Playing in video game championships when I was 9 and 10, I was able to see how easy it was to form relationships in the gaming community. We all enjoyed just having a good time. In middle school I was introduced to table top RPGs and I found a new love. Table Top board gaming and Miniature Wargaming have been my bread and butter over the past few years. Along with my own love for gaming, my mother instilled in me the desire to help others. Helping at community blood drives, food drives, volunteering at Texas Children's Hospital, and cloth drives showed me how much we here in Houston could actually help one another.

Foodmachine Houston is not my own idea. Foodmachine events happen all over the world and focus on the wargame Warmachine produced by Privateer Press.  But I saw the food drives and thought "With the size of Houston and the gaming community we could do so much for our great city." From the very beginning Foodmachine Houston was and is a multi-platform gaming/food drive. And with the help of this fundraiser we hope to become a larger boon to our community.


What We Need & What You Get

So here is the skinny

  • We only need $707 to become a 501.c3 Non-Profit Organization.
  • The rest of the funds will be used to help find and rent large enough locations to hold our different drives. Currently we do a food drive every year before Thanksgiving, but we would like to help with blood drives, clothing drives, and school fundraisers throughout the year.
  • Since we don't really have a product the only thing we can really give you is our sincere gratitude and immortalize you on our Facebook page and Wall of Fame Banner we will be putting together to take everywhere we help.

The Impact

Houston is a great city. Large in both populace and diversity in said populace. There are so many areas that can use help and with a community as grand as gamers, who better to lend a hand?

  • Your donation will go towards making Foodmachine Houston sustainable and benefit future generations of gamers and philanthropists.
  • This year marks the third year of Foodmachine Houston and our first real year of going big.
  • We have sponsors from game companies, local privately owned companies, and are currently talking with the University of Houston to be another sponsor. 

Risks & Challenges

The truth is we have no products. We have nothing to sell. Our only goal is to help better our community and establish a foundation that will help serve the Houston area for years to come. This may seem like a long shot, but if we can only try to start something big, it is better than not trying at all.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Some people just can't contribute monetary donations. We understand, but everyone can spread the word and raise awareness of Foodmachine Houston. :

    • Share this Indiegogo with your friends and family on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, your own websites, and of course in your work place.
    • Donations are not limited to individuals. We will gladly put a link to your place of work or any corporate sponsor that is willing to help our cause.
story_txt:
Gaming for Grub!
 Gamers everywhere have a passion for their games of choice. Roleplayers, Card gamers, Miniature Wargamers, and Table Top enthusiast love to sit down and have a good game. Foodmachine Houston  is a group of dedicated gamers from multiple gaming platforms that want to do more for our community through gaming.
My name is Mike Ramirez and here is my story.
Born in 1985, I have been able to have a broad variety of gaming under my belt. Playing in video game championships when I was 9 and 10, I was able to see how easy it was to form relationships in the gaming community. We all enjoyed just having a good time. In middle school I was introduced to table top RPGs and I found a new love. Table Top board gaming and Miniature Wargaming have been my bread and butter over the past few years. Along with my own love for gaming, my mother instilled in me the desire to help others. Helping at community blood drives, food drives, volunteering at Texas Children's Hospital, and cloth drives showed me how much we here in Houston could actually help one another. Foodmachine Houston is not my own idea. Foodmachine events happen all over the world and focus on the wargame Warmachine produced by Privateer Press.  But I saw the food drives and thought "With the size of Houston and the gaming community we could do so much for our great city." From the very beginning Foodmachine Houston was and is a multi-platform gaming/food drive. And with the help of this fundraiser we hope to become a larger boon to our community. We only need $707 to become a 501.c3 Non-Profit Organization.

Our only goal is to help better our community and establish a foundation that will help serve the Houston area for years to come. This may seem like a long shot, but if we can only try to start something big, it is better than not trying at all.  
  Other Ways You Can Help Some people just can't contribute monetary donations. We understand, but everyone can spread the word and raise awareness of Foodmachine Houston. :

Share this Indiegogo with your friends and family on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, your own websites, and of course in your work place. 

Donations are not limited to individuals. We will gladly put a link to your place of work or any corporate sponsor that is willing to help our cause.

story:
UPDATE #2 As the campaign is taking it's time to get off the ground, we have decided to add in some additional rewards for the first people to back us.  The first 10 backers will receive some unique dragon artwork, created and signed by our resident dragon artist Ben.  These rewards will be included on top of the usual perk reward, and will be regardless of actual amount pledged.


UPDATE #1 To clarify, we’ve chosen a 25 day time limit for the campaign. This may seem short in comparison to other indiegogo campaigns; while we would love to have a longer 40 or 50 day campaign to encourage word-of-mouth spread, time is of the essence – the sooner we can arrange the funding, the sooner we can bring on additional help to get the game into beta

 

The Team

We are DragonFlame Studios, a UK-based indie development company currently working on our first game, Dragons! (note the exclamation mark).  More specifically, we are four friends who have worked together for years; Ben Matheson is the art guy - whether hand-drawn or computer modelled, he's been drawing dragons since he was 6; Chris Gould is our coding wizard - while all of us have programming experience, no-one touches Chris when it comes to bashing out code; Johan Jensen is our resident Norwegian; half-viking, with the beard to prove it.  And then there's myself, Steve Sawyer, the Dungeon Master for most of our gaming sessions and the nominated 'business guy', the one who has to deal with all the boring stuff like budgeting and release dates.  But enough about us - what about the game?

 

The Game

Dragons! has been our labour of love for the past 2 years - it came out of a simple question asked during a gaming session; how many games let you actually play as a dragon?  Sure, there are a lot of games that FEATURE dragons, but the ones with dragons as a PC can probably be counted on one claw (the best of which - Choice of Dragons - is text-based and browser only).  As admirers of the noble beasts, we felt someone had to put this to right...and naturally we elected ourselves to do so. 

Dragons! was originally designed to be a run-and-gun type game with some treasure collection, but has evolved far beyond that.  It is now an action-strategy-RPG hybrid, which sounds relatively complicated, so let me run you through the basics;

To start the game, you first assign your initial pool of points to each of your four attributes - strength, which determines your hitpoints and physical strength; speed, which governs your speed in both the air and on the ground; intelligence, which determines your mana reserves; and willpower, which determines spell and breath attack strength.  You can also select your elemental type from a choice of fire, ice, storm or earth, which affects your starting breath attack (flame, ice, lightning or boulder respectively), along with the spell types initially available to you.  You can also customise your appearance, choosing your dragon's colour, basic shape, and wing design.

  

 

Once you have chosen your starting dragon, the world is randomly generated, and you start in your initial lair with a small amount of gold.  Your treasure pile is immensely important - you level up as you collect gold and treasure, gaining further attribute increases and access to more powerful spells, so guard your treasure pile well.  You can gain treasure through raiding towns and villages, destroying trade caravans, defeating monsters, or through completing quests offered by each of the three factions.

The three factions present in the world are the Council of Magi, a neutral body of mages that seeks out knowledge and power, the Altar Dominion, a human empire based around honour, justice and duty, and the Green Horde, a race of orks and goblins who worship war and chaos above all else.  Each of the factions will have a number of towns, villages and cities, with a capital where you can talk to the faction leader and accept quests for further rewards.  Each quest will inevitably bring you into conflict with one or more of the other factions - you can choose to be loyal to one faction, play them off against each other, or simply lay waste to them all.  The more quests you complete for one of the factions, the better the rewards will be - in the case of the Magi, you will recieve additional spells, the Horde will offer additional followers, and the Dominion can provide magical artifacts.  Also, the more you attack one faction, the more hostile they will be, until they actively send heros and champions against you to end your reign of terror.  

There are also a number of unaffiliated villages, towns and cities which you can raid with impunity, but beware - the stronger you become, the stronger their defenses are likely to be.  However, greater strength can also lead to followers willing to devote their lives to you, which leads to the strategy aspect of the game - you can set your followers to work improving your lair to provide additional benefits, and create elaborate traps and safety devices to better protect your treasure pile.  A dragon's hoard is a tempting thing, and occasionally thieves and rogues will try their luck.  If they succeed in getting past your defenses, you'll have to chase them down before they escape with a portion of your gold.

There are lone wizards (not affiliated with the Council of Magi) scattered throughout the world, in their own towers and strongholds.  You can assault these strongholds, and capture the wizards to put to work in your lair to research and unlock additional spells.  Higher-level wizards will be able to research more powerful spells, and will research faster, but beware; the higher-level the wizard, the more dangerous the battle is likely to be.  It's all about balancing the risk-reward ratio.  You can tell the relative level of a wizard from the size and appearance of his stronghold.  The highest-level wizards are the necromancers, who command armies of undead defenders from imposing towers and strongholds - the battle to capture such a wizard will be epic indeed.

 

 

As you grow in strength, you will also have to deal with wannabe heroes trying their luck to become the next St George.  The first few you deal with will be mere trifling annoyances, but they will gradually increase in skill and efficiency as you grow in power.  You can choose to simply fly away and ignore them - they can't fight what they can't reach, after all - but the higher level champions are likely to have magical items, which, as well as counting as a valuable addition to your treasure pile, can also bestow additional benefits, such as increased attributes or even special powers or effects.  You can only have three magical item effects active at one time, so choose them wisely.

The randomly generated levels plus the range of options avaliable at creation should help to keep the game fresh and encourage replayability - there will be a simple campaign included, but more as a tutorial, to get players used to the basic mechanics of the game.  The meat-and-bones is in the randomly generated levels - each game should evolve differently depending on initial choice of dragon, starting position, magical items found, etc.  We plan on adding a lengthier campaign with a full story, with branching pathways based on choices made within the campaign - this should be released a month or two after the full game; all reward tiers above Dragon Yearling will recieve this free of charge.  We also plan on adding multiplayer support as a further expansion, allowing up to four dragons at once to compete in the same world to build their own treasure hoard, in a slightly pared down version of the main game.

 

The Funding

At this stage, we still have a bit of coding left to finish, and the graphics engine is in need of a bit of spit and polish, which is where you come in; at the moment, we're running behind schedule, and with only four pairs of hands on deck we may not be able to make up the time.  All our funds have been tied up in the development of the game, and now we find ourselves without the additional funds necessary to hire someone else.  With your help and funding, we can afford to take on an additional programmer on a freelance basis to help out with the last of the coding and the graphics update; deity-of-your-choice willing, we can have the beta ready within 2-3 months of the campaign ending, which should theoretically give us enough time to iron out the bugs and sort any balancing issues in time for release by the end of the year.

In the horrible event that we don't raise ANY funds, the game will still be released (we're not about to throw in the towel at this stage), but it may get pushed back until sometime next year.  This means, even if we only reach part of our goal, we will still be able to fulfill all our pledge commitments, just perhaps slightly later than we would like. 

In the beautiful event that we get over-funding, we'll be able to speed the process even further, and it will allow us to add additional flourishes that we had initially planned but currently don't have time for.  If we do reach our funding goal early, expect some generous stretch-funding goals (with significant additional benefits to those early backers).

 

 

The Rewards

Whilst we know that you are kind, honest, decent people, we also don't expect you to give us your financial support without something in return.  Each backer, from $5 upwards, will be sent a key to the closed beta as soon as it goes live (assuming we meet our funding goal, that should be within 2-3 months of the campaign ending, if not, it may be pushed back a month or two, but we will of course keep you appraised of the situation).

From $10 upwards, you will also recieve a full copy of the game upon release.  This will be a digital download, DRM-free, details will be sent to you as soon as the game is released (if we meet our funding goal, this should be by the end of the year, hopefully in November barring any catastrophies/surprise dragon attacks.  If not, this could be pushed back to early next year, depending on how much funding we raise - again, we will keep you fully abreast of the situation)

From $20 upwards, you will also recieve any additional add-ons or expansions, including the planned campaign, multiplayer support, and any DLC released, no matter how minor.  We plan to keep working on and improving the game for a significant amount of time after release, so expect to see plenty of additional content.

For any of the further perk levels, with the ability to name/create characters or items for the game, we will initially be in touch when the campaign ends to collect some basic details, then will get back in touch within a month or two to create the content with you.  After the campaign ends, our first priority will be to get the beta up and running, but rest assured that you will receive your full reward for the game going live.  If you have any personalised content, such as the personal magic item or dragon, it will be provided as a personal DLC along with the release of the full game - if you wish, it will remain personal to you, and not be released to any other owner of the game.

 

Of course, any donation at any level is appreciated - all backers will earn a special place within our hearts, for having the faith in us and in Dragons! to show your support.  Thank you

story:
KeyStone is a totally free-to-play action card game, already available in StarCraft II's Arcade. You do NOT need to purchase StarCraft II to play it, just download it, install and launch, then click "Custom" followed by "Arcade" and search for "KeyStone" in the search bar.

Important Backer Information!

In order to deliver your perks, I need your StarCraft II Account ID and/or your Discord Account ID. Please fill out this short form with that information.

Perks are not cumulative, each is a separate item. You can donate multiple times at different levels to receive more than one perk, or pick one of the "bundle" donation levels.

 

Following the death of the Overmind, the sector was in disarray. Confident they could contain the turmoil before it reached Earth, the UED sent a fleet to conquer the warring factions and enslave the zerg. Raynor and Fenix banded together to survive the chaos, while Kerrigan, seeking to gain complete control over the Swarm, tricked the Dark Templar into helping her fight the UED and their fledgling Overmind.

The goal of this campaign is to fund Desperate Alliances, an expansion to KeyStone based on the alliances and betrayals of the Brood War period of StarCraft.
 

At this tier Desperate Alliances will be a mini-expansion with at least 15 new cards (5 per race). They will be available via the crafting menu, but not as packs.

Also, when we reach this tier we will immediately release 1 promotional card per race. These promotional cards don't count towards the "new cards per race" numbers mentioned in these goals, they're just a bonus!

At this tier the expansion will have at least 30 new cards (10 per race). They will be available via the crafting menu, but not as packs.

This tier also includes a new battlefield terrain themed after the expansion.

At this tier the expansion will have at least 45 new cards (15 per race), and they will be available as packs from the store. It's possible that we will include packs with slightly less funding, but not guaranteed; if a set is too small, packs can contain so many duplicates that they just feel silly.

At this final tier, the expansion will have at least 90 new cards (30 per race).
 

If we only make it partway to a goal, the extra money will go towards adding cards. For funding between $675 and $1350, funding goes towards new cards at a rate of $45 per card. For funding between $1350 and $3150, funding goes towards new cards at a rate of $30 per card.

The higher cost per card earlier in the funding is to cover the costs of developing and delivering perks, and art costs like the new terrain. Once these costs are covered, development can focus purely on designing the new set.

If we don't reach the minimum funding level of $675, everyone will be refunded and the expansion will be cancelled, but we will still deliver perks to the handful that were supportive enough to want to donate.
 

The last crowdfunding campaign started on August 20th, ended on September 20th, and the expansion released on November 2nd. That means we were able to release the expansion just 2.5 months after the launch of the campaign. I expect a similar timeline this time around, although it does depend somewhat on the size of the expansion. At a maximum the expansion should take no more than 4 months after the launch of the campaign to complete.

In-game perks will be treated a lot like online orders for physical items. As soon as you donate and fill out the backer form, I will begin working and you should see your perk in-game within a week or two.

Beta testing will begin as soon as there are new cards to test. This will be shortly after the campaign ends at the very latest, but it might be earlier.

Once these costs are covered, development can focus purely on designing the new set.If we don't reach the minimum funding level of $675, everyone will be refunded and the expansion will be cancelled, but we will still deliver perks to the handful that were supportive enough to want to donate. The last crowdfunding campaign started on August 20th, ended on September 20th, and the expansion released on November 2nd. That means we were able to release the expansion just 2.5 months after the launch of the campaign. I expect a similar timeline this time around, although it does depend somewhat on the size of the expansion. At a maximum the expansion should take no more than 4 months after the launch of the campaign to complete.In-game perks will be treated a lot like online orders for physical items. As soon as you donate and fill out the backer form, I will begin working and you should see your perk in-game within a week or two.Beta testing will begin as soon as there are new cards to test. This will be shortly after the campaign ends at the very latest, but it might be earlier.

story:
"Ideal Subject” is a story-based, first-person space adventure. Survive your way through being abducted to a strange, new world. Fight for your life against brutes, monsters, and anything that wants you dead; all while hopefully avoiding getting probed!

You play a man named Cole Doukas, your average, run of the mill individual who works at a local food market as one of the store managers. He finally gets a day off from the chaos of retail work and seeks the fresh air of the New Hampshire wilderness. However, what seems to be a normal hike in the woods to unwind, turns into the act that changes his life forever. Cole is kidnapped from earth, and taken to the far reaches of the known galaxy.

One year of time passes, and Cole’s life has changed on a cosmic scale; experimented on by the alien’s that have captured him. Through his isolation, and the experiments done to him; Cole unlocks powers he could only have dreamed of. However, with every step forward he takes in his training the brutal physical, and mental tests become unbearable for Cole. Every day becomes harder, and harder for him to look into the future for all he can see is despair. Until one day, an unexpected ally comes to his aide. Another alien reaches out to Cole, and a plan begins to take shape for him to escape.

This alien is a member of the race that is an enemy of his captures race, and they must work together to get out alive. However, haste is the key to their success because the leader of his captures, the architect of his abduction Magnus Haawes is coming to where Cole is being held. If they don’t escape now, he may never be able to feel any sense of freedom again.

Help Cole escape this scenario to head out the greater galaxy to embark on a grand adventure across the stars. Fight beasts, monsters, and the unknown on his journey to find allies, and friends along the way to try and defeat Haawes, or die trying.

 

Ideal Subject’s gameplay loop will consist around:

  1. Engaging Combat with Elemental Abilities
  2. Interesting Puzzles utilizing the elemental abilities used in combat.
  3. Explore Diverse Areas of Engagement

Combat:

Players will be able to engage in combat using various elemental abilities, and combing them to create even more powerful attacks.   By combining these various abilities, the player will need to manage which ones to combine in order to effect specific types of enemies.

These abilities are based off of the elements of the universe:

  1. Fire
  2. Water
  3. Ice
  4. Electricity
  5. Ground

Enemy types in Idea subject will be designed to counter your various ability combinations, although with everyone having a weak point the player will need to discover. So when playing, make sure when encountering the various enemies to find what they’re weak to, and exploit it.

Puzzles:

As with the combat in Ideal Subject, various puzzles will be placed in your path that you will need to use the ability system to try and solve them. Make sure to do your best with these puzzles, for the ancient ones haven’t been tested for a long time, and there’s no way to know what will happen on failure.

Exploration:

Once you escape with your new Alien friend, explore diverse environments as you travel around discovering the secrets of the galaxy.

story:
Hi, my name is Ryan. I am a lecturer in video games development and over the past year I have been publishing my own mobile game titles.My most recent game title is a game called Blobb.

Blobb is a puzzle game inspired by the ice dungeon puzzles in the Pokémon games and similar titles. You play as a new life-form called Blobb that is being tested for its intelligence. You are required to navigate the maze by slipping and sliding your way to the star. However when you start moving, you can't change direction until something stops you from moving. All of this while avoiding traps and obstacles that increase the challenge.

The game is free to download and includes 3 Episodes, each with 15 levels. However you can then choose to get the next 2 Episodes by purchasing the Silver Scientist add-on or the Gold Scientist add-on. The Gold Scientist however acts like a season pass and gives you access to all the new Episodes to be released in the future.

The game is complete and will soon be available on Android and Windows Phone in the coming weeks. But I would love the opportunity to port the game to iOS and release it there too. This though will cost me more money than I can afford and I am looking for help.

I need £1000 in order to purchase the equipment and licenses required for iOS development. If we exceed this goal, extra funds will be put towards better equipment and marketing.

This funding will not only help me port Blobb to iOS but also develop all my future games for iOS too

story:
Short Summary

My name is Daniel. I have been casting resin for years now and I am an enthusiastic tabletop wargamer.  On my Facebook page you can check all the things I have been commissioned to cast.

One of our friends, Zoltán, who is an talented sculptor is running the www.vargamuhely.com website. He created the 10-15mm scale wizard tower visible below for games like Warmaster. You can see two 10mm figures on the drawbridge (Copplestone Castings Rangers).

The multipart tower is 22 cm (9 inches) tall. The base is 7 x 10 cm (2,8 x 4 inches) .


I have been working on the items for Gregster's Lab and now I have teamed up with Zoltán for this project.. 

We decided to use Indiegogo to make the models available to all small-scale gamers like us and to collect funds to be able to mold and cast this amazing terrain piece. 

What We Need & What You Get

If you support us, we will be able to build a pressure chamber big enough to mold and cast the tower. We also need the funds to buy all the resin and the rubber in advance.

Risks & Challenges

I have never cast such a huge terrain piece but I am sure I can do it and have a perfectly accurate copy in resin. Many parts can be removed to ease the molding and casting.

I have to build a pressure chamber big enough to fit the tower inside. Besides the size, I do not think we face any other risk. The material will be purchased on time. We will calculate with flexibility when we set the deadline for delivering. Postage can also delay some packages, but we will also calculate with that and send everything as registered mail. You will receive the tracking number when the package is on its way.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you do not need any towers for your tables, we appreciate if you share the page for others who might like it. 

More pictures



After some discussion, we are also making available the other terrain pieces we have. Please see the perks on the side for prices.

The watermill

The watermill is a small piece of terrain to add for your tabletop. More pictures in the gallery. 140mm long, 83mm wide, 65mm tall.


The windmill

The windmill with its details and size can be a real centerpiece on a battlefield.


The lonely tower

The lonely tower was designed by Miniman in 3D and printed at Shapeways in Frosted Ultra detail, then cast in resin. There are two perks for it. You can have it with or without the custom made base. The tower itself is 90mm tall and 45mm wide. Comes with a balcony add-on.

story:
Help Support the Living Games Conference!

Live Action Role-Play is a vibrant and exciting corner of the game world. Across the world, hundreds of thousands of people get together and enjoy LARPs that range from high fantasy to personal drama, big budget live combat games to intimate freeform Nordic dramas. From battleships dressed up to be Battlestars to educational games that inspire children and adults to learn, LARP is a genre of games like no other. That's why scholarship and exploration of LARP is so important to keep the field growing. 

That is the purpose of the Living Games Conference.

My name is Shoshana Kessock. I'm a graduate student at the NYU Game Center in Brooklyn, New York. As a game designer and scholar who specializes in LARP, I chose to create the Living Games Conference as my graduate thesis so as to create a place where scholars, designers and community leaders could come together and share their expertise and passion for LARP. My aim was to create a three day conference that would feature panels, workshops and even a games showcase for the attendees to enjoy. Now, with the support of the NYU Game Center, that dream is becoming a reality. 

But to get the conference on its feet, I'm reaching out to you for help.

While fundraising has covered much of the cost of the conference, additional funds are needed, especially for one of the biggest parts of the conference: documentation. An important part of LARP scholarship is documenting events for posterity to be studied later. I want to make the events that go on at the conference can be made available not only to those who can't attend, but to those who might want to study the talks for future reference and inspiration. For that, some money must be raised. 

What We Need & What You Get

To properly fund the conference and provide the equipment for documenting the content properly, we are seeking $1000. This will contribute to:

  • Getting equipment for documentation (audio/visual equipment and assistance)
  • Graphic design and printing costs for conference materials.
Should our initial goals be met, the additional funds will be added to sundry needs for the conference, including aiding conference attendees who seek financial assistance to attend the event.
For your contributions, depending on the tier you donate, you get access to certain perks:
  • At $10 you receive a thank you email from the conferences director, and your name is listed on the website as a conference supporter.
  • At $30 you receive a signed Living Games Conference poster! This limited run of posters will only be created for this conference, and contributors will have theirs signed by designer Cryssy Cheung. 
  • At $100 you receive the conference proceedings sent to you on a USB drive straight to you address. No need to watch the videos online when you can have them all for your own. You will also receive a copy of the poster.
  • At $300 you will receive a short freeform LARP written for you by conference director and veteran LARP writer Shoshana Kessock. You will discuss with Shoshana what elements you want in the LARP and will receive a short game in return for you and your friends to play. (To be received summer 2014 - writing LARPs takes some time!)
No matter the tier, you will receive updates from the conference team about the conference, as well as links to the conference documentation once it goes online. You'll be contributing to our success, and we will share the fruits of that success with you as soon as they go online. 

The Impact

This conference is the very first live action role-play conference of its kind in the United States. By supporting Living Games, you'll be supporting not only the expansion of LARP and game scholarship, but you'll be helping to build a space where people can come together to share their ideas and design tools to build better games. Not only that, but with your support we'll then be able to take what happens at the conference and share it with the rest of the world through our documentation. 

Should the conference go well this year, we're hoping to make Living Games an ongoing project in the years to come. But to do that, this year's event has to happen first! I'm passionate about seeing this space built for games and with your help, I believe we can make it happen. 

Can't Contribute? There Are Other Ways To Support The Conference!

If you find that you can't contribute, help us get the word out to the community at large! Share this fundraiser or spread the word about the conference itself to those that might want to attend. Every little bit helps to bring this conference to life.

I appreciate your support and thank you for helping make this event a success!

story:
Introduction / Presentación

  • ABOUT ME / SOBRE MÍ:
    • My name is Carlos Antón, and I am a Designer born in Elche (Alicante, SPAIN), although I have been living almost half of my life in Granada.
    • I am also Superior Technician in Publishing Production, and Superior Technician in Animation for Physical Activity and Sports.
    • Also I have developed important functions and tasks like Plastic Artist, Graphical Designer, Industrial Designer, and Webmaster.
    • Finally, I have several inventions and patents officially registered.
      ___________________________________________________________________
      (español)

    • Mi nombre es Carlos Antón y soy un Diseñador Ilicitano, aunque he vivido muchos años en Granada.
    • Técnico Superior en Producción Editorial, Técnico Superior en Animación a la Actividad Física y el Deporte.
    • También he desarrollado funciones importantes como Artista Plástico, Diseñador Gráfico, Diseñador Industrial, y Webmaster.
    • Dispongo de varias invenciones o patentes.


  • WHAT IS MAGNECUBES? / ¿QUÉ ES MAGNECUBES?
    Infographics



    It is a very innovating construction´s game with magnetic attraction that makes it much more fun, and it is an important aid for developing the creativity and the logical thinking.
    The original Magnecube, as its own name indicates, is a magnetic cube able to assemble others in a very fast and effective way, so that it allows us to construct more complex structures from basic objects.
    It is a bucket of 2x2x2 cm. that trough an innovating technology is magnetized and turned in a formidable piece of entertainment and fun, giving rise to a wonderful and didactic game of construction. In such waythat I have created a game that combines the creativity and the logical thinking, besides with the processes of the new technologies in a totally novel way.
    Magnecubes is much more efficient, fast and attractive for playing than the rest of construction´s games. In addition, it is very easy to gather to keep it in a box.


    ___________________________________________________________________
    (español)

  • Es un juego de construcción muy innovador, con atracción magnética que lo hace mucho más divertido. Ayuda a desarrollar la creatividad y la lógica.
    El Magnecubo original, como su propio nombre indica,
    es un cubo magnético capaz de ensamblarse de una manera muy rápida y efectiva, por cualquiera de sus 6 caras, de modo que nos permite construir estructuras más complejas a partir de objetos básicos.


    Prototitypes


    Se trata de un cubo de 2x2x2 cms que, mediante una innovadora tecnología se
    magnetiza y convierte en una formidable pieza de entretenimiento
    Dando lugar a un maravilloso y didáctico juego de construcción.
    De modo que creamos un juego que combina la creatividad y la lógica,
    junto con los procesos de las nuevas tecnologías, de una manera totalmente novedosa.
    Magnecubes es mucho más eficiente, rápido y atractivo en su uso que el resto de juegos de construcción, además de muy fácil de recoger.



  • BENEFITS TO PLAY WITH MAGNECUBES / BENEFICIOS DE JUGAR CON MAGNECUBES:

    It stimulates the creativity and the logical thinking in 3 dimensions, besides to help the children to develop a better space´s perception and the surroundings.
    Aid also to develop as much the logical part as the creative one of the brain of the children.
    It also develops to the hand-eye coordination and the fine motor activity.It has as well other many benefits exist for playing with magnecubes, among them  we can emphasize as follow:

    • Aid the children for developing creative solutions.
    • Using the logical thought while children are playing.
    • Help the children to be much more organized.
    • Facilitating to include/understand better concepts like space, volume, weight, balance, symmetry or resistance.


    __________________________________________________________________
    (español)

    Estimula la creatividad y la lógica en 3 dimensiones,
    además de ayudar al niño a tener una mejor percepción del espacio y el entorno.
    Ayuda también a desarrollar tanto la parte lógica, como la creativa del cerebro del niño.
    Desarrolla también la coordinación oculo-manual y la motricidad fina.
    También existen otros muchos beneficios de jugar con magnecubes, entre los que podemos destacar:

    • Ayuda a desarrollar soluciones creativas,
    • A usar el pensamiento lógico,
    • A ser más organizado,
    • A comprender mejor conceptos como espacio, volumen, peso, equilibrio, simetría o resistencia.




    Construction examples


  • PROCESS / PROCESO:
    • Our process begins with the handmade sketches, and later we design the elements in 2D and 3D.
    • Secondly we start the manufacture of the plastic materials and purification.
    • Afterward the process continues to a magician and secret process of materials´ magnetization thus obtaining its great versatility.
    • The following step consists on the design and packing accomplishment.
    • Later we start the distribution, and so we were able to transport our product at all the houses.
    • And finally, it is received by the client and he could to start PLAYING AND ENJOYING!






    _________________________________________________________________
    (español)

    • Nuestro proceso empieza con los bocetos a mano y posterior diseño en 2d y 3d de los productos,
    • En segundo lugar pasa por la fabricación de los materiales plásticos y depuración.
    • Más tarde pasa a un mágico y secreto proceso de magnetización de los materiales, consiguiendo así su gran versatilidad.
    • El siguiente paso consiste en el diseño y realización del empaquetado.
    • Después se pasa a la distribución, gracias a la que conseguimos llegar nuestro producto a todas las casas.
    • Y por fin, se recibe y se comienza ¡A JUGAR Y DISFRUTAR!




In which concepts will be use the money? / ¿En qué se usará el dinero?


AMPLIAR IMAGEN / ENLARGE THE IMAGE



We needed a minimum 16.900 Euros to be able to obtain ours immediate goal, among which it is possible to emphasize:

  • Prototypes´ purification and one first industrial production of  about 10,000 pieces for estimating the market, with ABS plastic (diferent colores) finished or similar material, that it is detached in the following concepts:

  1. Manufacture of 3 molds of injection for plastic pieces. 
  2. Production of 10.000 plastic´s pieces.
  3. Developing the magnetization´s system.
  4. Packaging process.
  5. Others.

  • To acquire tools and machineries for developing the own prototype and I+D department.
  • Development of new forms and accessories for the construction game.
  • Creation of an own shop.
  • Other more expenses:
  1. Expenses of paypal/banks´ rates and fees.
  2. Expenses of collective financing platform rates.
  3. Expenses of industrial and intellectual property protection (patents).
  4. Administrative expenses and for the economic activity establishment.
  5. Improvement of Web showcase or creation of a new one.
  6. Merchandising.
  7. Creation of Marketing, communication, publicity and diffusion campaigns

If we were not able to get our total financing goal, our priority would be on the PRODUCTION AND DISTRIBUTION OF THE COMPENSATIONS.



 
    Desings in development







    Desings in development



__________________________________________________________________
(español)

Necesitamos un mínimo de 16.900 Euros para poder conseguir nuestros primeros objetivos, entre los cuales caben destacar los siguientes:

  • Depuración de los prototipos y una primera producción industrial de 10.000 piezas, con acabado en material plástico ABS de colores o similar, para tantear el mercado, que se desglosa en los siguientes conceptos:
  1. Producción de 10.000 piezas plástico.
  2. Sistema de imantación.
  3. Packaging.
  4. Otros.
  • Adquirir herramientas y maquinarias para desarrollar un departamento de prototipado propio y de I+D.
  • Desarrollo de nuevas formas y accesorios para el juego de construcción.
  • Creación de una Tienda Online Propia.
  • Otros gastos:
  1. Gastos de intereses de bancos / paypal.
  2. Gastos de intereses de plataforma de financiación colectiva.
  3. Gastos de protección de propiedad industrial e intelectual (patentes).
  4. Gastos administrativos y de establecimiento de actividad económica.
  5. Mejora de web escaparate o creación de una nueva (incluyendo inglés y francés).
  6. Merchandising.
  7. Creación de campañas de Marketing, comunicación, publicidad y difusión.

story_txt:
Introduction / Presentación

ABOUT ME / SOBRE MÍ:
My name is Carlos Antón, and I am a Designer born in Elche (Alicante,
     SPAIN), although I have been living almost half of my life in Granada.
I am also Superior Technician in Publishing Production, and Superior
     Technician in Animation for Physical Activity and Sports.
Also I have developed important functions and tasks like Plastic
     Artist, Graphical Designer, Industrial Designer, and Webmaster.
Finally, I have several inventions and patents officially registered.___________________________________________________________________(español)

Mi nombre es Carlos Antón y soy un Diseñador Ilicitano, aunque he vivido muchos años en Granada.
Técnico Superior en Producción Editorial, Técnico Superior en Animación a la Actividad Física y el Deporte.
También he desarrollado funciones importantes como Artista Plástico, Diseñador Gráfico, Diseñador Industrial, y Webmaster.
Dispongo de varias invenciones o patentes.





WHAT IS MAGNECUBES? / ¿QUÉ ES MAGNECUBES?





Infographics


It is a very innovating construction´s game with magnetic
attraction that makes it much more fun, and it is an important aid for
developing the creativity and the logical thinking.
The original Magnecube, as its own name indicates, is a magnetic cube able
to assemble others in a very fast and effective way, so that it allows us to
construct more complex structures from basic objects.
It is a bucket of 2x2x2 cm. that trough an innovating technology is magnetized
and turned in a formidable piece of entertainment and fun, giving rise to a
wonderful and didactic game of construction. In such waythat I have created a game that combines the creativity and the logical
thinking, besides with the processes of the new technologies in a totally novel
way.Magnecubes
is much more efficient, fast and attractive for playing than the rest of construction´s
games. In addition, it is very easy to gather to keep it in a box.___________________________________________________________________(español)

Es un juego de construcción muy innovador, con atracción magnética que lo hace mucho más divertido. Ayuda a desarrollar la creatividad y la lógica.El Magnecubo original, como su propio nombre indica,
es un cubo magnético capaz de ensamblarse de una manera muy rápida y efectiva, por cualquiera de sus 6 caras, de modo que nos permite construir estructuras más complejas a partir de objetos básicos.

Prototitypes

Se trata de un cubo de 2x2x2 cms que, mediante una innovadora tecnología se magnetiza y convierte en una formidable pieza de entretenimiento
Dando lugar a un maravilloso y didáctico juego de construcción.De modo que creamos un juego que combina la creatividad y la lógica,
junto con los procesos de las nuevas tecnologías, de una manera totalmente novedosa.
Magnecubes es mucho más eficiente, rápido y atractivo en su uso que el resto de juegos de construcción, además de muy fácil de recoger.





BENEFITS TO PLAY WITH MAGNECUBES / BENEFICIOS DE JUGAR CON MAGNECUBES:It stimulates the creativity and the logical thinking in 3 dimensions,
besides to help the children to develop a better space´s perception and the
surroundings.Aid also to develop as much the logical part as the creative one of the
brain of the children.It also develops to the hand-eye coordination and the fine motor activity.It has as well other many benefits exist for playing with magnecubes,
among them  we can emphasize as follow:

Aid the children for developing creative
      solutions.
Using the logical thought while children
      are playing.
Help the children to be much more
      organized.
Facilitating to include/understand better
      concepts like space, volume, weight, balance, symmetry or resistance.


__________________________________________________________________(español)Estimula la creatividad y la lógica en 3 dimensiones,
además de ayudar al niño a tener una mejor percepción del espacio y el entorno.
Ayuda también a desarrollar tanto la parte lógica, como la creativa del cerebro del niño.
Desarrolla también la coordinación oculo-manual y la motricidad fina.También existen otros muchos beneficios de jugar con magnecubes, entre los que podemos destacar:


Ayuda a desarrollar soluciones creativas,

A usar el pensamiento lógico,

A ser más organizado,

A comprender mejor conceptos como espacio, volumen, peso, equilibrio, simetría o resistencia.







    Construction examples




PROCESS / PROCESO:
Our process begins with the handmade sketches, and later we design the
elements in 2D and 3D.
Secondly we start the manufacture of the plastic materials and
purification.
Afterward the process continues to a magician and secret process of
materials´ magnetization thus obtaining its great versatility.
The following step consists on the design and packing accomplishment.
Later we start the distribution, and so we were able to transport our
product at all the houses.
And finally, it is received by the client and he could to start PLAYING AND
ENJOYING!


_________________________________________________________________(español)


Nuestro proceso empieza con los bocetos a mano y posterior diseño en 2d y 3d de los productos,
En segundo lugar pasa por la fabricación de los materiales plásticos y depuración.
Más tarde pasa a un mágico y secreto proceso de magnetización de los materiales, consiguiendo así su gran versatilidad.
El siguiente paso consiste en el diseño y realización del empaquetado.
Después se pasa a la distribución, gracias a la que conseguimos llegar nuestro producto a todas las casas.
Y por fin, se recibe y se comienza ¡A JUGAR Y DISFRUTAR!

be use the money? / ¿En qué se usará el dinero?AMPLIAR IMAGEN /  ENLARGE THE IMAGE

 Prototypes´ purification and one first

of injection for plastic pieces.

plastic´s pieces.

magnetization´s system.
Packaging process.
Others.

To acquire tools and machineries for

and accessories for the construction game.
Creation of an own shop.

and fees.

financing platform rates.

and intellectual property protection (patents).

and for the economic activity establishment.

showcase or creation of a new one.
Merchandising.

communication, publicity and diffusion campaigns

If we were not able to get our
total financing goal, our priority would be on the PRODUCTION AND DISTRIBUTION
OF THE COMPENSATIONS.

story:
Who am I?

Hello! My name is Rocco, and I am a game programmer and entrepreneur. About five years ago, I became strongly interested in computers and programming, so I looked around and became absorbed into the world of technology.

Last year, I started to put my skills to use and formed a company, Terrified Virus Games. I created a business plan, registered it under "Sole Proprietorship", and then began to make games. These started off as simple HTML5 games, which are games that can run in your browser, and can scale themselves if ran from a mobile device. I would then license these games to publishers for a fee.

However, this didn't make enough money to cover some of the major costs, and due to my computer getting messed up, many of the files became corrupt, meaning I couldn't send them to the publishers. So what I need from you guys is the funding required to pay for a new computer, as well as the money needed to pay for employees, and get better software (Photoshop CS2 is an entire four generations behind, and therefore unsatisfactory...).


A screenshot of one of my games:

Play it at www.terrifiedvirus.weebly.com. The graphics for this game were $100, and this is seen as a small graphics cost.

Where does the money go?

A new computer can cost a lot of money. To get a reliable MacBook Air, the minimum payment is $1600. I also need to pay for the graphics/audio. Graphics alone for a small, mobile game, on average, costs $300. Another thing I want to start doing is create native mobile apps, not "web apps" that run in the browser. To do this, I would need an iPod Touch to test it on, as well as an Apple Developer License, which is $100, and upgraded software. Below is a list of just some of the major things that need to be funded:

  • MacBook Air - $1600
  • Various Software Costs - $1000
  • Licenses - $200
  • Game Assets Per Major Mobile Game - $1000

As you can see, it costs a lot to make games. Too much. Especially for someone my age, as I don't have a backup job to pay for it all. However, if you do decide to donate to me, you will receive various benefits. For just $25, you get one week of advertising on one website, whichever has the highest traffic (I have two main websites). For $75, you will receive one month of advertising on one website. $150 will get you one month of advertising, as well as a T-Shirt with the Terrified Virus Games logo on it. However, these are limited. For $500 and above, you get the master package. This includes everything found below (one month free advertising, and a T-Shirt), but with one other very special perk. You get to be the designer of one of my games, and in the credits, you will be the project lead. This perk is priceless.

Can't make a donation? No worries.

It's OK if you can't make a donation, or don't want to, but still want to help. At the moment, I can't donate to anyone elses campaigns, even though I really want to. However, you can still help out by spreading the word across the internet. Have a blog? YouTube account? Facebook? Any social networking sites will work, or a blog. Just write about my campaign, and it will help a bunch. If you do a lot of advertising, I will give you the value of my first perk (one week free advertising on my website).

Thank You!

You can visit my website and play my games at www.terrifiedvirus.weebly.com.

story:
Hello everyone.  As mentioned in the video, my name is Peter Hrdy. I worked on many IT projects, including games, mobile apps, web apps, facebook apps, and so, Many of them were designed for great top companies. But I decided to quit my job and focus completely on WolfWars. This simple. The story and concept of WolfWars was created by me and my 2 sons which are at different ages. So I am quite proud of them, and very proud of game itself.

After few tries of showing this game to digital audience, I noticed that game is very easy to understand & playable for literally anyone. So I've put all of my money in the development, I brought some of the best people in industry, and now, after 4 months of development we have really playable version of our game. It is great.

So why this campaign?
Our resources are big enough to create game as it is now. And it will be great. But, to fulfil the vision of bringing game worldwide in triple A quality, we need your help and support. All funds raised by indiegogo campaign will go directly into the game development. Said in words:

3D environments: each of our heroes is from different side of the world. Each of them is in the power of different element. (air, earth, fire, water)
cards: WolfWars is not pure TCG/CCG but our story, and its extensions, demand more cards
sounds&music
programming (singleplayer/multiplayer)
testing


What will happen if campaign fails?
We put too much effort to not finish this game if this campaign fails. But we won't be able to finish this game as original & mind-blowing as we would be if we reach our goal.

How can you help?
You already helped by watching our video and reading this article. 
You can help us even more by spreading a word about this game or even more by funding this project.

Thank you very much for you time, help and support.
Peter Hrdy

Feel free to contact me:
peter.hrdy@gmail.com
+421944320875

http://www.wolfwarsgame.com



Game Overview - Heroes & Cards

WolfWars game is not about trading or collecting cards. Each player has the same amount of cards from the beginning to the end. There is no f2p/pay2win model, you all have same chances at the start.

Before you start the game, you will need to create your deck. Deck needs to have 1 hero and 5 playing cards. You can have as many decks as you wish to have. These 5 cards are all what you have during one game. You do not sacrifice any of them. All cards are on your hand without “spending” them and throwing any of them out of deck to graveyard.

For now, there are 4 races of cards. Each race has 4 cards with element variation.

For example:
Warriors – 1x air warrior, 1x earth warrior, 1x fire warrior, 1x water warrior
Dragons – 1x air dragon, 1x earth dragon, 1x fire dragon, 1x water dragon
Got it? Other 2 races are Wolves and Witches.

Each race has their specific behaviour, but all of them have general preferences like Attack Power, Defence, Cooldown, Stamina cost. But not all of them have it from start.


Dragons - strongest cards in attack with no defence. Expensive for stamina and each of cards need to take a nap after turn (cooldown).
Wolves – semi strong cards in attack with no defence. No cooldown.
Warriors – same value for attack and defence, a bit weaker than Wolves in attack, but much cheaper for stamina with no cooldown.
Witches – strong in defence with minimum attack, very cheap for stamina use and with cooldown needs.

So these are races and cards we do currently have in our pre-alpha version.

Heroes:
There are 4 heroes. Wolves. Each of them has different nature, something like classes in Call of Duty or Battlefield


Erghar - airwolf – recon: It is hard to hit him, and it is not possible to hit him with 100% attack
Therius – earthwolf – support: His stamina is never drained because is automatic refilled
Rothal – firewolf – assault: He is king of the hill – for me:). More cards of same race on hand give them more power in attack and defence. Leader of the pack:)
Arkwahl – watterwolf – medic: With automatic healing it takes a bit more time to kill this beast.

Q: Is it clear?
A: No, what is stamina?
A: Ok, stamina is something with what you pay for cards.
Q: Is it like mana, huh?
A: No no my dear. If you do not have mana in HS, or MtG, you are not able to turn with the card. Stamina in WolfWars is different. If you do not have enough stamina, then there is only 30% chance that your card will do the job on 100%.
Q: Got it?
A: …………


Stay tuned. http://www.wolfwarsgame.com/
story_txt:
Hello everyone.  As mentioned in the video, my name is Peter Hrdy. I worked on many IT projects, including games, mobile apps, web apps, facebook apps, and so, Many of them were designed for great top companies. But I decided to quit my job and focus completely on WolfWars. This simple. The story and concept of WolfWars was created by me and my 2 sons which are at different ages. So I am quite proud of them, and very proud of game itself.After few tries of showing this game to digital audience, I noticed that game is very easy to understand & playable for literally anyone. So I've put all of my money in the development, I brought some of the best people in industry, and now, after 4 months of development we have really playable version of our game. It is great.So why this campaign?Our resources are big enough to create game as it is now. And it will be great. But, to fulfil the vision of bringing game worldwide in triple A quality, we need your help and support. All funds raised by indiegogo campaign will go directly into the game development. Said in words:
3D environments: each of our heroes is from different side of the world. Each of them is in the power of different element. (air, earth, fire, water)cards: WolfWars is not pure TCG/CCG but our story, and its extensions, demand more cardssounds&musicprogramming (singleplayer/multiplayer)testingWhat will happen if campaign fails?We put too much effort to not finish this game if this campaign fails. But we won't be able to finish this game as original & mind-blowing as we would be if we reach our goal.How can you help?You already helped by watching our video and reading this article. You can help us even more by spreading a word about this game or even more by funding this project.Thank you very much for you time, help and support.Peter HrdyFeel free to contact me:peter.hrdy@gmail.com+421944320875http://www.wolfwarsgame.comGame Overview - Heroes & CardsWolfWars game is not about trading or collecting cards. Each player has the same amount of cards from the beginning to the end. There is no f2p/pay2win model, you all have same chances at the start.Before you start the game, you will need to create your deck. Deck needs to have 1 hero and 5 playing cards. You can have as many decks as you wish to have. These 5 cards are all what you have during one game. You do not sacrifice any of them. All cards are on your hand without “spending” them and throwing any of them out of deck to graveyard.For now, there are 4 races of cards. Each race has 4 cards with element variation.For example:Warriors – 1x air warrior, 1x earth warrior, 1x fire warrior, 1x water warriorDragons – 1x air dragon, 1x earth dragon, 1x fire dragon, 1x water dragonGot it? Other 2 races are Wolves and Witches.Each race has their specific behaviour, but all of them have general preferences like Attack Power, Defence, Cooldown, Stamina cost. But not all of them have it from start.
Dragons - strongest cards in attack with no defence. Expensive for stamina and each of cards need to take a nap after turn (cooldown).Wolves – semi strong cards in attack with no defence. No cooldown.Warriors – same value for attack and defence, a bit weaker than Wolves in attack, but much cheaper for stamina with no cooldown.Witches – strong in defence with minimum attack, very cheap for stamina use and with cooldown needs.So these are races and cards we do currently have in our pre-alpha version.Heroes:There are 4 heroes. More cards of same race on hand give them more power in attack and defence. Leader of the pack:)Arkwahl – watterwolf – medic: With automatic healing it takes a bit more time to kill this beast.Q: Is it clear?A: No, what is stamina?A: Ok, stamina is something with what you pay for cards.Q: Is it like mana, huh?A: No no my dear. If you do not have enough stamina, then there is only 30% chance that your card will do the job on 100%.Q: Got it?A: …………Stay tuned. http://www.wolfwarsgame.com/
