story:
Short Summary

Inspiration

One can say that the idea was brought up already in kindergarten. Kuba, along with his pal Tomek, invented a game where you tell stories based on randomly selected hand-made images. The games raised an abundance of emotions and were never boring. Plethora of funny stories were created, albeit none of them was ever recorded. Such a pity. After several years we decided to change this and develop an electronic version of our game. This is how we came up with mobile version of Tello - Tell Your Story.

 

Tello - Tell Your Story! Game description

Tello - Tell Your Story is a mobile game where you spontaneously tell stories based on randomly selected images. The made-up story is recorded during the game. Thus, you can edit it afterwards and even add a musical background. The final result is an original film that you can share with the world or save in your mobile phone as a kind reminder. What kind of story are you going to create? That we do not know, but we are curious.

 

Thematic packages

In tello app there will be some thematic packages, for example survival, horror, detective, sport, music, house, people, celebrity, animals, ocean, si-fi, fantasy, etc...

 

Survival

 

Horror

 

Boost your brain skills

Tello is a game that both entertains and stimulates creativity. The challenge here is posed by the limited time-bar (33 seconds) and the fact that you never know what image will come next. The more thematic packages you use the more interesting and surprising you stories become. A great challenge will be to create stories in a foreign language, rapping or singing the story out. All this depends on the invention of the players.  See how much you can do.

 

Who are we?

Jakub Sampławski - master of arts, graphic designer, animator,  currently working in  gamedev at BoomBit inc. , Forestudio founder. In free time he plays piano.

Cezary Adamowicz - graduated Intermedia department at Academu of Fine Arts in Gdańsk,  master of arts, architecture student, loves minimalism and rap music, mushroom picker.

Michał Rogowski - iOS developer, bachelor of computer science , lives and work in Warsaw, future  Aron's father - Tello Kids beta tester.

 

Feedback

Several months ago we attended PixelHeaven 2017 – an independent games fair event in Warsaw - where we received a lot of positive feedback that motivated us to take up further actions.

“I hope this will be a new social media phenomenon.”

“It could be nice to play on home-parties.“

“I appreciate the design aspect of the game.“

“More active game of puns.”

“Ideal warm-up for stand-up performers.”

“Great for the elderly people too."

“I would show it to teachers.”

We received support from the youngest ones as well. Kids fell in love with Tello and thus gave us a lot of images as souvenirs.That is why we decided to develop a special version of the game – Tello Kids. All animation will be developed based on children’s drawings selected by means of competition.

 

 

Tello Kids

Some games that children play develop skills that will come in handy during their adult life. One of the most important aspects is to develop imagination for it helps us cope in each and every situation as well as create remarkable things. Thanks to Tello Kids, we can stimulate creativity and spontaneity of children and furthermore - integrate whole families and lots of friends.

Children are thrilled the most when they can listen to and view their works. They aim at telling better stories each time they play and try using more difficult words as well as form more complex sentences. This is how a literary genius might be born in front of parents’ eyes.

 

 
Maja, age  9
 

Education - Learning through play

 

If our project succeeds, we will aim at transferring it into schools. This version will be prepared for teachers so as to allow them to use it during classes. Most of all, we will focus on developing a model for learning foreign languages. We will introduce various mini-games from which the teacher will be able to select the right one. For example – naming images for beginners and telling entire stories in a foreign language for children with more advanced command.​

Objectives of the authors

We wish to finish our mobile game Tello - Tell Your Story. We have been working on it for over a year now. So far, we have completed a test version suitable for ios. We also aim at developing a version for Android and Apple TV. We also aim at developing special versions dedicated to children (Tello Kids), teachers (Tello Education) and blind persons. However, in order to complete our project we require not only time but also resources to employ new specialists, conduct educational researches and develop the application even further. We need your support to succeed!  As a means of thanks for the money you donated, you can be sure that we will supply you with various types of rewards.

 

 

Perks - Become a Tello fan!

3$ - Thank You! -Special mention on our webside

6$ - We send u a postcard with our thanks and oryginal Tello hand made drawing

10$ - We send u a postcard with our thanks and oryginal Tello hand made drawing + gorgeus Tello badge!

15$ - Online parent of the Tello drawing listed on webpage next to the animation!

20$ - 10 gorgeous buttons badges from our Tello base (over 100pics) 

25$ - Access to development behind the scenes, beta iOS releases and android soon, also after the release!

50$ - White t-shirt with one of our tello drawing you pick from our base (over100pics) Shipping wordwide + and your name in the credits as a Funder.!

75$ - You in in-app credits + Access to development behind scenes + you will be mentioned in app in our credits!

100$ - Your kiddo drawing in app - Submit your kid drawing, we will change it into animation to Tello Kids app.

1000$  - Tello VIP package - Tello statue - personalized statue for your shelf, all gadgets from below, surprise stuff.

Goals

10k: Our main goal is to complete Android and iPhone app and also Apple TV

15k : Tello Kids - app for younger users, based on their drawings,

20k :  Tello Educational - Tello app for teachers and schools,

 

​Follow us:

Facebook : www.facebook.com/playTello/

Twitter : www.twitter.com/PlayTello

Instagram : www.instagram.com/playtello

website : www.playtello.com

 

Press kit:

www.goo.gl/uKeZzs

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Tell others about the project, leave a comment and share the website! We would be very grateful!
Leave some feedback. What would you change, what would you correct? Perhaps you would add something? All ideas are very welcome! Best regards, TELLO TEAM!

THANK YOU!

story:
Update

Thanks to everyone who has pledged so far, you're all awesome and it's fantastic we've hit the target already. I'm not setting stretch goals per se, but all subsequent donations help get us towards the ultimate goal of making Switch available for all ROM developers to use and thereby all devices. Switch is for you - Android fans. :-)

In the press

"MoDaCo.SWITCH ... looks brilliant" - Matt Miller, ZDnet

"Switch could still give ... fans the best of both worlds" - Engadget

"All your data is shared between the two" - Cnet

"Users can now have their Android cake and eat it too." - Android Central

"What makes this software special is the ability to flip back and forth between the two without losing any of your data." - geek

"While a simple dual boot would be cool, MoDaCo.SWITCH is so much cooler." - Android and Me

"Hannah Montana would be proud." - Phandroid

About MoDaCo.SWITCH

MoDaCo.SWITCH is not a custom ROM. It sits atop a ROM to offer a whole new approach to using multiple custom ROMs. In the past if you wanted to run different ROMs on your device - for example Samsung TouchWiz and stock Android or CyanogenMod - you'd have to manually flash between them and set up your data again every time you switched - certainly not ideal. SWITCH resolves this problem.

Multiple ROMs, one set of data

The core feature of MoDaCo.SWITCH is the ability to maintain one set of data between multiple custom ROMs. Switching from the heavily modified manufacturer ROM to the stock Google ROM? No problem, all your apps - and most importantly the settings for all your apps - will still be maintained. Just carry on using your phone!

Simple switching, simple updating, community support

With MoDaCo.SWITCH you don't have to boot into your recovery image and mess around flashing different ROMs... the Switch app does it for you. One click - 'Do you want to switch?' - and the device reboots to your new ROM in a process that's barely longer than a regular boot.

Updating to a newer version of SWITCH is simple courtesy of the built in over-the-air update mechanism powered by otaupdatecentre.pro - a service sponsored and supported by MoDaCo.

A forthcoming SWITCH companion app will help you manage aspects of SWITCH, and a SWITCH kitchen (Switchen?) for MoDaCo premium members (also included with some pledges) allows you to turn on and off different bits of ROM functionality as desired.

If you need support for SWITCH, head on over to the support topic on the MoDaCo forums for peer to peer help (and help from us of course).

Proven success

The campaign to bring MoDaCo.SWITCH to the Samsung Galaxy S4 i9505 comes on the back of the HTC One release, which has been critically acclaimed and widely used. You're not buying into an idea, you're buying into a product that's being successfully used by thousands of people on a similar device already.

What is the funding paying for?

This campaign is designed primarily to fund test devices to develop the software on. It's also an interesting way to gauge interest in the product. Of course, a massive amount of time is spent on this kind of project too which isn't covered by the funding target.

Often development is done for fun and to further the community, but there are always real physical and considerable time costs involved.

The plan for MoDaCo.SWITCH is to make the system available for ROM developers everywhere to use across a wide range of devices - your pledge will help us get closer to making that a reality.

The fashionable pledge

If you contribute towards 'the fashionable option', you'll get a t-shirt. The actual t-shirt design will be agreed democratically amongst the pledgers. International shipping of the t-shirt is included.

See MoDaCo.SWITCH in action on the HTC One

MoDaCo.SWITCH is real. Here's a demo of a pre-Beta running on the HTC One!
story_txt:
Update
Thanks to everyone who has pledged so far, you're all awesome and it's fantastic we've hit the target already. I'm not setting stretch goals per se, but all subsequent donations help get us towards the ultimate goal of making Switch available for all ROM developers to use and thereby all devices. Switch is for you - Android fans. :-)
In the press
"MoDaCo.SWITCH ... looks brilliant" - Matt Miller, ZDnet
"Switch could still give ... fans the best of both worlds" - Engadget
"All your data is shared between the two" - Cnet

story:
DayTrader A Financial Board Game brings you the thrills and chills of investing in the stock market. This is your chance to become a fast thinking, investment-savvy day trader; but first... get a job!

First, work at the companies on the board to scrape together some cash so you can make trades in the companies you work for. The more employees a company has, the higher the company's stock price.

Buy a company's stock when it's priced low and sell it when it's high to maximize your gains and create greater wealth. When you have enough cash to retire be the first to get to the bank before the volatile market sets you back. If you can do that, you win!

Bring the trading floor to your dining room table with Daytrader!

Daytrader is for Ages 10 & up, has a playing time of 30+ mins and is for 2 - 6 players.

 

WHAT YOU GET

 

There's no funny business here, what you get for what you pledge is simple, you get games! All games will be ready by October, just in time for the holiday season. I'm looking at this campaign as a pre-order opportunity for anyone interested to score a copy at a discounted price than what retail will be.

 

WHERE THE MONEY IS GOING

I originally put Daytrader on Kickstarter, and I was successfully funded. I'm filled with gratitude to say due to all the amazing attention Daytrader gained from kickstarter it's now bigger than a project, it's turned into a full blown business! So, where's the money going, you ask?

The first thing to know is Daytrader will be made, but, I'd like to increase the size of the first run to be able to put a game in the home of everyone who has shown an interest outside of the original campaign. Due to shipping costs, manufacturing of additional games, and new educational development tools I'm creating - I need a little more help to pull it off.  Every little bit helps to acheive this goal!

 

 

WHY

 

First of all, Daytrader is an extremely FUN game. I believe that entertainment can bring the masses together. Its my goal to get this game into as many homes, places of work and parties as possible so it can add a little fun, laughter and create some great memories to all whom play it.

Also, I feel there is a lack of  practical economic education in our school systems. I believe a game like this will benefit many high school students preparing for college and life, as well as, adults much like myself that seek more knowledge of the basics of investing.  It also serves to fill the void many expert investors may have with the lack of choices modern board games offer. I've spent a lot of time making sure that Daytrader has a simple enough mechanic to allow anyone from 10 to 99, musician to businessman, 99% to the 1% participate, laugh and maybe even learn something.

I'm also working towards educational versions for teachers that will allow students on the high school and college levels, as well as, working professionals learn the fundamentals in a more in concrete way by playing with different sets of rules that better reveal the topics and concepts introduced in Daytrader.

 

 

HOW TO HELP

Pledge today and receive a game (or five) in return. 

Share this page with your friends, family, co-workers and social networks. You'll be surprised at how many "closet" Day Trader's you know!

Play Daytrader and enjoy the experience!

story:
Short Summary

Hello, my name is Justin I live in Germany, but the rest of my team lives in the UK I came up with an idea one day to start a game because I always play games, but these days games lack story or dynamic content but usually I never without my friends so that's why we are going to make an MMO RPG game. (Massively multiplayer online, role play game)

Why we went flexible funding

The reason we went with flexible funding is cause if we don't make the full $20,000 and say we make like $3,000 we can still start a basic version of the project and still try to get our first game out there for you can play.

Funding Goals



Concept Art

(Galbourne Ridge Concept by Tyleredlinart)

(Concept Art by Section Studios)

(Concept Art and Illustration – Rowena Wang)

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need $15,000-$20,000 to start the project and buy all the things you will interact and see in the game.
  • The people who support our project will get special gifts, gear, early access, ect.

    Risks & Challenges

    • Sense we are a small and this is a very large project, it may take a while to see progress, but we promise we will produce a game worth waiting for.
    • There is a way to overcome that issue which is to help production by posting ideas talking to one of us in the team to see you can help out produce the game by doing modeling or scripting mainly anything could do but we need money to even start work and recruitment.

    MMO Concept

    • Within the multi-player game you can go on adventures find new islands buy new ships and capture camps off of other players.
    • You can take up roles in the online game such as smuggling, trading, adventuring, assassinating and much more! If you choose one role it doesn't mean you can't change at any point, you can always decide a different way of playing the game! 
    • You can also hire an NPC crew that you can capture islands with or just get a few friends together and play that way.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    • If you can't put money into our project or help with game design you can help by telling people about the game and you can do that by using Indiegogo share tools.

story:
UPDATE: our InDemand campaign for PAPERBACKs and HARDCOVERs is over. Both PAPERBACKs and HARDCOVERs of Vol. I are now available for ordering on Amazon.

 

 

 

What's the Big Idea?

 

 

The idea behind this book is to summarize the body of knowledge that already exists on multiplayer games but is not available in one single place. And quite a few of the issues discussed within this series (planned as three volumes 400+ pages each), while known in the industry, have not been published at all (except for maybe in discussion forums). 

Programming and deploying an MOG is a daunting task, and having a frame of reference is usually quite helpful — "hey, those guys have already tried this, and it worked for them."

By the end of Vol. 1, we'll complete our discussion of the things related to architecting your MOG, and will be ready to start discussing "Development" (Vol. 2) and "Deployment" (Vol. 3). For more details on what's within the book, see the tentative Table of Contents (it also includes links to all the beta chapters from Vol. 1). 

This current project is only about Vol. 1, "Architecture," but Vol. 2 and Vol. 3 are already planned (and obviously my enthusiasm about them will get an additional boost when Vol. 1 is successfully funded ;-)). 

Why Me?

 

 

I really hate to speak about myself, but this is one of those cases where I don't have much choice. So, here it goes (and if you really want further details, you can dig them out of my LinkedIn page).

20 years ago (damn, I am getting old) I was a co-architect for an electronic stock exchange of a G20 country, and for all practical intents and purposes stock exchanges are just another game genre. The project was fun and, among other things, allowed for real-time trading over the cellphones of that time (those with 9600 baud connection).

A few years later, I became a chief software architect working for a start-up that quickly grew into a rather large online game with half a million simultaneous players that processed half a billion user transactions per day. The project taught me a damn lot about such different issues as scalability, DB physical layout, server farms, attackers and cheaters of all kinds, and bot fighting — just to name a few.

Since then, I have consulted and performed due diligence on several game-related projects. In addition, I've spent quite some time researching the field and discussing related problems and their respective solutions with people from the industry.

I feel that this puts me in quite a unique position of knowing not only one single game, but a bunch of them, and being able to summarize and generalize my real-world experiences. Oh, and I have been writing for industry journals (and am especially proud of articles in CUJ and C++ Report) since 1998, so the process of typing sentences is not something new for me either.

Since When Are Rabbits Programming??

 

 

I cannot speak for all of rabbitkind, but this particular hare has gone alongside my writings for quite a while now. He was born as "No MT Bugs" Hare in 2010, in an Overload article titled "Single-Threading: Back to the Future?"

Therefore, there is evidence that this particular rabbit has been programming at least since 2010. Yes, he has changed his appearance, but deep inside, he is still the very same bunny with a naïve idea of making programs less buggy. BTW, the character is created by Sergey Gordeev, a guy with many animation awards, known (among other things) for being a director of some of the Animated Mr. Bean series.

Who Is this Book For?

 

 

The book is intended for those intermediary developers who want to become senior ones, and for senior developers and up. I expect that the book will also be useful for decision-makers, from PMs all the way up to CEOs — so if you by any chance know one, please make sure to give her a link to this page ;-). 

On the other hand, if you are working on your first programming project, this book will probably be too difficult for you. There will be no explanation on what event-driven programming is all about, what the difference is between optimistic locking and pessimistic locking, why you need a source control system, and so on. Instead, there will be discussions on how the concept of futures fits into event-driven programming, when the use of optimistic locking make sense for games, and how to use source control in the presence of unmergeable files. 

In the same spirit, the book is not intended to be a CD to copy-paste your sample MOG from. Instead, the book aims to help you write your own code that is tailored to your own needs, and tries to advise on the available choices at most of the junctions.

What's the Plan?

 

 

Currently, the "beta" chapters of the Vol.1 are already available on my blog ithare.com. The same "beta" posts are also available re-formatted as a single PDF (11.1M, 355 PDF pages; please note that this is NOT how the book is going to look). 

Steps still to complete to bring the "beta" draft into the shape of the ready-for-printing Vol.1:

  • Restructure Vol.1. Done.
  • Go through Vol.1 again, "harmonizing" and clarifying things. I expect to add about 30'000 words during this process (give or take). Current progress: ~30% completed, 12'000 words already added. ETA: July 2016. 
  • Make another pass through Vol.1, this time is more about self-editing (not that much will need be changed at this stage, I hope). ETA: August 2016. 
  • Give it to a professional copyeditor. ETA: September 2016. 
  • Give it to a book design/layout specialist. ETA: October 2016. At this point E-BOOKs will be sent out.
  • Print paperbacks with CreateSpace and hardcovers with IngramSpark, and get them sent to backers. ETA - November 2016. At this point PAPERBACKs and HARDCOVERs will be sent out.
  • Start selling Vol.1 on Amazon (planned price is $24.95 for Kindle, $34.95+Shipment for PAPERBACK, and $49.95+Shipment for HARDCOVER)
  • Become rich and retire to the Bahamas ;-). On second thought - this book probably won't suffice ;-(.

What's Inside?

 

 

Pretty much all MOG genres are within the scope of the book, from MMOFPS on one side of the spectrum to social games on the other side — with stock exchanges and multi-player casino games in between. However, things such as gameplay (including AI), and monetization are intentionally left out. In addition, the areas of physics and 3D graphics are too large by themselves and — to avoid expanding this into a 10-volume series — are only discussed very briefly (with pointers to good books on these subjects provided).

An excerpt from the tentative full ToC of the Vol.1: 

Chapter I. Game Design Document from an MOG Perspective

Chapter II. On Cheating, P2P, and [non-]Authoritative Servers

Chapter III. Protocols

  • RTT, Input Lag, and How to Mitigate Them (includes Client-Side Interpolation, Client-Side Prediction, and Lag Compensation)
  • Game World States and Reducing Traffic Publishable State, Interest Management, and different Compression techniques)
  • Point-to-Point Communications and Non-Blocking RPCs (including discussion on message queues)
  • IDL (includes hints on writing your own IDL compiler)

Chapter IV. DIY vs Re-Use. In Search of Balance

Chapter V. Event-Driven Programming

  • Classical Event-Driven Programs
  • Deterministic Event-Driven Programs (including benefits such as production post-mortem for both client and server, replay testing, and so on)
  • RPC Processing in Event-Driven Programs: from Plain Event Processing to Futures (with lambda call pyramids in between)
  • Relation to Actors, Node.js, and Erlang

Chapter VI. Client-Side Architecture

  • Graphics (only very basics)
  • Programming Language for Client-Side
  • Client-Side Architecture Diagram (based on multiple event-driven objects)

Chapter VII. Server-Side Architecture

  • Naïve Architectures
  • Web-Based Architecture (including write-back caching and locking strategies)
  • Classical Architecture
  • Front-End Servers
  • Load Balancing (including Round-Robin DNS, Server-Side Balancing and Client-Side Random Balancing)
  • Eternal Linux-vs-Windows Debate
  • Programming Languages for Server-Side

Chapter VIII. Unity 5 vs UE4 vs Photon vs DIY for MOG

Chapter IX. Pre-Coding Checklist: Things Everybody Hates, but Everybody Needs. From Source Control to Coding Guidelines

Chapter IX concludes Vol.1; for the list of the Chapters planned in Vol.2 and Vol.3, see the full tentative ToC.

What's Inside?   Pretty much all MOG genres are within the scope of the book, from MMOFPS on one side of the spectrum to social games on the other side — with stock exchanges and multi-player casino games in between. However, things such as gameplay (including AI), and monetization are intentionally left out. In addition, the areas of physics and 3D graphics are too large by themselves and — to avoid expanding this into a 10-volume series — are only discussed very briefly (with pointers to good books on these subjects provided).An excerpt from the tentative full ToC of the Vol.1: Chapter I. Game Design Document from an MOG PerspectiveChapter II. On Cheating, P2P, and [non-]Authoritative ServersChapter III. Protocols
RTT, Input Lag, and How to Mitigate Them (includes Client-Side Interpolation, Client-Side Prediction, and Lag Compensation)
Game World States and Reducing Traffic Publishable State, Interest Management, and different Compression techniques)
Point-to-Point Communications and Non-Blocking RPCs (including discussion on message queues)
IDL (includes hints on writing your own IDL compiler)Chapter IV. DIY vs Re-Use. In Search of BalanceChapter V. Event-Driven Programming
Classical Event-Driven Programs
Deterministic Event-Driven Programs (including benefits such as production post-mortem for both client and server, replay testing, and so on)
RPC Processing in Event-Driven Programs: from Plain Event Processing to Futures (with lambda call pyramids in between)
Relation to Actors, Node.js, and Erlang
Chapter VI. Client-Side Architecture
Graphics (only very basics)
Programming Language for Client-Side
Client-Side Architecture Diagram (based on multiple event-driven objects)
Chapter VII. Server-Side Architecture
Naïve Architectures
Web-Based Architecture (including write-back caching and locking strategies)
Classical Architecture
Front-End Servers
Load Balancing (including Round-Robin DNS, Server-Side Balancing and Client-Side Random Balancing)
Eternal Linux-vs-Windows Debate
Programming Languages for Server-Side
Chapter VIII. Unity 5 vs UE4 vs Photon vs DIY for MOGChapter IX. Pre-Coding Checklist: Things Everybody Hates, but Everybody Needs. From Source Control to Coding GuidelinesChapter IX concludes Vol.1; for the list of the Chapters planned in Vol.2 and Vol.3, see the full tentative ToC.

story:
New Update:

1/14/2016 - 4:10pm PST

This update is specifically to answer questions about the H1Z1 Hoodie distribution:

1) Daybreak Games is working on generating the Hoody codes and when ready will send them to us for distribution .

2) When we receive the codes from Daybreak we will distribute them to the contributor email addresses that were provided to the Indiegogo campaign.

3) For the codes to work, Daybreak must add the Hoody asset to the live H1Z1 servers. They have told us this will happen with the next scheduled patch update this month.

4) Daybreak will make sure that the Hoody asset is added to the live H1Z1 game servers before they give us the codes to distribute.

5.) When we distribute the Hoody codes, they will all be e-mailed out to everyone simultaneously during the same distribution time window. We will also announce that we are distributing the codes so that everyone knows.

6.) If you specifically contributed multiple times and have multiple transactions in the contribution log with each contribution being $10 or more - you will receive one code per transaction. So if you donated twice for two Hoodies, you will get two Hoodies.

That's it!

More info soon...

1/14/2016 - 12:26am PST

Quick Update:

THE CAMPAIGN HAS CLOSED!!! WE ARE NOW BEGINNING WORK ON THE REWARD TIER FULFILLMENT PROCESS!!! YAY!

Twin Galaxies would like to warmly thank EVERYONE for their positive support and tremendous contributions to #Right2Game. 

Although it might have been ideal to hit our specific funding target so that we could progress with maximum speed, the money and significant marketing awareness that has been generated through this campaign has been tremendous for us and all of it will go exactly toward helping Twin Galaxies make progress on the important items we have indicated on our page, just at a slightly more moderate pace! 

The #Right2Game mission is a long term effort, and because of your help we have collectively taken a very important step forward - and many large new partners have reached out to us with the desire to help and participate in the future!

Our Twin Galaxies initiatives can now work even harder to help create more public access to the recognition of an individual’s achievements and create greater personalization of those accomplishments so that the mainstream will be able to fully emotionally invest itself and learn, understand and respect the time investment value made by people into playing video games.

With more understanding, there is more positivity and mainstream support!

We are now moving into the "fulfillment" part of the campaign so that we can get all those rewards out to the contributors as soon as humanly possible!

For those of you eagerly awaiting your H1Z1 Hoodie, we are working closely with Daybreak games right now to coordinate the Hoodie code distribution and will have more info soon!

For those that have contributed, please make sure your e-mail and contact info is accurate so that we can reach out to you and make sure that your reward tier fulfillment is exactly correct (for instance if you are getting a T-shirt we will need to know size, etc.)

More information soon!

In the meanwhile, if you haven't yet had a chance to visit www.TwinGalaxies.com and sign up to become a member, please do!

-Twin Galaxies




H1Z1 HOODIE UPDATE:

"I just contributed, how do I receive my H1Z1 Twin Galaxies Hoodie?"

Codes for the Hoodie will be distributed once the campaign ends and we begin our fulfillment process for all the reward tiers. We will work with Daybreak Games specifically to deliver the Hoodie codes.

People should get the hoodie NOW, because once the campaign is over it will not be offered again and there will likely be no other way to get it! It may become one of the rarest hoodies in the entire game!

There are only 6 days left in the campaign! Act fast!

We are excited to offer this hoodie and honored by Daybreak's support. Together we can all help promote a more positive mainstream viewpoint regarding the activity of playing video games.

UPDATE: 

PC gamers, we present a new contribution tier in your honor! Extremely limited to only FIVE, you get a newly released Alienware Steam Machine. 

Some specs: 4GB DDR3L 1600MHz Memory; NVIDIA® GeForce® GTX GPU 2GB GDDR5; 500 GB 7200RPM SATA 6Gb/s Hard Drive; Intel® Core™ i3-4170T Processor Dual-Core (3MB Cache, up to 3.2 GHz)


UPDATE: 

We’re finally able to unveil one of our coolest perks yet! Our good friends at Daybreak Games are excited to show support for the #Right2Game campaign by bringing our positive message about the activity of playing video games into their amazing zombie survival MMO, “H1Z1”. In a forthcoming game update, now your character will be able to sport our official black Twin Galaxies hoodie in-game! It is an entirely unique hoodie and will only be available to get through the #Right2Game campaign! If you are an avid H1Z1 player, this Hoodie is a "must get" and you already know why!

And for real-life hoodie collectors, by popular demand we’ve now made the physical real hoodie available as a standalone perk (and we’ll throw in the digital “H1Z1” hoodie too to make sure art imitates life!) Note: Final art for digital hoodie image may vary slightly from TG Hoodie.


Note: Final art for digital hoodie image may vary slightly from TG Hoodie. 


As a video game enthusiast or someone who knows video game players, you have likely encountered the pervasive, negative notion that people who play video games are wasting their time and should be doing something “more productive” instead.  The effect on gamers everywhere—especially young ones—is widespread embarrassment and downward social pressure around an activity that they love.

What is not NEARLY as widespread is the understanding that playing video games actually presents numerous benefits and the passion should be supported.

Twin Galaxies is on a mission to raise awareness that avid gaming is a worthwhile, socially acceptable, and important activity that’s deserving of more understanding and support. To accomplish this,we are raising funds for the specific things listed below:

  • A new social media website platform module with features tailored exclusively for video game players to get greater recognition and exposure.
  • A mobile app to increase access, participation and mobile gaming recognition within the Twin Galaxies system.
  • Live streamed events, programs and competitions broadcasted through our media network Twin Galaxies Live at www.tglive.com .

We have been working hard, but can’t get to the finish line on our own. For the small cost of a T-Shirt, and your strong word of mouth, you can help us raise $250,000 and move us toward completion on all of the above as quickly as possible.

At the very core of our beliefs is the idea that we all have the #Right2Game without being culturally shamed, and that we should collectively foster a social climate where gamers feel comfortable considering the career options, mental and physical health benefits, and meaningful social connections that the video game space provides.

All of our initiatives aim to accurately represent the spirit of gaming as a fun, healthy, and ultimately rewarding activity that should not be frowned upon and discouraged.

But in order for our planned efforts to reach success, we need your support. We’re calling on gamers everywhere to join us in our fight for the 


As for what you get, we’ve already teased monumental and unprecedented collector’s items offered as perks at the highest donation tiers: Rick Fox’s 3 back-to-back NBA World Championship Rings, Jamie Lee Curtis’s famous little black dress from True Lies, Christopher Guest’s original Nike shoes and other items from This is Spinal Tap and a Hulk comic that was not only signed by Stan Lee, but used as a key prop on The Jace Hall Show.

But in between the big ticket items and basic perks of knowing you’ve contributed to a worthwhile cause — we’ve received encouraging support from premium gaming apparel companies EIGHTY SIXED ( www.eightysixed.com )and J!NX ( www.jinx.com ), game companies UBISOFT and WB GAMES, and our friends at NERDIST INDUSTRIES that allows us offer many more unique incentives to express our sincere appreciation for your support of our mission. 

TWIN GALAXIES™ has been supporting and celebrating the achievements of gamers since its founding in 1981, and has served as an official video game world record and player ranking authority, celebrating video game enthusiasts and their achievements with published recognition in national magazines and books, award ceremonies, broadcast events, and by maintaining a public database of video game leader-board accomplishment.

We are excited to have resounding celebrity support for our cause and our goals, from 3-time NBA Champion RICK FOX, to JAMIE LEE CURTIS & CHRISTOPHER GUEST, creator of Mortal Kombat ED BOON, music producer and former "American Idol" judge RANDY JACKSON, and even comic book legend STAN LEE — many of whom have donated RARE items that are available as perks to help raise funds for our initiatives to endorse gamers.

Together, our goal is to transform public perception so that those who achieve in the area of video games—whether it’s playing them well, designing them, or growing communities around them—will be as respected and encouraged as those who achieve in sports, music, or any other cultural area where people choose to invest their time and efforts.

At $250,000, we can complete:
  • Our development of a social media platform addition specifically for gamers and their gaming accomplishments. 
  • Maintenance and development of our core website, which preserves and promotes video game world records and high scores, submitted throughout the decades and from all around the world. We're also building a global online ranking & statistics system.
  • The Twin Galaxies mobile experience.
  • New Content Development for the Twin Galaxies Live live-streaming network that broadcasts positive player centric gaming content every day.

If we exceed our goals, we'll be able to start tackling:

  • The implementation of a no-content ID video submission and upload system.
  • Additional Outreach Staff dedicated to netting national attention for extraordinary gamers.
  • A true and proper “Gamer of the Year” award show.
  • A worldwide, industry cooperative, annual multi-platform, multi-genre video game “Olympics”

Sound good? Here are some more details:

If our funding goals are met, Twin Galaxies will celebrate by immediately giving back. At $250,000, we pledge to instantly donate $5,000 to Extra Life -- an organization that unites thousands of gamers in support of the Children's Miracle Network Hospitals -- and $5,000 to Crisis Text Line, an organization that serves anyone, in any type of crisis, providing access to free, 24/7 support and information via the medium people already use and trust: text. 

**IF RICK'S RINGS ARE AWARDED it automatically triggers a special invite-only celebration event hosted by Rick Fox - only for the #Right2Game campaign contributors at ALL levels. Everyone wins!

Please enjoy the detailed list of perks listed on the right side of this page to see the different donation options, and how we’ll reward you for your support of #Right2Game!

With your help and support, you’ll allow Twin Galaxies to make major strides in elevating the perception of video games, gaming, and gamers through our platforms, programs and ongoing initiatives. You’ll be paving the way…

  • …for heightened societal awareness of the benefits and career opportunities associated with video gaming.
  • …for people who experience fear, anxiety and bullying to be relieved of these pressures, so that they can nurture a passion that can grow into a career or foster a community that will support them and their identity.
  • …for gamers of all types—mobile, PC, or console—to enjoy participation in new outlets that cater to their interests and their desire to signal-boost their achievements to a growing population of serious gamers who will appreciate them.
  • …for Twin Galaxies to develop platforms and programs that will serve as new avenues through which video game enthusiast’s talents and achievements can be understood, amassed, marketed and promoted—as well as translated into real value and opportunities.

Much of what Twin Galaxies will be trying to do for the image and profile of gamers has never been done before. And as with any new venture, success can be a long game.

Thankfully, Twin Galaxies as an organization has stood the test of time. Since it’s founding in 1981, it has stood for gamers, and has established relationships on gamers’ behalf throughout the decades.  

Currently, Twin Galaxies is overseen by Jace Hall, founder of Monolith (creators of the “Fear” and “Condemned” video game franchises, among many others) and former Senior Vice President of Warner Brothers Interactive Entertainment. With a proven track record in business and many lasting contributions already to the world of video gaming he is positioned to propel the objectives of Twin Galaxies forward with his vast network of industry contacts and team of gaming consultants and experts.

But even with all this – maintenance and growth of a core database of 3 decades of gamer achievements requires support in order to live online forever, and changing societal perception remains a complex, long-term endeavor that can be costly and involves multiple simultaneous initiatives like the ones we’ve described in this campaign.

With your help as expressed through your support of this campaign, we stand the best chance of success together.

Even if you can’t contribute to #Right2Game, you can definitely help the cause! Here are some easy ways to show your support:

1. JOIN THE TWIN GALAXIES COMMUNITY! Head over to www.TwinGalaxies.com right now and sign up (its free!) Make new friends, explore, and contribute to all of the amazing video game playing achievement taking place in the world. Come and be recognized!

2. FOLLOW TWIN GALAXIES ON ALL OUR SOCIAL MEDIA! Our address is www.twitter.com/twingalaxies on Twitter and www.facebook.com/TwinGalaxies on Facebook, and will be updating as much as possible throughout this campaign!

3. POST ABOUT THIS CAMPAIGN, AND SHARE OUR UPDATES WHENEVER YOU CAN! Be sure to use #Right2Game

4. WATCH TWIN GALAXIES LIVE! Our roster of amazing gaming personalities will be gaming and interacting with you every single day from 3 PM to Midnight PST at www.tglive.com and will help you understand the campaign if you've got questions!

5. USE INDIEGOGO'S CONVENIENT SHARING TOOLS to let your gamer friends know about this campaign!

6. TAKE INITIATIVE AND POINT OUT THE BENEFITS OF GAMING whenever someone you know discourages or disparages their peers or children from playing video games.

7. And above all, BE GOOD TO YOUR FELLOW GAMER!  The best way to make sure the public perception of video game playing is elevated is to be supportive of each other, to form communities with each other, and to present the most positive image of the activity possible. 

Remember that together, we’re stronger in protecting and supporting our #Right2Game.

Thank you for your time and support! Game on!

story:
Here's the Deal!

Hello, my name is Bill Hays and I'm the designer, inventor, maker and "chief bottle washer" at Pocket Predator Slingshots... and I want to personally invite you to join in on the final couple of legs in our largest expansion to date!

We have been contacted by our mold making company and they're ready to start on our molds... They should be all finished in at the most 6 weeks... it would be faster but we have a lot of molds and some are fairly complex too.
But anyway, we're going to use the IndieGoGo crowdfunding site to take preliminary orders and try to recoup some of the over $100,000 we've invested in this project already... and with tax season being upon us, we really could use a little breathing room!
So if you're wanting one or more of the new models the quickest way possible, in time for the spring and early summer shooting sessions, then help us out a little now and that will be the best way to assure you get yours before the peak demand season!

For those who don't know us already, here's a little background:

Pocket Predator Slingshots has been in business for about 5 1/2 years and already we're largely responsible for a huge shift in the way slingshots are viewed, with major worldwide gains in overall accuracy, versatility and strength. Our original Ergonomic designs allowing for vastly increased comfort and consistency... along with our many unique and versatile attachment methods which allow for a greater variety of elastics and aiming possibilities means huge gains in overall accuracy... While at the same time the materials the slingshots are made from allow the actual strength of the elastics to be increased if so desired as well. With our many and varied original slingshot concepts and designs along with our over 200 youtube videos and many other people learning, understanding and taking inspiration from those designs and videos, many making their own slingshots and videos as a result... We've been fortunate to be one of major seeds of inspiration that's grown into a beautiful tree and is now the beginnings of a forest!

How far we've come would take to long write about right here, right now... but here's a few examples anyway:
Five years ago it was considered an incredible, almost world class feat if a person were able to hit a soda can 10 times in a row from 10 meters or further... and feats such as cutting cards or lighting matches, the stuff of legend and theory. Nobody could do them. Not one youtube video or other verifiable proof existed.... Now days, with our modern designs and shooting concepts it's considered a very easy task to hit a can 10 times in a row... and cutting cards, using our methods and concepts, not really hard to do at all... Lighting matches with your slingshot, the ultimate proof of accuracy? Well, there have been over 50 people so far on youtube and other online video sources who've proven they can shoot that accurately using our concepts and design innovations! As for tournaments and other competitions, what many consider "the crucible for proof of concept"... Here in the USA and in the UK, EVERY major tournament and competition won, in the last 3 years, has been won by somebody using our design concepts, outside the forks banding methods and or shooting principals we at Pocket Predator Slingshots pioneered and developed since the beginning of our being in the slingshot business!

Okay, after all of that what are we talking about then? After over three years, over $100,000 invested so far and over 1000 man hours between us, our engineers and patent attorney... We have basically settled on SEVEN different slingshot designs to begin with... Seven designs that fit the majority of beginner to experienced users needs... AND three highly unique and patented accessories that will help to bring new users into "the game" as well.

First up, we have updated one of the favorite slingshots of the modern era... The Hathcock Target Sniper! Named for the greatest Sniper of the Vietnam era, Carlos N. Hathcock, this slingshot is one that helped to launch and maintain the whole ergonomic slingshot movement. With it's highly intuitive and extremely consistent hold style due to the finger/ thumb grooves and the neutral wrist position because of the canted handle that allows for easier band alignment in a side hold... Many shooters, whether they be highly experienced or new to the scene, consider this design to be a classic and a favorite.

Next we have the Scorpion! The Scorpion happens to be my personal favorite design. It's hallmarks include a triple canted ergonomic frame, so you naturally point at your target in a relaxed position.... and a positive hand filling grip area that is designed to support your thumb to forefinger all the way out to the web... and a handle area that fills the hollow of your palm. The Scorpion is truly one of the most ergonomic slingshots of all time, and that ergonomic advantage allows for more stability, more comfort and greater shot to shot consistency... In fact the Scorpion design is THE first design in the modern era to show that match lighting, even with today's harder to light matches, is not only possible... but actually a fairly easy and common feat that can be done by many.

This next slingshot is the SERE. I could write volumes about this slingshot... but I'll try to keep it short. SERE basically stands for survive evade resistance and escape... All military pilots and crew who fly over enemy territory are trained in SERE techniques at one of several specialized schools in the United States... and about 3 years ago we were approached by SERE instructors from the Washington State school about the viability and usefullness of a slingshot in the "ditch bag" that pilots carry with them in the case of being shot down and having to use SERE tactics until being rescued. At first I wasn't to gung ho about the idea... Thinking that a small caliber silencer equipped firearm with extra ammo would be a better choice... but after some persuation I did come around to their way of thinking. So what was needed was a highly versatile slingshot that is extremely easy to use... it needs to be able to use many types of elastic, shoot all kinds of different ammo types and sizes, including arrows... and yet be small enough to included in the "ditch bag" in the first place. Seeing that our existing Hammer Takedown model slingshot with multiple modular fork types already fit most of those requirements, we simply went with a skeletonized and reduced size version of that... then over the course of several months of trying various things out back and forth... small mods here and there.. The SERE in 6061 aircraft grade aluminum was born. From that strictly utilitarian military version comes the SERE in Polycarbonate!

Note some of the defining characteristics of this new and improved design... The much deeper and inherently more stable interchangable forks and fork mounting recess.... necessary, we found, because although polycarbonate is very strong it's still not as strong as aircraft grade aluminum. Now look at the fork to handle fastening design... never a worry about vibration induced loosening of the forks, simply due to the double wrap around THROUGH the fork closure system. Next, the frame's grip is canted forward like a high end target pistol grip... that allows for the thumb muscle to attain a more natural hold and promotes natural point and shoot accuracy. Lower, the two finger grooves... your two strongest fingers naturally pull the frame deep into your hand while the tapering of the frame allows for the ring finger and pinky to balance out the grip for an extremely comfortable and easy to use hold. Then down to the picatinney rail... you can mount a reel for bowfishing, or a flashlight for night hunting... or BOTH if you want to bowfish at night... the rail is just long enough!

In short every part of this slingshot has been thoroughly tested in a variety of uses and situations... and it's been found to perform above expectations in every way. In fact after we gave away some of the prototypes at tournaments last year... it wasn't to long before some of our competitors announced they were going to come out with their own versions!

Up next we have the Ranger TAC with an over the top (OTT) band configuration. This particular design has been requested by many for it's pocketable size and the fact it's designed for a forefinger and thumb braced hold. A lot of old timers, Europeans and hunters prefer a symmetrical OTT design that's still ergonomic and comfortable to use all day long... and this slingshot fits that bill perfectly!

This next one is the TopShot... designed with a backward cant to the handle that allows comfortable ergonomic shooting in a forks up OR forks to the side hold... this frame is preferred by many who like to shoot with the fork in an upright fashion yet still prefers the ergonomically superior forefinger and thumb braced grip on the frame itself. Since introducing this design about 4 years ago, this slingshot has become very popular in the UK and many parts of Europe.... Since it is very concealable and ready to use at a moment's notice it's commonly referred to as a "poacher" design in the UK.

The TAC Hammer slingshot! There's just a not a lot that needs to be said about this slingshot... one look at it and it's obvious it means business and that it's going to be fun and easy to use as well... Most people who are just beginning with slingshots and haven't been around a lot of slingshot shooters, automatically try to hold pretty much all slingshots like this one is obviously designed for. This slingshot is designed for everybody from a beginner to the most experienced shooter there is.... it has our universal forks, a wide and forgiving fork gap width and of course is made from one of the most impact resistant materials out there!

The last full slingshot have for right now is the universal sideshooter. This slingshot is an improved version of the Boyscout model that we give away to scouting organizations. It's small enough to be used by an average 9 year old boy, but even an older person with much larger hands can use it as well. Designed to be used in a sideways hold only, it's one of the easiest slingshots with which to learn the fundamentals of shooting.

Now I want you to check these out.... These are our bifurcated shaft quick banding clamps... We call them "alien clamps" for short, because of the mouth within a mouth look of the final designs. These will be able to be used on any of the slingshots we have that have a hole in the universal forks, or on anybody else's slingshot that has a 5/16" diameter X 3/4" long hole in the forktip. No tools will be required to change out bands and what's more is you can use your slingshot as a makeshift band tying jig by using these as well... so if you're in the field and you want to make up a bandset or something... then you're not out of luck... your slingshot itself can be your jig!

Since we're talking about clamps and so forth... up next are our patent pending rod locking clamps, we call them gator clamps, and they will allow any standard 1/4" rod slingshot... like those in the big box stores, to shoot with flatbands in the preferred one line shooting method with no tied on or jumbled up looking bands... plus they will allow you to fix them in any orientation you wish... OTT, TTF or anything in between... With these you will be able to use any custom size or weight of band... train a child how to shoot with rubber-band strength bands and airsoft ammo... Then, in a few seconds you can take those bands off, change to some heavier bands... and you're able to go out and "soda can" hunt with the far more efficient and powerful flatbands you've always wanted when you go out to do that. What these clamps do is they take a simple and cheap rod frame slingshot and turn it into something you could easily compete and win with in a tournament. So soon, when a person asks "what's the best slingshot for a beginner?" The answer will be simple... buy the least expensive slingshot you can find at the store, put gator clamps on it, and you're all set!

These rod clamps and the bifurcated shaft clamps from before, are so unique, so groundbreaking in their design, that when the patent searches for prior art were conducted... there was simply nothing else to compare them to... So what we have done here is we actually created a couple of entirely new TYPEs of clamps... needless to say, that was more than a little amazing to the guys who conducted the searches in Washington DC!

And the last thing we'll be bringing out for now? Our Patented Quick attach archery plates that will allow you to take a cheap rod framed, tube equipped slingshot from the big box store and in about 10 seconds convert it to a slingbow that's just as powerful and accurate as all but the highest end, most expensive slingbows out there... and of course if you take a minute or so to tinker with it a little, cutting the tubes to the right draw ratio and installing the plugs we invented for making a fast attach bowstring... the converted "Walmart special" can then be just as powerful and maybe even MORE accurate as even the highest priced slingbow models! You see, through trial and error we figured out something early on... and that is those tubes and pouches on the store bought slingshots are not very good for REAL accurate shooting with standard ball ammunition... but if you set them up to shoot arrows, they're actually pretty darn hard to beat!

<b>

Frequently asked questions

I can't pick my color or hand preference on the perk I want
At the end of the campaign IndieGoGo will send us a list of supporters and which perks they chose. At that time we will contact you and get the details about what you want. OR you can do it earlier by emailing PocketPredator02@aol.com with all your information... name, contact email, shipping address, perk you chose, the hand you hold the slingshot in, and your color choice.

Will you extend the campaign for a few days so I can contribute at the first of the month?
I checked with IndieGoGo for their policy on that... and the short answer is that you can still contribute until I tell them not to accept more. So yes, we'll keep it open for 10 days after the campaign closes to allow our valued customers more time to get in on the special pricing we have set up for this campaign.

Will you do all the mailings and so forth even if you don't reach your goal
We would do the mailings and make good on the offers even if only one person supported us... Remember, everything is already paid for, and all you're doing by supporting us is allowing us a little breathing room while getting very special introductory pricing on our new product line! So YES you're going to get what you order no matter what!

I want to order the Alien Clamps, but there's no perk for that...
The Alien Clamps will come with every slingshot they are designed to fit... all those with the universal forks. When everything is in production they will also be available separately on our website for under $2 per set.

Is there another place where I can see updates?
Yes, you can see the complete update process by keeping up with the thread at: http://slingshotforum.com/topic/46518-finally-t...

 We have been contacted by our mold making company and they're ready to start on our molds... They should be all finished in at the most 6 weeks... it would be faster but we have a lot of molds and some are fairly complex too.
But anyway, we're going to use the IndieGoGo crowdfunding site to take preliminary orders and try to recoup some of the over $100,000 we've invested in this project already... and with tax season being upon us, we really could use a little breathing room!

story:
Weaving Tides is a charming single player adventure set in a world of magic and textile. Ride on the backs of carpet dragons and explore a stunning textile landscape, as you soar above and dive below the weave.

Call your Weaver and set out on a journey to explore ancient dungeons, solve puzzles, challenge quirky creatures and unravel the great mysteries of a long forgotten past!

  • Dive into an enchanting, woven world and reveal secret pathways.
  •  Stitch and cut your way through the textile landscape and wrap up your foes using your Weaver's unique stitching abilities.
  • Solve tricky textile puzzles which are scattered across the world.
  • Conquer Zelda-like dungeons but beware of their fearsome guardians!
  • Befriend three different Weavers, choose the one that fits your playstyle.
  • Outfit your Weavers with mystic embroideries to enhance their abilities.
  • Uncover hidden mysteries packed in a charming story.

Demo Download

Platforms: Weaving Tides will be released on Steam for Windows & Mac and Nintendo Switch. Check out our Steam coming soon page and feel free to add us to your wishlist!  

Weaving Tides will be available in seven languages: English, German, Russian, Japanese, Spanish, French and Simplified Chinese. 

We will also keep our ears open to your requests. If there is enough  interest we will do our best to translate Weaving Tides to even more  languages.

Some of our biggest influences: The Legend of Zelda Series, Bastion & Tearaway

Weaving Tides is influenced by a cluster of our combined interests and the things we love, but among our greatest inspirations are the Legend of Zelda series, Bastion and Tearaway. Our takeaways from these games are:

  • An epic adventure filled with challenges like in the Legend of Zelda  
  • A beautifully crafted story and lush, vivid environments like in Bastion 
  • Creative Puzzles and witty interactions with your surroundings like in Tearaway 

All of the mechanics in Weaving Tides are inspired by textile crafting techniques. The Weaver dragon you ride has a “ribbon tail” that flows behind it as you fly. It serves a variety of purposes and is the key to completing the challenges of the woven world.

Using the Weaver's ribbon allows you to complete magical stitching patterns, pull down hovering chests, drag heavy rugs, pull open curtains and more. 

Sometimes the solution lies hidden somewhere close by, other times you will have to explore the mechanics of the puzzle further in order to solve it. Use your imagination and puzzle-solving skills to overcome these challenges and advance on your journey.

The world is filled with secrets and optional puzzles. Find them and your curiosity will be rewarded with new clues revealing the mysteries of the world or useful new items.

While the primary focus of Weaving Tides lies in the narrative, as well as puzzles and exploration, it also offers laid-back, fun combat mechanics. 

 Every enemy will require you to adopt a different strategy in order to defeat it.   

 While, for example, the Toothy Yappers have to be flipped onto their backs by resurfacing right beneath them or dashing through them… 

 

  ...the moles have to be pulled out of their dens before you can stitch or dash them.

The combat in Weaving Tides is challenging, but not overwhelming.  If it turns out to be too easy for you, you will be delighted by the various opt-in modifiers in forms of items which will toughen up your foes.  

 

Once you’ve mastered these skills, explore dungeons to put them to the test! We have three dungeons waiting for you: a forgotten desert temple, a mind tangling forest maze and a dangerous lair which has yet to be unveiled!

And of course at the end of each dungeon a boss is waiting for you! 

 

Experience a sprawling, strange new world full of adventure and secrets. In this world Tass seems to be the only one of his kind - a human. Accompanied by his foster dad Kilim he sets out to solve the mysteries of his past. But the world he calls home is changing in dark, unexpected ways, and a force that once lay dormant beneath the weave is awakening. 

 

 Weaving Tides is a tale about finding a sense of belonging. The story is told in a light-hearted way sprinkled with charming characters and witty puns, but at its core it is a rich and emotional narrative about family, identity and the blurred lines of morality.

 

 

 Travel across the four unique layers of the woven world. Each layer has it’s own culture, aesthetic, puzzles and dangers. This strange world is inhabited by intelligent beings called "the Mothkin", moth people with human-like features and a predominantly friendly nature. 

Explore the sun-drenched dunes of the Silken Desert, home to small nomadic villages such as your hometown, Veteri.

Lush, dense & dangerous, the Spun Forests are home to the tribal Mothkin who are strict believers of the great mother Dea.

The Mothkin empire is a stronghold of trade and culture. Blessed by a moderate climate the Mothkin of the empire express their love for their land by growing beautiful, well-trimmed gardens.

Some speak of barren landscapes ravaged by relentless storms and hidden deep beneath the lustrous cities of the empire. Unknown things lurk down there; all we know for certain is they mean us no good.

The Weavers are the guardians of the woven world. Even though most Weavers are loners, three of them will join you in your quest and will invite you to ride on their backs. 

Each one of the Weavers behaves slightly different. While Twill has a higher movement speed, Luce can take more hits, for example - but their greatest difference lies in their special stitching abilities. It is up to you to use the Weaver best suited to your current situation, or you could just use whichever Weaver you like best!

Kilim's special move allows him to cover a wide area, perfect for patching up large rips and slowing down groups of enemies.

 

Twill spits her ribbon in a straight line and can therefore precisely remove single threats without having to move into dangerous zones herself. 

 

When Luce’s special move is unleashed he rushes forward, stitching and cutting everything in his path. Great for breaking through walls of enemies; not so great at avoiding painful obstacles. 

Although you will find some items by simply exploring the world and uncovering secret areas, some of the most sought after ones can only be bought from Salis the flying merchant.  

 

You gain Thread Essence by patching up tears in the world and by unsealing chests. Use the essence to buy magical embroidered patches which will greatly help you on your journey.

A small selection of the magical emroideries you will find on your journey.

Some of the items will be opt-in modifiers for folks that want an extra challenge: to give the enemies, say, more health in exchange for larger rewards. 

 Sometimes a Mothkin will entrust you with a letter to a loved one, other times you might find a ripped scroll of parchment stuck between the branches of a terry-tree. Collect these writings if you wish to delve deeper into the lore and mysteries of the woven world.

Capable explorers will find ways to reach even the most remote areas of the woven world. There you will find enchanted ribbons which can be used exclusively in Playground mode. Collect them all to create a stunning masterpiece of digital embroidery!

 

Weaving Tides' Playgrounds mode invites you to create your own digital artwork. In this mode you can choose from a variety of ribbons, including those you unlocked in Adventure mode. There are also some helpful special features:

  • different camera positions allow perfect framing for your fancywork
  • you can toggle the cutting functionality of the dash ability on or off
  • load in custom transparent background images to trace with your stitches
  • take a snapshot of your finished work by using the built-in camera

 

 The only limit is your imagination! Combine different ribbon styles to create mesmerizing patterns or pay tribute to your favorite game characters by reimagining them through weave. 

These are just a few of the main characters, but along your journey you will receive the help of a wide range of peculiar allies.

Weaving Tides’ evocative musical score, sound effects and overall audio will be handled by our talented composers Timo Jagersberger & Frank Schlick. Time and time again they have put us in awe with their rich and emotional music, but describing it with words won’t do it justice so we will let these tracks speak for themselves: 

 

What is an Add-on?

You can customize your Reward Tier by choosing items to add and increasing your initial pledge by the necessary amount.

How do add-ons work?

  • Select a perk that you would like to support and click "Get This Perk" button
  • Check "Perks you may also like" section and select the appropriate add-on that you would like to add
  • Proceed to Checkout

Hi we’re Follow the Feathers - a small independent games studio from Austria!

We strive to create enchanting worlds and love to come up with unusual game mechanics. Prior to this project we made NIVA, a game where you play as a mighty forest god that can grow or wither plants. We also worked on a bunch of smaller projects, but Weaving Tides is our most ambitious project to date.

 

Weaving Tides has been successfully crowdfunded on Kickstarter and received €54,182, surpassing our initial goal by 200%. We were able to achieve all listed stretch goals, but this campaign was very short and before the campaign ended, we received a lot of messages from people asking if there is another way they can support us. Some people only discovered our campaign after it has ended. Therefore, we decided to give a little extension of our campaign by opening it on Indiegogo. 

The extended campaign is planned to work as a tool that will allow people who missed the initial campaign to support the game and give them the possibility of joining the pre-launch access. All the additional funds will allow us to improve the overall quality of the game. We are also adding additional stretch goals which will bring a lot of existing improvements and new content.

Thank you everyone for your support. It really means a world to us.  

  This is how funds will roughly be split up:

After Indiegogo fees, taxes and fulfilling the Indiegogo rewards all funds will go directly towards the development costs of Weaving Tides, localization as well as paying our composers to whip up even more amazing tracks. 

About 75% of the game is done. The core of the game is fully finished and all levels except the ending are fully playable. What remains is a lot of gameplay polish, more art assets, scriptwriting for minor characters and bug squashing. We are therefore confident that we will be able to deliver Weaving Tides in late autumn 2020.

 

 

Risks and challenges

We have been developing Weaving Tides for more than two years. Most of the difficult work is done and throughout our past five years of working together as a tight-knit team we have learned how to tackle even the most daunting tasks. We give our estimates a lot of thought and factor in technical hurdles as well as polishing, therefore we are confident with the timeline we have laid out. Of course no one can predict the future and there is always a chance of unexpected problems to occur which will potentionally delay the project. However even if such a case arises we will finish Weaving Tides without compromise. Making Weaving Tides the best it can be is our main priority and we will always keep you in the loop about the current status of the project. Thank you for your faith and support!
story_txt:
Weaving Tides is a charming single player adventure set in a world of magic and textile. Ride on the backs of carpet dragons and explore a stunning textile landscape, as you soar above and dive below the weave.Call your Weaver and set out on a journey to explore ancient dungeons, solve puzzles, challenge quirky creatures and unravel the great mysteries of a long forgotten past!
Dive into an enchanting, woven world and reveal secret pathways.
 Stitch and cut your way through the textile landscape and wrap up your foes using your Weaver's unique stitching abilities.

Solve tricky textile puzzles which are scattered across the world.
Conquer Zelda-like dungeons but beware of their fearsome guardians!
Befriend three different Weavers, choose the one that fits your playstyle.
Outfit your Weavers with mystic embroideries to enhance their abilities.
Uncover hidden mysteries packed in a charming story.

Demo DownloadPlatforms: Weaving Tides will be released on Steam for Windows & Mac and Nintendo Switch. Check out our Steam coming soon page and feel free to add us to your wishlist!  Weaving Tides will be available in seven languages: English, German, Russian, Japanese, Spanish, French and Simplified Chinese. We will also keep our ears open to your requests. If there is enough  interest we will do our best to translate Weaving Tides to even more  languages.Some of our biggest influences: The Legend of Zelda Series, Bastion & TearawayWeaving Tides is influenced by a cluster of our combined interests and the things we love, but among our greatest inspirations are the Legend of Zelda series, Bastion and Tearaway. Our takeaways from these games are:
An epic adventure filled with challenges like in the Legend of Zelda  

A beautifully crafted story and lush, vivid environments like in Bastion 

Creative Puzzles and witty interactions with your surroundings like in Tearaway 

All of the mechanics in Weaving Tides are inspired by textile crafting techniques. The Weaver dragon you ride has a “ribbon tail” that flows behind it as you fly. It serves a variety of purposes and is the key to completing the challenges of the woven world.Using the Weaver's ribbon allows you to complete magical stitching patterns, pull down hovering chests, drag heavy rugs, pull open curtains and more. Sometimes the solution lies hidden somewhere close by, other times you will have to explore the mechanics of the puzzle further in order to solve it. Use your imagination and puzzle-solving skills to overcome these challenges and advance on your journey.The world is filled with secrets and optional puzzles. Find them and your curiosity will be rewarded with new clues revealing the mysteries of the world or useful new items.While the primary focus of Weaving Tides lies in the narrative, as well as puzzles and exploration, it also offers laid-back, fun combat mechanics.  Every enemy will require you to adopt a different strategy in order to defeat it.    While, for example, the Toothy Yappers have to be flipped onto their backs by resurfacing right beneath them or dashing through them…    ...the moles have to be pulled out of their dens before you can stitch or dash them.The combat in Weaving Tides is challenging, but not overwhelming.  If it turns out to be too easy for you, you will be delighted by the various opt-in modifiers in forms of items which will toughen up your foes.   Once you’ve mastered these skills, explore dungeons to put them to the test! We have three dungeons waiting for you: a forgotten desert temple, a mind tangling forest maze and a dangerous lair which has yet to be unveiled!And of course at the end of each dungeon a boss is waiting for you!  Experience a sprawling, strange new world full of adventure and secrets. In this world Tass seems to be the only one of his kind - a human. Accompanied by his foster dad Kilim he sets out to solve the mysteries of his past. But the world he calls home is changing in dark, unexpected ways, and a force that once lay dormant beneath the weave is awakening.   Weaving Tides is a tale about finding a sense of belonging. The story is told in a light-hearted way sprinkled with charming characters and witty puns, but at its core it is a rich and emotional narrative about family, identity and the blurred lines of morality.   Travel across the four unique layers of the woven world. Each layer has it’s own culture, aesthetic, puzzles and dangers. This strange world is inhabited by intelligent beings called "the Mothkin", moth people with human-like features and a predominantly friendly nature. Explore the sun-drenched dunes of the Silken Desert, home to small nomadic villages such as your hometown, Veteri.Lush, dense & dangerous, the Spun Forests are home to the tribal Mothkin who are strict believers of the great mother Dea.The Mothkin empire is a stronghold of trade and culture. Blessed by a moderate climate the Mothkin of the empire express their love for their land by growing beautiful, well-trimmed gardens.Some speak of barren landscapes ravaged by relentless storms and hidden deep beneath the lustrous cities of the empire. Unknown things lurk down there; all we know for certain is they mean us no good.The Weavers are the guardians of the woven world. Even though most Weavers are loners, three of them will join you in your quest and will invite you to ride on their backs. Each one of the Weavers behaves slightly different. While Twill has a higher movement speed, Luce can take more hits, for example - but their greatest difference lies in their special stitching abilities. It is up to you to use the Weaver best suited to your current situation, or you could just use whichever Weaver you like best!Kilim's special move allows him to cover a wide area, perfect for patching up large rips and slowing down groups of enemies. Twill spits her ribbon in a straight line and can therefore precisely remove single threats without having to move into dangerous zones herself.  When Luce’s special move is unleashed he rushes forward, stitching and cutting everything in his path. Great for breaking through walls of enemies; not so great at avoiding painful obstacles. Although you will find some items by simply exploring the world and uncovering secret areas, some of the most sought after ones can only be bought from Salis the flying merchant.   You gain Thread Essence by patching up tears in the world and by unsealing chests. Use the essence to buy magical embroidered patches which will greatly help you on your journey.A small selection of the magical emroideries you will find on your journey.Some of the items will be opt-in modifiers for folks that want an extra challenge: to give the enemies, say, more health in exchange for larger rewards.  Sometimes a Mothkin will entrust you with a letter to a loved one, other times you might find a ripped scroll of parchment stuck between the branches of a terry-tree. Collect these writings if you wish to delve deeper into the lore and mysteries of the woven world.Capable explorers will find ways to reach even the most remote areas of the woven world. There you will find enchanted ribbons which can be used exclusively in Playground mode. Collect them all to create a stunning masterpiece of digital embroidery! Weaving Tides' Playgrounds mode invites you to create your own digital artwork. In this mode you can choose from a variety of ribbons, including those you unlocked in Adventure mode. There are also some helpful special features:
different camera positions allow perfect framing for your fancywork
you can toggle the cutting functionality of the dash ability on or off
load in custom transparent background images to trace with your stitches
take a snapshot of your finished work by using the built-in camera

Time and time again they have put us in awe with their rich and emotional music, but describing it with words won’t do it justice so we will let these tracks speak for themselves:  What is an Add-on?You can customize your Reward Tier by choosing items to add and increasing your initial pledge by the necessary amount.How do add-ons work?

Check "Perks you may also like" section and select the appropriate add-on that you would like to add
Proceed to Checkout
