story:
Why

Team GamersLeague believes in eSports and we see it as the future number 1 sport in the world. We believe that our plans of taking eSports to a business level here in Norway is the next step on the road to our goals.

Team GamersLeague is a norwegian eSports organisation that in the past few years have been supporting players of all ages, genders and nationalities reach their dreams in gaming. We strive to build players from the ground up and supporting them in every step of the way, not just when they are on top. Our dream is to build a network around our players that will help them reach their dreams in the best way possible.

What

As a team we will be working towards helping all of our players get to the highest level in their selected games. We will strive to build them up, support them in their daily lives, online and on live events they attend. We have some goals that are set in stone and more will be added after the company has been created and players start giving their input.

·  Diet and training advice

·  Uniforms and gear

·  Travel support

·  Practice camps

·  Coaching and learning

·  Personal and team sponsors

·  Legal advice

·  Support and motivation!

How

To do all this we need to register our company so that we can start providing the things we have planned for our players. The company form we have chosen is the safest company form here in Norway and it will give our players and teams part ownership of the team.

The company form we have chosen to go for is known as AS "Aksjeselskap" and is a company form that leaves the owners and players with a minimum risk and all the benefits of being a registered company in Norway. To register a new AS you need to have a base value of at least 30.000,- NOK or 5.000$ USD plus fees for registering. Another positive thing with registering the company in the form of a AS is that after we have paid the money we can then spend it on the team.

Our plans for the 6.000$ we hope to raise are the following.

  • New shirts and uniforms for our members and the first batch of shirts for our webshop. By selling shirts we hope to raise even more money towards helping our players travel the world to compete. 2.000$
  • We will do a summer practice camp for our Dota 2 lineup to build team spirit and synergy. 1.000$
  • Tournaments open for everyone in every game we support to help build the esports community arround our teams and crew. 1.000$
  • The final 2.000$ will be put aside to pay for travel costs for some of our players so that they can compete at the highest possible level at live events.
FAQ

GamersLeague eSport has been around from the early days of Starcraft 2. We started out as a small team of friends and quickly expanded to being one of the strongest teams in Norway and later on in europe. After just a few weeks we started winning tournaments and decided to see how far we could take things.

Now, several years later we have sent players all over the world to play the games they love and compete at a top international level. In the past years we also expanded into several other esport games and we have also had international lineups in different games. We strive to help new players get their chance to shine on the big stage.

To reach our funding goal we have set up several different perks of donations where you as a donator will get a little extra from us. This varies from having your name on our website to playing with our players and even having your company logo on our shirts. All donations are valued by us all and we hope you take a little extra time to read up on what it is we offer.

Notable results and some videos:

  • 3rd place at ESWC 2011 in Dota 2.
  • 1st place HomeStoryCup VI Starcraft 2
  • 1st and 2nd place Gamer's Paradise 2011 Starcraft 2
  • 1st and 2nd place Gamer's Paradise 2012 Starcraft 2
  • 1st place Gamer's Paradise 2012 League of Legends
  • 1st place RedByte 2v2 2011 Starcraft 2
  • 1st place ONOG I2 Starcraft 2



We appreciate you taking the time to read this and we hope you have a good understanding of what we are trying to do and that you can help spread our project via Indiegogo's sharing tools.

story:
Please make sure to give the game an UP vote on Steam Greenlight!



 Just Beneath The Skin is a story driven action/puzzle RPG revolving around Shyla, whom unknowingly and unwillingly is forced into battling for her life and for the lives of many others.

Shyla lives with her father and brother in the woods, her mother disappeared when she was ten years old and never returned. Seven years later a stranger comes to her father from the woods, soon Shyla will begin a journey that will take her into a world she never could have imagined, a world far beyond her comprehension and far beyond limiting conceptions. 

For Shyla, there is a long road ahead, for those who have been watching her since birth, there is a long wait ahead and for the God that is living inside of her body, well for him, his long wait is over.

He will use Shyla to be re-birthed into existence and once again try to rule the universe. The question is…. 

Will Shyla be able to stand up to the tests that are coming her way? 

Will she fulfill her destiny? 

Or will she be consumed by the darkness...?

In due time all the answers will fall into place...



JBS first started as a book idea, when I was younger I would write away in my notebook story ideas/plots and extend on them if I liked the base. I loved the concept of this game so much that I wrote an entire 150 page novel to really bring the JBS world alive, after several years of revisions and edits to the draft I thought about publishing it. Considering I know the story inside and out from what I envisioned it was more of a video game/anime then a book. So with that JBS for the PC was born, starting from scratch it is where it is today because of how much I love this story.

I also expanded on the JBS world and wrote two sequel books that not only bring you into more brand new worlds but continue where the story left off each book, pulling you in and making you want more!

 

JBS is already well into development, and you can check out the latest Beta v1.8

(caution, this game is not intended to be easy)


Try the BETA: 



BETA Gameplay: 

  • 2 hours + worth of gameplay (depending on player).
  • Is in BETA stages but everything should run smoothly. 


This game only works on windows so please keep that in mind before downloading, if you come across any issues feel free to message me.



Why RPG old school style?


In the era that I grew up in I played video games that were extremely hard, not only were they hard but you actually had to acquire a decent amount of skill to pass each level or a group of skills to beat a whole game. For me this is what video games represent, something to conquer by gaining skills, you see the challenge is what is most thrilling for me and most people I would assume. 

I wanted to bring games back to where they used to be, hard, hard and fun yet rewarding, without having to have a full 3D interface to enjoy it. Remember Ninja Turtles for NES? How about Aladdin for Sega? These titles bring one thing to mind for me, SKILL! As you had to have skill to play or even beat these games. Not just that but these games did have bugs and perhaps there were things we didn't like about the game. Still we played anyways and for years we will continue to play, in any video game we play and adapt to the environments that are presented to us. 

With JBS it's all about adapting to the environment as it may change continuously and if you don't pay attention, you may get lost or confused, which is where the 

"Acquiring Skill" mode comes into play.



What will you find in JBS?


So what's in JBS? Puzzles, puzzles, puzzles, I love puzzle games as well as horror/survival but JBS isn't a horror game so I went with a more "surreal" experience to compensate. Dreamy and beautiful environments surround you only to keep you from the absolute truth, nothing in JBS is as it seems, at least almost nothing..... 

Besides puzzles there are many foes that Shyla must fight against in order to survive as she progresses on her journey. You see in order for the God inside Shyla to gain energy, Shyla must draw blood and never stop. As the game progresses you will be able to transform into Caldon (the ancient alien God inside of Shyla) during battle and use his extreme powers to surpass all who stand in their way. 

So we have puzzles, fighting and very deep plot? Interesting combination eh? What else is in here? Oh you know just stuff that most people who play RPG's love, check the features section below for full details and example images.



Jeremy Solares

                           Game Designer, Graphic Designer, Multi-Media Producer



I go by Tsuyoi Raion in many places, I am indie designer who has experience in many different fields. Always having a curiosity in any form of art, I tend to grab hold of anything I can learn in order to master everything as they would say. As an indie designer I know how important it is to be good at many different things, with eighteen years of computer experience and knowledge in over three hundred plus programs I hold myself up pretty well against competitors.

I have at minimum 8 years in the professional business field doing marketing, production, sales, etc. which leads me to be an entrepreneur of all sorts. 

I love video games, they are truly a part of my life as I grew up with games everywhere and still to this day can't fathom not having games in my life. Not only has gaming created something so capturing but it has opened opportunities to have friends who enjoy the same games or i can battle with online. 

Gaming has opened doors that were closed for me and even more so now that Indies are stepping into the spotlight more and more, because of this I know if not anything else, at least indie video games will be designed and supported fully by the gamers. 


Luna Elto

Hired artist (Character Art)


Luna is an aspiring artist who is currently attending College to become a professional artist, I happen to find Luna through a friend of mine after falling in love with his work. Since then the character art for JBS has skyrocketed finally giving the game that nice feeling all around. Luna wishes to do all he can to help the game progress and has even offered to do the art for the 2nd and 3rd game for JBS. Looks like we have a keeper ladies and gentlemen! 



I have been self funding this project for the past year and now I need your help!! I want to bring you a great game to play and in order to do that I need to be able to fully focus on the production of this game, I believe a great game comes from hard work, dedication and continuous focus. With your help I can bring this game alive in 6 months or less!  So please help me to help you... jump into the world of JBS and beyond!!


Last year I threw a Kickstarter that raised almost $1,000!! Unfortunately my goal was $5,000 and I did not receive any of the donations. I could have really used that money and was bummed about it but hopefully those of you who contributed last run are willing to donate once again and this time I will get it! 


Where Your Money Goes

Being an indie dev. means you either have the skill to make whatever it is you need OR hire outside sources to accomplish those things for you. For me, I have hired an outside hand for the character designs as well as a coder here and there for certain aspects of the game (in game menu, etc.).

For the hard work these people have contributed I have promised due payment, your contributions will help in getting these hired hands what they deserve! Check below in the Characters section to see what the new artist has contributed to the game! 

I recently decided I was going to add in a small voice over role for Shyla here and there throughout the game, for this I have found a voice actress whom I have paid already for the parts she has already done. I would like for her to continue doing voice over for Shyla in the game, your contributions will also go towards paying for her services. 


Progression

For the most part the general feedback from the gamers in the most recent BETA releases were they loved the game but felt the character art really hurt the games appeal. 

The character designs have changed a few times since the creation of JBS but I realized what I had prior wasn't what I was really looking for. So Upon finding the new hired artist I feel content with the character art now and have confidence the gamers will too!

Below is progression sheets for the characters that are currently finished, not all characters are complete as of right now but will be coming soon.


Shyla


The Doctor


Mr. Crow


Natalie


These are just a few examples of progression sheets for the characters, below is detailed information for each character that is available as of now.


Character Info








More Coming soon...



  • Story Driven Gameplay Style
  • Complicated puzzles
  • SBS (Sideview Battle System) and ATB (Active Time Battle System)
  • Stage Select
  • Animated Characters (Dialogue)
  • 8 Directional Movement
  • Manual Stat boosting capability
  • Spirit Alignment System
  • Journal
  • Side-Quests
  • Quick save (for saving on the go when it’s dire)
  • 3 different storylines to discover, 3 different lives to live
  • 30+ stages to explore and conquer (for starters)
  • Console window responds to game such as: Full console window shakes/moves
  • Fishing Feature
  • Mining Feature


Thanks to the power of the internet and social marketing platforms available I can branch out in ways that would have been impossible before. There are various locations JBS is available for viewing/downloading as well as many youtubers who have done "Let's Play" videos for demonstration purposes. I want to take a moment and thank all those youtubers who are doing great things by playing the games we work so hard on and enjoying them.

  • Gamedevunderground
  • Desura
  • Indiegamemag
  • Digitalblare

Promo's:






The asking amount above is just enough to cover the games production but is there more that can be accomplished if I pass the $5k asking amount? Oh yes, there definitely is! 

The funds will go towards things such as:

  • $5,500 = Cover art for book
  • $7,000 = Editing Fees for book and hire a helper                                              OR Android port (Final decision will be left up to the                                                     public by vote)
  • $9,000 = Publishing for book
  • $13,000 = Android/OUYA port
  • $15,000 = JBS character plushies OR initially funding for JBS 2
  • $17,000 = JBS 2 initially funded and secured 
  • $20,000 = JBS 2 fully funded, Cover art for JBS 2 book and JBS 2 editing fees
  • $24,000 = Publishing for JBS 2 book + JBS 2 Android/OUYA port
  • $30,000 = JBS Movie (paying actors, editors, location renting, etc.)
  • $40,000 = JBS 2 Movie (same as above but needing more)
  • $60,000 = JBS 3 funded/secured, JBS 3 book editing fees, JBS 3                      Android/OUYA port
  • $75,000 = JBS 3 Movie (same as above), JBS 3 book publishing

Being a one man developer I have to cover everything in the game from scratch up, everything merely takes time to do and perfect but can be done over due time. With that said a 6 month deadline is what I am going for but if things come up such as long fazes of fatigue due to illness things could be delayed for a few months. Even if illness does come up if I have the funds I will make sure to at least hire on someone to continue the work for me in my absence.

The funding from this fundraiser is supporting me for the next 6 months and pay for my hired hands services. As of now I have no steady income and am really putting myself on a tightrope wearing a blindfold and asking the audience to guide me. This is something I have to do because we all have to go for our dreams, the ones that bring us joy through the challenges and rewards.
story_txt:
Please make sure to give the game an UP vote on Steam Greenlight! Just Beneath The Skin is a story driven action/puzzle RPG revolving around Shyla, whom unknowingly and unwillingly is forced into battling for her life and for the lives of many others.Shyla lives with her father and brother in the woods, her mother disappeared when she was ten years old and never returned. Seven years later a stranger comes to her father from the woods, soon Shyla will begin a journey that will take her into a world she never could have imagined, a world far beyond her comprehension and far beyond limiting conceptions. For Shyla, there is a long road ahead, for those who have been watching her since birth, there is a long wait ahead and for the God that is living inside of her body, well for him, his long wait is over.He will use Shyla to be re-birthed into existence and once again try to rule the universe. The question is…. Will Shyla be able to stand up to the tests that are coming her way? Will she fulfill her destiny? Or will she be consumed by the darkness...?In due time all the answers will fall into place...JBS first started as a book idea, when I was younger I would write away in my notebook story ideas/plots and extend on them if I liked the base. I loved the concept of this game so much that I wrote an entire 150 page novel to really bring the JBS world alive, after several years of revisions and edits to the draft I thought about publishing it. Considering I know the story inside and out from what I envisioned it was more of a video game/anime then a book. So with that JBS for the PC was born, starting from scratch it is where it is today because of how much I love this story.I also expanded on the JBS world and wrote two sequel books that not only bring you into more brand new worlds but continue where the story left off each book, pulling you in and making you want more! JBS is already well into development, and you can check out the latest Beta v1.8(caution, this game is not intended to be easy)Try the BETA: 
BETA Gameplay: 

2 hours + worth of gameplay (depending on player).
Is in BETA stages but everything should run smoothly. 
This game only works on windows so please keep that in mind before downloading, if you come across any issues feel free to message me.Why RPG old school style?In the era that I grew up in I played video games that were extremely hard, not only were they hard but you actually had to acquire a decent amount of skill to pass each level or a group of skills to beat a whole game. For me this is what video games represent, something to conquer by gaining skills, you see the challenge is what is most thrilling for me and most people I would assume. I wanted to bring games back to where they used to be, hard, hard and fun yet rewarding, without having to have a full 3D interface to enjoy it. Remember Ninja Turtles for NES? How about Aladdin for Sega? These titles bring one thing to mind for me, SKILL! As you had to have skill to play or even beat these games. Not just that but these games did have bugs and perhaps there were things we didn't like about the game. Still we played anyways and for years we will continue to play, in any video game we play and adapt to the environments that are presented to us. With JBS it's all about adapting to the environment as it may change continuously and if you don't pay attention, you may get lost or confused, which is where the "Acquiring Skill" mode comes into play.What will you find in JBS?So what's in JBS? Puzzles, puzzles, puzzles, I love puzzle games as well as horror/survival but JBS isn't a horror game so I went with a more "surreal" experience to compensate. Dreamy and beautiful environments surround you only to keep you from the absolute truth, nothing in JBS is as it seems, at least almost nothing..... Besides puzzles there are many foes that Shyla must fight against in order to survive as she progresses on her journey. You see in order for the God inside Shyla to gain energy, Shyla must draw blood and never stop. As the game progresses you will be able to transform into Caldon (the ancient alien God inside of Shyla) during battle and use his extreme powers to surpass all who stand in their way. So we have puzzles, fighting and very deep plot? Interesting combination eh? What else is in here? Oh you know just stuff that most people who play RPG's love, check the features section below for full details and example images.Jeremy Solares                           Game Designer, Graphic Designer, Multi-Media ProducerI go by Tsuyoi Raion in many places, I am indie designer who has experience in many different fields. Always having a curiosity in any form of art, I tend to grab hold of anything I can learn in order to master everything as they would say. As an indie designer I know how important it is to be good at many different things, with eighteen years of computer experience and knowledge in over three hundred plus programs I hold myself up pretty well against competitors.I have at minimum 8 years in the professional business field doing marketing, production, sales, etc. which leads me to be an entrepreneur of all sorts. I love video games, they are truly a part of my life as I grew up with games everywhere and still to this day can't fathom not having games in my life. Not only has gaming created something so capturing but it has opened opportunities to have friends who enjoy the same games or i can battle with online. Gaming has opened doors that were closed for me and even more so now that Indies are stepping into the spotlight more and more, because of this I know if not anything else, at least indie video games will be designed and supported fully by the gamers. Luna EltoHired artist (Character Art)Luna is an aspiring artist who is currently attending College to become a professional artist, I happen to find Luna through a friend of mine after falling in love with his work. Since then the character art for JBS has skyrocketed finally giving the game that nice feeling all around. Luna wishes to do all he can to help the game progress and has even offered to do the art for the 2nd and 3rd game for JBS. Looks like we have a keeper ladies and gentlemen! I have been self funding this project for the past year and now I need your help!! I want to bring you a great game to play and in order to do that I need to be able to fully focus on the production of this game, I believe a great game comes from hard work, dedication and continuous focus. With your help I can bring this game alive in 6 months or less!  So please help me to help you... jump into the world of JBS and beyond!!Last year I threw a Kickstarter that raised almost $1,000!! Unfortunately my goal was $5,000 and I did not receive any of the donations. I could have really used that money and was bummed about it but hopefully those of you who contributed last run are willing to donate once again and this time I will get it! Where Your Money GoesBeing an indie dev. means you either have the skill to make whatever it is you need OR hire outside sources to accomplish those things for you. For me, I have hired an outside hand for the character designs as well as a coder here and there for certain aspects of the game (in game menu, etc.).For the hard work these people have contributed I have promised due payment, your contributions will help in getting these hired hands what they deserve! Check below in the Characters section to see what the new artist has contributed to the game! I recently decided I was going to add in a small voice over role for Shyla here and there throughout the game, for this I have found a voice actress whom I have paid already for the parts she has already done. I would like for her to continue doing voice over for Shyla in the game, your contributions will also go towards paying for her services. ProgressionFor the most part the general feedback from the gamers in the most recent BETA releases were they loved the game but felt the character art really hurt the games appeal. The character designs have changed a few times since the creation of JBS but I realized what I had prior wasn't what I was really looking for. So Upon finding the new hired artist I feel content with the character art now and have confidence the gamers will too!Below is progression sheets for the characters that are currently finished, not all characters are complete as of right now but will be coming soon.ShylaThe DoctorMr. CrowNatalieThese are just a few examples of progression sheets for the characters, below is detailed information for each character that is available as of now.Character InfoMore Coming soon...

story:
New Stretch Goal ($6500!)

We have a new stretch goal and everyone who donates $50 or more will receive a physical copy of TurfBattles with an exclusive item in the game! The physical copy will be professionally made and be similar to collectors editions of Diablo and WoW.   Below is the type of box you can expect TurfBattles to be delivered in. If we reach the goal we'll be eating into our own pockets! All shipping will be paid by us! This is as a favor for the community to keep Turf Battles forever.


What Is Turf Battles?

Turf Battles is a 3D MMORPG unlike any other. It holds a very large emphasis on the PVP Aspect of games that makes it quite the riveting and exciting experience. Players are able to progress their characters rather quickly and engage in territorial battles against other players, either by themselves or with members of their Tribe(Guild). These battles determine ownership over Turfs that are inhabited by monsters that, when killed, drop valuable items used in upgrading character items and skills. Players must defend the Turfs from invading Tribes (Guilds). Although character progression is important, it is not the deciding factor in a battle. Players can hone their skills by cutting and stacking their skills together, much like with combo's. Skills have 0 cast time, and only a very few skills have cool downs. 

Turf Battles was released in America, but unfortunately it was later shut down. To those of you who played Turf Battles, you know of the riveting and exciting game play I'm speaking of. You probably have even followed the game through it's multiple failed versions, and even tried to play other MMORPG's. However I bet no other MMORPG but the original Turf Battles has ever given you the form of satisfaction and enjoyment that Turf Battles did. The thrill of performing time sensitive combinations of attacks, movement, and jumping in order to defeat enemy players in all out war simply does not exist in any other MMORPG.


What We Propose

We are rebuilding the original Turf Battles. This is not a new game, it is not going to have changes to the games system. It will be Turf Battles, the game we all know and love. The game we all spent hours upon hours having fun, making friends, and even arguing in the PVPChannel.

It will have cutting, stacking, combo's, you will be able to hold over 1000 potions, players will be able to PvP in all the areas they were able to in the original version. Quests such as the Roof Top Hop will return to the game. Monsters that have long been unseen, such as the Turtoid Lord, will return. Equipment and Skills will have the original requirements, stats, and abilities. Weapons such as Eonic Weapons, Stun and Mana Steal Weapons, Leni Steal weapons, etc will return. Players will be able to earn PK Points in order to be on the PK Rankings on our website. I can go on, but that would be kind of point less. You must have gotten the point by now.

We are bringing back Turf Battles, the only game that has ever been good enough to actually continue playing for over 9 YEARS!


Who Are We?

We are group of players that have been playing Turf Battles and all of its versions since 2005. We have team members that work on different aspects of the game. Such as a Graphic Designer, Web Developer and Designer, Programmers, etc. Each member has had a tremendous amount of experience in his/her field. We have all been working hard to make this dream, that the entire Turf Battles Community has been wanting since it shut down in 2008, a reality.

You can learn more about the team on the about us page of our website.


What We Need?

A very large amount of work has already been put into the project prior to this campaign being started. Between now and the end of the campaign we will be uploading various screenshots, videos, and development diaries of our progress. These can all be viewed here or on our website. It is our hope that we update the community on a weekly bases.

However, our team is not the biggest group of people. We all have lives, families, jobs, and bills to pay. That being said the purpose of this campaign is to raise enough money to allow the members of our team to work on Turf Battles full time for a period of time. 

We will also be using left over money to host our Test Server, when that time comes, as well as to pay our web hosting fees.

Basically, the money raised will ensure that there will always be people working on Turf Battles, because it will be our jobs. We may even be able to find room in the budget to outsource some work to other developers in order to speed up the development process.

Everyone that donate's will be thanked by each member of our team, as well as having their names listed on our websites Donor List. If you would not like to be listed on the Donor List, you simply need to ask us not to list your name.

On top of our thanks, because we know thanking you could never be enough. We are offering various perks to people that donate, the value of these perks goes up as the player donates more. As well a player receives all the perks above his perk price. 

For Example

If you donate 60 USD, you will get the following perks:

  • Beginner's Luck
  • Deal of a Life Time
  • Not So New Begginings
  • Beta Tester
  • Pet Master
  • Alpha Member
  • The Tardy Early Bird

If we reach our goal, we believe that the game will be able to be released for Beta Testing as early as September, maybe even earlier. If you have any questions or concerns about the campaign, please feel free to post them on our forums. A member of our team will be more then happy to answer them.

Can't Donate?

We understand that some people just can't contribute, due to personal reasons. That's okay, but if you still want to help you can do so by bringing awareness to the our campaign. Simply share the campaign's URL with your friends, or anyone you might think would be interested in the campaign.

As well a player receives all the perks above his perk price. For ExampleIf you donate 60 USD, you will get the following perks:

Beginner's Luck


Deal of a Life Time


Not So New Begginings


Beta Tester


Pet Master


Alpha Member

The Tardy Early Bird

If you have any questions or concerns about the campaign, please feel free to post them on our forums. A member of our team will be more then happy to answer them.Can't Donate?We understand that some people just can't contribute, due to personal reasons. That's okay, but if you still want to help you can do so by bringing awareness to the our campaign. Simply share the campaign's URL with your friends, or anyone you might think would be interested in the campaign.

story:
The Scoop

(VIDEO COMING IN THE NEXT 48 HOURS!)

Mortifera Incident is a online MMORPG that is a tecxt based RPG enhanced by graphics and audio. The game has been a personal project for over a year now, and is finally coming together. It is a world of virtually unlimited scale, and makes players not only learnt to fight of the Zombie horde, but to actually survive, and realize the human factor of such an apocalypse.

 The Lead Developer

My name is Jordon, and I'm a 24 year old residing in Michigan, USA. I have been developing websites and web based programs since I was 18. I am knowledgeable in HTML, CSS, PHP, MySQL, JavaScript, JQuery, and AJAX.

Along with being a well-rounded programmer, I am a avid gamer. I have always been attracted to this genre, and I always found that every game I tried always came up short in some way, shape, or form. Thus the idea of Mortifera Incident was born.


Mortifera Incident

This game has been my brain-child, and it has really evolved into something special over the many months of planning, coding and development.

The game will allow players to spawn into a post-apocalyptic world that is over 225 million square miles of dynamically generated, fully destructible terrain. Players will have the option of surviving on their own, or teaming up with other players and/or NPC's to form raiding parties or even entire societies.

There will be literally thousands of items in the game, and it will be up to the players to live a freelance life, try to uncover why the incident happened, or attempt to seize power in this new world.

 


Reason For Funding

The reason we are reaching out for funding is pretty simple and straight-forward. We are looking to raise money to support the accelerated launch and sustainment of the game. These costs include the following:

  • Dedicated Server Costs
  • Artwork Costs (Art By Adam Talley, famed Comic artist)
  • Sound Costs (Music Provided By ConnorORT)
  • Initial Awareness Campaign Costs
  • Programming Time

In a nutshell, I am the primary code monkey for this project. I do have the help of a couple of close friends who are adding in when they can, but we are doing this around full-time work schedules. The funding will not only help us appropriate a dedicated server to launch from, but allow us to get some funds to Connor and Adam (Who I must mention have been more than generous in helping us get some content together to show you fine folks) so they can get the ball rolling on the art and music scene, to help us but together a bit of funding for an initial marketing campaign (So you have people to play the game with!), and of course to help allow us coders to allot some more time to the project.

 

What We Need, Where It Goes, What You Get!

Now we are going to take a moment to quickly hit on approximately how much of the set goal amount will be going towards which items, and the kinds of things we are offering to our generous donators. (If we exceed our initial goal we have several stretch goals planned, and will release them as necessary!)
  • Server Costs (1 Year) - $1200
  • Artwork Costs - $1500
  • Sound Costs - $800
  • Marketing Costs - $500
  • Programming Costs - $1000

This are rough estimates of how the $5000 goal will be allocated. This will be updated if we are to exceed our goal. If we fall short, the money will remain proportionally the same to the above mentioned categories.

 

Can't Donate? We Still Need You!

We understand that there are some Zombie lovers and just generally good hearted people out there who would love to help but aren't in a place financially to do so. We would like to say to each and every one of you to pass along the word about our project and this fundraising attempt to help us succeed. Word of mouth is how this will get accomplished, and the more mouths spreading the word, the better!

  • Make use of your social networks like facebook, twitter, and your blog.
  • Use the share functions provided by Indiegogo
  • Like us on facebook, retweet us on twitter, and tell your friends!
  • Join our forums and be an active part of the community!

 

Additional Donator Rewards (http://www.mortiferaincident.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=6&t=1971)
story_txt:
The Scoop
(VIDEO COMING IN THE NEXT 48 HOURS!)
Mortifera Incident is a online MMORPG that is a tecxt based RPG enhanced by graphics and audio. The game has been a personal project for over a year now, and is finally coming together. It is a world of virtually unlimited scale, and makes players not only learnt to fight of the Zombie horde, but to actually survive, and realize the human factor of such an apocalypse.
 The Lead Developer
My name is Jordon, and I'm a 24 year old residing in Michigan, USA. I have been developing websites and web based programs since I was 18. I am knowledgeable in HTML, CSS, PHP, MySQL, JavaScript, JQuery, and AJAX.
Along with being a well-rounded programmer, I am a avid gamer. I have always been attracted to this genre, and I always found that every game I tried always came up short in some way, shape, or form. Thus the idea of Mortifera Incident was born.
Mortifera Incident
This game has been my brain-child, and it has really evolved into something special over the many months of planning, coding and development.
The game will allow players to spawn into a post-apocalyptic world that is over 225 million square miles of dynamically generated, fully destructible terrain. Players will have the option of surviving on their own, or teaming up with other players and/or NPC's to form raiding parties or even entire societies.
There will be literally thousands of items in the game, and it will be up to the players to live a freelance life, try to uncover why the incident happened, or attempt to seize power in this new world.
 
Reason For Funding
The reason we are reaching out for funding is pretty simple and straight-forward. We are looking to raise money to support the accelerated launch and sustainment of the game. These costs include the following:

Dedicated Server Costs
Artwork Costs (Art By Adam Talley, famed Comic artist)
Sound Costs (Music Provided By ConnorORT)
Initial Awareness Campaign Costs
Programming Time

In a nutshell, I am the primary code monkey for this project. I do have the help of a couple of close friends who are adding in when they can, but we are doing this around full-time work schedules. The funding will not only help us appropriate a dedicated server to launch from, but allow us to get some funds to Connor and Adam (Who I must mention have been more than generous in helping us get some content together to show you fine folks) so they can get the ball rolling on the art and music scene, to help us but together a bit of funding for an initial marketing campaign (So you have people to play the game with!), and of course to help allow us coders to allot some more time to the project.
 


What We Need, Where It Goes, What You Get!

Now we are going to take a moment to quickly hit on approximately how much of the set goal amount will be going towards which items, and the kinds of things we are offering to our generous donators. (If we exceed our initial goal we have several stretch goals planned, and will release them as necessary!)
Server Costs (1 Year) - $1200
Artwork Costs - $1500
Sound Costs - $800
Marketing Costs - $500
Programming Costs - $1000

This are rough estimates of how the $5000 goal will be allocated. This will be updated if we are to exceed our goal. If we fall short, the money will remain proportionally the same to the above mentioned categories.
 


Can't Donate? We Still Need You!
We understand that there are some Zombie lovers and just generally good hearted people out there who would love to help but aren't in a place financially to do so. We would like to say to each and every one of you to pass along the word about our project and this fundraising attempt to help us succeed. Word of mouth is how this will get accomplished, and the more mouths spreading the word, the better!

Make use of your social networks like facebook, twitter, and your blog.
Use the share functions provided by Indiegogo
Like us on facebook, retweet us on twitter, and tell your friends!
Join our forums and be an active part of the community!

 
Additional Donator Rewards (http://www.mortiferaincident.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=6&t=1971)

story:
Down With the Death Knights;

 Hello Everyone,

 My name is Aaron, and I'm an engineering student at Portland State University. I've been playing Knights and Dragons for a year now, and watching the Death Knights influence continue to spread across the game in the plague that is the Empire. I am currently leading a team of individuals who are highly connected in the top 10 culture. We have assets within the Empire, Rebel, Coalition, and MERC alliances. We have the people, the plan, and the time needed to replace the Death Knights, and create a level-playing field for all guilds to have a shot at the number one spot. We want to see the little guilds, have an opportunity to move into the top 10 without the level of organization that empire has. The one resource we are asking for help with, is money.

      Not much either, a $1 contribution, from one fifth of the Knights and Dragons player base, would yield 5 times what we need to keep DK off of the throne. Your contribution is helping all those players who can't afford the thousands of dollars a month spent by Empire in order to continuously claim 7 of the top ten spots.

   Here is the breakdown; 30% of funds will be used initially to fund a max level guild which will simply outscore DK. We will repeat this process until DK and Empire are tired of losing, and have agreed to our demands. We aren't going to replace one monopoly with another however. Once established, we will still allow 1-2 guilds from each of the alliances to compete for top ten. This setup allows space for 3-4 more guilds in the top ten. These guilds will be funded by the remaining campaign contributions. Guild Masters can apply for campaign funds in order to supply their guild with Google Play cards to fund their own top ten run.

It's time to stop the tyranny and oppression that is DK, be a part of the movement in which they fall.

 Donate today. A one dollar contribution can make a better game for all of us.

  If you can’t help financially, that's ok. You can help our cause by posting our link everywhere in Line chat, or your guild chat. Tell people about our campaign, and what it will do for the game. Together, we will make war epics something that everyone has a right to.

story:
Caravaneer 2

Caravaneer 2 is the second part of a free browser-based post-apocalyptic RPG game with trading elements and turn-based battles. You can play the first part here: http://www.gamesofhonor.com/caravaneer

The game has several aspects:

  • Transporting goods between towns and dealing with economy
  • Fighting bandits who try to rob you
  • Story and dialogues which involve all other aspects and more

The second part is planned to be much bigger than the first one. It'll have better graphics, a bigger story and a whole lot of new features, such as slavery, morale, a possibility to own businesses etc.

 

Author

Dmitry Zheltobriukhov, the author of this game has been in browser-based games business for almost 10 years now. He's responsible for the creation of a dozen of Flash games and two game sites: Sugar-Free-Games.com and GamesOfHonor.com

Funding

This is a one person game and there will not be many expenses, except, maybe, for music and a couple of other small things. However, this game is relatively big and the only person working on it needs a lot of time to finish the project. He needs to receive some sort of salary duing this time, and that's what the money will be spent on. It's hard to tell how much money is needed exactly. The more will be raised, the more time I will have and the better the final product will be.

Perks

Even though some people think of crowdfunding as some sort of selfless donation, it's not exactly true. Contributors receive valuable rewards in exchange for their money. In the case of Caravaneer 2, all rewards are absolutely unique and there's no other way to receive them other than helping with the game development. It's an excelent chance for Caravaneer fans and game enthusiasts to lay their hands on some exclusive stuff.

Other Ways You Can Help

There are other ways to help the project other than money. You could share a link to this page ton social networks, or you could also volunteer to help translate the game into your language, be a beta tester or do something similar. If you think you can volunteer to help with the game development, please join a Facebook group called Caravaneer2 Volunteers (http://www.facebook.com/groups/221094054595107/) or contact the author via GamesOfHonor.com contact form (http://www.gamesofhonor.com/contact.php)

story:
Short Summary

My name is Şerban Mihai-Daniel and I started SMD Gaming Studio in October 2014 with an idea. An idea that had never been tried before ... or at least, not like this ... I want to create a really great, unique gaming company that  is driven by its community ...  by the players that play the games created by us .

I first started alone and I created a website (link here) where I exposed my ideas and published the first game (link here) but since then others had join forces with me and now we are a dedicated team that believes in this idea . 

... so now we are presenting SMD Gaming Studio, a  badass gaming company that let you decide how your gaming should be. Help us make this into a reality by donating to our campaign. We need your support. Without you, none of this would be possible. 


What We Need & What You Get

We need at least $50,000 to pay for the cost of everything that's needed to create this company. The donations you give us will be used to fund a working place, some hardware components, graphics development gear, art creation gear, and software for game development. Every penny will be used to pay for making this idea into a reality.

In return, you will get the coolest and most unique games that we create. Each game will come free! With your generous help, we'll be able to make these games as high quality as possible. 

The Impact

We are a small organization and without you, we cannot make it. Every donation matters to us, as this campaign determines whether or not we can continue working on these games or not. Without your contributions, we cannot afford to pay for developing on our own, so please donate! With your help, we can bring your games into the world and make the universe a happier place. 

Risks & Challenges

We are committed to bringing you great games, and won't settle for anything less. Thus, during our development stage, we will actively work with the community to make sure that everything is up to your standards. We recognize that this might result in a delay in our development process if complications arise, and we find it very important to make sure that games are produced in a timely matter, but we will prioritize quality. Rest assured we will notify everyone of what's going on so there will be no surprises.

Other Ways You Can Help

There are many ways to contribute! Even if you don't have the money right now, you can help us by sharing this Indiegogo campaign with your friends. Just click on any of the Facebook, Youtube, and other sharing buttons let the world know about our awesome idea!

story:
eonwars

We are Mentopia a visual effects company in Barcelona (Spain).

We were working in several feature films (+14) and ad spots.

We wanted to make strategy social game, but it's too simple.

game to gamers.

The effort of thousands of players will help predict the index of companies in the stock market.

No, It's not a stupid game stock exchange.

In Eonwars it's a free social game. You conquer planets, galaxies. It's advanced strategy game. Your ships will not be hundreds, will be thousands. Never seen before. Complex strategies involving stars, planets, comets, black holes... (real spaceship not included, sorry it's only a game).

Internal market you receive real rewards for your efforts.

The collection of assets in the game will give us the prediction index of the companies on the stock market.(yes, it's crazy but it's works!. check our webpage) 

for traders and stock investors.

In Eonwars players have to collect items to grow your empire. These elements are found in clouds, in an uncertain place in space. They know where they were, and their characteristics, have to predict their movement.

The elements are more powerful if the prediction is greater period of time and more accurate.

The clouds are graphical representations of the values ​​of the Nasdaq. The choice of the players with greater predictability are our index prediction.


Technical information and based papers could be found in our website for traders.

what you get

Eonwars will be online May 2014.

for gamers: an incredible experience, a strategic game based in 3D space. In our crowdfunding campaign you will get a personal universe.

for traders: an invaluable support for your investments, 6 months free subscription. 

timeline

Our record is 83 hours working without stop. We guarantee that our efforts will be  supreme.

objetives

Our objectives are ambitious, we want to offer our prediction API to other developers and share our platform. Not only forecast trading is possible, scientific data could be analysed and get predictions.


our dream, please share.

Eonwars is our dream, we make good use of the time that many players spend on social games. This is only the beginning, with the success we create games that help to medicine, biology...

Hope sweet hope, please share!.

story:
“This is the future of playbooks!”– Coach in Los Angeles, California

“Best play making app I’ve seen.” – Coach in Beaverton, Oregon

Our Product.

SportsLab transforms how teams educate student athletes. With the SportsLab web application (the non-iPad version), over 100 teams across the country have already collaborated and shared their team plays.  sportslabhq.com 

Here's a quick demo of our product: http://vimeo.com/54326270

And here's what is said about us:

“…it greatly facilitates my ability as a coach…and the kids really knew what we wanted them to do” - Coach in Ottawa, Canada

“What took me 30 minutes or more, took me 2 minutes with SportsLab.”– Coach in Walnut Creek, California

Click on the image below to watch what SportsLab does:

 

 

What are Teams using Today?

Most coaches resort to drawing their playbooks and logging team calendars, stats and rosters using pen and paper or Microsoft Office. It can be a real headache. In the video at the top of this page, the coach says they just don’t give out the wasteful and unread playbooks anymore. Coaches and athletes want a new and better way of doing things.

This is what coaches use today:

The Campaign.

We want to raise $70,000 to complete the SportsLab iPad app and launch a pilot test for McClymonds High School. The money will go to:  

  • Develop app from prototype to version 1.0 release on the Apple App store.
  • Purchase 25 iPads to do a pilot test with McClymonds High School.
  • Test for everything a team would do with the app.
  • And, of course, purchase and deliver our rewards for our backers: You!

We've analyzed every detail of the project. The amount we raise will deliver a solid foundation to outfit teams and help all athletes play smarter. 

Update: We are now proud to be working with Oakland High School. A portion of the funds raised here will also go towards a pilot test with their team.

Why McClymonds High School?

We chose to outfit McClymonds' football team with the pilot test of our SportsLab product because these guys have real heart. The school has been an important part of the Oakland, California community with some notable alumni (Bill Russell, MC Hammer, Senator Nicholas Petris, to name a few) and a storied history of facing adversity in a disadvantaged environment. Poverty and violence festers in this community. People like Malcom X and Muhammad Ali have promoted their message of progress on campus. McClymonds makes a difference in education with the means they have and the community around them. 

Now, SportsLab wants to use technology to add to this progress.

The priviledged can afford most new technology. Our project challenges this reality. We can help change the mindset of underpriveledged student athletes by outfitting them with iPads and SportsLab technology to show them that smart preparation both on and off the field is the key to success and a better life.

We need your help to make this happen!

Technology & Education Supports Success

Our studies show that teams who use the web version of the SportsLab product retain 30% more strategy and preparation for their efforts on the field. Just like studying for a test, SportsLab helps teams prepare properly for gameday.

We want to outfit the teams with the next generation of the SportsLab product, which will be an ecosystem of iPads running the SportsLab app. It will allow teams to manage their team strategy, data, stats, calendars and rosters all on our seamless cloud system.

If this mobile app gets created, then your team will have the chance to own the right tools to play smarter and win better.

Who are we?

Noman and Monty are the co-founders of SportsLab. After growing up in Oklahoma and Texas, football has stitched into the fabric of their lives. Now they work in the SF Bay area, and they see how technology positively impacts life experiences and education. Their vision is to empower athletes to have technology that makes a positive impact in their lives.

Your Contributions Rewarded.

Each contributor will be notified when the app is available to download from the Apple App Store so you can provide us feedback. In addition to being the first ones to try out the app, we want to return our thanks with rewards that are as high in quality as our SportsLab product.

Check to the right under the "Perks" section to see what you will receive for your contribution. And look below to check out pictures of the rewards.

Thank You Post Card

SportsLab Exclusive T-shirt Design

NFL SportsLab Autographed Football

 

Football Display Case

If you contribute at the Franchise and Hall of Fame level, then we want your youth or high school football team sponsorship to have a meaningful connection for you. We want to know your affiliation and team contact information in addition to your information.  If we get the same team being sponsored more than once, we'll ask you to sponsor another team.

Make an Impact!

This is your chance to not only help build an app that will prepare your football team for greatness, but it will also positively impact the lives of athletes in football. You know that sports teaches students valuable life skills. SportsLab's technology empowers every athlete to prepare smart and succeed.  

We know $70,000 is an ambitious goal, but, like McClymonds, we're a nimble team with high dreams. Over 100 teams, including talks with NFL and college teams, is only the beginning.

Noman and Monty (the founders of SportsLab) have a track record of delivering technology to this market. We'll continue making plays to revolutionize the sports world. Get in the game, join our team and fundraise with us.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute directly, please share this project with friends, family and others who love sports and changing the status quo as much as you do.

And if you have any questions, comments or love to send our way, then feel free to leave a comment on this project.

We know $70,000 is an ambitious goal, but, like McClymonds, we're a nimble team with high dreams. Over 100 teams, including talks with NFL and college teams, is only the beginning.
Noman and Monty (the founders of SportsLab) have a track record of delivering technology to this market. We'll continue making plays to revolutionize the sports world. Get in the game, join our team and fundraise with us.
Other Ways You Can Help
If you cannot contribute directly, please share this project with friends, family and others who love sports and changing the status quo as much as you do.
And if you have any questions, comments or love to send our way, then feel free to leave a comment on this project.

story:
ALERT - PLEASE READ THIS FIRST

As our fundraising efforts have largely failed, we're pulling the plug a little early. Please do not donate at this time. We're still working on trying to make this arcade happen, but clearly an IndieGoGo campaign is not the way to do it. Please read the last two Updates for more information. If you're still interested in helping make this happen, then please join our Facebook Group to keep abreast of our progress.

 

ALERT - PLEASE READ THE ABOVE FIRST

 

Once upon a time, video arcades littered the landscape. It was easy for people in urban areas to find a half-dozen arcades within their area, and even rural areas had a few machines. These days, though, arcades are becoming something of a dinosaur. Home consoles have been serving up a nearly-arcade-quality experience for over a decade, and as a result, the player base for arcade games dwindled. In an effort to retain their customer base, many arcades switched over either to specialty machines that required special control schemes that couldn't be easily replicated at home (gun games and rhythm games, in particular), or quarter-gobbling “ticket redemption” games. Some few arcades tried to stay true to their roots, and most of those have gone out of business. And many of the locations that still have machines are dirty, and their machines are in poor repair.

But there's one arcade experience that cannot be replicated on a console at home - pinball. While virtual pinball games like Pinball FX2 and Pinball Arcade do an astounding job of replicating the look and general physics of pinball games, by their very nature they cannot, and will not, ever replicate the tactile feel of playing pinball. Pinball fans know that the tactile sense is a very important part of playing pinball!


With that in mind, we want to bring the thrill of pinball back to our area. There are a few arcades in the Los Angeles area that have some pinball machines, and a few dozen bars, bowling alleys, and pizza joints that have one or two. But there’s only one in all of Los Angeles County that focuses on pinball, and that one is focused more heavily on the much older electro-mechanical machines, rather than the newer (and more popular) solid state games. To play the more recent games, you either have to search them out one by one across the region, go north to the Bay Area for an annual pinball convention, or much farther northeast to Las Vegas for the Pinball Hall of Fame (which I recommend to any pinball fan anyway). 

 

The Arcade

I intend to create a pinball arcade in the South Bay, ideally not too far from LAX, and therefore easily accessible for visiting pinball fans. This fundraising drive would help get the machines needed to properly stock the arcade. We are dedicated to providing a top-notch gaming experience for everyone who walks through our doors.

The arcade will be set up as an "admission" format. There will be a flat fee for entry, and all of the machines will be set up for free play. We will also have a small snack bar, of course.

The general plan is to have two to four very new machines like Stern's X-Men and AC/DC; Four to six "top-tier" older machines in excellent condition, such as Twilight Zone, The Addams Family, Monster Bash, The Simpsons Pinball Party, and/or Star Trek: The Next Generation; and eight to twelve "lower-tier" pinball games, such as Road Show, The Machine: Bride of PinBot, Earthshaker (especially thematic for a SoCal arcade!), and The Getaway: High Speed II. Ideally, we want to have around twenty machines to start. 

If we can manage it before we launch, we intend to have every machine set up with a headphone plug - in addition to the normal speaker music and sounds, players will have the option to plug in their own headphones in order to be able to hear the table that they're playing clearer, blocking out background noise from the other machines. That will enable them to focus on the call-outs and audio cues that the machine gives them.

If everything goes according to plan, we should be opening in Spring 2013. When we reach the initial goal of $100k, we will pay for six months' worth of lease on our space. Every 25k we go over that will add another six months to the lease, pre-paid - that means that if we hit, say, $150k, the arcade will be open for a bare minimum of a year and a half, guaranteed. We'll also have other guarantees and bonuses as we hit stretch goals, but we'll talk about that later.


Who are we?
Okay, so you want to know who "we" are. That's a fair question.

I am Jason DuVall. I've been playing pinball and video games for my entire life. One of my earliest memories is of standing on a bench, watching my father play a pinball machine, and being scolded for leaning against the machine to get a better view. I have a very colorful history, from being a Las Vegas Blackjack dealer to working for Interplay (a now-defunct computer gaming company). I love gaming in all of its many and varied styles, and I've been involved in gaming in one facet or another for over 20 years. I currently volunteer as head of the Video Gaming room for the Strategicon group of conventions - Orccon, Gamex, and Gateway. My favorite machine is Twilight Zone.

My partner is Polly Aylor. She refers to herself as an, "old-school girl gamer." Her first gaming experience was when her parents bought an Atari 2600... for themselves. She has been playing arcade games for over 30 years, and still doesn't understand people who think that there are no girls (or women!) in gaming. She is also a volunteer for the Strategicon group of conventions, with experience in the Role-Playing, Video Gaming, and Registration departments. Her favorite machine is Addams Family.

 

Always a creature of art, Jenn Kampmeyer honed her skills in everything from modeling clay to crayons, though colored pencils will always be her first love. Also a writer, she learned character creation from table-top gaming and through that hobby made friends with first Jason, and later Polly. Now she lives in the wilds of the Pacific Northwest and is glad to be reunited in this terrific project. Who knows? If successful perhaps it will mean a return to the lands of her birth!

 

Once the funding is well under way, we will have positions open for a webmaster and a technician. Once the project is running smoothly, we may have a few positions open for arcade staff, as well.
 

Additional plans for the Arcade:
As part of the purpose of this is to expose more people to pinball, we will be involving local charities, such as The Boys & Girls Clubs of Long Beach. In particular, 50% of the first month’s gross proceeds will be donated to the BGCLB, and 10% of net profits for months after the first will be donated to similar local children’s charities. We will, of course, be encouraging these charities to bring their kids out to play some pinball, too!

 

In Closing:
I realize that not everyone who is interested in pinball can donate here. Some people live too far away for it to matter, and some just can’t afford it. But if you have any love for the hobby of pinball, get the word out, tell others about this project! It’s a steep hill we’re climbing, and we need all the help we can get. IndieGogo has some great tools for sharing, and you can make a difference.

If you want to contribute in some other way than straight cash - if you have a location that you think would be suitable for us, and are willing to reduce the lease rate, or if you have pinball machines that you would donate or reduce the price on - please contact us.

Also, we want to make it clear that we are committed to seeing this project through, even if it takes several attempts to hit our goal. No matter how successful this campaign is, all funds will be dedicated toward making this project a reality, and all donation rewards will be honored once we reach our goal.

All images used with permission or under Creative Commons licensing. Header image used with permission, Copyright Ars Technica 2009.

story:
Welcome to the Comic Sutra fundraising page.

The Comic Sutra is an adult party game where teams of two people, while fully clothed, race through as many positions as possible before time runs out.  Sounds like a party people would never forget, right?

The game consists of 84 position cards (enough to play 3 rounds of increasing difficulty with 5 teams), instruction card, timer, and box. 

What We Need & What You Get

We would like to print our first 1000 games and we are asking for your help.  Please note that we will be going to print even if we fall short of our goal, so support with confidence.

We feel very confident that a ship date of Sept 1st is easily achievable.  Print quotes and the basic artwork are done.  We just want to give ourselves enough time to make small changes to the game, print, ship, and mail to you. 

Please see the Perks for a list of the goodies you can get for helping us.  We believe you are actually getting a good value for your contribution.  For example, if the retail price of the game is $24.99 (there is a lot of print material here) and assuming $8 shipping, for your $25 contribution, you are actually paying about 24% less than when we make this offering to the public after going to print. We have also put together some perks that include Comic Sutra t-shirts, naming positions for the game, and designing your own card.  The shirt is shown below.

Gratitude

Thanks for looking and I hope you love our game.  The Comic Sutra® was a blast to make and play.  We hope you enjoy it as well.

Thank You.  The Comic Sutra Team.

 

Please share this page with your friends.

story:
In Summary

Hi.

We are Bobby, Kiel, and Bobby and Kiel's close friends and confidants.

Bobby is a Math/Business student who works in sales

Kiel is a Programmer finishing his CSE degree

We both love adventuring, coding, being nerds, and having fun. So that is what inspired this. It all began when the obvious childhood dream of playing Pokemon in real life was still everpresent at 20. However unrealistic it was to invent a ball that could capture and shrink deer and other natural wildlife; and then proceed to shoot them back out to normal size. I decided an application in which you photograph them and other nature-ly things could be very fun. The core ideas of this app are:

  • "Capture" Animals by photographics them and battle/level up/trade
  • Find beautiful landscapes and landmarks exploring to show to       others
  • Leave treasures and trinkets or maybe even more (A campsite!? who knows!) geocaching style for other users
  • See the stuff thats around you and meet people!

Your photos are rated and identified by multiple other users if its an animal. A good shot gets a capture, and a bad one just gets the wikipedia entry of the animal Pokedex style.

If you want to go to a scenic area and take shots they can be rated by other users just like animal photos but you dont get a capture, you just get some points that we have to come up with a cool name for. Others can also explore and geocache in areas you have photographed and show you what they found there in case they may have come across something you didnt.
This is a huge deal to me. I want to find a way to get people outside and socializing. It kills me to see two friends sitting at a table both on their phones ignoring each other. Why not use them together and make it an adventure!?

Our Need:

  • Your Love
  • Virtual Linux Server
  • Time (quitting school to aggressively develop if this goes through)
  • Development Rig(s)
  • Hardware to test on


Our goal is 8000 dollars. We put this number on it because we will need to acquire development rigs, virtual servers to handle the photos and user information, a website to handle all of that, a facebook page, etc. These are not all physical costs but require a lot of time. Working on this project if we reach out goal I am going to drop everything and work on it 35-40 hours a week and knock it out of the park. We have 2 other developers alongside me working. We are all students and work, so this will require some sacrifices. If we get less than that, I still plan on finishing this it just might take a little longer.


The Impact

This truly isn't just a game. We want to give people a reason to go out and explore. Theres always fun with the mystery of exploration, and its always fun seeing sights others have marvelled at. We want to combine this and give you a reason to document the memories and experience. And with the technology involved, we can legitimately enhance the experience for the explorer. Notes left in augmented reality mode for other explorers, geocaches hidden and buried, make a wisdom hut in a woods if you want!We just want to have people go out and marvel at the world like man once had to the call of the wild and the call of the sea. It seems like its faded. So lets go be adventurers guys!

Other Ways You Can Help


If you cant give us money, we still love you. A lot. Send us an email, comment on what you see, give us an idea you think would be fun! Heck, if you have some coding or graphic design or balance design for combat or ANYTHING we might be involving ourselves with,  shoot us a message if you want to help out. Were completely open to constructive criticism and want to make this for YOU!

story:
The video displayed is one we got produced at an event we setup and live streamed, if you want more read on...

Looking to raise £800.00 for Scottish Independence Live Events for equipment and running costs that will take us up to the referendum.

At moment, I'm currently paying LiveStream service costs myself: $50(£35)/Month.
See "Basic Plan": http://new.livestream.com/plans
Cost: 8 month * 35 = £280 till referendum

Equipment & service for mobile live streaming - Huawei E589 4G LTE Mobile Pocket WiFi Hotspot
See details http://www.4gltemall.com/huawei-e589-4g-lte-mobile-wifi.html
See our live stream video test of product: https://new.livestream.com/IndependenceLive/events/2833099/videos/44845874
EE's 8Gb is £25.99 on a month to month contract, the device itself is £50 at the start.
Cost: 50 + 8 month * 26.00 = £208 till referendum

Other "stuff": tape, cables, bits & pieces.
Cost: £100 till referendum

Subtotal: 280 + 208 + 100 = £588

Estimate travel costs - £20/event - 2 big bags with equipment. Every new venue for live stream needs a test which is another visit on different day. I don't drive and not always a car available, which means public or taxi transport with the big bags.
Cost: 800 - 588 = £212 till referendum (will be more than this, impossible to be exact)

As I write this, we have currently 5 live stream events scheduled and more in the pipeline, including. Tariq Ali, Glasgow Uni; RIC Mass Canvassing, Drumchapel; RIC 7 Artists, GladCafe, Glasgow; Motherwell, indy event and Yes Renfrew, indy event.
