story:
About:

The Random Encounter will be a new gaming experience in Evansville, IN.
 
Our mission is to provide a clean, comforatble, friendly environment for you to play your favorite games!
 

Description:

A place for friends to come and play any Card Game, Board Game, or RPG. We will have clean restrooms, and our center will always be a welcoming place to come play your favorite Tabletop Games!
 
The Random Encounter will also be a kid friendly environment and will have a place for small kids to play.
 
 

General Information:

We think that the biggest problem among the gaming population here in Evansville is that there really is no where to play! We are forced into dark basements, hidden away from society, but no longer.
 
The Random Encounter will not only be the area's premiere late night gaming shop, but, as our name suggests, we will also help you find like-minded gamers when you are without your own group.
 
At The Random Encounter you will be able to purchase or order your favorite products. We will also have used items at a great price!
 
We will also have a drink fountain and quick food/snacks available.
 

Hours: (Subject to Change based on need)

  •  Monday - Thursday: 2pm-4am
  •  Friday Open 2pm until Sunday Night at 12am!

           (Yes, open all weekend!)

 
 

The V.I.G. Membership Details:

  • Cost $10 per Month
  • Wi-Fi will be available for our V.I.G's at no charge, and for a small fee for daily use for non-V.I.G's.

Food and beverage discounts:

  • We will have a Soda Fountain at the shop. Anyone purchasing a drink, member or not, has free refills for an entire 24 hours. We are shooting for $2.00 a Cup. V.I.G. get a 50% discount on drinks, and we are still somewhere between 10-20% on food items.

 Random Rewards:

  • We drew this idea from table top gaming. We all know what action points are, right? In a nut shell, extra d6's when the die value just falls a little flat for what you need. So let's say you come up and purchase a few things, you flash your awesome Random Rewards membership card. You'll roll (3)THREE six-sided dice and on the most expensive item that you're buying you'll receive a percentage discount equal to your roll, with a few exceptions. MINIMUM 10%, no one goes away with nothing. If the roll result is 18 (all 6's) the discount is bumped up to 20%. If the roll result is 3 (all 1's) the discount is 19%. How cool is that?

The Random Buck Reward:

  • When buying TCG singles or other product that is not still mint from the manufacturer, there will be a system in place that will give you 1 Random Buck for every $5 you spend on this type of merchandise. This is like store credit, but it will only work on used items.

We are still thinking of other perks we might give to V.I.G. Members.

 

Perks:

  1. NPC ($40) - Your name listed on the wall of support featured on our Facebook page and our business website when it is launched.

  2. V.I.G. ($100) - (All NPC Perks) You will also receive 5 Free Months of V.I.G. Membership ($50 Value) and a free T.R.E. T-Shirt.

  3. Founder ($250) - (All V.I.G. Perks) Plus 7 more months of V.I.G. (1 year total) Membership and a custom ordered T-shirt with your name or gamer tag printed on it. Also you will be treated to a game night of your choosing.

  4. Heroes of The Random Encounter ($500) - (All Founders Perks) Plus a Custom T-shirt with all the Heroes names. Also you will be invited to a pre-opening Heroes party.

  5. Raid Boss ($1000) - (All Heroes of T.R.E. Perks) Plus Lifetime V.I.G. Membership and an additional %5 off All products for 1 year. You will also receive a honorary plaque stating that you are a Raid Boss and Heroe of TRE and will be honored at the Heroes Party the day before Grand Opening!

Stretch Goals:

If we get more funding that our goal we will use this extra generous money to make your experience at The Random Encounter an even more enjoyable one! Don't think this is all we have planned for the shop, this is just what we need to get off the ground! There is much more in our heads that can be done with this place!!!

 

Why are we doing this?

 

"It's our dream! Speaking from the heart here guys! I've wanted to do this since I was in middle school! A friend of mine once owned a store were we could go play Magic and other games. When that store closed down, I felt lost. And I really never had the same experience at any of the "game shops" in Evansville since. I want to bring that experience back and make it more and as special to others as that was to me! So I can only say thank you to any support we get...Lets keep this up!" - Sean Isaac

 

 "Every time I think of our store I think of Avalon in Bloomington. It felt more like home than home was. It's where I know I met most of the friends that I have now. No, more than friends, family. I want to share that experience with Evansville. Evansville WILL see a new gaming experience." - Jack DeCaire

story:
My name is Josh Stepakoff.  In 1999, when I was only 6, I was shot by a gunman who fired over 70 rounds into my day camp.  Listening to the news about Newtown, Conn., I was horrified to find out that it was the exact same thing that happened to me thirteen years ago.  The pictures of the children being reunited with their families, all the parents waiting to hear about their children, all the kids being taken out of the school - all those images were identical to what I saw as a 6 year old.  

I'm scared, I'm angry, I'm sad and I just wish I could go out there and help everybody. I'm filled with disgust knowing that we've let this happen again.  

I am helping Women Against Gun Violence raise $25,000 over the next 50 days to support this Organization's programs to educate the public about the realities of gun violence and mobilize communities in support of sensible gun legislation. Please donate what you can.  Every dollar helps us fund the programs we need to support this valuable cause.

As a member of the Women Against Gun Violence Speaker's Bureau, I have the opportunity to turn my grief into action by sharing my story with others so that we can work together to avert future tragedies.

As survivors, we share our stories with communities.  

We share them so that people recognize the real life consequences of gun violence.  

We share them so that parents know how to talk with their kids about guns and let them know what to do if they are in a situation where a gun is present.  

9 kids a day--every day--are killed in gun related incidents.

We share our stories so that people will be moved to join with us in calling on our legislators to enact common sense, reasonable gun laws, like the reinstatement of the Assault Weapons Ban, a ban on the sale of high capacity ammunition magazines, and a stronger system of background checks. (40% of gun sales occur without background checks.)

Women Against Gun Violence has a track record of success, including removing junk guns from the streets of Los Angeles and successfully advocating for California’s strict gun laws. We can do the same for the nation.
story_txt:
My name is Josh Stepakoff.  In 1999, when I was only 6, I was shot by a gunman who fired over 70 rounds into my day camp.  Listening to the news about Newtown, Conn., I was horrified to find out that it was the exact same thing that happened to me thirteen years ago.  The pictures of the children being reunited with their families, all the parents waiting to hear about their children, all the kids being taken out of the school - all those images were identical to what I saw as a 6 year old.  
I'm scared, I'm angry, I'm sad and I just wish I could go out there and help everybody. I'm filled with disgust knowing that we've let this happen again.  
I am helping Women Against Gun Violence raise $25,000 over the next 50 days to support this Organization's programs to educate the public about the realities of gun violence and mobilize communities in support of sensible gun legislation. Please donate what you can.  Every dollar helps us fund the programs we need to support this valuable cause.
As a member of the Women Against Gun Violence Speaker's Bureau, I have the opportunity to turn my grief into action by sharing my story with others so that we can work together to avert future tragedies.
As survivors, we share our stories with communities.  
We share them so that people recognize the real life consequences of gun violence.  
We share them so that parents know how to talk with their kids about guns and let them know what to do if they are in a situation where a gun is present.  
9 kids a day--every day--are killed in gun related incidents.
We share our stories so that people will be moved to join with us in calling on our legislators to enact common sense, reasonable gun laws, like the reinstatement of the Assault Weapons Ban, a ban on the sale of high capacity ammunition magazines, and a stronger system of background checks. (40% of gun sales occur without background checks.)
Women Against Gun Violence has a track record of success, including removing junk guns from the streets of Los Angeles and successfully advocating for California’s strict gun laws. We can do the same for the nation.

story:
Beast's Fury will be a 2D, arcade-style fighting game featuring anthropomorphic characters. It is currently being developed by a small, passionate team of individuals who are both gaming enthusiasts and professional programmers. The game will not only involve action, but also features engaging story lines, intriguing characters, exotic arenas, and a killer soundtrack! Inspired by famous 2D fighters such as the street fighter series and Skull Girls. If you have any burning questions about the project, drop us a line on our facebook page! http://www.facebook.com/beastsfurygame


                                                                             

PC: http://www.evildogserver.com/share/BeastsFuryDemo_v8b_PC.zip

Mac: http://www.evildogserver.com/sha…/BeastsFuryDemo_v8b_Mac.zip

Linux: http://www.evildogserver.com/s…/BeastsFuryDemo_v8b_Linux.zip

                                                                          


                                                                




We've been working hard on Beast's Fury for two years now, and we'have been in talks with Investors and Publishers. They agree that the game has potential but they want to see a more complete product but to do that we require more funding (This is for the people who missed out or who could not donate at the time i am not asking the current backers to contribute again)

                                                                   

                                                                      


           


                                                                               

                                                                                  

                                                                          


.

Arcade Mode: Play a team of characters through regular matches, boss fights, and an ending sequence.

Versus Mode: Test your skills in one-on-one combat mode against computer AI.

Local Mode: Challenge a friend to versus mode on one console.

Online Mode: Versus mode using http://ggpo.net/.

Training Mode: Practice combos and set ups.

Replay Feature: Watch your online matches.

 


 Project Lead / Owner: Ryhan is an avid gamer, and trained martial artist. He is the creator of Beast's Fury, and is fully dedicated to making his dream game a reality. He has been investing his life and finances into this project for over a year, and has been studying all the details related to the intricate programming, design, and skill that it takes to make a video game.

2D Artist: Carlos Enrique is a professional illustrator with a vast portfolio of work and numerous clients worldwide. He specializes in heroic fantasy illustrations, comics and educational illustration for school textbooks. He was a long-standing active member of the staff of Illustrators for the trading card game "Myths and Legends", Salo S.A. company.

Lead Animator: Ben Halstead is currently based in the greater LA area, he's a traditionally-trained animator with 4 years of experience working both as a freelancer and in various studios. His projects range from online 3D game environments to hand-drawn feature films.
http://www.halsteadart.com

Patrick Stannard is a classically trained animator with experience working in both commercial and the video game industry. His latest work on Stoic's "The Banner Saga" included not only cutscene but in game combat animations as well. His previous work on Beast's fury was animating the character Don, and he looks forward to working on many more characters in the roster. Check out his work: http://vimeo.com/user2398400/videos

Cleanup/Colors/Shading: Rafael Llerena (A.K.A. Sorcerer Lance), is an aspiring comic artist/animator. Partly trained in art college and partly self-taught, he continues to learn by contributing in collaborations and improving his craft while developing his own independent projects in his spare time. http://sorcererlance.deviantart.com/

NEW Animation & Cleanup Team:

 Phillip Joseph 2D Clean-up Artist: (aka Koru Xypress) is a professional 2D Animator and Digital Illustrator. He specializes in fantasy themes and his portfolio includes various projects from character illustrations, concept arts, storyboards, book covers, to logo designs. On the internet, he is known as the artist behind Xypress Illustrations. http://koru-xypress.deviantart.com/

Ricky Bryant worked on Skullgirls and Children of Liberty as an artist and animator. He'll be the middle man between the animators and the game designers, cleaning and prepping animation frames so that the are ready for color and implementation into the game.

Kenny Chen is a freelance comic artist, avid fighting gamer and martial arts geek who has previously worked on a few personal game mods, as well as done animation cleanup for a couple of old Gameboy titles. He will be doing some cleanup and other legwork for Beast's Fury.  

Rukiya Hassan is an animator for Beast's Fury, a lover of video games and trained in White Tiger Shaolin Kung Fu. She dedicated much of her time to study and learn the art of animation after longing to bring characters to life. She has been investing her time with Beast's Fury as a clean-up animator for a few of the character Vincent's movesets. She is going to continue working with Beat's Fury as a clean-up animator to help finish the animation of all the characters in this game.

=========================================================

Programming: Marco Arsenault aka Evil-Dog is the programmer.  He has worked at Ubisoft Montreal for 5 years as a gameplay/AI programmer on Rainbow Six Vegas, Farcry 2 and Avatar: The Game.  Since 2004, he has been making indie games such as the award winning "Road of the Dead" as well as the somewhat popular music game series, "Punk-o-matic".  He has been running his own company, Evil-Dog Productions, for over 2 years.

Music / SFX: Zach Striefel is the Lead Sound Designer at Symphony of Specters. He has worked on projects with many notable companies such as Disney, Coca-Cola, Adult Swim, GSN, WB, NBC Global, as well as many Indie studios

Voice Actor / Writer / Editor: Poesy Rosewood is the writer for Beasts fury. She has done work as a ghost writer while working on several independent stories. Poesy has been an active member in developing the story, character designs, and concepts; including providing the voice for Odette.

UI Designer/Programmer: Adam Wan is the lead UI designer and developer for Beast's Fury. He's worked in the fields of desktop publishing, web design, and various disciplines of programming for the past decade. Adam currently resides in the Orange County of California where he works as an applications developer.

Creative Design Lead: Andrew Fein (Known Professionally as 40%FlashKick) breathes life into the characters and designs how they function within the game, and how the character balancing works. He's been playing professionally since 2009, and has since supported the FGC ever since. His fields of expertise is with dynamic combat systems.

Voice director: Danielle McRae is a voice actress residing in Los Angeles, California. Some of her most notable credits have been in League of Legends as Karma the Enlightened One, World of Warcraft: Cataclysm as Hagara the Stormbinder, Dragon Nest as Sidel, SkullGirls as Painwheel a New Conglomerate Solider in Planetside 2, Jada in Battle High 2, and most recently, you can hear her in the video game "Starcraft Universe: Chronicles of Fate: as the Adjutent and Captain Arley Sims.

 


The combo system will have a series of linked normal attacks that can end with a special move, sweeping attack, super move, launcher move or ultimate finish (Beast’s Fury’s version of Ultra Combos). Players can also perform air-attack / juggle combos that can end with a special move/ultimate finish. Juggling limits are also set individually for each character to keep them balanced and avoid over-powering. Players will have a series of attacks to choose from to make their combos. Everything from Crumples (moves that force opponents to stagger to their knees), to Wall and Ground bounces. Using a mixture of the Linked Combos (Normal moves that are strung together with the right timing) The special moves (Unique to the character) and the Juggle Combos (Moves that are strung together in the air), the player will try to lower the opponent’s life bar to zero the fastest. Or, in some cases, lower it enough that they can sit easy on a life lead.

  •   Combo Links and Attack Strings; this allows for players to put different attacks together to form devastating combos and counter-attacks, allowing players maximize damage against their opponents. This is a staple of Fighting Games however, so its nothing a seasoned fighting game veteran won't be unfamiliar with.
  • Dynamic Wall and Ceiling Combos; Beast's Fury uses a different approach to combos in the corner and at midscreen, in making it so that characters can use dynamic elements of the wall (Where they hit the wall and how hard) as well as if they're launched against the ceiling of a stage, and changing where/how they hit the ground. This changes the typical juggling system in that it makes players reconsider their combo choices depending on the stage.
  • Unique Mechanics Per Character; All of the characters in the game have unique abilities and game mechnics that set them apart. Though they follow the simple scheme of 'get the opponent to 0 life', all of them carry unique abilities that allow them to turn the tide of battle. Some prime examples being Vincent's ability to spend Meter in order to cancel his special moves into other special moves, or Don's ability to combo into EX Command Throws.
  • Adrenaline and Fury; Characters in Beast's Fury have the ability to store up energy for a Final Round push, giving them a game-ending boost where their natural abilities and unique game mechanics get boosts that make characters' much more powerful for a limited time. The stored energy is Adrenaline, and once per game, characters spend their adrenaline to go into Fury. However, they run out of Adrenaline to fuel their Fury gauge, their character powers down, losing their game changing mechanics and occasionally losing other skills as well.
  • Ultimate Finisher; Similar to Instant Kill Attacks in other games, the Ultimate Finisher is a move that is only available in the final round of any normal game. When a player activates their Fury, they have a limited amount of time to land a certain amount of hits on their opponent. If they succeed in landing the required amount, a cinematic finisher plays, and the opponent is instantly defeated, regardless of their remaining health.

story:
100%! 

Thank you very much everyone for your support, by your messages and donations. We promise you a game which you will remember for a long time and be assured that we'll inform you about the project's progress!  

New Game + is a mode that gives players the ability to recreate a character in a new game mode that will be more difficult, which will include new monsters and more likely to get powerful weapons (there are 7 levels of rarities for weapon and armor) 

Tower of 100 challenges will be part of god saucer (theme park) : it's a tower where, indeed, you will get 100 challenges to master. Every five succeed Challenges, you can choose to leave the tower and get a reward for your floor, or continue and risk losing everything.


              


Discover the secrets that lurk through more than twenty biomes, tame monsters and make them your allies , save the Chloriniens from the Night Walkers , create a community and protect it , create your own weapons, your own armor, your own magic and make the planet Centauri the cradle of a new civilization or your tomb!

THEY TALK ABOUT US ! 


  • Colorblind filters 
  • Each Monster, Weapon and armor is unique! 
  • Dynamic gameplay & movement 
  • Craft your own magic spells! 
  • Multiplayer 
  • Catch them all! Capture and tame monsters 
  • 100,000 ++ physical combinations and more than 500 clothes 
  • 2 play modes, Scenario and Sandbox and 3 difficulties mode 
  • Achievements are real impact in the game 
  • Weather 
  • Quests
  • Agriculture and Cooking 
  • Fishing 
  • Create your weapons and armors 
  • Create a village and give a job to the people 
  • Create an advanced network system! 
  • Set the behavior of the NPC and Robots 
  • God Saucer - A lot of mini games and challenges 
  • Mods, Mods everywhere - use many editors to create your own dungeons, biomes, monsters etc...

CREATE YOUR CHARACTER THE WAY YOU WANT IT TO BE!

With over 100,000 possible physical combinations and more than 500 clothes, you can give free rein to your creativity to create the character of your dreams!

MULTIPLAYER

Locally or via Internet, invite your friends to embark on the adventure and confront the many dangers of Centauri!

EACH MONSTER, WEAPON AND ARMOR IS UNIQUE!

With random suffixes and characteristics, no monster / equipment will be like any other! Proceeding with caution and praying the flying spaghetti god that you got good enough suffixes on your items will probably be our two best tips.

CRAFT YOUR OWN MAGIC SPELLS!

Your fireball is slow? Your healing spell is ineffective? You want to jump higher than Hulk?

Create your own spell!

Determine yourself the power of your spell and the cast time , the area of effect , the speed and / or the number of shots as well as many other possibilities!

CREATE A VILLAGE AND GIVE A JOB TO THE PEOPLE!

Save the Chloriniens , build them a safe place and then grant them a job as hunter, tailor, guard, wizard, researcher and much more!

SET THE BEHAVIOR OF THE NPC AND YOUR ROBOTS!

Planet Centauri has a unique script specially made for it, the “Centauri Script” (everything is in the originality of the name!). The latter, designed for everyone to use, will let you develop your own AI that you can embed in your community NPCs or bots.

A SCENARIO, A MULTITUDE OF EVENTS AND USEFUL ACHIEVEMENTS!

In Planet Centauri, you will encounter many characters who will either support you or seek to harm you, and a multitude of questions that will torment you to solve! Why are you here? How are you going to leave? Who are the Night Walkers? Why is your robot companion such a *******? Is it really a flying pig you just saw? Add to that the number of events that will spice up your life. Achievements that have a real impact in the game are no longer a dream! They will affect your success and enrich your world by unforeseen events.

WEATHER

Rain, snow storm, sandstorm, fog...Time will be capricious and potentially dangerous, take an umbrella when you go out or even a shield …

AGRICULTURE AND COOKING

"Eat to get stronger." Never has a quote  been truer in Planet Centauri.

COLORBLIND FILTERS

FISHING

Take your boat and go off for a carefree day, supervising  your fishing rod with sleepy eyes… What is the dream of many men could quickly turn into a nightmare if you’re not prepared for the dangers hiding in the seabed.

CATCH THEM ALL!

Are you feeling alone? Are you scared in the dark? Capture and tame monsters! Your new companion will support you and will evolve to become stronger! Each captured creature keeps its unique features, evolving with experience.

CREATE YOUR WEAPONS AND ARMORS!

Take your destiny in hand with a hammer and an anvil! The ability to insert power gems in your equipment, a variety of suffixes and 7 rarity levels allow you to customize your equipment and adapt to any situation!

PUT YOUR REFLEXES TO THE TEST WITH A DYNAMIC GAMEPLAY!

Dodge attacks with a dash, protect yourself with your shield, double jump to escape the lava, use your ninja rope to get out of dangerous situations and unleash your fury with one of your multiple attacks available! Whether through your techniques, your magic or your inventions , you will be equipped to survive in a hostile and aggressive planet.

THE GOD SAUCER!

Arenas, themed dungeons, attractions etc … The God Saucer will be a paradise for all those who love the mini games and challenges!

MODS, MODS EVERYWHERE!

Many editors will be available to create your own dungeons, biomes, monsters, furniture, clothes …

CREATE WITHOUT LIMITS WITH OUR UNIQUE NETWORK SYSTEM !

Like the excellent Terraria ( wires ) and Minecraft ( redstone ) Planet Centauri also has its network system! Pending further information on this topic , here is an explanatory cartoon on one of the many networks in the game 

EN : http://s14.postimg.org/fqhfczo01/Electrical_Networks.gif

FR : http://s14.postimg.org/s6e56qhc1/bd_r_seaux_2x.gif

OST! 


Exlusive HD desktop wallpaper : 

An exclusive HD wallpaper for anyone who has helped us on Indiegogo (original size: 1920x1080 - 2 versions with and without the logo of game)

Get the game  :

A digital version of the game (Windows/Mac/Linux) via Steam or DRM-Free. 

Beta access : 

You'll get access to a Beta version of the game. Scheduled  Q1 2015.

Prototype of the game :

You will have access to a prototype version of the game that will include three biomes and the first level of cavern. Scheduled for end  2014/Early 2015.

Exclusive Shiba pet :  

Adopt a shiba! Dogs will notify you of nearby dangers and help you see in the dark. Other species of dogs will be available in the game, along with other animals.

Create your very own Item/Weapon/Armor : 

Create your very own item/weapon/armor  for the game! you can choose to create only for you or for it to be integrated in the game and available for all (you also choose the text description and your name or nickname will be displayed on the object). Do not hesitate to contact us if you have questions!

Create your very own Pet/Monster/Boss : 

Create a pet, a Monster or even a Boss  for the game!  They will be provided with at least 4 animations (can be up to 5 or 6 depending on the type of pet / monster / boss)

Do not hesitate to contact us if you have questions!

Create a biome :

Create your own biome! A complete environment including 1 background, 1 boss, 2 monsters, 1 armor , 3 weapons and 5 items. You can choose to create only for you or for it to be integrated in the game and available to all .

It has been over one year since we started working full time on the project and we used almost all of our savings to create the game.

The largest part of costs have already been covered and that’s why we do not need to raise huge amounts of money. However we now need money to be able to keep working full time on the project and complete the game development faster.


Here's how we'll spend it:
  • Game development (GUI/Sound/Music/Pixel art)   
  • Mac & Linux support
  • Translation of the game by professionals
  • Indiegogo/Paypal fees
  • Taxes 
  • Miscellaneous charges (Website, Greenlight, Marketing..)
  • Buy pasta to survive (with tomato sauce)

    Risk and Challenges

    We are experienced in the area of games design and have carefully identified, reviewed and addressed the different possible risks. With all the core elements of the gameplay and working prototype already in place, we are now working on solid ground, and we believe we’re well past the unknowns and potential difficulties inherent to early development stages.

    The money will allow us to work in the best possible and complete the game development faster. 

    Talk to your friends!

    Word of mouth is the key to success, don't forget to share this page on social medias / forums, that will help us a lot!
    Contact
    Have a question or concern? Feel free to e-mail us!



    Thank you for your interest and support!
story_txt:
100%! Thank you very much everyone for your support, by your messages and donations. We promise you a game which you will remember for a long time and be assured that we'll inform you about the project's progress!  New Game + is a mode that gives players the ability to recreate a character in a new game mode that will be more difficult, which will include new monsters and more likely to get powerful weapons (there are 7 levels of rarities for weapon and armor) Tower of 100 challenges will be part of god saucer (theme park) : it's a tower where, indeed, you will get 100 challenges to master. Every five succeed Challenges, you can choose to leave the tower and get a reward for your floor, or continue and risk losing everything.


              

Discover the secrets that lurk through more than twenty biomes, tame monsters and make them your allies , save the Chloriniens from the Night Walkers , create a community and protect it , create your own weapons, your own armor, your own magic and make the planet Centauri the cradle of a new civilization or your tomb!
THEY TALK ABOUT US ! 








Colorblind filters 
Each Monster, Weapon and armor is unique! 
Dynamic gameplay &
     movement 
Craft your own magic spells! 
Multiplayer 
Catch them all! Capture and tame monsters 
100,000 ++ physical combinations and more than
     500 clothes 
2 play modes, Scenario and Sandbox and 3
     difficulties mode 
Achievements are real impact in the game 
Weather 
Quests
Agriculture and Cooking 
Fishing 
Create your weapons and
     armors 
Create a village and give a job to the
     people 
Create an advanced network system! 
Set the behavior of the NPC and Robots 
God Saucer - A lot of mini games and
     challenges 
Mods, Mods everywhere - use many editors to
     create your own dungeons, biomes, monsters etc...

CREATE YOUR CHARACTER THE WAY YOU WANT IT TO BE!
With over 100,000 possible physical combinations and more than 500 clothes, you can give free rein to your creativity to create the character of your dreams!


MULTIPLAYER
Locally or via Internet, invite your friends to embark on the adventure and confront the many dangers of Centauri!

EACH MONSTER, WEAPON AND ARMOR IS UNIQUE!
With random suffixes and characteristics, no monster / equipment will be like any other! Proceeding with caution and praying the flying spaghetti god that you got good enough suffixes on your items will probably be our two best tips.


CRAFT YOUR OWN MAGIC SPELLS!
Your fireball is slow? Your healing spell is ineffective? You want to jump higher than Hulk?
Create your own spell!
Determine yourself the power of your spell and the cast time , the area of effect , the speed and / or the number of shots as well as many other possibilities!
CREATE A VILLAGE AND GIVE A JOB TO THE PEOPLE!
Save the Chloriniens , build them a safe place and then grant them a job as hunter, tailor, guard, wizard, researcher and much more!


SET THE BEHAVIOR OF THE NPC AND YOUR ROBOTS!
Planet Centauri has a unique script specially made for it, the “Centauri Script” (everything is in the originality of the name!). The latter, designed for everyone to use, will let you develop your own AI that you can embed in your community NPCs or bots.
A SCENARIO, A MULTITUDE OF EVENTS AND USEFUL ACHIEVEMENTS!
In Planet Centauri, you will encounter many characters who will either support you or seek to harm you, and a multitude of questions that will torment you to solve! Why are you here? How are you going to leave? Who are the Night Walkers? Why is your robot companion such a *******? Is it really a flying pig you just saw? Add to that the number of events that will spice up your life. Achievements that have a real impact in the game are no longer a dream! They will affect your success and enrich your world by unforeseen events.
WEATHER
Rain, snow storm, sandstorm, fog...Time will be capricious and potentially dangerous, take an umbrella when you go out or even a shield …
AGRICULTURE AND COOKING
"Eat to get stronger." Never has a quote  been truer in Planet Centauri.


COLORBLIND FILTERS




FISHING
Take your boat and go off for a carefree day,
supervising  your fishing rod with sleepy eyes… What is the dream of many men
could quickly turn into a nightmare if you’re not prepared for the dangers
hiding in the seabed.


CATCH THEM ALL!


Are you feeling alone? Are you scared in the dark? Capture and tame monsters! Your new companion will support you and will evolve to become stronger! Each captured creature keeps its unique features, evolving with experience.




CREATE YOUR WEAPONS AND ARMORS!
Take your destiny in hand with a hammer and an anvil! The ability to insert power gems in your equipment, a variety of suffixes and 7 rarity levels allow you to customize your equipment and adapt to any situation!
PUT YOUR REFLEXES TO THE TEST WITH A DYNAMIC GAMEPLAY!
Dodge attacks with a dash, protect yourself with your shield, double jump to escape the lava, use your ninja rope to get out of dangerous situations and unleash your fury with one of your multiple attacks available! Whether through your techniques, your magic or your inventions , you will be equipped to survive in a hostile and aggressive planet.

THE GOD SAUCER!
Arenas, themed dungeons, attractions etc … The God Saucer will be a
paradise for all those who love the mini games and challenges!
MODS, MODS
EVERYWHERE!
Many editors will be available to create your own dungeons, biomes,
monsters, furniture, clothes …
CREATE WITHOUT LIMITS WITH OUR UNIQUE NETWORK SYSTEM !
Like the excellent Terraria ( wires ) and Minecraft ( redstone ) Planet Centauri also has its network system! Pending further information on this topic , here is an explanatory cartoon on one of the many networks in the game 

EN : http://s14.postimg.org/fqhfczo01/Electrical_Networks.gif
FR : http://s14.postimg.org/s6e56qhc1/bd_r_seaux_2x.gif
OST! 




Exlusive HD desktop wallpaper : 
An exclusive HD wallpaper for anyone who has helped us on Indiegogo (original size: 1920x1080 - 2 versions with and without the logo of game)


Get the game  :
A digital version of the game (Windows/Mac/Linux) via Steam or DRM-Free. 
Beta access : 
You'll get access to a Beta version of the game. Scheduled  Q1 2015.
Prototype of the game :
You will have access to a prototype version of the game that will include three biomes and the first level of cavern. Scheduled for end  2014/Early 2015.
Exclusive Shiba pet :  
Adopt a shiba! Dogs will notify you of nearby dangers and help you see in the dark. Other species of dogs will be available in the game, along with other animals.

Create your very own Item/Weapon/Armor : 
Create your very own item/weapon/armor  for the game! you can choose to create only for you or for it to be integrated in the game and available for all (you also choose the text description and your name or nickname will be displayed on the object). Do not hesitate to contact us if you have questions!
Create your very own Pet/Monster/Boss : 

Create a pet, a Monster or even a Boss  for the game!  They will be provided with at least 4 animations (can be up to 5 or 6 depending on the type of pet / monster / boss)
Do not hesitate to contact us if you have questions!

Create a biome :
Create your own biome! A complete environment including 1 background, 1 boss, 2 monsters, 1 armor , 3 weapons and 5 items. You can choose to create only for you or for it to be integrated in the game and available to all .






It has been over one year since we started working full time on the project and we used almost all of our savings to create the game.The largest part of costs have already been covered and that’s why we do not need to raise huge amounts of money. However we now need money to be able to keep working full time on the project and complete the game development faster.
Here's how we'll spend it:

Game development (GUI/Sound/Music/Pixel art)   

Mac & Linux support

Translation of the game by professionals
Indiegogo/Paypal fees
Taxes 
Miscellaneous charges (Website, Greenlight, Marketing..)

Buy pasta to survive (with tomato sauce)


Risk and Challenges

 
We are experienced in the area of games design and have carefully identified, reviewed and addressed the different possible risks. With all the core elements of the gameplay and working prototype already in place, we are now working on solid ground, and we believe we’re well past the unknowns and potential difficulties inherent to early development stages.The money will allow us to work in the best possible and complete the game development faster. 


Talk to your friends!

Word of mouth is the key to success, don't forget to share this page on social medias / forums, that will help us a lot!
Contact
Have a question or concern? Feel free to e-mail us!





Thank you for your interest and support!

story:
OUR STORY:

Hey everyone, thanks for checking out our project. We're Pete and Steve, the owners of allUgot.com. We both grew up playing video games, and love competing at them. Unfortunately, gamers like us haven't gotten the respect we deserve, especially from our parents. How many times has your dad yelled at you for wasting your life playing them? About a million times each for us! This is all because there's never been a concrete reward for being good at them. Well, we decided to change that forever, and came up with allUgot.com, a place where gamers can earn money doing what they love!
WHAT IS IT?

allUgot.com is an online gaming community where gamers can communicate and compete with other players from around the globe, and more importantly, earn real money competing at the games they love. HOW DOES IT WORK?

You simply join allUgot.com, add funds to your account, and compete against other gamers for cash prizes!

WHO CAN USE IT?

Whether you’re a pro or a n00b, allUgot.com accommodates all skill levels, giving every gamer a chance to earn money doing what they love. We are currently developing a skill ranking and feedback system so you know how good your opponent is, and if they play fair.

WHAT GAMES ARE AVAILABLE?

allUgot.com already supports a wide variety of game titles and will always adding new ones by request. We want to make sure every allUgot.com member has their favorite game to compete at.

WHAT KIND OF COMPETITIONS ARE SUPPORTED?

allUgot.com separates competitions into two categories, Challenges, and Tournaments. A Challenge is a single round competition between two individual gamers, or two teams. A Tournament is a multi-round competition where individual gamers or teams fight their way through the brackets to win a large cash prize for a small entry fee.
WHY WE NEED YOUR HELP:
So far we have designed and developed the small portion of the site which is shown in the video above. The site may seem very simple up front, but behind the scenes it is VERY complex and already consists of thousands of lines of code. For almost two years now we have been spending all our spare time designing and developing allUgot.com, and we’ve made great progress. Unfortunately, there’s a LOT more work to be done, and at the current rate, It’ll take us another two years to finish. With your help, we’ll be able to dedicate all of our time and effort to completing the site within the next three months. allUgot.com is the future of gaming, allowing people from around the world to earn real money doing what they love... with your help, we can make this happen.

WHAT WE NEED & WHERE DOES IT GO?

Our programming team estimated it will cost between $12,000 and $20,500 to get the site made and ready to launch. 95% of that money is going towards the programmers to cover their hours of work and expertise (ALL of them are experienced and have master's degrees!). The remainder of any funding we receive is going towards web hosting, as well as bank processing fees. We're not spending a dime on ourselves... 100% of any funding we receive is going towards allUgot.com to make it the best possible competitive gaming experience available.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP:

If you don't have the cash to spare (and trust us, we understand!), you can still be a part of the allUgot.com team by helping spread the word!  Post about us on facebook, twitter, video game forums, and everywhere else you go online. Tell your friends about us and get ready to compete at your favorite video games and Win More Than Respect!

THANKS FOR YOUR SUPPORT!

story:
About us

Txarli Miniatures is a young brand that seeks maximum satisfaction among all players.

The creator of the brand and its miniatures sculptor (Carlos Pileño) has been passionate about wargames for many years.

With the help of RN Estudio, Txarli Miniatures seeks to provide players around the world, the highest quality miniatures so they look at the field in the best way possible.

RN estudio is a very important painting company, also they do 3D sculpt, the best

3D printings and HD resin cast.


They helped other companies to have success in their crowdfunding projects, they work in more than 14 successfully completed projects.

They have enough experience to bring you the best quality HD resin cast miniatures, for your Fantasy Football match, or simple for collect and paint !


Why Crowdfunding?


We have finish awesome models for Lizardmen team, that we want

you enjoy fast !, because of this, we need your help to make this teams reality.

If you help in this proyect, you will get the best price you can dream, and very interesting exclusives miniatures !

story:
In 2012, psychologist, Dana Klisanin, Ph.D., introduced the scientific community to the "cyberhero" a new archetype that stands in stark constrast to the "cyberbully". Rather than seeking to harm others, the cyberhero uses digital technology to help other people, animals, and the environment. In this award-winning interactive gaming adventure, cyberheroes show-off their strengths and skills. (For more about the science of cyberheroes go to the * at the bottom of this page).  

Don a digital cape and take on 15 arch-enemies in a battle to save the future of the world. Game play consists of a mixture of action, adventure, and stealth exploration. Gamers build a secret hideout, complete dangerous missions, and extended game play into the real world using GPS enabled smart-phones. Visits to museums, National Parks, and even World Heritage Sites, will unlock in-game mysteries and increase in-game points.  In the process of playing, gamer's will be providing people with water, food, medicine, shelter; they'll be saving acres of rainforest, protecting endangered species, preserving World Heritage Sites, even defending the night sky! Gamers who complete all the heroic exploits will earn the badges of the nonprofit organizations, including the badge of the "Heroic Imagination Project". The Cyberhero League game portal  is linked to "Project Milky Way," an epic narrative and transmedia adventure. The aim of this first stage of development is to establish an online headquarters that will serve as a gathering place and training ground for cyberheroes. 

Cybehero League Founder: All Backers will become founding members of the Cyberhero League. You will have passcode protected access to the Cyberhero League and game, and will earn a special digital "Backer" badge that will forever be on your Profile page (or that of the person you gift it to). If you ever, even once, wanted to be a hero or superhero now's your chance to put on a digital cape and help us create a whole new way to play! Our perks will be delivered by mid-December and are wonderful Holiday gifts for family and friends!

Project Milky Way e-Book: When you're not gaming, you can download the first book of the Project Milky Way trilogy and literally join a cast of characters on their perilous journey across time and space because YOUR NAME will be added to the story. 

 

Cyberhero League Poster: Our "Rise of the Cyberhero Leauge" poster is designed exclusively for our Indiegogo Backers and has a clue to a geocaching treasure hunt. It will become an instant collectable!

Cyberhero League Cape or Tee Shirt: If you like the style of Batman and you're a bit on the eccentric side you'll love wearing our incredible Cape. If you're more of the understated type, we've designed a Tee-Shirt just for you.

 Cyberhero League Collector Set: Our special edition Collector's Set includes a 1st edition hardcover printing of the first novel in the Project Milky Way trilogy signed by both the author and the illustrator, 1 adventure Poster signed by the artist, and 1 cape or tee-shirt, plus the rewards at the $50 level.

Cyberhero League Patron: A limited-edition print of orignial concept art is sure to delight collectors of all ages, plus all the collectables at the $350 level.

Cyberhero League Launch Party: Don your cape and join us at our Launch Party in the Dome at the LA Center Studios!

  Never doubt that a small group of thoughtful, committed citizens can change the world; indeed, it's the only thing that ever has." M. Mead

Your contribution will help people of all ages collaborate on tackling real world challenges, all while playing a series of games. Once the Cyberhero League is up and running, our gamers will be continually donating aid to our nonprofit partners. So basically YOU will have made that happen. YOU will have empowered a whole generation of gamers to 'be the change they wish to see in the world'.

Our team of International nonprofit organizations and nongovernmental organizations continues to expand. Some of our current nonprofit partners include: Center for Biological Diversity; Charity:Water; C3: Center for Conscious Creativity; Earth Charter; Heroic Imagination Project; International Dark-Sky Association; Pachamama Alliance; Raincatchers.org; Reef Check; The Converging World; The Millennium Project; World Futures Studies Federation.

Check out our website for more info about our team --combined we have over 25 years experience in the entertainment industry working with industry giants like Disney, Universal Studios, and Warner Brothers. In addition to our creative team, we have team of talented advisors, including Internet pioneers and specialists in social entrepreneurship. We also have over a dozen amazing nonprofit partners that are lending us their expertise in addressing a variety of global challenges. By combining our talents we are bringing art and science together to create entertainment that literally changes the world for the better.

Establishing the Cyberhero League is important to us because we want to give cyberheroes of all ages a way to use the power of the Internet to tackle real world challenges and have fun doing it. Think about it. The actions of cyberbullies and cyber-criminals negatively affects our world everyday. We believe that heroism can be found inside everyone and that through nurturing it, we can positively affect the world -- bringing some balance to the equation -- giving cyberbullies and cyber-villains some stiff competition for the headlines. Last year Cyberhero League was selected as a winner in the World Future Society's Beta Launch Tech competition. Development of the game is well underway and now all we need to get the job done is YOU! Please help us fund this game-changer! We guarantee that you will love our perks and have fun discovering this new adventure.

We need your help because our game design is based on a socially-responsible business model that enables us to give 30% or more of our profits to our non-profit partners based on the gamer's actions. Your contribution is vital to our success because traditional investors aren't comfortable with this business model. To succeed we need to fund our project with money from people who want to be part of a new way of doing business.

CAMPAIGN UPDATE: Our business model is changing. Cyberhero League is applying for nonprofit status in an effort to return the largest percentage of funds  to our nonprofit partners.  

We will use the money we raise to pay artists, game developers, animators, and musicians. We’ve designed the game to have a flexible budget and scope, so if we reach our target budget goal, we have a list of great stuff we can add into the mix through stretch goals, for example, more hideout options, more vehicle options, more equipment options, more in-game powers. Additional money we raise will go straight into the game to add new levels, NPCs, and the development of apps that add depth to the game experience. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We clearly believe in the heroic nature of people and the power of the Internet. We understand that everyone can't contribute money, but if you'd love to see us succeed you can help us by spreading the word of the forming of the Cyberhero League to friends far and wide.

The world needs heroes, and cyberheroes are the newest kind! Use the Indiegogo share tools to make sharing easy! THANK YOU.

 

* MORE ABOUT THE CYBERHERO:

Cyberheroes have characteristics of heroes and superheroes. They are like heroes because their actions help people in the real world. They are like superheroes because the Internet gives them "superpowers" like shape-shifting, speed, and bi-location. For cyberheroes, taking action against cyberbullying is like warming-up before working out. After they've taken action against cyberbullying, they go on to tackle global challenges like poverty, climate change, diseases, loss of habitat, and protecting endangered species.

The world needs heroes, and cyberheroes are the newest kind! Use the Indiegogo share tools to make sharing easy! THANK YOU.
 
* MORE ABOUT THE CYBERHERO:
Cyberheroes have characteristics of heroes and superheroes. They are like heroes because their actions help people in the real world. They are like superheroes because the Internet gives them "superpowers" like shape-shifting, speed, and bi-location. For cyberheroes, taking action against cyberbullying is like warming-up before working out. After they've taken action against cyberbullying, they go on to tackle global challenges like poverty, climate change, diseases, loss of habitat, and protecting endangered species.

story:
Who are we and what do we do?

By we I mostly mean me, Petter Ljungqvist, although I am getting some help.
 
I've decided to make a game that I would have liked to play myself, had it only existed. I've set out to combine old-school graphics with an - hopefully - engaging plot, and some clever puzzles.
 
As I said, this is mostly a solitary endeavour, but not entirely. Music is being made by a certain Nellie Neely, and my life partner Helena is supporting me spiritually, and she's also the model in the recordings I make for the rotoscope animations. The rest is made by yours truly, with plenty of help from the ever so helpful AGS community.

What We Need & What You Get

Basically what we need money for is proper voice acting. Nothing can ruin a game like a bunch of amateurs who believe they can do voices, so I'm going to consult someone who's at least semi-professional in the field, and for this I need a starting sum.

If you like old-fashioned Point-N-Click adventure games - and frankly, who doesn't - then help us realize this project, so that it can see the light of day before the end of 2013.

First tell me some more about this "game" of yours

Fair enough. The Samaritan Paradox is set in Sweden in the 80's. Ord Salamon has agreed to help Sara Bergwall find the book her father, Jonatan Bergwall, wrote before he died. During the course of this treasure hunt, he learns that Jonatan was investigating the weapons industry, and more specifically some covert affairs with foreign dictatorships.

But more questions arise. What is the book about, and why does Sara want Ord to find it for her? Did her Alzheimer's-stricken mother know the secret before she grew too demented to share it? And how did Jonatan actually die?

The progress

As you can see in the video trailer, we're well into the progress. Rest assured that this game will be released at some point, regardless of your support. Fundings will only make it even better!

This means that claiming a perk should be regarded first and foremost as a pre-order; you'll be guaranteed to obtain the game before normal buyers.

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
So check it out… I’ll bring the roll of quarters, all I ask is for you to make a donation in support of children and families suffering from cancer. 

Basically, I want to throw one of the coolest video game events in the history of mankind, possibly even dating back to the time of the dinosaurs.

LET'S MAKE A DEAL!

Raise $375,000 for charity and children with cancer and I'll host the event on October 26th in San Francisco.


It is that easy…and you and a friend can WIN BIG.

GET AN ENTRY TO THE SWEEPSTAKES JUST FOR SHARING

 CLICK HERE TO GET 1 ENTRY FOR SHARING 


WHAT I NEED YOU TO DO.

Select a perk and donate now for a chance to play video games with me, Will Ferrell, in beautiful downtown San Francisco (not San Diego, but stay classy!)



Our 2 hour gaming extravaganza will be live broadcast on Twitch for the world to watch, allowing everybody to watch in awe as I, Will Ferrell, show off my gaming skills and crack jokes with fellow top gamers and surprise guests!


TRUST ME. YOU WANT TO WIN THIS!

Basically, the 1 lucky grand prize winner should expect a bunch of jealous friends, new followers & tons of haters all over the inter-web wishing they were you....oooh yeahhh!!!

GRAND PRIZE: An all-expenses paid trip for 2 to San Francisco - includes round-trip airfare + 2 nights in a hotel (see fine print at bottom for details).

The lucky grand prize winner will receive:

  • VIP visit to Twitch's offices in downtown San Francisco (the super secret filming location for the event)
  • Play video games with me.....live broadcasted on Twitch
  • Hang out with other special guests including top pro gamers & charity sponsors
  • All kinds of cool swag including event t-shirts, my all new sunblock for gamers, and much more. 
  • Some photographs with me (to prove it really happened)

If we meet our goal, 1 lucky grand prize winner will be selected at random from all entries into the sweepstakes.


DONATE TO FIGHT CANCER, GET REWARDED!

Click the reward below to donate to charity and receive the reward.


































* Reward Appearances Not Final, some images simulated


VIDEO GAMES CAN HELP?

Alright, enough about the prizes and fun stuff. Prepare  to get your MIND BLOWN.

Yeah, video games aren't just fun for late night binge sessions or weekend tourneys with your gamer clan...games are also used as a form of therapy and help patients significantly during their treatment.



In fact, games have been created with the specific purpose of helping cancer patients battle the disease. Crazy, huh? 


WHY $375,000? THINK ABOUT THIS...

OK OK, you might now be asking what $375,000 means to Cancer for College and DonateGames.org? What will they do with this funding?

Think about this: Cancer for College receives hundreds of applications from cancer survivors each year. The charity is only able to grant scholarships to less than 10% of total applicants, meaning there are SO many cancer survivors left unsupported and unable to make their college dreams come true.

What $375,000 equates to on Cancer for College terms are the funds to allocate two full years of scholarships at our current rate of giving.  

That's upward of 150 new scholarships for cancer survivors.  


WHERE THE MONEY GOES.

Here are the general facts about how your donations will be used:

  • We're here to help kids with cancer and survivors. 
  • Proceeds will be directed to nonprofits Cancer for College and DonateGames.org
  • Funds raised will be used to fund college scholarships for cancer survivors & provide direct financial support to families with children battling cancer 

About Cancer For College: Cancer for College provides hope and inspiration to cancer survivors by granting college scholarships.  Since inception, the charity has granted nearly $2 million in scholarships to more than 1,000 survivors from around the country. Visit www.cancerforcollege.org to learn more.

About DonateGames.org: DonateGames is a charitable organization that leverages video games, technology and innovation to help children and families suffering from cancer. A trusted nonprofit in the video game industry, DonateGames unites a philanthropic purpose with technology, providing gamers with a vehicle to change the world for children with cancer. Learn more at www.donategames.org.


WHY WE ARE HERE AND WHY WE CARE.

With all sincerity, the people in the pictures below are the heroes and why I'm involved with this charitable event....they are the ones who inspire me, and the reason we're all here today!

These are kids battling cancer or survivors who we have helped go to college through our charity, Cancer for College.

A family will use every last resource to return a child to health often leaving nothing for things such as a college education.


SWEEPSTAKES OFFICIAL RULES

NO PURCHASE OR CONTRIBUTION NECESSARY TO ENTER OR WIN. 

Void where prohibited or restricted by law. Sweepstakes is offered only in the (50) U.S. to legal residents of the U.S. who are currently physically residing in the U.S., and are 13 years of age or older at time of entry. Ends 11:59 p.m. PT on 10/12/14. To enter without making a contribution, print out the Entry Form (or piece of white paper) and follow the instructions (see Rules section 3(ii)). Mail-in requests must be postmarked no later than 10/13/14, and received no later than 6:00 pm PT on 10/17/14. If donors wish to contribute but do not wish to be entered, they can click the ‘Contribute’ button and enter a user-defined donation amount thereby opting-out from receiving a perk and entering the sweepstakes. Limit (5) entries total, per person, regardless of overall Contribution amount (if applicable), or method of entry. Odds of winning depend on the number of eligible entries received. Subject to complete Official Rules.

story:
The Interactive Museum of Gaming and Puzzlery - Annual Campaign



Who we are and what this is

My name is Kyle Engen. I am a Steward at the Interactive Museum of Gaming and Puzzlery (IMOGAP). My wife, Carol Mathewson, and I had the idea for IMOGAP in 2009 when we learned that while there are some great museums for toys, major league sports, and video games, there was no museum in the United States focused on Board Games. From our formation, to our current public facility in the Portland Metropolitan area, we have celebrated the aesthetic, historic, and functional beauty of games, puzzles and their components. 

Please help us make the world a more playful place by supporting this annual campaign. 


Why it's good

We spend every day preserving great games for the future, and sharing those games with the public. That’s our job and we love doing it. But we can’t do it alone. We need your help. We believe the exploration of ideas that are modeled by games and puzzles can produce common ground, encourage creativity, and enhance learning. That's why we are asking you to support IMOGAP's mission by contributing to our campaign.


How much and for what?

We are asking for $20,000. This will supplement our income from visitors, foundations, and sponsors to maintain operations during the year. We spend this money on exciting things like rent, utilities, office supplies and insurance. Having a good foundation for these mundane costs means that we can focus our attention on other opportunities for growth. Grant opportunities will be improved by having matching funds to bring to the table, and partnership programs (with schools, regional museums, hobbyists, and more) can receive more attention when IMOGAP's basic needs are met.

If we exceed that goal, and reach our stretch goal of $35,000 we will not only be able to expand our offerings and grow the collection, but we'll be able to complete our History of Games poster. This poster, based on an earlier work by Carol Mathewson called 'Structured Play' will feature more than a hundred games over the last 5 thousand years in full color. 

With your help:

  1. We can share great games with visitors, expand our collection, and continue to preserve board games for future generations. 

  2. We will be able to reach more communities of gaming enthusiasts throughout the world, on the web, and here in the Pacific Northwest .

  3. We will be able to digitize the collection so that web users, and others who can’t easily come to Portland, can see all of the games in the collection.

  4. We can develop research, partnerships, and new ideas, like our History of Games Poster, or our Young Game Designers Program.
If we receive donations that exceed our stretch goal, we will be able to offer new programs, expand our hours, upgrade our facilities, and accelerate the growth of our collection as well. 
In the case that we receive massive donations that push us over a million dollars, we will be able to form a Museum Foundation that will manage resources to keep IMOGAP sustainable into the foreseeable future. Now that's a stretch goal!


What's in it for you?

We have several perks available to folk who donate to our cause. For donations over $40 you can receive our gamesheet pads. They are a handy size and form for all kinds of note making and design with graph sheets, hex sheets, and score sheets. Donors above $60 can receive our neat foam puzzle cube, a rare novelty that shows good taste. Above $80 can receive our custom stamped mini-discs: A small plastic frisbee suitable for display, catch, or marking your lie on the disc golf course. Donors of $100 will receive a commemorative plaque and acknowledgement on our annual donors game board. 
Most of all, your support allows IMOGAP to continue it's mission to preserve and share the many games and puzzles of the present era, and the past, for all people.


How else you can help

Donating to this campaign is one of the best ways to help IMOGAP grow, but there are a lot of other things that can contribute:

  • Donate games: There are a lot of great games we haven't got in the collection yet, and even games we do have are valuable for play copies, for reference on versioning, and for sharing. Our street address is below.
  • Volunteer: If you are nearby in the Portland Metropolitan Area we can always use a helping hand. Come play games with guests, or help document the archives, or spread the word.
  • Share: Even small things can make a big difference, so please 'Like' us on Facebook and YouTube, and most of all, please Share this campaign with people you know who enjoy games. You can let people know by email, or text, or a phone call, or a tap on the shoulder!

Thank You

So many people have helped us with this campaign, that we can't list them all, but here's a bunch of them that appeared in our video:
  • Jill, Kerstin, and Robin
  • John, Josh, and Tyler
  • Kat and Sara
  • Ben and Nell
  • Mary, Matthew, Sheila and Scott
  • Tobin, Sam, and Margie
  • Nefertari and Mulufuf
  • Xerxes
  • Matt, and Zayne

story:
Mercenary Games, FleetCOMM Phase 2

You've probably heard of us from our previous Kickstarter project.

The good news; we survived. Kickstarter was an environment where allegedly 1/4 projects die, where small projects are surrounded by a firewall of celebrity projects, and even projects attempting not-so-covert plagiarism (those tend to sour the whole mood, and everyone around them). Yet we still survived.

The bad news; we didn't get the kind of media coverage we needed. Thanks to a few honest journalists, we were able to get the word out, even as far as France. However, folks on the web were far more focused on the Kickstarter buzzfeed of controversy and celebrity, lots of gamers missed out on FleetCOMM. So, we're extending our campaign, reaching out to calmer shores here on IndieGogo.

 

The Roster

  • Google Translate, Voice Actress.
  • Andy Lucas, Dungeon Master, Level Designer.
  • Ben Canant, Video and Media Editor.
  • Alan Richardson, Graphics Programmer.
  • "Spider", Enemy Concept, Graphics Artist.
  • Jason Smidt, Art Director, Particle Effects.
  • Slade Villena, Engine Programmer, Producer.

 

The Continuing Mission

We have enough funds to deliver this project on the PC, thanks to Kickstarter. We want to expand our operations, our schedule, and deliver this game on iOS. The following list is a breakdown of everything our crew needs for developing this game on iOS (during Fall 2012);

  • At least 4 months of full time development, after August 15, 2012.
  • iOS devices and workstations for as many crew members as possible. Currently, we have a gear loadout for only 1 crew member.
  • A team license for the iOS developer program.
  • Room and Board, for all our crew members. 
 

The Game

FleetCOMM : Operation Vigrior is an open world strategy game. Players will be thrust into one section of the galaxy, running missions, combat scenarios, reconnaissance and saving human colonies.

Fleet Command and Control. Players will be given a fleet ansible. This tool is capable of creating, saving and executing complex combat maneuvers. The player can execute their own designs with one trigger. This tool eliminates the need to ramp up a players interface skill, while giving the player visual feedback in a real time combat environment. Players can focus on strategy and maneuvers, instead of clicking speed.  

CORE GAME MECHANICS

(2D) OPEN WORLD. Players will operate in one sector of the galaxy, Vigrior. They will be given an entire campaign, in an open (quite possibly, endless) map, with unique story driven missions. Players can do any mission, any time, in any area they reach.

RTS/RTT STANDARD ELEMENTS. We aren't reinventing the wheel on this game, though we are making some small modifications. No more build orders, no structural dependencies, no resource gathering. Map controls and unit controls are about the same, except you will have the capacity for a dynamic range of maneuvers.

COOPERATIVE GAMING. Players will be able to use their local network, or the planetary network, and run up to 4 player games.

HORDE ENEMY A.I. Players will encounter enemies that operate as swarms, each enemy also having unique abilities. Players will often be outnumbered, however, in the scope of maneuver warfare, numbers don't account for victory. In an open world map, the enemy can come from anywhere, and nowhere.

RECON MISSIONS. Ever seen an RTS / RTT game have fun side quests? You'll get locked areas where you will guide a fleet on a fixed flight path. Your task will be to survive, evade, and cloak.


MISSION AND MANEUVERING DATA. Players will be able to save their current state in Vigrior (assuming they have cleared all combat encounters), as well as save their fleet maneuvering data. These files will be easy to mod, and share all over the web. Players will also be able to record their ansible transmissions to video files.

FLEET UPGRADES.  Players will be upgrading their fleets; adding new ships and increasing the rate of their ships maneuverability. They will also be able to deploy multiple fleets at once, if they have earned their stripes.

BOSS FLEETS.  We'll let you simmer on what that implies. We don't intend to create "boss characters" that are overdone. Instead, we will be creating unique enemy fleets, with very precise maneuvers. It is up to you to study how to defeat these Viral anomalies.

If you still want more details, feel free to visit our Kickstarter page.
story_txt:
Mercenary Games, FleetCOMM Phase 2
You've probably heard of us from our previous Kickstarter project.
The good news; we survived. Kickstarter was an environment where allegedly 1/4 projects die, where small projects are surrounded by a firewall of celebrity projects, and even projects attempting not-so-covert plagiarism (those tend to sour the whole mood, and everyone around them). Yet we still survived.The bad news; we didn't get the kind of media coverage we needed. Thanks to a few honest journalists, we were able to get the word out, even as far as France. However, folks on the web were far more focused on the Kickstarter buzzfeed of controversy and celebrity, lots of gamers missed out on FleetCOMM. So, we're extending our campaign, reaching out to calmer shores here on IndieGogo.
 
The Roster


Google Translate, Voice Actress.

Andy Lucas, Dungeon Master, Level Designer.

Ben Canant, Video and Media Editor.

Alan Richardson, Graphics Programmer.

"Spider", Enemy Concept, Graphics Artist.

Jason Smidt, Art Director, Particle Effects.

Slade Villena, Engine Programmer, Producer.



 
The Continuing Mission
We have enough funds to deliver this project on the PC, thanks to Kickstarter. We want to expand our operations, our schedule, and deliver this game on iOS. The following list is a breakdown of everything our crew needs for developing this game on iOS (during Fall 2012);

At least 4 months of full time development, after August 15, 2012.
iOS devices and workstations for as many crew members as possible. Currently, we have a gear loadout for only 1 crew member.
A team license for the iOS developer program.
Room and Board, for all our crew members. 

 
The Game


FleetCOMM : Operation Vigrior is an open world strategy game. Players will be thrust into one section of the galaxy, running missions, combat scenarios, reconnaissance and saving human colonies.
Fleet Command and Control. Players will be given a fleet ansible. This tool is capable of creating, saving and executing complex combat maneuvers. The player can execute their own designs with one trigger. This tool eliminates the need to ramp up a players interface skill, while giving the player visual feedback in a real time combat environment. Players can focus on strategy and maneuvers, instead of clicking speed.  

CORE GAME MECHANICS

(2D) OPEN WORLD. Players will operate in one sector of the galaxy, Vigrior. They will be given an entire campaign, in an open (quite possibly, endless) map, with unique story driven missions. Players can do any mission, any time, in any area they reach.RTS/RTT STANDARD ELEMENTS. We aren't reinventing the wheel on this game, though we are making some small modifications. No more build orders, no structural dependencies, no resource gathering. Map controls and unit controls are about the same, except you will have the capacity for a dynamic range of maneuvers.

COOPERATIVE GAMING. Players will be able to use their local network, or the planetary network, and run up to 4 player games.

HORDE ENEMY A.I. Players will encounter enemies that operate as swarms, each enemy also having unique abilities. Players will often be outnumbered, however, in the scope of maneuver warfare, numbers don't account for victory. In an open world map, the enemy can come from anywhere, and nowhere.

RECON MISSIONS. Ever seen an RTS / RTT game have fun side quests? You'll get locked areas where you will guide a fleet on a fixed flight path. Your task will be to survive, evade, and cloak.


MISSION AND MANEUVERING DATA. Players will be able to save their current state in Vigrior (assuming they have cleared all combat encounters), as well as save their fleet maneuvering data. These files will be easy to mod, and share all over the web. Players will also be able to record their ansible transmissions to video files.
FLEET UPGRADES.  Players will be upgrading their fleets; adding new ships and increasing the rate of their ships maneuverability. They will also be able to deploy multiple fleets at once, if they have earned their stripes.

BOSS FLEETS.  We'll let you simmer on what that implies. We don't intend to create "boss characters" that are overdone. Instead, we will be creating unique enemy fleets, with very precise maneuvers. It is up to you to study how to defeat these Viral anomalies.
If you still want more details, feel free to visit our Kickstarter page.

story:
Who we are and what we do?

Hi everyone, my name is Peter, and I think the best way to introduce ourselves is to show you the teaser of our game:

Strike Zombies Teaser 

I'm the founder of our small, but ambitious team from Hungary called: Sharpbyte. As of now, the team has 3 members (plus a few freelancers help us out occasionally), working on the same thing; we want to create our first own commercial videogame: Strike Zombies. (Which is actually going to be available for free, so commercial rather refers to the quality of the final product this time ...)

We have already made significant progress, but as we are edging closer to actually finishing the game, it is also getting a lot harder because of mostly two reasons:

  • Simply put: we don't have the proper tools for the job - (We'll get back to that...)

  • Microfunding for small startups is pretty much non-existent around here, leading to a loss of talent, forcing young guys to work in areas they're not even good at... WE WANT TO CHANGE THAT! 

That's the main reason why we turned to crowdfunding... 

We would like to make our products, our work as affordable and accessible to most everybody as possible, so we decided to publish our first game – Strike Zombies – for free, but in order to do that, we are going to need some help from you guys. Via crowdfunding, people can:

  • influence the market directly, by a vote of confidence, coming from their wallets, thus deciding what’s worth creating and what’s not,
  • help providers like us give back more, special bonuses, perks, benefits, an extra „bang for their buck”,
  • lower our costs of marketing by being active in social media, allowing us to use these spared funds to enhance our product greatly,
  • (most importantly in my opinion...) give startups enough funding to get proper tools! There are so many talented youngsters out there, with great plans they’re unable to present, because of their ancient computers, phones, etc...

3000$ USD for software & hardware

Right now our team's fastest desktop PC is an old single-core P4 with 512 Mb RAM - 99% of the work you see here or at our website (facebook, youtube, twitter, etc...), was done on that particular machine. Believe me when I say: It's SLOOOOOOOOOOWWW! :) We could cut the time needed to finish the game in half (at least), and still increase the quality of the game in the meantime.

As you may have guessed, we don't have better equipment on other fronts either, I'm actually still using a "dumbphone" for example, which makes life kinda hard for an Android developer... :)

So we need your help!

Licencing useful software - like the Adobe CS package or a sequencer like FL Studio - would also decrease the development time by a lot! So you are basically buying us time with your contribution!

About the game itself:

Almost 2 years ago, I was thinking about a simple control method concept, something I haven’t seen in a game before.  The basic idea was that I drew 2 diagonal lines on a smartphone’s screen with my finger, and then a completely vertical line shot out from the intersection of the diagonal lines, hitting (or missing) the target below... I knew I could use this for controlling a targetting system, a defense mechanism for something that shoots from either up or down. It seemed to me that the perfect system to test if it produces a fun gameplay, was a lightning generator.

From here it was kinda straightforfard, that it’s going to be an action/tower defense hybrid, and the coming waves of attackers just had to be zombies. (I mean, just think about it, a screaming, attacking zombie approaches you or someone you love, is really closing in a hurry... Then suddenly a lightning bolt just smashes the zombie, out of nowhere, with a huge bang of thunder, ripping it to pieces... Hmm, sounds like a fun game...) 

This concept has come a long way since then, and we decided to start giving you details, artwork,  screenshots, teasers, and - in a few days - a working prototype! We already have plenty to show, so hop along, and enjoy the ride as we present you: Strike Zombies!

The game will come to Windows & Android first, but we plan to port it to multiple platforms, like IOS for example. The full game will be completely free to download & play, although the free version will have a few ads in the menu section – no ads during gameplay though!!!

We already have a simplified, working prototype made with the Game Maker engine, using custom scripts, gfx and music, but we plan to put a few more features in it before we show this demo to you. Until then, check out our new teaser (at the top of the page)! (By the way, a few words about our ideas, about our work in the comments section can really light up our day - or give us new ideas -, so don't hold back! Thanks!)

There are going to be very frequent updates, so check back often!

I also encourage you to follow our social media related portals on Facebook, Twitter and Youtube. Hopefully you’ll find plenty of stuff that makes you want to click on those „thumbs up” buttons, maybe even share something, and become a part of helping Sharpbyte live up to these great promises.

We have plenty of creative perks to thank you for your support!

Thank you for taking a look! Take care!
