There are going to be very frequent updates, so check back often!

We have plenty of creative perks to thank you for your support!
Thank you for taking a look! Take care!

story:
Introduction

Hello! My name is Graeme and i'm looking to kickstart my own charity: Gaming for Parkinsons. To raise money for the victims and families that are affected by the disease. Parkinsons does not take lives directly but the symptoms do. People suffering from this disease will live with a lot of dicomfort until the very end.

I am one of the many who know someone that was taken by this highly treatable virus. My grandfather passed away in December 2013 at the age of 70 due to an infection that was accelerated and amplified by Parkinsons.

Sitting here in my room I asked myself the one simple question: "What can I do to help those in my situation?"

My solution is Gaming for Parkinsons.

How will we raise awareness?

To raise awareness, as the name suggests will be through gaming. We are looking to set up 12 - 24 hour streaming sessions in which the viewer has the option / ability to make small to large donations based on level of involvement. The streams will be an almost constant event but as most of us have other commitment like work and families ect. The channels will be divided and events will be broadcasted within those channels.

The games in which we will stream will differ depending on the streamer. But the games will be current and up to the highest of standards.

Twitch TV will be our main medium as this has the largest viewer base and easiest accessability.

How can you help and what does this kickstarter fund?

As the intro described - This is a kickstarter and not a charitable cause at this moment in time. The proceeds will aim towards starting the foundation of this charity in terms of equipment and other resources.

Commiting to this cause and donating will basically make all of our wishes come true and help us commit to this project. Possibly to the point where it can become a constant stream of dedicated players who are looking to raise money for this charitable cause.

We are 100% commited to this cause and aim to please all of our viewers with regular competitons - perks and promotions.

What is in it for you?

This is a charitible cause and all proceeds will be replicated where available to the charity. Your contributions will not be wasted on the foundations as we aim to increase this tenfold and put it back into the charity. At this point we are still in talk with corporate sponsors with the possibilty of merchanise which we will send to our most valued contributors (Design not available at this time).

What we will do is create our own website where all contributors will be added to the starred hall of fame. This will range from £5-10 donations. For those who maybe cannot donate as much, you will receive a massive hug from ourselves and a thank you for your help. You are awesome.

Game over.

From myself and everyone here at Gaming for Parkinsons we would like to extend our deepest thanks to those who do choose to donate to this cause and assist us with making this a reality. It's a huge ask and we do appreciate that a lot of people will turn their noses up at this campaign. All I can really do is plead for the help and support of all our friends here, there and everywhere.

Thanks for your time!

- Graeme and the Team at Gaming for Parkinsons.

story:
My friend Hunter recently lost his arm in a shark attack on his vacation to North Carolina.

http://abcnews.go.com/US/teen-shark-attack-victim-hunter-treschl-didnt-coming/story?id=31815794


Hunter is an awesome kid and a great friend! But he's also an avid gamer, and he says he wants to keep on living his life.


I want him to be able to keep on doing what he loves doing. One of those things that he loves doing is being a freaking awesome gamer! There are a lot of one-handed alternative gaming systems out there, but they tend to be pretty pricy!

http://www.benheck.com/controllers/

http://www.razerzone.com/gaming-mice/razer-naga

http://stinkyboard.com/stinkyboard/

http://www.oneswitch.org.uk/1/AGS/AGS-onehand.htm

Please help Hunter get back to his life after this devastating event!

story:
WHAT WE ARE ALL ABOUT:

Welcome, and thanks for checking out our Indiegogo campaign! You're probably asking yourself, "What is Project: Rhea anyway?" Well, in a nutshell, it is a new type of gaming concept. Think "cyberpunk meets a new world." A truly unique RPG/FPS MMO sandbox hybrid, the likes of which the world has never seen. At least we like to think so. We believe that most gamers have a list of favorite features from each game they play, but wish they all existed in the same game. Our own "favorites list" forms the basis for Project: Rhea, and will be added to and/or modified based on what you want. You will find a tentative feature list below.

WE WANT YOUR IDEAS:

A big part of the design process for this MMO will be the interaction and feedback from you, the potential player base, on what should go into the game. A special area will be set up on the Rhea forums: www.project-rhea.com/forum, where we will follow a collaborative process via discussions and polls between our team and all of you. We want to hear from you. Tell us what you like in an MMO. Tell us what you don't like. Describe the makings of the dream game you have always wished for. We need and welcome your input!

OUR CORE FEATURE FOCUS POINTS:

In creating this game, we are focusing our energies on a certain "core" list of concepts. Everything else will form around these:

- Open-ended, sandbox-style gameplay: giving players unprecedented freedom to forge their own path, while still possessing an engaging underlying storyline to drive things in the background.

"Sandbox" Video - Coming soon...

- Player-created content on a grand scale: The ability to construct just about anything you can imagine. This will be possible through an extensive and innovative crafting system, including recombination of raw materials, creation of components, researching/blueprinting, all fully physics-based, coupled with the ability to harvest almost any type of resource. Want to build a table, do it. Want to build a 6-wheel rover, do it. The possibilities are virtually endless.

"Player-Created Content" Video - Coming soon...

- Player-created settlements: Refer to the previous point regarding content. Create your own shelter. Gather a group of people/resources/skills, and upgrade to a town. Eventually upgrade to a fortress/city. Populate it with people's homes, shops, repair facilities, you name it. Build an army of drones to defend it. Etc...

"Building Your World" Video - Coming soon...

- Earned skills in lieu of traditional skill trees and automatic skill granting: Forget about going to an NPC who magically "grants" you the ability to do something. In Project Rhea, just go out and do it. The more you perform a skill, the better you will get at it.

"Earned Skills" Video - Coming soon...

- Hybrid mission system: Procedurally generated missions based on the current environment, economy, politics, and resource availability of a particular region. Gone are the days of "kill x number of giant spiders - receive a trinket". Also, there will be a system in place for players to generate missions. These missions will also take into account the current stats of the player creating them and can be for any number of purposes. Some examples are job requisitions, paid construction, crafting, defense, paid mercenary, etc...

"Missions" Video: http://youtu.be/IKRX7g7KRME

- Advanced NPC/mob AI: Things like working as a group, roaming, tactical maneuvers, learning about players actions, inter-NPC communication, etc...

"AI" Video - Coming soon...

- A fully dynamic, persistent, and regenerative world: Conservation of resources, which change form, grow, decompose into other materials, etc..., but do not just "disappear" from the world-state balance.

"The World of Project Rhea" Video: Coming soon...

- Multiple "planes" of simulation: Everything from underground, ground-level, oceans, atmosphere, and space travel will be simulated. In effect, the game will exist in a virtual solar system.

"Simulation In A Nutshell" Video: Coming soon...

- And much more...

Read on below if you are interested...

BACKSTORY:

It is the distant future, and mankind is at a crossroads. The situation is desperate. Global climate change has, over many hundreds of years, taken a terrible toll on the planet. Places which were once teeming with life, are now either perpetual deserts, or barren frozen wastelands. Several world-wars, depletion of natural resources, and over-population have made Earth a hostile, uninhabitable place. Our home is no longer fit to sustain us, and we must search out a new place to live. "Per aspera, ad astra", through hardships to the stars.

(note: the images below are just concept art, and do not necessarily reflect anything that will be in the actual game)

Fortunately for us, the world's continually declining condition and eventual plight was forecasted by visionary individuals from the scientific community two centuries ago. At that time, plans were put into motion to save us all from our inevitable future fate.

The governments of several world powers formed a top-secret collaborative alliance, and initiated work on the ultimate global survival contingency plan, code-named: "PROJECT: Rhea".
Rhea's ultimate goal is to ensure the survival of the human race after the Earth is no longer capable of sustaining life as we know it.

The three main tenants of Rhea are:

1. Provide for long-term travel through inter-stellar space for large numbers of people.

 2. Develop technologies which will enable personal survival on other planets.

 3. Create tools and infrastructure to promote the creation and the sustainment of new civilizations on other planets.

As time progressed, several gigantic starships, called "Arks" were built in space-docks orbiting Earth.

Each ark is fully automated and self-maintaining, with all human passengers and crew in hyper-extended cryogenic suspended animation. Pointed at a destination star system, they travel at FTL (faster than light) speed.

Upon nearing their destination, the ships begin to revive their crew, who then conduct an exploratory mission to search for a habitable planet. If unsuccessful, the ship is put back into automatic control and the crew to "sleep" until the next system is reached.

IN-GAME STARTING POINT:

The arks eventually reach the Epsilon Eridani star system, a long studied location thought to harbor planets capable of sustaining life. A thorough off-world scan reveals that this is true.

It is discovered that during the journey, several of the arks were lost, with the cause being largely unknown. There are some fragmented clues recorded by the computers of the remaining arks, but nothing as yet conclusive.

The satellite known as Epsilon Eridani B, now renamed Rhea Prime, is selected as the first planet to attempt habitation.

The orders to start the disembark are issued, and the first group of passengers are given the green light to head to the surface. Each new Rhean, is given a personal shuttle to get them to the surface of the planet, stocked with the tools to enable them to survive in the new frontier they will find themselves in upon landing.

Once you step onto the planet, you are on your own. You must build your destiny in the new world. Forge alliances, wage wars, build great things, make a living constructing valuable tools, become a real-estate mogul, become a solitary rogue, take up politics, build a band of space bandits and wander the star system. Not even the sky is the limit!

SOME MORE ON FEATURES:

- Each individual has at their disposal (among other things that are TBA):
    - A personal shuttle, capable of spaceflight between the arks and the planet(s). Also can serve as a shelter until one is built.
    - Many tools/technologies meant to aid in survival
    - Universal computer/communication device
- Extensive resource-gathering abilities. (Mining, foresting, etc...)
- Extensive trade-skill abilities. (Metal/wood-working, masonry, carpentry, various technological trades, etc...)
- Unique physics-based system which supports construction of arbitrary objects from other objects, and creating components of said objects from raw materials gathered from the environment.
- Freedom to explore and lack of classical story-arc driven gameplay.
- Open-ended, sandbox gameplay.
- No concrete "traditional" skill trees. Do something to get better at it, instead of learning "canned" abilities.

PHYSICAL WORLD SPECIFICS:

- Procedurally generated, dynamic world.
- Multi-level physical environment modeling. (Space, atmosphere, land, sea, underground, etc...)
- Persistent physical processes that shape the environment on a continual basis.
- Fabric of the "world" consists of a grand hierarchy. Higher-order elements built from collections of lower-order elements, according to global rules.
- Conservation of resources. Physical elements do not just disappear, but rather decompose into lower-level components.
- No "zoning" boundaries or loading screens. Use of "simulation hand-off" to offer seamless transition between game zones/servers.

WHERE THE FUNDING WILL GO:

- Tools: hardware and software needed for development and testing.

- People: devs, artists, riggers, admins, testers, etc... like to get paid for their work.

- Assets: art, 3D models, sound, music, etc...

- Infrastructure: servers, among other things.

- Marketing/publicity: we need to get our name out there into the wide world.

OUR QUALIFICATIONS:

We are a small team of talented and experienced developers who collectively have the skills to make an MMO such as what we propose, a reality. That being said, we are actively working to grow the team a bit, in order to ensure the best possibly experience for our user base.

THANK YOU IN ADVANCE!

If you have any questions, please ask. We'd love to here from you.
story_txt:
WHAT WE ARE ALL ABOUT:
Welcome, and thanks for checking out our Indiegogo campaign! You're probably asking yourself, "What is Project: Rhea anyway?" Well, in a nutshell, it is a new type of gaming concept. Think "cyberpunk meets a new world." A truly unique RPG/FPS MMO sandbox hybrid, the likes of which the world has never seen. At least we like to think so. We believe that most gamers have a list of favorite features from each game they play, but wish they all existed in the same game. Our own "favorites list" forms the basis for Project: Rhea, and will be added to and/or modified based on what you want. You will find a tentative feature list below.
WE WANT YOUR IDEAS:
A big part of the design process for this MMO will be the interaction and feedback from you, the potential player base, on what should go into the game. A special area will be set up on the Rhea forums: www.project-rhea.com/forum, where we will follow a collaborative process via discussions and polls between our team and all of you. We want to hear from you. Tell us what you like in an MMO. Tell us what you don't like. Describe the makings of the dream game you have always wished for. We need and welcome your input!
OUR CORE FEATURE FOCUS POINTS:
In creating this game, we are focusing our energies on a certain "core" list of concepts. Everything else will form around these:
- Open-ended, sandbox-style gameplay: giving players unprecedented freedom to forge their own path, while still possessing an engaging underlying storyline to drive things in the background.
"Sandbox" Video - Coming soon...
- Player-created content on a grand scale: The ability to construct just about anything you can imagine. This will be possible through an extensive and innovative crafting system, including recombination of raw materials, creation of components, researching/blueprinting, all fully physics-based, coupled with the ability to harvest almost any type of resource. Want to build a table, do it. Want to build a 6-wheel rover, do it. The possibilities are virtually endless.
"Player-Created Content" Video - Coming soon...
- Player-created settlements: Refer to the previous point regarding content. Create your own shelter. Gather a group of people/resources/skills, and upgrade to a town. Eventually upgrade to a fortress/city. Populate it with people's homes, shops, repair facilities, you name it. Build an army of drones to defend it. Etc...
"Building Your World" Video - Coming soon...
- Earned skills in lieu of traditional skill trees and automatic skill granting: Forget about going to an NPC who magically "grants" you the ability to do something. In Project Rhea, just go out and do it. The more you perform a skill, the better you will get at it.
"Earned Skills" Video - Coming soon...
- Hybrid mission system: Procedurally generated missions based on the current environment, economy, politics, and resource availability of a particular region. Gone are the days of "kill x number of giant spiders - receive a trinket". Also, there will be a system in place for players to generate missions. These missions will also take into account the current stats of the player creating them and can be for any number of purposes. Some examples are job requisitions, paid construction, crafting, defense, paid mercenary, etc...
"Missions" Video: http://youtu.be/IKRX7g7KRME
- Advanced NPC/mob AI: Things like working as a group, roaming, tactical maneuvers, learning about players actions, inter-NPC communication, etc...
"AI" Video - Coming soon...
- A fully dynamic, persistent, and regenerative world: Conservation of resources, which change form, grow, decompose into other materials, etc..., but do not just "disappear" from the world-state balance.
"The World of Project Rhea" Video: Coming soon...
- Multiple "planes" of simulation: Everything from underground, ground-level, oceans, atmosphere, and space travel will be simulated. In effect, the game will exist in a virtual solar system.
"Simulation In A Nutshell" Video: Coming soon...
- And much more...
Read on below if you are interested...
BACKSTORY:
It is the distant future, and mankind is at a crossroads. The situation is desperate. Global climate change has, over many hundreds of years, taken a terrible toll on the planet. Places which were once teeming with life, are now either perpetual deserts, or barren frozen wastelands. Several world-wars, depletion of natural resources, and over-population have made Earth a hostile, uninhabitable place. Our home is no longer fit to sustain us, and we must search out a new place to live. "Per aspera, ad astra", through hardships to the stars.
(note: the images below are just concept art, and do not necessarily reflect anything that will be in the actual game)

Fortunately for us, the world's continually declining condition and eventual plight was forecasted by visionary individuals from the scientific community two centuries ago. At that time, plans were put into motion to save us all from our inevitable future fate.

The governments of several world powers formed a top-secret collaborative alliance, and initiated work on the ultimate global survival contingency plan, code-named: "PROJECT: Rhea".Rhea's ultimate goal is to ensure the survival of the human race after the Earth is no longer capable of sustaining life as we know it.
The three main tenants of Rhea are:
1. Provide for long-term travel through inter-stellar space for large numbers of people.
 2. Develop technologies which will enable personal survival on other planets.
 3. Create tools and infrastructure to promote the creation and the sustainment of new civilizations on other planets.

As time progressed, several gigantic starships, called "Arks" were built in space-docks orbiting Earth.
Each ark is fully automated and self-maintaining, with all human passengers and crew in hyper-extended cryogenic suspended animation. Pointed at a destination star system, they travel at FTL (faster than light) speed.

Upon nearing their destination, the ships begin to revive their crew, who then conduct an exploratory mission to search for a habitable planet. If unsuccessful, the ship is put back into automatic control and the crew to "sleep" until the next system is reached.

IN-GAME STARTING POINT:
The arks eventually reach the Epsilon Eridani star system, a long studied location thought to harbor planets capable of sustaining life. A thorough off-world scan reveals that this is true.
It is discovered that during the journey, several of the arks were lost, with the cause being largely unknown. There are some fragmented clues recorded by the computers of the remaining arks, but nothing as yet conclusive.
The satellite known as Epsilon Eridani B, now renamed Rhea Prime, is selected as the first planet to attempt habitation.

The orders to start the disembark are issued, and the first group of passengers are given the green light to head to the surface. Each new Rhean, is given a personal shuttle to get them to the surface of the planet, stocked with the tools to enable them to survive in the new frontier they will find themselves in upon landing.

Once you step onto the planet, you are on your own. You must build your destiny in the new world. Forge alliances, wage wars, build great things, make a living constructing valuable tools, become a real-estate mogul, become a solitary rogue, take up politics, build a band of space bandits and wander the star system. Not even the sky is the limit!
SOME MORE ON FEATURES:
- Each individual has at their disposal (among other things that are TBA):    - A personal shuttle, capable of spaceflight between the arks and the planet(s). Also can serve as a shelter until one is built.    - Many tools/technologies meant to aid in survival    - Universal computer/communication device- Extensive resource-gathering abilities. (Mining, foresting, etc...)- Extensive trade-skill abilities. (Metal/wood-working, masonry, carpentry, various technological trades, etc...)- Unique physics-based system which supports construction of arbitrary objects from other objects, and creating components of said objects from raw materials gathered from the environment.- Freedom to explore and lack of classical story-arc driven gameplay.- Open-ended, sandbox gameplay.- No concrete "traditional" skill trees. Do something to get better at it, instead of learning "canned" abilities.
PHYSICAL WORLD SPECIFICS:
- Procedurally generated, dynamic world.- Multi-level physical environment modeling. (Space, atmosphere, land, sea, underground, etc...)- Persistent physical processes that shape the environment on a continual basis.- Fabric of the "world" consists of a grand hierarchy. Higher-order elements built from collections of lower-order elements, according to global rules.- Conservation of resources. Physical elements do not just disappear, but rather decompose into lower-level components.- No "zoning" boundaries or loading screens. Use of "simulation hand-off" to offer seamless transition between game zones/servers.
WHERE THE FUNDING WILL GO:
- Tools: hardware and software needed for development and testing.
- People: devs, artists, riggers, admins, testers, etc... like to get paid for their work.
- Assets: art, 3D models, sound, music, etc...
- Infrastructure: servers, among other things.
- Marketing/publicity: we need to get our name out there into the wide world.
OUR QUALIFICATIONS:
We are a small team of talented and experienced developers who collectively have the skills to make an MMO such as what we propose, a reality. That being said, we are actively working to grow the team a bit, in order to ensure the best possibly experience for our user base.
THANK YOU IN ADVANCE!
If you have any questions, please ask. We'd love to here from you.

story:
About iPIN Debit- 2013

You can see our website at www.ipindebit.co.uk .  Some of the website is password protected so contact us if you would like the password.

Right now you can pay at a grocery story with debit card and PIN  and that is the only type of transaction where you are asked if you want cash back.  Merchants love same as cash transaction and we are now bringing debit card with PIN same as cash to the Internet.

iPIN Debit will  initially enable cash for online gambling venues and home lotteries.. iPIN will generate a % fee per transaction charged to the online gambling companies.   Our goal is to leverage our same as cash debit card with PIN technologyearly on in the world of online gaming and wagering in the 150 billion euro online gambling  market. We are a financial Tech company positioned at the early stages of extreme worldwide growth in the ICT industry.

iPIN Debit owns a 35 year old Swiss Trust that will open depository accounts for our online gambling clients and will acquire and settle the incoming debit card with PIN same as cash wagers. Currently Listed on the GXG First Quote.  Stock symbol: IPIN.  Only available for accredited investors.  www.gxgmarkets.co.uk

Your donations are important in helping us develop our iPIN.   The iPIN will enable mobile and lap top and desk top debit card with PIN same as cash transactions and will prevent your debit card from being seen or stored by the web merchants..

 

About the Staff

The majority of staff are investors. Right now, none of us are receiving salaries. We all are working 7 days a week to get this launched.

The CEO is Rick Walker who has over 20 years executive background in large corporate retail online venues such as Office Max.

The CMO is Jeff Atwood who has over 20 years in the industry. Jeff has worked on projects for TD Waterhouse, IBM, and Apple. Jeff was also a previous creative director for a Reuters company.

Our Technology Director is Jason Elliott who has 15 years in  IT development and server support.

We appreciate your help and please remember to SHARE with Friends!!

story:
Help us make sure Hurricane Sandy relief reaches those that need it most.


By making a gift to Disaster Accountability Project (DAP), you are empowering the nation's only independent watchdog of disaster relief and humanitarian aid to make sure responding agencies and organizations are doing their jobs and donations are used as intended.

After disasters, hundreds of organizations want your money to help survivors cope and recover. Billions of dollars change hands very quickly. And yet, there is no other organization to make sure organizations with critical, life-saving responsibilities are having maximum impact.
 
DAP will use your donation to improve oversight, monitor for gaps, investigate critical systems, and advocate for improvements in preparedness, response, relief and recovery.
 
Why give to us?

A donation to Disaster Accountability Project multiplies the impact of donations to other disaster relief organizations. DAP increases the transparency and effectiveness of disaster relief dollars and advocates for system improvements both in real-time and long-term. Independent oversight is necessary to ensure relief is actually working.

DAP improved the transparency of over 1.4 billion dollars urgently raised to save lives after the Haiti earthquake and found that half sat unspent after one year, as thousands were dying of cholera. DAP is making sure donations are used effectively and that survivors get the help they need.

Join our effort today to maximize the impact of the Hurricane Sandy response.

story:
Thank you all for supporting us! Stay tuned for updates!

 

What is (un)Lucky7?

If we were to describe it with the fewest words possible it would be a "horror, sci-fi themed, jRPG-view, story-driven, pixelart puzzle game" – read on if this intrigued or confused you, we will explain it in more detail.

 

(un)Lucky7 is a game about six prisoners sentenced for life and one android, who are sent into unknown regions of space in a ship powered by an experimental engine. They are promised freedom in exchange for exploring the unknown and testing this new method of transportation – indeed a chance of a lifetime, hence the name "Lucky 7".

 

This doesn't last long, though. Upon arriving on an alien planet they find an entrance to a strange base, seemingly lifeless and abandoned. Soon, they are trapped inside, forced to fight for their life and searching for a way back home.

 

You play as one of the crew members, a spaceship pilot by the name of Moro. In order to keep yourself and others alive you'll have no choice but to explore this hostile place, uncovering its history and solving its dark mysteries. All the while developing and maintaining different relations with the rest of the crew (many of which depend on your actions).

 

The game is inspired by titles like To the Moon, Corpse Party and Ao Oni, as well as classic point and click adventure games and sci-fi horror movies from the '80s and '90s. Thus, unsurprisingly, we want to focus on telling a great story with a lot of unexpected twists, unique characters and relations between them. And of course quite a few good scares.

 

This brings us to the horror aspect. It may seem hard to make a scary game in this visual style, but we strive to deliver you a quality scare by developing many elaborate ways to frighten you instead of simply concentrating on cheap jumpscares. We put emphasis on the soundtrack and sound design because together with a heavy atmosphere and a sense of danger it creates deep immersion.

 

As mentioned above, we believe music and sounds are one of the most important atmosphere-building factors in a horror game. That's why we decided to hire a professional composer to create our soundtrack. He goes by the name of "Fox Amoore" and you can hear a sample of his work in the trailer. If you want to check out more of his beautiful music you can visit his Facebook (https://www.facebook.com/FoxAmooreMusic) and SoundCloud (https://soundcloud.com/fox-amoore) accounts.

 

We also want you to feel the impact of your decisions and choices – that's why there are multiple possible endings divided into three categories:

1. true ends – for when you finished the game and got one of the main endings.

2. special ends – smaller bonus endings spread throughout the game.

3. dead ends – these mean you probably died. Oops.

Keep in mind, though, that the game doesn't judge whether you're "good" or "evil" and you will not be forced to behave like a knight in shinning armour in order to get a "good" ending.

 

When it comes to the puzzle aspect, jRPG-like puzzle games tend to concentrate purely on puzzle-box type of puzzles and dialogue choices. We thought that we would spice things up by adding more inventory puzzles, where you actually need to use the inventory item instead of just having it when it's needed. Don't worry, it won't be annoying to use because we provide a highlight system that marks the places you can examine and interact with. We're also adding special group puzzles, where you have to choose other crew members to help you based on their unique skills.

 

If we reach our goal on IndieGoGo we intend to use our own custom built engine. It supports Windows, Linux and Mac but is not yet finished. If we do not get enough funds, we will stay with the Windows-only rmvx engine to save time and money.

 

Who are we?

The core of our team is an "army of two" – one programmer and one artist. We're both from Poland and we have been into game development since high school. We always knew that the game industry is the only place we would ever want to work in and the only place where we can show our love for games by making them ourselves.

We met at university and together helped create some non-commercial game projects, strengthening the bond between us. Right after graduation we got jobs of lead programmer and lead artist in an Australian company. After working there for over two years we had decided that we want to do something more ambitious. With our combined experience and the help of other like-minded people we want to create a great game that's based on our own ideas.

 

Why Indiegogo?

Even with professional experience we still need to spend a large amount of our time to create the game. Without fund-rising, we'll have to create the game in our spare time, essentially working two shifts at once. This negatively impacts the rate at which we make progress on our project and may cause us to put the project on hold or lower its quality. We wish to deliver a high quality product, looking exactly the way we want it to look. For that we need enough funds to allow us to work full-time on the game.

 

Why do we need 46 000 euros?

We sat down and crunched the numbers. This is how much we need to make it all possible. It may seem excessive, but it includes a lot of expenses:

1. setting up a small company (small expenses needed to do it legally over here)

2. necessary software and hardware

3. paying Fox Amoore to compose high quality music specifically for us

4. buying a license for sound effects or getting someone to record them

5. paying a translator to check all our dialogue

6. salaries (unfortunately, we're not robots – we need to eat and pay our bills)

7. office expenses

 

What happens if we do not meet our goal?

We decided for a "keep-it-all" model because we want to finish the game no matter what. For example, if we get only 50% of our goal it will of course force us to cut corners and the game will end up much shorter than initially planned. If we get even less, then the development process will take a lot longer as we won't be able to work on the game full-time anymore.

 

What happens if we exceed our goal?

We will make the game longer by adding more puzzles, endings and unlockable bonus chapters that give better insight into some events from the game. The amount of CG artwork will be expanded and with enough donations we might even afford voice actors to record voice-overs for all the dialogues.

 

What are the rewards?

Everyone who contributes to our project will get not only the warm feeling inside their heart but also bonus rewards according to the "Perks" table visible on the right! Including the game itself which you get from tier two and above!

 

Is there any other way I can help?

Yes! In fact, there are two things you can do apart from donating!

1. Vote for our game on Steam Greenlight – http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=118625631. This will help us to release the game to a broader audience of players and create more games in the future! We can't stress enough how important it is for us to be greenlit. This is a big chance for indie game developers like ourselves! So please – if you like our project vote for it there! Even if you can't afford or don't want to donate anything on Indiegogo!

2. Spread the word – tell your friends, give them links to Indiegogo and Steam Greenlight projects, ask them to send those to their friends as well!

 

marvelous

story:
English version HERE !

Le projet :

ICE Project est un FPS coopératif en ligne orienté sandbox sur PC se situant dans un univers de science-fiction. Il propose aux joueurs divers mécanismes simples et innovants pour permettre une interaction sociale, compétitive et conviviale aux joueurs.

Jeune studio indépendant basé à Nice, Ve-Game est composé d'une équipe de 8 personnes
passionnées par le jeu vidéo. L'objectif est de lancer les pré-ventes du jeu en 2013 pour
permettre à la communauté de tester le jeu très tôt et de disposer d'un contenu évolutif.

Histoire :

Nous sommes en 2147. Sur Terre, un gouvernement mondial autoritaire règne sur les hommes, concentrés dans d'immenses mégapôles sous haute surveillance. Mais ces derniers mois, la situation a empiré, en effet un rapport de l'O.M.S déclare l'apparition d'un parasite végétal d'origine inconnue sur la planète bleue qui provoquerait des conséquences graves pour la santé.

Suite à une infection particulièrement violente, l'état d'urgence est déclaré et une corporation d'entreprises lance le projet ICE (Innovation Comfort Ethics) visant à concevoir et envoyer une flotte de vaisseaux pour coloniser une nouvelle planète viable et habitable.

Des places et même des vaisseaux entiers sont mis en vente à chaque personne ayant les moyens pour commencer une nouvelle vie loin de la Terre.

Séparé de vos proches et de vos biens en échange d'un ticket pour l'espace, fuyant une atmosphère inquiétante et dangereuse, c'est un nouveau départ pour vous. Dans ce vaisseau, en compagnie d'un groupe de personnes qui seront dorénavant vos compagnons de survie, vous allez devoir vous entraider pour apprivoiser ce nouvel environnement, survivre face à l'inconnu et faire prospérer votre colonie.

L'aspect sandbox :

Présentation :

Fraîchement débarqué sur cette planète luxuriante, livré à vous-même, vous allez devoir évoluer en groupe progressivement et essayer d'atteindre le but principal de l'aspect sandbox : construire la colonie la plus efficace possible pour survivre dans les meilleures conditions.

Une multitude d'outils sont mis entre les mains du joueur et de la colonie dans sa globalité pour vous permettre de réaliser cet objectif mais la voie pour y arriver ne dépend que de votre imagination et de votre créativité !

Serez-vous un explorateur partant braver les dangers du monde pour percer les secrets de la planète ? Un artisan décidé à aider ses compagnons en créant diverses armes et outils ? Un politicien voulant faire prospérer la ville par sa main ? Un économiste souhaitant imposer sa colonie comme productrice principale de minerais pour la planète entière ? Un architecte chargé de la construction des bâtiments ? Ou même un paria vivant à l'écart de la société pour évoluer seul ?

Tout ces rôles et bien d'autres sont possibles, vous êtes maître de votre destin et de celui de votre colonie, mais sachez que vous n'êtes pas seuls sur la planète et que vous êtes en lien direct avec les autres, la compétition peut être rude, quelle stratégie adopterez-vous pour le futur ? C'est à vous de décider...

Système de colonie :

Dans ICE Project, il existe deux sortes de colonies (représentant en réalité un serveur à part entière) qui oeuvrent pour l'expansion de leur territoire. Chaque serveur peut contenir un maximum de 50 personnes hormis les PNJ.

  • La première est une colonie "privée" pouvant être fondée par un joueur, une structure, une communauté, etc... Et qui vous appartient totalement, vous pouvez donc partir à l'aventure avec votre cercle d'amis ou même avec la communauté de votre forum préféré !

  • La seconde est une colonie "publique" fondée par la corporation ICE et qui permet à un joueur seul de prendre part à l'aventure avec des inconnus.

Frises de développement :

Avec ICE Project, nous avons mis en place un système de frises pour suivre l'évolution de la colonie et du joueur. Vos progressions personnelles et collectives sont donc répertoriées grâce à ces frises chronologiques qui permettent de développer de nouveaux attributs et talents.

Pour la colonie, il existe deux frises : "Politique" et "Technologique".

Quand au joueur, il dispose d'une seule frise : "Développement personnel".

Ces trois frises notent les choix et l'évolution dans le temps de la colonie et du joueur, elles permettent de développer des talents ainsi que de débloquer de nouveaux outils et options de développement.

L'aspect e-sport :

Présentation :

Nous avons un objectif ambitieux avec ICE Project, c'est de percer dans le domaine du sport électronique, également appelé e-sport. Pour cela, nous nous consacrons énormément à travailler sur du contenu compétitif qui puisse réunir un large public et ne pas se retrouver bloqué dans une sphère élitiste. Alors comment cet aspect s'articule-t-il ?

Au centre de chaque colonie, il y a une arène. Cette arène est accessible par tous et pour tous, il n'y a pas besoin d'accomplir quoi que ce soit pour y avoir accès. Les joueurs voulant se consacrer exclusivement à l'e-sport le peuvent, et les curieux n'étant pas forcément intéressés au premier abord peuvent tout de même venir facilement observer ce qu'il s'y passe.

Dans cette arène, des matchs courts à durée déterminée se déroulent et permettent de faire s'affronter deux équipes dans divers modes de jeu.

Modes de jeu :

Il y a plusieurs facettes qui permettent de satisfaire chaque type de joueurs : des modes fun et conviviaux pour s'entraîner et s'amuser et un seul mode de jeu taillé, équilibré et pensé pour l'e-sport qui permettra aux équipes ayant l'esprit de compétition de se mesurer à des adversaires à leur niveau.

Ce mode compétitif se déroulera comme suit : une carte de taille moyenne avec deux équipes de cinq personnes face à face et un objectif commun au centre.

Il faudra atteindre cet objectif avant l'équipe adverse et le défendre pour permettre l'apparition d'un drapeau au point de départ qu'il faudra aller chercher et ramener au centre.

Un mode simple mais efficace, avec les avantages suivants : il permet grâce à sa simplicité en surface et sa lisibilité de réunir un large public de spectateurs et de part sa complexité au niveau des mécaniques de gameplay d'attirer un éventail de joueurs intéressés par l'e-sport.

Rôles :

Chacun des cinq joueurs aura un rôle en particulier dans l'équipe : Attaquant/Défenseur/Runner (il peut donc y avoir plusieurs attaquants ou défenseurs par exemple) et chacun aura des outils pour atteindre l'objectif et empêcher l'équipe adverse d'y arriver avant eux.

Compétition :

Notre ambition étant de démocratiser cette discipline à un cercle plus large qu'il ne l'est actuellement, il nous semble obligatoire de proposer des outils pour les structures, partenaires et sponsors pouvant permettre un circuit professionnel ainsi qu'un réel show compétitif avec un mode spectateur à la hauteur, et c'est dans cette optique que nous travaillons à implémenter une véritable plateforme claire et accessible composée d'un modèle économique viable et intéressant pour chaque acteur de la scène du sport électronique.

 

Le financement participatif :

Notre studio étant en processus de création, nous avons naturellement débloqué une partie des fonds permettant le développement du jeu et de l'entreprise. Cependant, pour arriver à terme de ce projet, nous avons besoin de votre aide et c'est pour cela que nous faisons appel à vous aujourd'hui!

Grâce à vous, nous pourrons :

  • Nous doter d'une interface web claire et pratique pour communiquer sur notre jeu et mettre à disposition les outils nécessaires à l'interaction avec la communauté.
  • Louer des serveurs additionnels. 1000 €
  • Fournir à notre équipe des outils supplémentaires pour travailler dans les meilleures conditions (licences, softwares...) 2000 €
  • Mettre à disposition les goodies que nous vous proposons en contreparties. 1000 €
  • Récompenser notre compositeur musical à hauteur de son talent ! 1000 €

Les paliers :

L'objectif premier est de réunir la somme de 5000 €. Une fois ce premier palier franchi, nous pourrons lancer convenablement notre projet. Si nous atteignons d'autres paliers plus élevés, en plus de nos sincères remerciements, nous travaillerons à ajouter du contenu en conséquence. Voici les différents paliers :

  • 8000 € > Implémentation de plusieurs mécanismes supplémentaires dans le jeu dont un système qui permettra à chaque joueur de pouvoir personnaliser l'intérieur et l'extérieur de sa maison dans la colonie (housing).
  • 10.000 € > Organisation de tournois avec récompenses dès les phases d'alpha-test pour tester nos fonctionnalités.
  • 15.000 €  > Jeu entièrement doublé en français, voix de qualité pour tous les personnages.

Les packs :

Evidemment, votre soutien sera récompensé, le palier à 10 € vous donnant accès au jeu complet et à l'ensemble des phases de beta-test, vous pourrez également profiter de goodies de plus en plus intéressants en fonction de votre générosité !

Avec ICE Project, nous voulons vous impliquer réellement dans le suivi du jeu, c'est donc pour cela que nous allons proposer du contenu dans un délai assez court (2013) pour qu'il évolue avec vous rapidement et régulièrement. L'accès à la phase de beta-test vous accordera donc une place de choix en tant que joueur et testeur pour nous aider à améliorer le jeu ainsi que donner votre avis sur diverses implémentations lors du développement.

 

Vous n'êtes plus seulement spectateur mais bel et bien acteur !

L'équipe :

Ve-Game, avant d'être une entreprise, est avant tout une idée : celle de rassembler un maximum de compétences diverses et variées pour mettre en place des jeux innovants.

Nous avons donc réuni une équipe pour cela, qui sera amenée à s'agrandir au fil du temps :

  • 1 Community Manager (Louis Wyss), chargé d'animer la communauté, de répondre à vos questions, de faire tout simplement le lien entre vous et nous.
  • 1 Responsable de production (Jean-Baptiste Papin), chargé de définir et de contrôler nos objectifs qualitatifs. Il se chargera de la gestion et la mise en place de l'ensemble de nos phases de tests.
  • 1 Lead Artist 3D (Alexandre Ducreux), chargé de modéliser l'ensemble de l'univers en 3D et de rendre vivante cette planète avec des animations de qualité.
  • 2 Concept-Artists (Sylvie Hannedouche & Jeremy Monet), chargés de définir une identité graphique au projet et d'imaginer un monde crédible et vivant.
  • 1 Programmeur (Jose Manuel Martin), le mécano de l'équipe, chargé de s'assurer que tout fonctionne correctement.
  • 1 Compositeur/Sound-Designer (Vincent Govindin), qui doit faire en sorte de vous immerger dans ce monde avec de belles musiques et une ambiance sonore travaillée.
  • Et pour finir un Chef de projet (Elliott Duffard), moi même. Je dois faire en sorte de mener ce projet à son terme, de m'assurer que l'univers est respecté et les joueurs satisfaits.

Nous vous remercions de l'interêt porté à notre projet et nous espérons qu'il vous plaira autant qu'il nous plaît, si vous voulez nous contacter n'hésitez pas à poster un commentaire et nous nous ferons un plaisir de vous répondre.

Vous pouvez également envoyer un mail à l'adresse suivante : contact@ve-game.com

Rejoignez-nous sur :

  • Notre site : http://www.ve-game.com/
  • Facebook : http://www.facebook.com/pages/Ve-Game/153846438027767
  • Twitter : https://twitter.com/ve_game

 

Merci et à très bientôt !
story_txt:
English version HERE !
Le projet :
ICE Project est un FPS coopératif en ligne orienté sandbox sur PC se situant dans un univers de science-fiction. Il propose aux joueurs divers mécanismes simples et innovants pour permettre une interaction sociale, compétitive et conviviale aux joueurs.
Jeune studio indépendant basé à Nice, Ve-Game est composé d'une équipe de 8 personnespassionnées par le jeu vidéo. L'objectif est de lancer les pré-ventes du jeu en 2013 pourpermettre à la communauté de tester le jeu très tôt et de disposer d'un contenu évolutif.

Histoire :

Nous sommes en 2147. Sur Terre, un gouvernement mondial autoritaire règne sur les hommes, concentrés dans d'immenses mégapôles sous haute surveillance. Mais ces derniers mois, la situation a empiré, en effet un rapport de l'O.M.S déclare l'apparition d'un parasite végétal d'origine inconnue sur la planète bleue qui provoquerait des conséquences graves pour la santé.

story:
Short Summary

Connect the Pieces (CTP) to Prevent Prescription Drug Abuse is a campaign to promote prescription drug safety and awareness in our community.  Drug overdoses are now the number one cause of accidental death in the U.S., recently surpassing traffic fatalities.  Ninety (90) percent of these deaths are due to prescription drug use and misuse. Connect the Pieces empowers families to become a part of the solution to reducing deaths through education and changed behaviors.

Supportive Housing and Innovative Parnterships, Inc. (SHIP) and its soical venture Second Chance Building Materials Center created the Connect The Pieces campaign in a response to this growing epidemic.  Our goal is to develop a coordinated community response to deal with the epidemic of prescription drug abuse in partnership with prescribers, pharmacists, state and local government, law enforcement, family members, friends, schools, churches, businesses and other civic organizations. 

What We Need & What You Get

This year funds will be used to develop a prescription drug safety program for grades K-12, continue to educate parents and grandparents in our community and beyond regarding the deadly consequences of prescription drugs, and continue to provide locking medicine units.

As part of the educational program, we are planning to develop an android app game that educates children on the dangers of prescription drugs. We need funds to make this happen. 

For those who donate $100 or more will receive either one of our Connect The Pieces Lapel Pin, Connect the Pieces Black Polo Shirt or one of our Connect The Pieces Locking Medicine Cabinet.

The Impact

SHIP relies on the generosity of the members of our community to continue to create second chances for individuals in recovery from substance abuse.  The people we serve come from all walks of life. Many are veterans; many have become homeless; many have experienced the justice system. Your contribution can change lives, rebuild families and create awareness as to the rise of prescription drug abuse.

Other Ways You Can Help

For other ways you can help, please visit our website and take the Pledge to Prevent Prescription Drug Abuse at http://www.connectthepieces.org/connect-the-pieces-pledge. Let's join together to make a difference.

story:
This is a game. Not only that, but in this game, you are an alpaca. Your in a dark dungeon, and for some reason you really want to jump into a black whole and get ripped in half to be transferred to the next room. To get to this black whole though, you must avoid getting sawed to little bits, crunched in gears, shot with some strange spike thingy, killed by some face-less dude, or some other thing. The levels get progressively harder and you only have 25 lives to start with, once those are all gone poor you will have to start all over. Each time you die you lose about 1 life, and start the level over, don't worry, you CAN get extra lives. By the time I'm done with the game, actions you make on early levels, can open up opportunities in later levels. What happens at the end? Your gonna have to find that out on your won... mwa ha hah hah ha.


Who Am I? I am Nick, Not only do I make games, but I skateboard mountain-unicycle, I'm very skilled with knifes, I've been working on a scratch cocoa recipe for over 5 years, I can cook, I have 7 chickens (Alice, Mildred, forest, Lucy, Freya, Freasha, and Juanita), 2 dogs, 2 cats, I love running through forests, I take a lot of big hikes, I love snowboarding and water skiing, I can break dance, I can do lot of flips on a trampoline, and I play lots of instruments (Guitar, ocarina, piano, etc).
story_txt:
This is a game. Not only that, but in this game, you are an alpaca. Your in a dark dungeon, and for some reason you really want to jump into a black whole and get ripped in half to be transferred to the next room. To get to this black whole though, you must avoid getting sawed to little bits, crunched in gears, shot with some strange spike thingy, killed by some face-less dude, or some other thing. The levels get progressively harder and you only have 25 lives to start with, once those are all gone poor you will have to start all over. Each time you die you lose about 1 life, and start the level over, don't worry, you CAN get extra lives. By the time I'm done with the game, actions you make on early levels, can open up opportunities in later levels. What happens at the end? Your gonna have to find that out on your won... mwa ha hah hah ha.
Who Am I? I am Nick, Not only do I make games, but I skateboard mountain-unicycle, I'm very skilled with knifes, I've been working on a scratch cocoa recipe for over 5 years, I can cook, I have 7 chickens (Alice, Mildred, forest, Lucy, Freya, Freasha, and Juanita), 2 dogs, 2 cats, I love running through forests, I take a lot of big hikes, I love snowboarding and water skiing, I can break dance, I can do lot of flips on a trampoline, and I play lots of instruments (Guitar, ocarina, piano, etc).

story:
For RPG Fans Only!  

Thank you Everyone!!!

We have enough following with this campaign that we will continue to make Dragon Crush as a direct result of the great interest generated by indiegogo.

You can still contribute directly and we need your help at http://dragoncrush3d.com

Why should I contribute to a game like this?

Epic Story

In-game status galore!

Classic meets modern!

Bragging Rights!

Become a Legend!

Pre-order or Contribute today

http://www.sbwire.com/press-releases/dragon-crush-indiegogo-campaign-gains-momentum-with-free-download-484343.htm

A $25 contribution will have you shipped immediately a Collector's Edition Dragon Crush Exquisite Key-Scribe Shield (see below) and also will come with a beautiful antique copper chain and clasp.  Each shield has a secret code that will open up Collector Only features, items, and loot bonuses!

A fresh, new 3D Casual RPG game, Dragon Crush–Crush or Be Crushed, is under development and looks to appeal to a wide audience

A new innovative 3D casual RPG game that is currently in development aims to draw gamers into its world with fantastic graphics, cool characters and an amazing adventure. Dragon Crush RPG (role-playing game), is the fresh idea from programmer and avid gamer, Jim Pierce who said that true 3D RPG balanced gameplay is his passion.

Dragon Crush has depth, wit and charm. The storyline of the game takes place in a land called Zendom, which has been devastated by a powerful dragon. The beast has taken captive Princess Zenora, princess of Zendom. The player’s role is to defeat the dragon, save the princess and help restore Zendom back to glory.

According to Pierce, this new role-playing game is sure to appeal to the masses with its casual click or touch play with true 3D perspective, epic battle scenes and the game’s immersive casual RPG play. Gamers will also enjoy the freedom of interacting in either third- or first-person modes. Another matchless feature of Dragon Crush is gem crushing, a brilliant enhancing concept that is sure to impress even the most seasoned gamers.

The secret to any good RPG game is balance, said Pierce, who added that Dragon Crush leverages the culmination of years of game science to create balance within many dimensions of game play.

Until now, all of the support for the development of Dragon Crush has been self-funded, according to Pierce. He has recently launched a fundraising campaign on indiegogo.com. Pierce is looking for individuals who are interested in helping him bring this innovative new RPG game to market.

Currently, Pierce said that Dragon Crush is supported on Mac, Windows and on web browsers. He said he would like to bring it to mobile as well, specifically iOS, Android and Win8.

“We have more than a dozen experienced professionals now helping to make Dragon Crush come to life,” said Pierce.

Here is a glimpse into our new 3D world with Lush new Dragon Crush environments: (The pre-orders and contributions  we have received so far is allowing us to purchase wonderful assets for the game at a fraction of the normal production costs!  Please see below a list of all our carefully selected asset contributors!  Our Dragon Crush team is then integrating these wonderful environments, models, animations into our overall game play and fantastic adventure.  Please contribute and continue to let us expand our game inventories and core developers, artists, and designers.)

Dragon Crush Training Ground:

Dragon Crush features Casual click or touch play in true 3D perspective, while observing epic battles.  Gamers have the freedom to interact in 3D in third or first person modes; however, the immersive Casual RPG play will appeal to the masses.

The secret to any good RPG game is balance.  Dragon Crush leverages the culmination of hundreds of years of math and game science to create balance within many dimensions of game play.  More important than balance is equilibrium, which is the ability for an imbalance in the system to become balanced throughout the system.

Character development and team battle configuration strategy is an essential element of repeat game play.  Using Single Path Solution Theory, achievement levels are created with single or minimal (x) path solutions in which players seek the best strategy combination to win.

Balance of power is also integral to balanced warfare.  Armor, Gear, and Weapons all can be enhanced using a powerful and brilliantly exciting gem combination, called Gem Crushing.  With every combination, the Gems get stronger and can be used to enhance each item.

Dragon Crush brings the elements of classic RPG game play together with the latest Casual RPG.

Dragon Crush will utilize an innovative monetization system that does not overload the player with Free-to-Play and in-game purchases.  (Responsible monetization)  There is also balance in the amount of value a gamer receives and is willing to invest over time.  This balance of reward value is paramount to the game’s success.  

As you defeat enemies, they become part of your team that will be Allies to aid in the defeat the Gold Dragon!  Game characters can be sent to the Cloud for 3D printing and shipped to Gamers or sent to their local 3D printer.  Your game is truly immortalized.

Dragon Crush story has depth, wit, and charm.  Your beloved home land Zendom has been ravaged by the legendary Gold Dragon.  The princess Zenora has been captured by the Gold Dragon.



The Gold Dragon is not just gold colored but is actually made from gold.  The Gold Dragon has the special power to consume gold.  The sheer weight of the Dragon will Crush an opponent in a single blow.  It is said that if the Gold Dragon is killed, all the gold from all the treasures consumed will turn into a pile of gold.

As you seek revenge and vow to save the Princess from certain doom, you arrive at the Valley of Dragomar.  You will need help to destroy a Dragon.  You will need training.  You peer into the small valley of Dragomar, known for its training of Dragon Knights.

Your journey begins...

If you are tired of Free-to-Play games really only meaning Free-to-Download?  If you want a classic RPG re-done modern with all your favorites rather than just a classic RPG re-released on a new platform?  If you want to experience a game that offers both modern Casual RPG play, but let's you have the freedom of third and first person perspectives?  Be part of a modern game science equilibrium economy and balance of power?  Experience crafting rather than grinding?  Have smart monsters with unique features and personality, instead of just another hack and slash? Be one of the first to pre-order in the next hour and receive a SECRET BONUS!

Let's face it, our goal is modest in comparison to the total game development costs.  Other campaigns have acheived their similar goals, with either only artwork and concepts or celebrity endorsements.  Dragon Crush offers a real game foundation and as you can see, many of the assets, game mechanics, models, animations, and tools exist.  You can be part of bringing Dragon Crush to life and "Be In The Game!".  If you contribute within the next hour you will also receive a SECRET BONUS!!!

In the meantime, we have a 100% free download and 100% free to play PC game version of the Classic 2D Dragon Crush RPG

In the next phase of development, Pierce intends to produce a foundational, working game with items including new characters, new levels and more features.

that you can download and play at https://drive.google.com/file/d/0BxFh_aOGMJIxY2kyV0NERGxKWUE/edit?usp=sharing while we are busy making the 3D Dragon Crush Epic RPG.

Pre-order contributions can be made at https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/help-us-make-an-epic-3d-casual-rpg-game-dragon-crush/contributions/newhttp://www.indiegogo.com/projects/help-us-make-an-epic-3d-casual-rpg-game-dragon-crush/x/6811016?c=activity and helps us enhance/accelerate our current on-going 3D Dragon Crush development.

Have fun and Crush the Dragon! 

What has been done so far?

We are in sprint 5 of 12 of game development.  Our team is growing daily, but we have over a dozen experienced professionals now helping to make Dragon Crush come to Life! 

Sprint 4 includes a foundational working game, including, but not limited to;

  • Highly animated 3D models of Classic RPG monsters, (see pictures)

  • Each monster has unique features and comes with personality, (“Beholder of the Eye” and “Ghouly” are favorites)

  • Working version of the game for web, mac, and pc, with funding will add mobile,

  • Professional game play music track (not sounds yet),

  • Crafting system,

  • Scalable balanced battles,

  • Character Leveling,

  • Inventory and Equipment,

  • Quests,

  • And achievements.

  • More to come!

  • More funding will provide more monsters and more hero characters, adding a few each sprint,

  • Initial completed level with 3 linked quests and working achievements is available today to founders. 

  • Each sprint adds a level to the game and more features to the game play

Next Sprint 5 will include a new hero character and new monster Artificial Intelligence.

Your contributions and pre-orders are helping us grow.  We have expanded across the globe with a team of grofessionals focused on bringing Dragon Crush to life.

Dragon Crush is the game for RPG fans.  Your contribution will help us continue.

VIP Level 10 or higher contributions will receive the following gaming partnership Dragon Crush Identity Kit for Serious Collectors!.


How Dragon Crush is interesting and what is new in its features?

One of the most innovative games that I have ever experienced is Dragon Crush. This new innovative Casual RPG is a game that attracts your attention instantly. The main feature of the game that is excellent in nature is its casual click or touch play characteristic along with a 3D perspective that it allows to the gamers. The gamers also have the freedom to interact in 3D in third or first person modes and playing it has largely appealed to me and I am sure it will also interest you.

The key ingredient that makes any RPG game good or stands apart in the market is its balance and Dragon Crush has managed to create a perfect balance within many dimensions of the game with the help of math and game science. Equilibrium is also another important factor for the popularity of a game. It means the ability for creating an imbalance to become balanced through the system.

Dragon Crush has also succeeded efficiently in the character development and team battle configuration. It helps the players to seek the best combinations of strategy through which they can win easily. The game also has excellent powerful abilities along with an integral balanced warfare of its characters. Balanced warfare, armor, gear and weapons all are available in its options. There is a brilliant exciting gem combination that is called Gem Crushing.

Dragon Crush is an impressive game that brings in the forefront the basic elements of classic RPG game play with the latest casual RPG. This combination helps you to experience the best game with exclusive features that are available in the market in the recent years.

The game is the perfect example of the combination of modern and innovative systems and does not overload the player with free to play and in game purchases. It also guides the gamer throughout the series and helps them to cross each level successfully and easily. The story of Dragon Crush is excellent and deep. The Princess Zenora has been captured by the Gold Dragon who actually has the power to consume gold. Your aim is to save the Princess from the dragon and seek revenge from him. But before the final fight and actual beginning of the game, you need to train yourself to fight with the dragons and this training is provided to you as you peer into the Valley of Dragomar. With this perfectly laid story line you lead further in the game and try to complete all its missions to accomplish your goal. The game in totality is a wonderful production of new techniques, modern systems and technological advancements that you will love to experience.

How is Dragon Crush being made?

We are using state of the art tools and artists to pull together quality assets to bring Dragon Crush to life!

The following modules are installed as part of the Dragon Crush game foundation.  We then bring together the assets, animations, and highly addictive Dragon Crush game-play.  Your funds help grow our library of quality assets and let us add unique features, personality, intelligence, and harmony to the overall game.  This method of game development helps us keep costs to a minimum, while providing gamers with Epic scale game play.  Our funds can focus on Dragon Crush game features. A game of this magnitude would not be possible with current budget levels, otherwise. 

Plus our Dragon Crush talented developers and Epic Dragon Crush Game-play!

Game Design and Author bio: Michelle Brumley is a freelance writer from beautiful Post Falls, Idaho. She's an avid gamer and comic book geek, chasing conventions across the Inland Northwest. Michelle is fueled by cats, caffeine and British television. She writes everything from Dark Fantasy to young adult zombie slapstick epics. You can follow her literary adventures on her website: http://www.bloodgatekey.com

Lead Graphics Artist and Illustrator bio: Joel Stieber graduated with a B.F.A. in Illustration from Art Center College of Design in 2007. After graduation, I was hired by BRC to do concept design for theme parks and museums. Shortly after, I worked at Focus 360 creating highly polished illustrations for proposed buildings in Los Angeles, Dubai, and Hawaii. I am currently a digital designer for Dragon Crush.  If there is one image that can sum up my personality it would be the one to the left.  My mischievous ways and ridiculous sense of humor have lead me to make up nicknames for all my friends. As for them, they dubbed me “ The Knib” with the K being silent. As “The Knib” I’m an inspired cook that loves to barbeque, but never goes to another man’s house and tells him how it’s done. I never shop hungry. It’s about time they make candy with all reds. I’d rather lose my wallet and phone before my keys. No one is lucky they are just prepared when the opportunity knocks on their door. I still like excite bike and all other 8 bit games. I love Bay Area sports, and I am proud of the Golden State Warriors for finally making the playoffs. Contrast is the meaning of life, shadows are our friends, and squinting is the answer to everything.  http://joelstieber.com
