story:
Kamla Arts: AE Shatranj

Hello everyone, I’m Angelous L Gonzalez, president, creative director and the mind behind the Aeternus Eternus world. Alongside me I have Redys Padron (VP/marketing specialist), Steven McIntire (modeling/animation/rigging/tech support), Michael Burroughs (producing/business), and Jorge Soto-Marce (special effects/ animation/concept art). We’re here to raise the $2,180,000 for our first game of the Aeternus Eternus series, AE Shatranj.

In the Aeternus Eternus universe, all life, individual Spirits are incomplete… Our true loves (twin flame) are our other half as we are theirs.  It’s only upon meeting our most beloved flame where we gain the opportunity to become one;  To become one is to unite with our most beloved swan as “human angels ready to earn our ever-wings.”

In AE Shatranj (Action-Strategy/Adventure RPG), we introduce the Aeternus Eternus universe. You learn about relationships as you engage different characters and create your bond(s) with all those you meet throughout your adventure and moments of great challenge! You create your unique guardian which acts as the lead role for your team of sworn brothers and sisters, along with your created beloved flame who takes on the role of one of your soldiers.

Why?

Redys, Steven, Michael, Jorge, Rey, and I all have diverse backgrounds with a shared vision: To integrate magic, life, beauty, and art into every one of our games, creating an experience within the Aeternus Eternus universe that will not only be fun, but also interesting.

This series is (so far) divided into three parts, however we are here for part one in the series; and for our beloved AE Shatranj we have estimated a cost of $2,180,000.

Projected Expenses

Team – We need more team members to join our band of adventurers. We already have a long list of highly experienced, talented, and very enthusiastic creative individuals ready to become a part of the Kamla Arts team.

Equipment – Workstations - 3D Development, Programming

Software - Maya 2013, Photoshop, Visual Studio, Unreal Engine

Legal Fees – Pending legal fees for when we get the full funding for AE Shatranj such as copyright, licensing, contracts, etc.

Utilities/Necessities – Studio Lease, Electricity, Furniture (Desks, Lighting, etc.)

Reserve – For the unexpected so we have the ability to resolve any unforeseen issues.

 

 

What is AE Shatranj and what inspired its creation?

                

Overall Gameplay Mechanics

                I have my own collection of favorite games across all platforms. Yet as much as I enjoy them I tend to find myself longing for more which pushed me towards finding the Aeternus Eternus series and AE Shatranj; much like how Michelangelo felt and brought alive his Pietà.

AE Shatranj integrates aspects of martial arts and gives players a sense of freedom, along with moving with great agility in outrageously fun, fast paced game play. In martial arts, we learn that we as individuals are constantly creating our reality within each moment with our every thought/action. To bring this into the game play, we took combat principals/discipline from martial arts and applied it to how players move while engaged in combat, in addition to focusing on the “feel” of game play and individual expression.

Character Customization

                Much like a university where you choose your major, you know that your area of study is not a full definition of your abilities. Choosing a warrior type that has a uniquely free way of using magic as a primary ability for example does not limit you to only magic items or abilities. You are able to define your warrior in any of the other abilities, skill subsets, and items that are available.

                While you are not limited to any ability, you have your selection of skill subsets.  If for instance you pick a swordsmanship style for your weapons ability, you have certain skills and weapons exclusive to that style. Players are also able to choose passive/core skills for their warrior which greatly helps to grow character combat, social, and personal traits, along with giving a sense of deeper meaning to their own character.

 

Warrior Types & Primary Abilities

Spell Star - Similar to a sorcerer/tempered berserker/monk.  Direct with their magic while in combat, often allowing for close up encounters.

Arc Magnus - Much like a mage/scout/artillery.  Plans ahead and takes care of anything from a distance.

Valkyric - An infused druid/priestess/Kunoichi. Excels at using stealth while providing versatile support and crowd control.

Paladins - A hybrid tank/priest/summoner. Able to provide a bubble/wall of defense for allies and also excels at taking on those of hatred/envy/corruption.

Slayers - Enraged berserkers/anti-magic. Specializes in nullifying and sealing magic while also able to provide great strength in the front lines.

Techni - An engineer/heavy support/Mechi specialist. Provides a range of support to many platoons while taking charge of the battlefield.

 

Story, Environment, and Character Development;  

                The Aeternus Eternus world is filled with a multitude of peoples, cultures, nations, and so forth...  To enhance the experience, we thought a lot about the individual aspects of what makes an individual. Starting with common traits, we turned to character lineage, which include Draconian (Dragon), Devil (Lamia/Succubus), Moon Elven (Moonlight Children), Minataurous (Titan), Searians (Spirits of Water Elementals), Valkyries (Devas [?] of the Foxy Wing-Lings), Fays (People of the Flower Gardens), and many more.

The magic, weapons, and core skills not only give arsenals to the player but also define a sense of individuality, forms of individual expression; a key in what shapes us as humans. The character lineage contributes to this by adding a sense of heritage or culture such as gestures, features, mannerisms, quirks, and slight preferences that kinship share. 

                We as individuals have our own unique experiences, and it’s our choices that create the venture, which defines ourselves as we continue to learn and grow into the future. In Aeternus Eternus, players are able to make similar decisions and define their own venture or path. This also means there is no right path for any one player, what may be good for one player may not be as good for another. In other words, there are no good/neutral/bad choices, there are instead options provided that are a reflection of the expressions and uniqueness of that individual player, and making a choice that more reflects that character will have the best outcome. This not only allows more freedom and flow throughout their endeavor, it allows them to experience this through interactions and understandings with team mates and those encountered along the way. These experiences vary slightly with each player, and the choices made grant more depth into the further development of their character.

Core of Aeternus Eternus

The vastness of Aeternus Eternus is love, and all aspects are tied to that essence. Most especially, the love between twin flames and how their love forms, expresses, and identifies their identity as individuals and as two in one.

 When players fight, they do so alongside their beloved twin flame. They are accompanied with the many opportunities to learn, understand, interact, engage, and grow with their most beloved. In a sense, it is experiencing what it is to live and fight alongside your most precious one; Thus Player’s actions and movement are symbiotic with their mate. Their mate has their own actions and thoughts, yet still corresponds to the player’s, inspiring that feeling of intimacy in their most precious relationship.

We want the players to constantly keep answering questions such as:

What is that that matters most? Why is it that we fight? Strive? What do we live for?

Ultimately this gives a unique and fresh approach with personal traits, along with individual growth via your choices and relations. All of which are synonymous with love, the ways in which we experience and express ourselves within the virtual universe.

 

Questions: 

Q: Why are we asking for $2,350,000 when we need $2,180,000?

A: The additional $170,000 to the requested $2,180,000 is the estimated fee for using Indiegogo.com

 

Q: Why Flexible funding?

A: To continue on we need the full funding; flexible funding would guarantee us to finish pre-production and move on to production. Getting the full funding will allow us to go full forward all the way

 

Q: Where are we at as of now?

A: We have most of the design concept done; we need a few more team members to finish it, thereby completing pre-production. Afterwards with more members we can immediately start production, which brings us here to Indiegogo.com

 

Q: What game(s) is out there that is closest to AE Shatranj?

A:  AE Shatranj is a game that is new to the industry with original key mechanics in gameplay, story, and focus. As such it is very difficult to find something close to it that has already been done. With that said, the closest would probably have to be the following; Tales of the Abyss, Baldur’s Gate II: Shadows of Amn, Infinite Undiscovery, Kingdom Hearts, Fire Emblem: Radiant Dawn, Final Fantasy XII, and the 2008 Prince of Persia. All of the games mentioned are great games, each offering something very enjoying that captures our hearts;

  • In Prince of Persia, the way Prince and Elika work so well with each other
  • Final Fantasy XII, the rich world filled with diversity
  • Kingdom Hearts, the appreciation of friendship and courage
  • Baldur’s Gate II: Shadows of Amn, the immense amount of lore and grand selection of customization
  • Tales of the Abyss, The quirky characters and the development of Luke’s relationship with Tear
  • Fire Emblem: Radiant Dawn, the use of tactics and strategic play

Certain aspects of these wonderful games are shared in AE Shatranj.

 

Q: What is different about AE Shatranj and the AE world?

A: There are many key differences with AE Shatranj with which we'd like to keep secret for now, however there are some aspects which we can share; example,

  • AE Shatranj along with the Aeternus Eternus series itself has unique gameplay, original abilities for Guardians along with an original interpretation of warrior classes;
  • In AE Shatranj, there is a heavy emphasis in character development along with interactions with environment and others. What AE Shatranj does is take this even further, integrating this aspect so that the experience feels more intimate;
  • the core of AE Shatranj itself is something that is mostly new to the industry, especially to the level/degree in which it drives all aspects of the game and series itself; The idea of twin flames and their miraculous bond is entirely new
  • The way in which players make their choices as the story progresses and how the choices/effects affects story, characters, and gameplay is also new to video games. I.e. in the way it is done in AE Shatranj.       
  • The level and manner in which martial arts is interweaved into AE Shatranj and The entire Aeternus Eternus series is something which hasn’t been done before i.e. not the way in which we have done so.  

 

Q: How else can backers helps us?

A: Another way that would greatly help us is by spreading the word to as many people as you can thereby giving all of us here in Kamla Arts the chance to gain the funding and support we need to help us continue along our path in making the Aeternus Eternus universe alive for everyone to experience and enjoy. 

 


Q: Rewards and Shipping?


A: Rewards will be released when we are finished with post -production; the date listed is the estimated date when we expect to be done and ready for shipping. We will contact everyone any needed information through email and/or phone. When we are ready to ship, we will let everyone know the cost of shipping. Unfortunately we can't pay for shipping for everyone as much as we'd like to be able to but will add extra gifts as a thank you for you wonderful support. 

 

Q: What is the art work? Why the Art work?

A: The concept art in the title is a concept on the emotions and energy of Valkyrie –Valkyric Royal Knight – Fuyuko Freyja rather than on how she looks like. We thought we should mention this so as not to confuse the visual of AE Shatranj. We will upload the title art work with its other counterpart. Enjoy.

 

 


To the world, we thank you from our hearts and eagerly look forward to sharing the Aeternus Eternus Universe. 

Sincerely, 

Kamla Arts

 

Webpage: http://kamlaarts.com/ 

 Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/kamlaart

Update I – To further explain our approach; Taking the approach we chose has led us to a profound way of understanding The Aeternus Eternus World. First, it has greatly helped us in understanding not just the lore and magic but the characters themselves thus allowing us to get a glimpse of what it is to feel the magic through them. This allowed us to come up with abilities that closely resonate with each type of guardian, The Spell Star, the Arc Magus, The Paladin and so forth. As a bonus, this also helped us in reinterpreting what an Arc Magus and Paladin are for example. We are uploading our first images which led us towards this path.

Update II - We have decided on where we would like to go for the concept art for characters in AE, as soon as that’s done, we will upload some images for everyone to see.

                Much like a university where you choose your major, you know that your area of study is not a full definition of your abilities. Choosing a warrior type that has a uniquely free way of using magic as a primary ability for example does not limit you to only magic items or abilities. You are able to define your warrior in any of the other abilities, skill subsets, and items that are available.
                While you are not limited to any ability, you have your selection of skill subsets.  If for instance you pick a swordsmanship style for your weapons ability, you have certain skills and weapons exclusive to that style. Players are also able to choose passive/core skills for their warrior which greatly helps to grow character combat, social, and personal traits, along with giving a sense of deeper meaning to their own character.
 
Warrior Types & Primary Abilities
Spell Star - Similar to a sorcerer/tempered berserker/monk.  Direct with their magic while in combat, often allowing for close up encounters.
Arc Magnus - Much like a mage/scout/artillery.  Plans ahead and takes care of anything from a distance.
Valkyric - An infused druid/priestess/Kunoichi. Excels at using stealth while providing versatile support and crowd control.
Paladins - A hybrid tank/priest/summoner. Able to provide a bubble/wall of defense for allies and also excels at taking on those of hatred/envy/corruption.
Slayers - Enraged berserkers/anti-magic. Specializes in nullifying and sealing magic while also able to provide great strength in the front lines.
Techni - An engineer/heavy support/Mechi specialist. Provides a range of support to many platoons while taking charge of the battlefield.
 
Story, Environment, and Character Development;  
                The Aeternus Eternus world is filled with a multitude of peoples, cultures, nations, and so forth...  To enhance the experience, we thought a lot about the individual aspects of what makes an individual. Starting with common traits, we turned to character lineage, which include Draconian (Dragon), Devil (Lamia/Succubus), Moon Elven (Moonlight Children), Minataurous (Titan), Searians (Spirits of Water Elementals), Valkyries (Devas [?] of the Foxy Wing-Lings), Fays (People of the Flower Gardens), and many more.
The magic, weapons, and core skills not only give arsenals to the player but also define a sense of individuality, forms of individual expression; a key in what shapes us as humans. The character lineage contributes to this by adding a sense of heritage or culture such as gestures, features, mannerisms, quirks, and slight preferences that kinship share. 
                We as individuals have our own unique experiences, and it’s our choices that create the venture, which defines ourselves as we continue to learn and grow into the future. In Aeternus Eternus, players are able to make similar decisions and define their own venture or path. This also means there is no right path for any one player, what may be good for one player may not be as good for another. In other words, there are no good/neutral/bad choices, there are instead options provided that are a reflection of the expressions and uniqueness of that individual player, and making a choice that more reflects that character will have the best outcome. This not only allows more freedom and flow throughout their endeavor, it allows them to experience this through interactions and understandings with team mates and those encountered along the way. These experiences vary slightly with each player, and the choices made grant more depth into the further development of their character.
Core of Aeternus Eternus
The vastness of Aeternus Eternus is love, and all aspects are tied to that essence. Most especially, the love between twin flames and how their love forms, expresses, and identifies their identity as individuals and as two in one.
 When players fight, they do so alongside their beloved twin flame. They are accompanied with the many opportunities to learn, understand, interact, engage, and grow with their most beloved. In a sense, it is experiencing what it is to live and fight alongside your most precious one; Thus Player’s actions and movement are symbiotic with their mate. Their mate has their own actions and thoughts, yet still corresponds to the player’s, inspiring that feeling of intimacy in their most precious relationship.
We want the players to constantly keep answering questions such as:
What is that that matters most? Why is it that we fight? Strive? What do we live for?
Ultimately this gives a unique and fresh approach with personal traits, along with individual growth via your choices and relations. All of which are synonymous with love, the ways in which we experience and express ourselves within the virtual universe.
 
Questions: 
Q: Why are we asking for $2,350,000 when we need $2,180,000?
A: The additional $170,000 to the requested $2,180,000 is the estimated fee for using Indiegogo.com
 
Q: Why Flexible funding?
A: To continue on we need the full funding; flexible funding would guarantee us to finish pre-production and move on to production. Getting the full funding will allow us to go full forward all the way
 
Q: Where are we at as of now?
A: We have most of the design concept done; we need a few more team members to finish it, thereby completing pre-production. Afterwards with more members we can immediately start production, which brings us here to Indiegogo.com
 
Q: What game(s) is out there that is closest to AE Shatranj?
A:  AE Shatranj is a game that is new to the industry with original key mechanics in gameplay, story, and focus. As such it is very difficult to find something close to it that has already been done. With that said, the closest would probably have to be the following; Tales of the Abyss, Baldur’s Gate II: Shadows of Amn, Infinite Undiscovery, Kingdom Hearts, Fire Emblem: Radiant Dawn, Final Fantasy XII, and the 2008 Prince of Persia. All of the games mentioned are great games, each offering something very enjoying that captures our hearts;

In Prince of Persia, the way Prince and Elika work so well with each other
Final Fantasy XII, the rich world filled with diversity
Kingdom Hearts, the appreciation of friendship and courage
Baldur’s Gate II: Shadows of Amn, the immense amount of lore and grand selection of customization
Tales of the Abyss, The quirky characters and the development of Luke’s relationship with Tear
Fire Emblem: Radiant Dawn, the use of tactics and strategic play
Certain aspects of these wonderful games are shared in AE Shatranj.
 
Q: What is different about AE Shatranj and the AE world?
A: There are many key differences with AE Shatranj with which we'd like to keep secret for now, however there are some aspects which we can share; example,

AE Shatranj along with the Aeternus Eternus series itself has unique gameplay, original abilities for Guardians along with an original interpretation of warrior classes;
In AE Shatranj, there is a heavy emphasis in character development along with interactions with environment and others. What AE Shatranj does is take this even further, integrating this aspect so that the experience feels more intimate;
the core of AE Shatranj itself is something that is mostly new to the industry, especially to the level/degree in which it drives all aspects of the game and series itself; The idea of twin flames and their miraculous bond is entirely new
The way in which players make their choices as the story progresses and how the choices/effects affects story, characters, and gameplay is also new to video games. I.e. in the way it is done in AE Shatranj.       

The level and manner in which martial arts is interweaved into AE Shatranj and The entire Aeternus Eternus series is something which hasn’t been done before i.e. not the way in which we have done so.  
 
Q: How else can backers helps us?
A: Another way that would greatly help us is by spreading the word to as many people as you can thereby giving all of us here in Kamla Arts the chance to gain the funding and support we need to help us continue along our path in making the Aeternus Eternus universe alive for everyone to experience and enjoy. 
 
Q: Rewards and Shipping?
A: Rewards will be released when we are finished with post -production; the date listed is the estimated date when we expect to be done and ready for shipping. We will contact everyone any needed information through email and/or phone. When we are ready to ship, we will let everyone know the cost of shipping. Unfortunately we can't pay for shipping for everyone as much as we'd like to be able to but will add extra gifts as a thank you for you wonderful support. 
 
Q: What is the art work? Why the Art work?
A: The concept art in the title is a concept on the emotions and energy of Valkyrie –Valkyric Royal Knight – Fuyuko Freyja rather than on how she looks like. We thought we should mention this so as not to confuse the visual of AE Shatranj. We will upload the title art work with its other counterpart. Enjoy.
 
 
To the world, we thank you from our hearts and eagerly look forward to sharing the Aeternus Eternus Universe. 
Sincerely, 
Kamla Arts
 
Webpage: http://kamlaarts.com/ 
 Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/kamlaart
Update I – To further explain our approach; Taking the approach we chose has led us to a profound way of understanding The Aeternus Eternus World. First, it has greatly helped us in understanding not just the lore and magic but the characters themselves thus allowing us to get a glimpse of what it is to feel the magic through them. This allowed us to come up with abilities that closely resonate with each type of guardian, The Spell Star, the Arc Magus, The Paladin and so forth. As a bonus, this also helped us in reinterpreting what an Arc Magus and Paladin are for example. We are uploading our first images which led us towards this path.
Update II - We have decided on where we would like to go for the concept art for characters in AE, as soon as that’s done, we will upload some images for everyone to see.

story:
Cassie's Chaos (Tough Mudder Team)

Cassie's Chaos team was set up earlier this year to take part in Tough Mudder (Scotland) to raise funds for Cassie McEwan. Cassie has CdLS (Cornelia de Lang Syndrome), which is a condition caused by a mutated gene.


Last year Team Cassie raised over £12k for the CdLS Foundation and all the monies raised went directly to the foundation who support families of children affected by CdLS and also fund research into the condition.

This year we are raising funds for Cassie with a donation going to the foundation as well. Every child deserves the best their parents and family can provide when growing up – whether they have special needs or not. Cassie will need ongoing care and support as she gets older and her mum and Dad are constantly seeking new ways to improve Cassie's life.

The aim of this campaign is to help towards Cassie's ongoing needs like buying sensory lights for her room or even new shoes – her shoes are specially made as her feet are so small – let's face it, every little girl always needs new shoes!

We think it's a very worthwhile cause and we hope you do too. Please give generously!

We've put a conservative estimate of £2k on what we hope to raise but it would be fantastic if your contributions took us over our goal.

story:
One year ago, we began to work on a crazy project: create a server side middleware for independent web game developers.

One year later… guess what? We are still working on but it is online and it runs!

His name : Dingg.it

As a demonstration of our tools, we created two games: 

Blood Rights (a fantasy game done in HTML5)

  • Starfight (a space conquest game used to evaluate our tools). 

 

A few years back we noticed that each time we created a new web game we were spending months adapting our tech to this project. It usually costs so much time that we had to cut features. So we said: “NO MORE! We need a tool allowing us to go straight to the point.” This was the beginning of Dingg.it! 

 

Dingg.it is a framework that contains:

  • Player and inventory management
  • Items selling
  • Social networks connection
  • In-game actions
  • Achievements system
  • Quests system
  • Updates based on time (cron)
  • Real time multiplayer management
  • And many other things

What skills are required for developing with Dingg.it?

Dingg.it is a powerful tool that only requires few skills to fully exploit it. Knowledge in HTML and JavaScript are the basics for a developer to successfully use the tools and create his own game.

Can a developer do any kind of game with Dingg.it? I saw your game Blood Rights and it looks like Mafia Wars. 

Yes, developers can do any kind of web games with Dingg.it. It is totally modular. It uses a powerful system that can adapt to any kind of game. Developers do not have to adapt their game to the technology.  

Is it compatible with all web technology? 

Yes. At this time we support  HTML 5 / JS and Flash. In a short future we will be able to extend Dingg.it capabilities to iOS, Android and Unity. 

How much does it cost? 

It is free! 

It is important for us to freely give access to the technology to any developer. Developers can create, test, and publish their project free of charge. 

What are the D! points? 

D! points are a virtual currency shared across each Dingg.it game. Usually players have to purchase crystals / coins / energy only usable for a specific game. With D! points, the money is shared across each Dingg.it game making the experience more user friendly. 

 

One year ago, we had only few ideas of what to do once Dingg.it would be live. After a year, we have a much more ideas!

The list could be long but in a few words: 

  • Finish our second game we develop with Dingg.it: Gridpix (a Picross like game). 

  • Support independent developers until they are able to publish their game. 
  • Convince new developers to use Dingg.it.
  • Add new features to Dingg.it  (Analytics and Smartphones support as examples).
  • Have a larger working space to host starting developers and help them in their projects.
  • Paying servers for the year to come.
What if we get more money?

If we get more than expected, for each $10,000 we will be able to do or help an independant developer to bring his game to life.

We also be able to concentrate on adding new features to Dingg.it (like a chat system, expand the social networks features, adding translation modules, the list will never end).

 

My name's Arnaud Rossi, I'm a 37-years-old game veteran from Paris, France. I felt in video game when I was 8 and have worked on a little more than 20 released projects (PC, console, and web).

We currently have a great technology that deserves to be known and used. It can really help people to make their dreams come true (but will never do the job for them ^^). 

You can check out what we have done there: Dingg.it 

Sorry Blood Rights is currently French only (but we plan to translate it). Our next one (Gridpix) will be released in English. 

 


Feel free to contact us by email at contact[AT]dingg.it if you have any questions or just want to say hi!

You can also find us on Twitter: @dinggit, @workbandits, @bloodrights, @gridpix

 

And please if you can't help us, spread the word to the world.

story:
Summary

What I'm trying to do is create a revolutionary new simulated pet game based around felines. Players would breed, raise, train, and show their feline companions. Over time, players would have the ability to narrow down the physical aspects of certain mixed breeds and be able to have them reclassified as a new breed.
 

What We Need & What You Get

All the funding will go towards paying for programming and artwork. I am doing a lot of the art myself, but my ability to draw cats is fairly restricted.My specialty is landscapes.

Cost of programming  - $600

Cost of artwork - $ 300

Total cost - $900

You may be wondering what you'll get from all this? Well, you'll be listed as a site donater, and if you're interested in playing this sort of game you will be given a forever upgraded account in any number you choose besides 1 and 2.

Why I'm Doing This

Why am I doing this? Do you know how many feline-based simulated pet games there are out there? Very few. And very few of them will be as stimulating and revoluntionary as I intend PakaSanura to be.
If I can raise enough money, this could potentially be one of the best games to be released recently, and I find that very exciting.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're unable to donate, that's cool too. But let your friends know about it. Tell them what's going on. Tell them why this is worth it.
Just please, help us reach our goals!

story:
Let's say hello first ... or... is it hello again?

 

Hello and thanks for stopping by. Maybe you just stumbled across this campaign and you were wondering what it may be about. I'll tell you in a minute. 

But first something about myself: I am the guy behind the scenes. Creator of a few horror games that you might know - pheenix93 or Fabian (my real name). I am creating horror games since a bunch of years now over here in germany. Everything I do, I am doing alone... or ... almost. Sometimes i get a little bit of help from friends or my brother helps me out a bit if I need some better sounds or music.

 

The game you are looking at here will be something ... fun. I started this just because i wanted to create a small horror game for people to enjoy. It is hard nowadays to find good horror games that really live up to the expectations. Most just get stuck in development... stay a concept or a demo of some sort. That's why I decided a long time ago to make the world a better place and provide it with actually good horror games - Games that dont throw a jumpscare on you... play an overly loud sound... simply appear cheap and not well done.

But yeah... what can i say? ... I could not just leave my little game like that. I guess I am sort of a perfectionist. So that is why we are here. I need your help to make this game better than any other of my previous ones.

 

The Game - Clockwise

 

The game itself started as a tube of rooms... i wanted to create something similar to the well known and fun SCP-games. So that is where i started... and look where we are now.

You will find yourself in an endless row of rooms, hallways and other areas, while each room there is different for itself. You are basically in a giant... neverending "haunted house".
There are puzzles, scares and unique happenings that you probably won't find in any other game. 

 

This is where you come to play

 

I need your help to make this game even more unique. Even better than any of my previous ones were. With just a modest amount of money i will be able to include better models, meshes and all kinds of things that it takes to make this game the most enjoyable one you have played in a long time ago. Unfortunately i don't see myself in the position to spend a lot of money for gaming assets. I try to do as much as possible alone... model the assets myself, even though that is really taking a lot of time and effort.

 

What will happen? Where does my money go?

 

All the funds collected will go directly into the game development process. It doesn't really matter how much you give... every little bit helps. A dollar could already be enough for me to implement a cool new piece of furniture. 

The whole campaign is about improving the game as much as possible. the more funds... the better the game will get.

 

You can't donate? No problem!

If you can't spend some money or don't want to, you're welcome to spread this campaign and/or follow me and the game on Twitter or Gamejolt.
Also any feedback or comment helps a lot. :)

Cheers, Fabian (pheenix93)

story:
Bob Novak                  

Terry Eberhardt   

Kevin Eikenburg  


This fundraiser will support the much-needed development, build-out, and realization of Red Bridge Studios; an innovative and cutting-edge music, recording, and instructional studio located in Historic Savage Mill.  


Conveniently located between Washington, D.C. and Baltimore, this quaint historic mill was constructed during the Industrial Revolution in the early 1800s and is home to the iconic red truss bridge spanning the Little Patuxent River.  Steeped in history and rich architectural character, Savage Mill provides the perfect setting for Red Bridge Studios.  

This unique space will serve professional musicians and emerging artists who are interested in recording, film, and music instruction with a strong emphasis on vocal lessons and technique. 


The old masonry foundation walls, massive hand-hewn wooden beams, and high ceilings resonate to lend a perfect natural ambience that is nearly impossible to recreate in a newer more modern space.  After much research and consulting with the great acoustical designer George Spano and Polysonics Corp., we are forging ahead with plans to construct a space that will be multi-functional and not only serve as a "bridge to the arts" but as a hub for the community, in particular the music community that is rapidly growing in this region.
 

Vocal lessons, recording sessions, video shoots, masterclasses, and performances, will draw professional musicians, recording artists, and aspiring musicians to the space.  Terry Eberhardt believes that Red Bridge is unique in that most music centers offering lessons simply don't have the technology or space to offer recording services.  

"The fact that my students could study voice with a professional singer and then record a professional CD, demo, or video for a college application, is brilliant.  There is no one else doing this and it it will be one of the keys to our success."  


Development, buildout, and operational costs.  

  • Demolition: $2500.00
  • Hvac:  $4500.00
  • Ceiling renovation and sound isolation: $8200.00
  • Electric wiring/lighting: $2250.00
  • Doors/windows:  $3200.00
  • leasing terms/insurance/electric/yr.  $16,000
  • Equipment costs/technology/ $8000.

With your support Red Bridge Studios will:

  • Development, buildout, operational costs
  • Create a state of the art floor plan
  • Invest in recording technology
  • create a business identity with logos and web design
  • provide services for specific target audience that has yet to be met in this area

Thank you for supporting Red Bridge Studios!

Photographer, Jerry Byers. http://jerrybyers.com

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't make a contribution at this time, there are other ways to help!

  • Please share this link to anyone who might believe in Red Bridge Studio's mission.
  • Share with your friends on Facebook.
  • "Like" our new Facebook page! Coming soon!
  • Check back often for updates, and new perks.
  • Contact us if you feel you can help in other ways.. do you provide services or products that may contribute.. graphic design, products, contracting services?
story_txt:
Bob Novak                  
Terry Eberhardt   
Kevin Eikenburg  

This fundraiser will support the much-needed development, build-out, and realization of Red Bridge Studios; an innovative and cutting-edge music, recording, and instructional studio located in Historic Savage Mill.  


Conveniently located between Washington, D.C. and Baltimore, this quaint historic mill was constructed during the Industrial Revolution in the early 1800s and is home to the iconic red truss bridge spanning the Little Patuxent River.  Steeped in history and rich architectural character, Savage Mill provides the perfect setting for Red Bridge Studios.  
This unique space will serve professional musicians and emerging artists who are interested in recording, film, and music instruction with a strong emphasis on vocal lessons and technique. 
The old masonry foundation walls, massive hand-hewn wooden beams, and high ceilings resonate to lend a perfect natural ambience that is nearly impossible to recreate in a newer more modern space.  After much research and consulting with the great acoustical designer George Spano and Polysonics Corp., we are forging ahead with plans to construct a space that will be multi-functional and not only serve as a "bridge to the arts" but as a hub for the community, in particular the music community that is rapidly growing in this region.  
Vocal lessons, recording sessions, video shoots, masterclasses, and performances, will draw professional musicians, recording artists, and aspiring musicians to the space.  Terry Eberhardt believes that Red Bridge is unique in that most music centers offering lessons simply don't have the technology or space to offer recording services.  
"The fact that my students could study voice with a professional singer and then record a professional CD, demo, or video for a college application, is brilliant.  There is no one else doing this and it it will be one of the keys to our success."  





Development, buildout, and operational costs.  





Demolition: $2500.00
Hvac:  $4500.00
Ceiling renovation and sound isolation: $8200.00
Electric wiring/lighting: $2250.00
Doors/windows:  $3200.00
leasing terms/insurance/electric/yr.  $16,000
Equipment costs/technology/ $8000.


With your support Red Bridge Studios
will:


Development, buildout, operational costs
Create a state of the art floor plan
Invest in recording technology
create a business identity with logos and web design
provide services for specific target audience that has yet to be met in this area




Thank you for supporting Red Bridge Studios!

Photographer, Jerry Byers. http://jerrybyers.com
Other Ways You Can Help If you can't make a contribution at this time, there are other ways to help! 
Please share this link to anyone who might believe in Red Bridge Studio's mission. Share with your friends on Facebook.
"Like" our new Facebook page! Coming soon!
Check back often for updates, and new perks.
Contact us if you feel you can help in other ways.. do you provide services or products that may contribute.. graphic design, products, contracting services?

story:
MANTECORE PLAYING CARDS - INSPIRED BY A CLASSIC, DESIGNED FOR THE MODERN GENERATION

Magicians, cardists or poker players-Mantecore Playing Cards will suit your needs. Mantecore sports an original and striking back design with custom aces, pips and court cards. These cards will also last longer than your average deck as they are printed by the good guys at Legends Playing Cards Company.


We have breathed new life into the classic back design, by redesigning everything from the backs to the pips from scratch but still kept the Rider Backs overall layout.

Mantecore was named as a tribute to magicians Siegfried and Roy's famous tiger. The tiger was chosen as the main theme for the deck because of my love of these majestic beasts. 

Rather than being just another deck of playing cards. We wanted to attach meaning and story to our deck. It is estimated that only 3,200 tigers are currently left in the wild. Thus, we have included a line on the side of the tuck that says "Save the Tigers", to increase awareness of the dwindling number of tigers due to poaching. Only 3,200 decks of this colour will be printed to reflect the number of tigers in the wild.  Today, you get to "adopt" your very own rare tigers designed by Edo Huang by pledging for a deck or two. Edo is an experienced graphic designer by day who has designed multiple sought after playing cards, such as the Nautical playing cards.
A portion of the funds collected will be donated to the Panthera's Save The Tiger Fund (http://www.panthera.org/node/1399). Your contribution helps define their stripes. 


We seek your support in making this idea a reality. You can click on one of the pledges to help us out, or scroll down to learn more on how the cards look like and a FAQ at the end. 
*Note: IGNORE INDIEGOGO'S PROMPT THAT THE DECKS WILL BE SHIPPED FREE TO YOUR LOCATION. Shipping is not free except for the uncut sheet perk. Please remember to add that to your order when you check out or I will not be able to ship the cards to you. Check out the shipping portion of the campaign down below for more details.


The Cards

UPDATE: This is how all the cards would look like on an uncut sheet
Backs

The backs of the cards feature an intricate design inspired by one of the most classic back designs of all-time, the Rider Backs.



Every part of the design for the back of the cards have been carefully thought of. From how it looks in a fan, to when it is spread vertically and horizontally, as well as when it is spun on one finger. There are even areas for magicians to "work their magic".



Faces

Mantecore has custom pips (Spades, Hearts, Clubs, Diamonds) that have a fresh new look but are yet easily recognizable.


All 4 aces have a tiger interacting with the pip in the middle.


The court cards have been simplified and enlarged, taking inspiration from 2 of our favourite decks Smoke and Mirrors, and Magic Con 2012 by Dan and Dave. The simplified court cards have their faces tweaked to look younger. The borders that restrict the royals have also been removed. The colour of their clothing have been tweaked to match the colour scheme of the deck as well.


This decks features one joker that shows a lone tiger standing majestically atop a rock with a secret reveal (not pictured) that allows you to produce miracles.


Extras

You will get double backer that opens endless possibilities for magic effects.

Check out the gallery section for more pictures of the prototype deck in action.

Quality

We have worked closely with Lawrence Sullivan from Legends Playing Card Company (LPCC) to print these cards to our specifications in Taiwan. LPCC has for the past few years produced world class playing cards that cardists, magicians and poker players adore; such as the highly sought after Legends #852 v.1 and v.2. Their traditionally cut European card stock has a great snap and feel, coupled with precise printing registration making really thin borders possible which look great in fans and spreads. Mantecore Playing Cards will feature LPCC's signature Diamond Finish which feels and handles wonderfully and lasts for a long time even in warm and humid weather where cards tend to clump easily. 

Above: A side by side comparison of two new decks, Bicycle (left), Legends (right)

LPCC ultra precise printing with thin borders



What We Need & What You'll Get

Enough about how the deck looks and feels. Here's why we need your help. For Mantecore to become a reality, we will need to raise $7,000 to print 3,200 decks, as well as ship them to you. As this is a fixed funding campaign, we won't be able to print the Mantecore Playing Cards if our goal of $7,000 is not met within 30 days. The upside though, is that you will be refunded after this 30 day period.

Once our goal has been reached, we would break even. I would then proceed to liaise with LPCC to get the cards printed to be shipped to you.


Risks & Challenges

Our design is completed and ready for production. The main risk and challenge would be the production and fulfilment process once the project as been successfully funded. To help ease any hiccups during production we have already built a strong relationship with the representative at LPCC who will help with production and fulfilment. With LPCC handling shipping, you can have a peace of mind as your shipping costs are lowered as they are shipped straight from the source without any delay. I also have spent hours studying other successful and unsuccessful Playing Card projects by other creators that have gone before me to learn from their strengths and weaknesses.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not all of you will able to back this campaign. However, just by helping us spread the word, you are helping us a great deed. You can help us by sharing this page via any sort of social media or word of mouth. Your help would be greatly appreciated by us as well as Panthera. It would be my dream to see this project become a reality and these decks in the hands of magicians, cardists and poker players worldwide.


SHIPPING

THIS PART IS VERY IMPORTANT IF YOU ARE BACKING THIS PROJECT

Shipping is NOT free to anywhere in the world. However, we have made shipping as cheap and affordable to everyone by working with LPCC for fulfilment.
We do understand that shipping can be expensive if there is a fixed international shipping cost. We have thus broken it down to a few regions to help cut the cost on your end. Simply enter the shipping amount that corresponds to the number of decks you have pledged as a custom amount additional gift after the pledge,then click on "Continue to Payment" to send in the amount and we will take care of the rest.

Shipping Table



*For shipping above 24 decks, and those amount not listed, please contact us via the campaign page or at loojlbenjamin@gmail.com for an accurate quote.



Frequently Asked Questions

Can I add-on decks?
Of course you could. Just follow this table for the price of your add-on decks and add them together with the shipping for the TOTAL amount of decks that you are backing. Simply add this amount to your pledge and let us know how many decks you are adding on and you are good to go.

For example, you originally got the 3 deck pledge, but you would like to add 1 more deck and you live in Asia. Simply enter $23 (1 deck add-on plus shipping for 4) or more as a custom amount additional gift after the pledge, then click on "Continue to Payment". Once you've done so, simply forward the e-mail from IndieGoGo to us at loojlbenjamin@gmail.com, and we will take note of the add-on for you. 


What should I do? I forgot to add the shipping amount.

Fret not. Simply click on "The Good Guy" pledge and select Custom Additional Gift that corresponds to your pledge amount of decks and country you are shipping to. Once you have done so, simply forward the email from IndieGoGo to us at loojlbenjamin@gmail.com with your previous pledge details and we will take note of the rest.


Do you do wholesale?
Yes. Please contact us, via the campaign page or at loojlbenjamin@gmail.com, for orders more than 144 decks for a wholesale price.

Will there be stretch goals?
Yes! Here are some of the stretch goals planned. More will be added as we go along.

More will be revealed on the Collector's Edition as we approach our stretch goal.

How much of the funds are being donated?
5% of profits collected after the project has ended will be donated the Save The Tiger-Panthera Fund. A proof of donation would be provided as an update after the campaign.

Why is there a slight variation between the back design in some of the pictures?
The photos were taken with a few prototype decks that varied slightly. We printed them as such so as to better see which design would look best when printed on a playing card and also for the photo and video promotional shoot. The final product may vary slightly from the photos and video. What you see in the pictures is very close to what you will get in the final product.

Why is the printing off centered when you say the LPCC has precise printing registration?
That is because these prototypes were not printed by LPCC. I have provided a picture of LPCC's precise printing above. The final product will have that exact precise thin borders.

Is this a limited deck? Why 3,200?
There will only be 3,200 decks being printed, which is the estimated number of tigers currently left in the wild. This is limited such that it will be a one-off printing never to be reprinted with the same design and colour.

Thank you for even reading thus far. I hope I have answered all your questions. If you haven't pledged, click on any one of the pledges to help make this a reality. Do contact me via the campaign page, comments or drop me an email at loojlbenjamin@gmail.com if you still have any queries. I will attend to them ASAP. If you have already pledged, thank you. You are now one step closer to receiving your Mantecore Playing Cards.

About Us

Thank you for reading thus far. Our humble team consists of Edo Huang, from Indonesia and myself, Benjamin Loo from Singapore. Edo and myself are magicians at heart and avid card enthusiasts. We have been doing magic for 11 and 8 years respectively. I have been doing close-up magic for the past 8 years and have experimented with countless playing cards printed by various companies.


Cheers
Benjamin Loo

story:
Chosen Space was originally launched back in 2006 and developed an enthusiastic and dedicated player base. In the eight years since then Chosen Space has been through a few different versions but is now showing its age.

We think it's high time Chosen Space was relaunched with brand new graphics and improved gameplay and features. We've developed our own Game Engine called MMO Lab which will allow us to finally make the Chosen Space we've always imagined, and which the players have always deserved.


We've recently finished a successful KickStarter campaign and have had several people contact us about supporting Chosen Space but who weren't able to use the KickStarter payment system. So we've decided to set up this IndieGogo campaign as the simplest and quickest way for those people to support Chosen Space and have access to all the great backer rewards that were previously had on offer.


  • A living, sandbox, Galaxy constantly responding to Player Actions
  • Supports diverse play-styles and professions
  • All new Strategy and RPG elements
  • Incredible ship customization
  • Thousands of unique planets to colonize, trade with or control
  • A Galaxy of over 15 million grids to explore and secrets to discover.

Harking back to classic, early, text-based strategy and RPGs, Chosen Space is focused on providing entertaining and absorbing gameplay.

An easy to use interface with relatively simple controls is in reality a powerful tool that lets you explore and manipulate an entire sandbox galaxy.

hosen Space offers players great depth of gameplay. You can immerse yourself in the political intrigues between players as they fight for their Faction or Planet to come out on top. Or spend time putting together the perfect Starship, choosing the best components, fine tuning parts and squeezing that last bit of energy out of your reactor.

Play as casually or as intensively as you like, just dipping in now and then as you please or obsessively waiting for that next Action Point.

Chosen Space also has a strong focus on community. You won't be alone out there. You'll be sharing the Galaxy with thousands of other players each with their own goals and ambitions. It's up to you to decide how you interact with each other, join a pre-existing faction or make your own, go it alone, the choice is yours. Deadly rivalries, unbreakable alliances; that's just week one!

The game is completely free to play, with no subscription or pay walls to premium content. Players will be able to purchase an in-game currency to speed up acquisition of the larger in-game assets. However the game has been carefully balanced so that pay to win scenarios cannot occur. Players will be able to buy the currency from each other in-game, meaning good players will have access to all the in-game currency they need.

Chosen Space is full of great features designed to give players as much freedom as possible and tons of different game play styles to explore.

  • Asteroid Bases - Carve yourself out a safe haven among the stars in your very own Asteroid. A launching pad for pirate raids or just somewhere to relax.
  • Spacelanes - Navigate your way across the Galaxy using ever shifting Spacelanes. Scout out faster routes through unexplored regions of space or stick to the busier, safer paths.
  • Mining - Carefully excavate Asteroids for their precious minerals of just blast them and see what falls off. Or risk your ship to mine the stars themselves, extracting Dark Matter from Neutron Stars.
  • Trading - Traverse the Spacelanes between Systems in search of the best trade deals in the quiet life of a merchant. Or add some danger to your life as a blockade running smuggler.
  • Planetary Ruler - Overthrow governments and put yourself in their place. Fight to become the most powerful Ruler in your System, your Sector, even the entire Galaxy.
  • Starships - Choose between a range of small craft ideal for scouting/exploration or slipping past blockades, mid-sized Starships perfect for battle or hauling cargo between Systems, or huge Capital Ships capable of projecting power across the entire Galaxy.  


To find out more visit our forums at MMO Lab. Join the conversation now!


Any good Space MMO game needs a universe that feels alive and bustling. It has to feel like a real place with a million adventures just waiting to be had and incredibly rich locations just begging to be explored. That's the kind of Galaxy we want to give players in Chosen Space one where they feel they can fly off in any direction and find something exciting or new.

Part of the beauty of the game never resetting and being a persistent universe is that it develops a rich history and character all of its own. Where it feels like other people are out here with you and you can stumble across some old wrecked ship or long abandoned asteroid base and wonder what their story was. We're already building on a community with over eight years of history but it's great that we can include more ways for that to be reflected in-game.

We're really striving to make it so that players actions will have real and meaningful results for the game. Even the smallest actions will have impact and will help to shape the galaxy. One of the most overt of these is the new Colonisation mechanic. This will allow players to transport willing colonists to uninhabited systems in the galaxy to establish whole new planets. The Galaxy will expand and grow over time as more people join the game and set off into the wild frontier to establish new communities out there. The Galaxy is going to feel wild and untamed at the edge of civilised space, far from rescue.


MMO Lab is a platform we’ve developed that allows anyone to create their own browser based MMO game using a simple graphical interface, without needing a background in programming. It's like WordPress for games.

Once your game is created any member of our community hub can play it, giving the games access to a large pre-existing potential player base.

The MMO Lab platform is designed to be as simple to use as possible so that even people with no technical skills can bring their vision to life. This is a guiding principle throughout our entire design; usability and clarity are key. We want people to be able to build really complex games by taking small, easily understood steps using a Modular system to gradually build up. The end result should be a game that when viewed as a whole is complex but is created by combining numerous simple parts.

  • Innovative - With its easy to use Modular design system MMO Lab makes creating complex and varied games a more straightforward process and not a frustrating impossibility.
  • User Friendly - Our driving goal is to provide solutions to the problems facing prospective game developers and to use what we've learned from our own early game dev experiences to provide a system that's easy to use but also has the power to build the games you want.

  • Adaptable - Unlike other systems, MMO Lab supports an unlimited number of game genres and gives users unmatched control over game content, game mechanics and gameplay.
  • Community - Games depend on their players, MMOs especially. As anyone who has played an MMO can tell you half the fun comes from the relationships you build in game, and we see no reason that shouldn't extend outside of the games as well. Which is why we're committed to building a strong community through our Hub. With our Forum and Direct Messaging services it will be easy to stay connected no matter how many games you're playing on our system. Not to mention that all the games published on our Hub will have instant access to thousands of players alongside fellow game developers.

We've also been chatting with the players of the current version of Chosen Space, canvassing them for ideas about how to improve gameplay and what kind of features they'd like to see added. Or in some cases removed; explosive space mines seem to be almost universally despised and have undergone a fair bit of redesigning. So far it's been a really useful discussion.

This sort of responsive developer culture is exactly the kind of thing we hope MMO Lab will help cultivate. Being able to chat with your prospective or current players about what they like in a game can go a long way to improving things. It's very easy to come at game design from the mindset of a developer and somewhat forget about the player experience. A vocal and creative playerbase is an absolute gift to game designers and should not be squandered.

The present schedule is a conservative one so as to ensure we can deliver things on time and not be too thrown out by unforeseen setbacks.

Harking back to classic, early, text-based strategy and RPGs, Chosen Space is focused on providing entertaining and absorbing gameplay.An easy to use interface with relatively simple controls is in reality a powerful tool that lets you explore and manipulate an entire sandbox galaxy.hosen Space offers players great depth of gameplay. You can immerse yourself in the political intrigues between players as they fight for their Faction or Planet to come out on top. Or spend time putting together the perfect Starship, choosing the best components, fine tuning parts and squeezing that last bit of energy out of your reactor.

Play as casually or as intensively as you like, just dipping in now and then as you please or obsessively waiting for that next Action Point.
Chosen Space also has a strong focus on community. You won't be alone out there. You'll be sharing the Galaxy with thousands of other players each with their own goals and ambitions. It's up to you to decide how you interact with each other, join a pre-existing faction or make your own, go it alone, the choice is yours. Deadly rivalries, unbreakable alliances; that's just week one!The game is completely free to play, with no subscription or pay walls to premium content. Players will be able to purchase an in-game currency to speed up acquisition of the larger in-game assets. However the game has been carefully balanced so that pay to win scenarios cannot occur. Players will be able to buy the currency from each other in-game, meaning good players will have access to all the in-game currency they need.
Chosen Space is full of great features designed to give players as much freedom as possible and tons of different game play styles to explore.
Asteroid Bases - Carve yourself out a safe haven among the stars in your very own Asteroid. A launching pad for pirate raids or just somewhere to relax.
Spacelanes - Navigate your way across the Galaxy using ever shifting Spacelanes. Scout out faster routes through unexplored regions of space or stick to the busier, safer paths.
Mining - Carefully excavate Asteroids for their precious minerals of just blast them and see what falls off. Or risk your ship to mine the stars themselves, extracting Dark Matter from Neutron Stars.
Trading - Traverse the Spacelanes between Systems in search of the best trade deals in the quiet life of a merchant. Or add some danger to your life as a blockade running smuggler.
Planetary Ruler - Overthrow governments and put yourself in their place. Fight to become the most powerful Ruler in your System, your Sector, even the entire Galaxy.
Starships - Choose between a range of small craft ideal for scouting/exploration or slipping past blockades, mid-sized Starships perfect for battle or hauling cargo between Systems, or huge Capital Ships capable of projecting power across the entire Galaxy.  

To find out more visit our forums at MMO Lab. Join the conversation now!
Any good Space MMO game needs a universe that feels alive and bustling. It has to feel like a real place with a million adventures just waiting to be had and incredibly rich locations just begging to be explored. That's the kind of Galaxy we want to give players in Chosen Space one where they feel they can fly off in any direction and find something exciting or new.



Part of the beauty of the game never resetting and being a persistent universe is that it develops a rich history and character all of its own. Where it feels like other people are out here with you and you can stumble across some old wrecked ship or long abandoned asteroid base and wonder what their story was. We're already building on a community with over eight years of history but it's great that we can include more ways for that to be reflected in-game.


We're really striving to make it so that players actions will have real and meaningful results for the game. Even the smallest actions will have impact and will help to shape the galaxy. One of the most overt of these is the new Colonisation mechanic. This will allow players to transport willing colonists to uninhabited systems in the galaxy to establish whole new planets. The Galaxy will expand and grow over time as more people join the game and set off into the wild frontier to establish new communities out there. The Galaxy is going to feel wild and untamed at the edge of civilised space, far from rescue.




MMO Lab is a platform we’ve developed that allows anyone to create their own browser based MMO game using a simple graphical interface, without needing a background in programming. It's like WordPress for games.



Once your game is created any member of our community hub can play it, giving the games access to a large pre-existing potential player base.
The MMO Lab platform is designed to be as simple to use as possible so that even people with no technical skills can bring their vision to life. This is a guiding principle throughout our entire design; usability and clarity are key. We want people to be able to build really complex games by taking small, easily understood steps using a Modular system to gradually build up. The end result should be a game that when viewed as a whole is complex but is created by combining numerous simple parts.



Early version of MMO Lab showing Chosen Space interface being modified


Innovative - With its easy to use Modular design system MMO Lab makes creating complex and varied games a more straightforward process and not a frustrating impossibility.

User Friendly - Our driving goal is to provide solutions to the problems facing prospective game developers and to use what we've learned from our own early game dev experiences to provide a system that's easy to use but also has the power to build the games you want.




Adaptable - Unlike other systems, MMO Lab supports an unlimited number of game genres and gives users unmatched control over game content, game mechanics and gameplay.

Community - Games depend on their players, MMOs especially. As anyone who has played an MMO can tell you half the fun comes from the relationships you build in game, and we see no reason that shouldn't extend outside of the games as well. Which is why we're committed to building a strong community through our Hub. With our Forum and Direct Messaging services it will be easy to stay connected no matter how many games you're playing on our system. Not to mention that all the games published on our Hub will have instant access to thousands of players alongside fellow game developers.



We've self-funded the project so far and have reached an Early Alpha stage. Large sections of the game are already built and functioning, though not yet at the point they could be reliably used by players.We've also been chatting with the players of the current version of Chosen Space, canvassing them for ideas about how to improve gameplay and what kind of features they'd like to see added. Or in some cases removed; explosive space mines seem to be almost universally despised and have undergone a fair bit of redesigning. So far it's been a really useful discussion.
This sort of responsive developer culture is exactly the kind of thing we hope MMO Lab will help cultivate. Being able to chat with your prospective or current players about what they like in a game can go a long way to improving things. It's very easy to come at game design from the mindset of a developer and somewhat forget about the player experience. A vocal and creative playerbase is an absolute gift to game designers and should not be squandered.



The present schedule is a conservative one so as to ensure we can deliver things on time and not be too thrown out by unforeseen setbacks.



 Take a look at the great perks that are on offer to Backers. Don't forget you can transfer the Add-Ons if you want to gift someone a Starship or an early access key.


This is the Meteor, the standard Starter Ship available to all players when they join the game. It's small but versatile and will be a loyal companion as you take your first steps into the Galaxy.



All perks after "Colonist" will receive the Stingray, an exclusive Starter Ship. It's bigger and better than the Meteor and will let you start the game in style. If you'd like a different Starter Ship you can find some cool additional choices in the Add Ons section below.







 Can’t decide which perk to back? Why not create your own? We’ve got a lot of awesome perks, so we’ll let you cherry-pick your own.
During check out, manually add the correct amount to your total pledge. We'll then contact you within 24 hours to find out which add-ons you want. Please note that some add-ons are limited and they will be given out on a first come first serve basis.
Early Access - Keys can be purchased for another user


Starter Ship - Limited to one per user. If you have not selected a perk or your perk does not include the 'String Ray' Starter Ship then add $8 to the price of each ship.


Unique Items - Limited to one per user


Virtual Currency - Can be used within any of the games created on MMO Lab.


Other amounts are available upon request


We appreciate your interest in seeing what Chose Space has to offer. We’re really proud of it and want to share it with as many people as possible. All contributions are welcome, even if it’s just passing on our info to an interested friend. Chosen Space is a game all about Community and players interacting with one another in a shared galaxy. So help us build that community. We rely on people like you to help get the word out, and tell you friends! We will be making frequent updates throughout the campaign with new videos, screenshots, additions to the stretch goals, partnership announcements, FAQs, and more. So don’t forget to check back in from time to time to see what’s new. We’ve got some pretty cool stuff lined up.
Please visit the site at chosenspace.com

story:
At first glance you may be thinking this is another, of many, bubble games just like you have played many times before. We are here to assure you that this game is NOT just a mindless bubble popping game, but an adventure that will captivate and entertain you for many, many hours.

First of all we have many characters to choose from, both male and female. 


This character gets to represent you on your quest for world domination of the sport RO-SHAM-B0. For those of you who don’t know, this is another way of saying rock-paper-scissors. In addition to this ancient game we have added a lizard and Spock to make it more challenging.

This game is set in a global format, where you get to travel the globe and play many different countries. In each country there is a specific obstacle, and specific skill that you can acquire, to make it easier to overcome that obstacle.


Each country will be represented by a character that you need to battle against.

As you battle against your opponent you will gain points to help you get these specific skills to overcome the level. The better you beat your opponent the more points you will score as you progress from bronze to silver, to a gold medal.

At the beginning of each turn you automatically battle your country opponent with RO-SHAM-BO. If you beat this opponent, then you automatically advance to a bronze medal and pass the level and potentially move on. Then you get three options of how you are going to play. First we have just basic bubble popping skills, where you match each item above with what you are battling with (i.e. rock would match with rock). This is very typical of many bubble matching games and can bring hours of enjoyment. When you feel like doing something more challenging, you can go to the “Battle Mode”. This is where your same rock will kill the lizard as well as crush the scissors. This no longer just matching, but a challenging adventure as you learn how both the lizard and Spock are used along with rock, paper, and scissors to battle. The same level can now be played again but with a twist.


Beyond the modes and features of the game you also have the option of visiting any country of your choosing. For instance, let's say you get stuck on a level in the country of Japan, well you do not need to finish that country to move on to other country's. Now of course there is a catch, you must complete all levels of the first 5 country's to move on to the next 5 country's. This I just another of the many features that our game has over the other bubble games.

Finally if you want something totally different and you feel like you want to use some of your coins you can go to the “Battle Zone”. In here we have many challenging games that will further entertain you as you try to gain the skills to help you pass the levels. We are certain that anyone and everyone who downloads this game will have hours of fun and addicting adventure.

Main Menu

Zoomed in map page

One of the main characters

Palladon the Guru

Main Menu Play


My Team consists of myself - Mother, Real Estate Broker, Author and soon to be successful Game creator. I have many years of experience in business, sales, and writing plus creating, developing and finishing projects. When I start a project I see it all the way through, despite any obstacles. I may be new to creating apps but I know research and I have a team full of ideas and dreams. Plus I have hired a designer/developing company that has created over 100 mobile games for the iOS, android, PC etc., and they have the expertise in their field and together we will be making a kick butt game.

My Partner - Dave the Creative engineer - Dave works in the healthcare field were he is running a successful clinic. His ability to sell and use creative ideas to promote any product makes him a success in anything he does. He is also a gamer and electronics guru.

The research and hands on idea team - my kids

Austin - Master of electronic games - He is a huge contributor for ideas and designs from his experience with games he has played.
He is an eagle scout, owns his own chicken farm (that produces eggs that he sells around his community) and is a great student.

Shelby - The organizer - She helps organize all the levels, maps and ideas. She is a A student in school and is very responsible.

Joshua - Out of the boxer thinker - Josh is a successful student with talent beyond his years. When we get stuck on an idea he comes up with one that makes everything fit. Very creative.

Madison - Story teller - She has helped a lot with the characters and the idea of being part of a tournament. She has contributed to many of the main features for the game.

You might think that only an adult team could produce anything successful but I would disagree. We have 2 successful adults, a company with 11 years of gaming experience and 4 kids that play all sorts of games. I believe this is a perfect combination.

Excalibur Games

Excalibur Games - team of highly skilled professionals and veterans of the gaming industry. They develop games entirely, from a simple idea to release on iOS, Android, Mac and PC using Unity 3D.

Petr Lisenko began his career as a game artist in 1999. He started from the position of Texture and Tiles Artist for «Darkened Skye» from Boston Animation and «Firestarter» from GSC Gameworld (of S.T.A.L.K.E.R fame). He then took the position of Lead Artist in Action Forms and worked on «Vivisector: Beast within» and «Cryostasis: Sleep of Reason».

Sasha Homyak is a game industry veteran. He began his career as a Concept Artist and Level Designer in Rostok Games. His first project was «Beltion», followed by a whole bunch of casual games. He even made his own indie project «Power of Defense» during his stay with 4sdk team. He then worked in Poland on «Hell Racing».

Serhiy Yavtyshenko is a Programmer - Before getting into gamedev, Sergei worked for many years in large software companies. He has been part of the team for several years.

Artem Luxembourg is a game designer. His journey began in a small studio TopEvidence that created casual games for the «Big Fish Games» portal. This team of 4 have created many games that have been top in there categories.

Their website is currently under construction to update all the new games they have developed.

Here is just a few of their games in this portfolio with much more coming out, including ours....


We have the ideas, mock ups, descriptions and every little detail mapped out and we have funded it as much as we can and that is where you come in. Development started in May 2014 on what was initially an idea.

It has since grown into a passion project that we've been self-funding and as you can see we are getting great results. We're committed to finishing this project, but we need your help to take it to the next level..

We still have a lot left to do:

  • Designing and adding animation to all characters.
  • Continued designing the details of the country's and levels.
  • Creating music and sound.
  • Creating and designing multiple puzzles, obstacles, and skills for every level.
  • Polishing and beta testing every aspect of the game.


    Your pledge will help us take the time we need to achieve our vision. As thanks for backing, we're offering these rewards:



    • Continued design work of Countries, Characters, animations etc.
    • Coding and software development
    • The first 50 levels
    • Made available on iOS and Android 
    • Cost of honoring rewards.


    Beta Version by the end of December 2014 on the iOS

    Update 1. - New Lightning bubble.

    Though our funds are tight we are still working on this next big game of 2015. Ro Sham Bo Bubble Battle. More updates to come.

    Update 2. - New Character - Hawaiian

    Risk and Challenges

    We are have hired an experienced developer in the area of games design and development and have carefully identified, reviewed and will addressed the different possible risks. We feel strongly that through beta testing and developer testing we will be ready to go when the game goes live.

story:
Who the flip are we?

Our name is Pixelz, we are a small team working as hard as we can with the time and the room we have to polish and make this game as good as possible. My name is Raphael Fortin, I am the game designer and creator of this title. I am also teaching video game at a popular school here in Montreal. I have been doing so for the past two years. 

Coop is a game I designed during the summer. I created a small prototye and then i got a lot of feedback about it so I decided to make it our first priority. We started working on it in December 2012.

Since our goal is just to finally see our game release and being played by the community, all we need is your help to gather just enough money to rent a real studio (because right now we are working on Skype...I know...), and get better hardware and make this project our main focus.  

You don't need money to make a game, you need a place, a team, time, passion and talent. We have all that except the place to work and the big machines!

Why do we need money again?

Like I explained above, the money that we require is only to make this game even more possible. We are already working on it, with or without money we want this game to be released. The money we will receive will be invested in renting a space where we could all work instead of using online sharing tool and skype, it will be used to buy new hardware, software licenses and more.

What happens if we get more than we actually need?

My second personnal goal as a entrepreneur here in Montreal is to create a place where graduated 3d artist without a job could go and work with other people on projects or simply improve their portfolios. So basically I would use the extra money to buy extra hardware, licenses and everything and I'd make this place live.

During my 2 years of experience as a teacher I've noticed that a single year of study was not actually enough to have a solid portfolio for the industry. Sometimes you just need the extra 2-3 months to polish your portfolio but you don't have enough time, or money nor help. So my goal would be to help them out by making this place where they could get help, friends, hardware and then improve their chances to get a job.

Ok...But what is this game?

Coop is a third person Puzzle-Adventure game where you need to swap between 2 robots to solve the puzzle and go through the game.

Unfortunately I'd love to say much more about it but I don't want to spoil the story nor the game. 

 

Dawg, I don't want to spend any $ on your game!

We understand if you don't want to or even if you can't help us with money, there are many other ways you can help us. Just by sharing or liking our page or our game via the social tools here on Indiegogo we would be grateful.

 

Thank you for your support!

 

http://facebook.com/pixelzstudio
